description:
This review is long overdue and very much deserved. 

In December last year, the Brixton accommodated our wedding dinner at a price no one could beat. Phill gave us the front half of the restaurant and dedicated wait staff to take care of our party of 40 people. The food was great, our glasses were never empty, and Phill was even kind enough to buy my husband a drink in celebration of our wedding. Phill and his staff were fantastic and the entire night went off without a hitch. 

Booking was also super easy, and Phill's response to my initial inquiry about holding our dinner at his restaurant was both professional by personable.
author: Stefanie P.

description:
When trying to assign a rating to an experience, it can be difficult to balance the things that were positive with the things that were negative. In the case of the Brixton, there are many good things going for it. Nice ambience, decent music, wait wasn't too bad for Halloween weekend. Just one problem that, unfortunately, stood out like a sore thumb and completely put a dampening our evening...

We arrived at the bar on October 27th at 1:00 am after a Halloween boat cruise. I ordered 2 hendricks tonics and 4 vodka tonics. A few girls in our group also ordered some vodka cranberries. When we went to cheers, we all collectively agreed the bartender had not made us 2 hendricks tonics, 4 vodka tonics, and a couple vodka cranberry's. She had instead made us 6 waters and a couple cranberry juices. All of them, completely devoid of alcohol. Was it my bad tipping? I highly doubt it considering I tipped well over 50% to ensure she would prioritize me the next time I went up.

I went up to the bar and told her we thought our drinks were too light. She immediately became defensive and insisted she had not "poured us waters". And like that, our problem was resolved. I was happy knowing that all 9 of us were the idiots. The bartender knew exactly what she was doing.
author: Nicolas T.

description:
I've always gone to the Brixton at night for drinks- it gets pretty crowded, hard to get the bartender's attention, etc. Here is a review for dinner:

On a Sunday evening, this place was popular but was able to be seated immediately. The menu is pretty standard, apps, sandwiches, salads, burgers, etc. I ordered the Impossible Burger which I have had a few times at other restaurants. I would have to say, the Brixton prepared the burger patty SO closely to a beef burger patty. Same texture, same taste. At other restaurants, I noted that the impossible burger was good but had a distinct taste. The Brixton was different- so meat-like! Only recommendation including a vegan sauce- vegan mayo/aioli etc. The burger was very dry and needed SOMETHING. I got the half and half fries- tasty, enough for one hungry person, I wouldn't split. 

Other than that, pretty standard experience at the Brixton, would come here again.
author: Marcie A.

description:
I've been to the Brixton a handful of times--both for dinner and drinks. It's either a hit or miss. Recently, I met up with some new friends I made through Bumble BFF to a Bumble-organized event at 7PM on a Saturday. Much to my surprise, the crowd was more relaxed than usually--a huge plus! But the later it got, the more the Brixton started to resemble a rowdy dance club with uncontrollable drunk patrons. Luckily, that night was casual enough to talk to my new friends, but lively enough to have a good time.

The food was solid, but the service was dicey. Around 9PM, I ordered a basket of sweet potato fries, which was accidentally given to the group next to us. I was suspicious, but didn't question it since they ate it...all of it. After 30 minutes of waiting, I flagged down the bartender (which took an additional 5 minutes), and he realized the mistake. Less than 10 minutes and one round later (over 45 total minutes of waiting), we finally got our sweet potato fries. They were more frantic than apologetic, trying to handle the crowd. I was too hangry to complain.

Overall, I had a great time with my Bumble BFFs. The Brixton is a nice bar to start off the night.
author: Joanna S.

description:
I won't be doing a brexit at the Brixton anytime soon!! :) 

Well, it's cool word play but the Brixton ain't even a British establishment. It's purely American, with cool rock and roll music memorabilia on their wall, plenty of TVs spread throughout to watch the World Cup and massive space for seating. 

I've been here couple of times now and while my favorite is still their ALL DAY happy hour Tuesday, their brunch is killer. They can accommodate large parties with only a week notice, don't charge cake fee, have fantastic service (hard for a large group!) and amazing food. 

Just how amazing?! Pillowy soft pretzel knots with jalapeño cheese dip, crispy flatbread with a over easy egg on top, delicious beef enchiladas, wonderful roasted chicken breast salad and even decent steak and eggs. The star of the show? The Impossible Burger! 

What is that exactly? Would you believe this hardcore meatatarian, is now a convert to a burger that is 100% vegan, and yet, it tasted just like the real thing! Upon further research, I've found that the Impossible Burger is made with potatoes, wheat, soy and a molecule called "heme" which even gives the meat that bloody color. It's something that's straight out of the chemistry lab and this delights the scientist in me! This burger is topped with lettuce, tomato, caramelized onions and mayo. I took a bite out of my husband's beef burger and I swear, I couldn't taste the difference!  If you don't leave satisfied after eating the vegan version of a burger, then stuff yourself silly with their perfectly crispy thin cut fries. 

Order an Arnold Palmer or a brunch cocktail and your Sunday is complete. Now, if only Germany won that match against Mexico, then I wouldn't have a sulking husband at home.
author: Janice C.

description:
This place has a pretty amazing bloodymary bar! Many toppings, different flavored mix, fill up the drink with generous amount of alcohol. Our server had strawberry or red hair and was amazing.

One of my friends didn't enjoy the BM (didnt drink it) server was kind and comped it off.

The food itself is BEAUTIFUL but the taste doesn't live up to the aesthetic.

Carnitas scramble: could've had more of a spice to it
burrito: actually good! they put the sides on top of it (sour cream, guac, etc.) sides should stay ON THE SIDE. 
benedict: the bread was so hard I couldn't cut through it & had to eat around it. 

the ambiance is pleasing with the patio.

basically looks good on social media but i enjoy places that taste good too!
author: Rubi D.

description: Love the location, the spacious space and the staff here! We had a super fun event here with Bumble SF. Everyone loved hanging out here, we just had a great time! Shout out to the amazing Rachael for being so welcoming and making everything so smooth for our big party!
author: Hande D.

description:
Came on Sunday for brunch and had a pretty good experience. Parking was a nightmare but they glady held our reservation when we called. Service was attentive and pretty quick despite the holiday.

The avocado toast was good, we got two orders although next time I would get the sauce on the side as I don't think it went all that well together. I also got a fired egg on the side to put on my toast which was delicious and I highly recommend! 

Two salads were also ordered and were very good in size! Also one was to be shared and they even put it in two bowls without our request which was nice! 

Food and service was great, nothing overwhelming but wouldn't mind going back maybe for the bigger menu and not just brunch!
author: Rachel K.

description:
I have only been here for the happy hour but I would definitely recommend it. It goes until 7 so we got a table at 6:30.  The place is a little dark inside but it is trendy.  We enjoyed the ambience overall but it could have used a bit more lighting for grandma.

We had a party of three so we decided to share a bunch of the happy hour specials.  They have specials for $3,7,9.  

We ordered:

Demoned eggs $7 (deviled eggs with crab and bacon) without bacon.  The order comes with 4 pieces and they were very good. The crab on top had a bit of a vinaigrette in it and the flavors went well together.

Pretzel knots $7. The order comes with two bar pretzels with a side of honey mustard and their version of beer cheese. This was a table favorite and was gone in seconds.  The pretzel itself was hot and soft and could be eaten without the dip, but the dips made it that much better. I would definitely get this again.

Giant meatball $7. This comes piping hot with one giant meatball surrounded with marinara, melted cheese, and 2 pieces of buttered bread. I ordered this because my wife does not eat meat and since we had a third party with us I was finally able to indulge. To be honest I do not feel the need to order this again but the flavors were decent. Our favorite part was actually dipping the bread into the sauce and melted cheese.  It was however a decent size for sharing an appetizer. 

Flatbread $9.  I believe that the toppings on this change once in a while but the special this night was sausage and pepperoni.  The flatbread itself was a decent size and the flavor was not bad.  

We actually ordered an order of fries $3 and broccolini $7 but since the 4 orders above came out well before them we were already stuffed and luckily we had time to cancel the last two items.  Between the 3 of us we had plenty of food and we liked everything overall.  I would come back for the pretzels and eggs for sure and the happy hour drink prices and possibly try some of the non happy hour entrees.
author: Danielle B.

description: I'm far from being a regular here but at our last visit basically everything went right here. The food was surprisingly good - the burger was state of the art, the portions were generous, and the service quick and friendly. I love the rock theme of the bar - you can't go wrong with a Jane's Addiction poster on the wall!
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Good, local spot in the area. It wasn't too full so my wife and I were able to walk right in and get a table around 8:30. It was noisy though, so if you're looking for an intimate spot, this place isn't for you. 

We got a burger and a Caesar salad to share. The salad, despite looking really good, was actually pretty bland. The burger was quite good and the sweet potato fries were excellent. 

The service was very good. Our server was very attentive and friendly. This is always a plus for me in a restaurant. 

I'd like to come back in the day time to try out the brunch but I would definitely come back here with friends for dinner. 

Side note, if you check in on Yelp, they'll give you a 50% off coupon for a bottle of wine on Wednesday's. That's great considering the cheapest bottle I saw was over $50.
author: Matt M.

description:
This place is near our house & we were looking for a casual place to grab dinner and a drink. This place did the job, it was very busy on a Saturday night; since it was last minute, we didn't have reservations but the hostess was very nice to give us a table if we promised to be up for the 9:30pm reservation (which was easily done). 

The inside is neat but loud so don't come here if you want a romantic dinner. Our server was very nice and attentive and the food is good. We got the Caesar Salad with chicken and the Brixton burger with SP fries.  

The salad was a good portion but just your basic salad, the additional chicken we added ($4) was pretty skimpy - it was hard to even find a piece in the salad. The burger was ok, nothing to rave about - ordered it medium well and it was definitely undercooked; sp fries were great though!

Good place but I'll probably try other places before coming back here.
author: Bethany M.

description:
The highlight was the Bloody Mary bar(see pic). It was very cool, tasty, and plan on stealing the idea for brunch at our house.  

I had the bacon blue cheese burger which was very good, even though burger was not medium as requested.  Really like the grilled onions. 

My wife had the carnitas which lacked some
flavor and definitely needed salt, but still good.  My daughter had the Italians sub was very good and I enjoyed it as well.  

Overall, enjoyed the meal.
author: Brian V.

description:
Food was good and the waitress was funny and kind. We visited on Sunday right after brunch hours so the menu was not spectacular but the ahi tuna salad along with the sweet potato fries were great. I am giving this four stars because their table top was extremely wobbly and the bus boy wanted to clear our plates while we were taking bites of the food. 

I will be back for sure!
author: Roberto G.

description:
The Brixton has been bookmarked on my Yelp for years but I finally tried them out this past weekend. I was pleasantly surprised that the prices weren't astronomical being in this fancy pants neighborhood. It's a semi-loud, gastro pub-ish, but upscale at-the-same-time restaurant. A nice bar area to have drinks, with plenty of tables for both small and large groups. 

Being that is was around 2pm on a Saturday, the menu was brunch. It had all the classic breakfast items you'd expect as well as salads and burgers etc. My wife and I ordered:

Grilled Flatbread- House-made pizza dough, prosciutto, red onion, mozzarella, cage free egg, arugula. This was my favorite item, it was delicious. I actually wanted pizza with red sauce, but this flatbread with the Brie and egg was the greatest thing ever. Ever. Ever.

The Brixton Burger- Grass fed ground beef, Panorama burger bun, balsamic red onion, pickles, roma tomato, lettuce, sharp cheddar, plus I added Avocado for a buck fifty more. This was a good burger, but it was just that, a good burger. That flatbread pizza on the other hand...

Chorizo Breakfast Burrito- A flour tortilla with spicy Molinari chorizo, scrambled eggs, potatoes, and sharp cheddar cheese. This was my wife's order. She didn't like it. I tried it... I didn't like it. Pass on the burrito, you'll hate that you wasted calories on it. That flatbread pizza though is a different story...

The Impossible Burger- 100% plant-based burger. Served on Panorama bun, balsamic red onion, lettuce, roma tomatoes, pickles. My family that are vegans ordered this burger. They said it was good but I wouldn't know because real men eat meat. Real men also eat flatbread pizza...

The service was good and very friendly. Food took a little longer than I would like. But overall The Brixton is a good place to eat when in the area.
author: Michael L.

description:
Consider this a 3.5 star rating, only because I've been there just once, and so haven't experienced much of the menu. Went with a friend for lunch, where he started with the demon eggs that everyone who writes a review here seems to adore. I didn't have them, but he ate the whole thing, so we'll add another enthusiastic thumbs up to those ratings!

My friend had the kale salad, which he said he really enjoyed; I had "the impossible burger," which looks, smells and tastes like a beef burger, but has zero meat in it, and I loved it. I've been a vegetarian for six months now, and while I miss meat less often than I used to, this was a really fun surprise. Added cheese and avocado and side greens, and it was a perfect lunch (didn't have the bun so can't speak to the bread they used).

The server was super nice -- remembered my friend, who goes there pretty frequently, by name and by what he orders. Wow! Not so common these days. The place itself smells like a bar -- which, duh, is what it is, but if you have a sensitive nose as I do, you'll notice that when you come in.

Good, standard, reliable fare -- would certainly return when next in the area.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
2 stars because the food was great. The rest was an awful experience. Came in and had to ask 3 people about the football game I wanted to watch. Finally a manager said absolutely we will put it on the tv. We sat at the bar, ordered drinks and brunch...

At the beginning of our being there and ordering drinks a waiter got pissed off and hella hyphy with the manager. At first it was awkward for him until we realized all of the waitstaff was on his side. Both my friend and I have worked in restaurants and I currently work for a winery so we understand the dynamic. At the same time the bar is not behind closed doors. You take that shit to the back not in front of all of the patrons. Although not gonna lie, I wanted some popcorn and for them to have microphones. 

Fast forward past breakfast and the manager comes over and says she has to change the channel on our game to a different one because a different bigger party wanted the other one. The local niners team was on every other screen. Then she tried to say it came from the owners, like the owners are at the restaurant choosing the games on a Sunday and she kinda gave herself up earlier saying it was customers requesting it. She comped a round of drinks but seriously sucks to have to go to a new bar mid 1st quarter when the local niners team is playing.

Never going back.
author: Brittany C.

description:
We were in town for a wedding so were looking for something within walking distance and I made online reservations at the Brixton. I had to change the guest number and time but the phone kept saying the number wasn't in service so we decided to head over and see if it was open. 

It was - and we were seated right away with a party of 6 on a Friday night   Very attentive wait staff and a nice clean restaurant. 

Food came out quick and tasty, everything was really good. I got the catch of the day (salmon) and if was amazing! 

My only complaint ?? 

TURN DOWN THE DANG MUSIC

it was so loud and so distracting that very little conversation could be shared at the table. Nobody could hear each other. I am giving this a 5 star review but I will never EVER return because I can't handle that type of loudness, it makes me anxious and my husband has problems with his hearing aide. Luckily the volume was cranked up towards the end of our meal so we got to enjoy half of it but the dessert and coffee and after drinks we had planned on ordering were scrapped so we could get out of there. 


I know music plays a big role in the whole ambiance but when you have to shout at the waitress who is right in front of you and they still can't hear you, it is probably too loud. 

But otherwise, nice place!
author: Stacy N.

description: One of our "go to" places for brunch or large group dinners when we used to live in the marina. Service at the bar is slow for drinks, but they along with the servers do their best. We usually order their salads (they're huge!), deviled eggs, or flat bread pizzas. Great place to socialize with friends.
author: Angellica Y.

description:
Do not go here if you have any dietary restrictions or would like to make a slight change to their item. They will not accommodate. This was one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. This place is only good for alcohol and parties. Do not eat here. 

After making a reservation, we were told some of the tables were unavailable due to an "accident." Then when we finally got to sit outside, multiple tables complained about the sun and asked if the canopy could be rolled out to provide some shade. They pulled it out half way which didn't help any table and said they couldn't open it any further because it would block the natural light inside. Finally, after complaining the manager they eventually opened the shade the entire way. 

Now to the food issue, they have a fried egg sandwich for $12 and it clearly states, "additional $4 charge for a different sandwich". This is served with hash browns or potatoes. As a vegetarian and gluten free, I asked for a lettuce bun and to have the impossible burger meat instead of the other meat I was told that the kitchen didn't have time to accommodate those changes. I counted and there were 7 tables in the entire restaurant with people... also, my friend was told her latte would take a min of 10 min because the server had to make it, which is weird because they should have the bar tender or barista helping the server, but whatever. 

After complaining to the manager about not being able to get my meal he agreed that this was also not okay for the kitchen to say it would take too long. He said let's just order you the impossible burger with the egg for the egg sandwich and you'll be fine. 

My order came, no egg. Also, once the bill came, I was charged the impossible burger price of $18 vs $16 which is what the breakfast sandwich with a $4 charge should have been AND I was charged an additional $6 for hash browns... WHAT? 

As a local, I will not be returning and if you're trying to get good food I'd recommend a ton of other restaurants on Union over this spot.
author: Mcknzie R.

description: Came on a Thursday right at the start of happy hour. It wasn't busy when we arrived, but the place filled up pretty fast. Atmosphere and decor was dark and modern, similar to other gastropubs I've visited. Service was fine and the food came out fast. Off the happy hour menu, we ordered the giant meatball, demoned eggs, regular and sweet potato fries, spinach & artichoke dip, bbq pulled pork sandwich, and flat bread.  Everything tasted great. Our favorites were the giant meatball and the demoned eggs. The meatball was juicy and saucy, so good.  The aioli, the bacon and the blue crab in the demoned eggs was delish. It was almost addicting. They have a kids menu if you have the kiddos in tow.
author: Effie D.

description:
The Brixton is a mellow place to eat lunch at during the week day. Sometimes the service is good but sometimes it needs a major boost. I rated them 4 stars due to the fact that my friend raved about her burger. I had the fish sandwich which was ok but bland along with a side Cesar that was un impressive. 
I will return though as I have heard they have an amazing Bloody Mary bar!
author: Lauryn H.

description:
I really want to love this place - so we are coming back for a second try.

That being said - we came for brunch on Sunday and it left a lot to be desired.  We got bloody Marys from the Bloody Mary bar.  Looked awesome, lots of snacks to add, tasted good.... except there was MOLD on the cheese. Really took the fun out of it.  We ordered a breakfast sandwich - pretty good standard thing. A veggie wrap add sausage patty - came with chicken apple sausage instead which was annoying.  And we got an eggs Benedict - eggs were cooked through - not poached as expected.  We started off with an appetizer of the pretzels - only came with 2 small ones and the cheese sauce is surprisingly thing - otherwise it was a fine starter. The Froze drink as delicious - but they did forget to bring it and then we had to wait for it and it was all a bit awkward.

We plan to try again and get a burger and the carnitas hash - from gazing at other peoples plates it seems like the right choice.  But great location and cute outside tables so again - I really want to like this place.
author: Margo B.

description: I mean, who lives in the Marina and doesn't love the Brixton!  Great place to come and get a drink and hangout with friends all day and all night, and then do it all again, over and over. I love the Brixton.
author: Paula E.

description:
If you want delicious food in a casual upscale setting then this is a superb place to explore.

Chef Anthony is a passionate human who has a long connection with the establishment. 

The staff were friendly and helpful not to mention attentive. 

I started with the Spinach Artichoke Dip which was delish. It has a perfect consistency to match it's flavor. 

Next I had a savory tart along with some savory shrimp served over fresh greens that I was given to understand were locally sourced.

Lastly I tried these amazing peppers that were like a combination of green pepper and edamame. Rolled in a sweet glaze and lightly salted. These were extraordinary. 

Remaining enthusiastic about a job as a chef is a serious challenge for almost anyone. Chef Anthony is succeeding and his love of food makes this epicurean establishment stand out in a city that is filled with fare.
author: Evrett K.

description: Great atmosphere and great drinks! Shane is the best make sure you ask him for a special drink
author: Allan I.

description:
To be honest, we were shopping for a new sofa at Zgallaria next door, and upon leaving needed to use the bathroom.       Stepped in and got hooked my the sight of the condiment-rich body Mary bar, and decided to stay for lunch.   

That's when its went from groovy to disappointing.   For starters... the place was not packed but full of employees.  So it made no sence that we waited 10 mins to have our order taken and another 30+ to get our food... especially since it was a salad and a garden burger.  

When we did finally get the food, its was no frills, and I had to send it back to the kitchen so they completed my order, and they still served a burger with no catsup.    And her chicken and beat salad... bland and tasteless, just like my ultimate burger... no flavor.  

Perhaps the kitchen and service staff had a rough Friday, cause we were there on a Sat at 12:30pm and this place is mostly a nighttime bar scene.   And I'm sure at night it rocks, but for a resteraunt during the day, Im brobly not coming back for the food... which btw, was pricey for what you get as well.   

Sorry... not a fan, and the only thing that kept it a 2 star and not less... was the bacon bloody marry juice they make in house.  A saving grace for this experience.
author: Vlad C.

description:
Stopped with some friends for a bite after a bit of drinking and before a fair bit more. I'm sure they were absolutely thrilled with our laughter and slightly elevated speaking level as soon as we entered. 

We got a table near the back so quickly my shoes almost fell off at the door, and they had the foresight to keep us out of arms reach of any other patrons. This little nod to our "needs" did not go unnoticed. 

I ordered expecting the food to be about average, but they blew about average out of the water. The flavor acted on me immediately, the taste was perfect!  I ordered rare meat, which most often arrives medium but not this time. The taste was to die for and even though they were ready to get rid of us when we arrived, I never felt hurried. 

The service was excellent and fast (or seemed fast to my brain which only picked up about 1 in 4 seconds as the others were dropped due to load limits of a drunk mind). 

This place through liquor colored lenses was absolutely perfect and I hope to make another go of it when I'm back in the city for adventures.
author: West E.

description:
Came here a couple times with friends and another time with my parents. This is definitely a place for a younger crowd.  They serve food during the day and at night it turns into a bar. Music is pretty loud so it may be a bit difficult having meal conversations. 

Food is pretty delicious and the drinks are great too.  Definitely a fun and trendy place to go out to in the marina. Has a darker, modern pub sort of feel.  

Service here was exceptional. The waiter we had was very friendly and we felt like we were really being taken care of. 

Atmosphere: 4/5
Food: 4/5
Service: 5/5
Overall Experience: 4/5
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
My girlfriend and I had been in the neighborhood since 11am and we were starving. (We both hadn't eaten all day.) I quickly made a reservation through OpenTable for Brixton for Saturday, May 20th at 2:45pm and we headed across the street for brunch.

When we arrived, the interaction with the hostess checking us in was a little weird. Since I just made the reservation, she tried to tell me that we were considered walk ins and that I shouldn't have made a reservation. Okay, that was off putting, but I wanted to ensure us a table and I'm starving, so please seat us! (I didn't actually say this. I just thought it.) She brought us to a table in the back area. It wasn't too busy at this time.

*Fried Chicken Benedict: House-made English muffin, cornmeal crusted chicken thigh, poached cage free egg, shredded cabbage, pickled peppers, bacon hollandaise ($15)
*The Brixton Prather Ranch Burger: Grass fed Prather Ranch ground beef, Panorama burger bun, balsamic red onion, pickles, roma tomato, lettuce, Choice of sharp cheddar, swiss, jack or bleu cheese ($16)
*Mumm Napa Brut: Napa ($12 glass)
*Matanzas Creek Chardonnay: Sonoma ($13 glass)

I was very delicate from the night before, so honestly, I could barely eat. But I forced myself to since that fried chicken benedict was so good! The chicken was crispy, the egg yolk a little runny, that hollandaise so rich and creamy. The cabbage and pickles added just the right amount of contrast by cutting into the richness of those three ingredients. For the side, you can pick home fries or hash browns. I picked hash browns which ended up being the most comforting choice as they reminded me of a certain fast food chain's hash browns, which I adore. My girlfriend got the burger which she enjoyed.

Our server was nice and attentive. My gf and I were talking a lot, so it took us a while to look at the menu and order. She was very patient. I did have to flag her down for water though as I was trying to rehydrate from the night before. So much so, that I didn't finish my glass of bubbly. Yes, this was one of the few times I left alcohol behind. I felt that delicate!

I had a really nice brunch / lunch with my gf, but that hostess started off our meal with a really bad taste in my mouth. I don't know if she knew she was coming off as rude, so hopefully it wasn't intentional. Subtracting a star from my otherwise four star experience. There's no reason to begin a meal feeling that way.
author: Elena N.

description:
We made dinner reservations for 9:30 pm on a Friday night. The website shows dinner service until 11 pm 7 days a week (see photo). Around 7:30 pm I received a call basically telling me that we would only have a half an hour to eat since the kitchen closes at 10 pm so sadly had to cancel my reservations.

To add to this, when reserving a table on Yelp, it states that kitchen serves until 12 am nightly. I've attached another photo.
author: Kaili L.

description:
Really enjoyed my time and the ambiance!!  Ordered the Impossible Burger  - PSA it's a 100% plant based but taste like beef!!! Very yummy!

Giving this place a 4 instead of a 5, because the service wasn't great and they must up one my orders, but they were very polite about it!

If you are looking for a good spot on Union,I highly recommend!
author: Afroditi Dionysia P.

description: Good, but not spectacular.  Outdoor seating on the sidewalk, with heaters, (which is nice as the area can get a little breezy from time to time).  Service was a little on the slow side, but the drinks made up for it.  Well balanced, with a good depth of flavor and taste.  Didn't eat on this visit, but did see a few things on the menu that looked intriguing.  I think Brixton has a lot of potential, and I'll have to stop back in and see about what else they have to offer.
author: Jeff H.

description: I love the food at Brixton. Last time I was there I had the burger & fries and demoned eggs topped the crabmeat. Despite being extremely busy, my food came in a reasonable amount of time and my juicy burger was the perfect temperature. The cucumber martini is my favorite cocktail here. It's like a spa cocktail. I've also tried the pretzel knots, organic spinach & artichoke dip, the giant meatball, grilled flatbread pizza, the kale salad, grilled steak @& potato salad, San Marzano bucatini, pasta carbonara, sweet potato fries, spicy Mac & cheese, also Mahi Mahi fresh catch of the day. As you can see, I've eaten at Brixton a lot. It's always consistently delicious. And the carbonara is divine!
author: Danielle S.

description: Brunch choices are amazing!! Live the build your own bloody Mary bar! Servers are super friendly. The whole experience was awesome. You don't want to miss this place!!
author: Brenda K.

description:
I had Christmas Eve brunch here with my sister and brother-in-law. It was my first time and right went I walked in I fell in love! The decor was awesome, I love the wall paper and the dark ambiance. 

The Bloody Mary Bar was a nice surprise, I've never seen one set up like that before. I ordered the "demon eggs" which were the best deviled eggs I've ever had! I highly recommend ordering that! Overall this place is great, I would come back again
author: Jonathan S.

description:
Not completely sure how to feel about the brixton. The vibe, music and food didn't seem to match exactly. 

The space has a urban alternative rock meets grandpa's study.  There are pictures of bands all over the walls, mostly alternative or light rock yet the music playing when we came in was country. This threw me off a little.

Drinks, specially the cocktail, was subpar considering the price and size. Beers are def the best thing to order here. 

Once we were seated for dinner the order process was smooth and we got our food pretty fast. The burgers were AMAZING and came with a lot of complematary toppings. The grilled onions and mushrooms were super tasty and flavorful. The fries  (sweet potato and regular) were salty and a perfect compliment to the burger. 

The real winner of the meal was the mac and cheese. I could have eaten three more servings, easily. If you come here and don't get the mac and cheese, you're doing something wrong.
author: Kaley K.

description: I sat outside on the patio during happy hour. Very friendly service and super fast! I had a virgin mojito (suggested by the waitress) and it was delish! Also, the pretzels are really good. I was just in for a snack and this fit the bill. Great prices for happy hour and I was in and out. Right in the heart of the action on Union Street. Parking is difficult here - street parking only. I recommend it!
author: Wanda G.

description:
I'm sure this is a fun place for a late night bar hang out. We came only for dinner and it was not bad. Service was friendly and attentive. 
We ordered the fried okra special and I could not even finish half a piece. The Steak Caprese was much better. Surprisingly tender though it really didn't need that big slab of cheese on top. Salsa around it was good. Mashed potatoes also overly done with cheese and sour cream. Salmon was not bad. Dessert was some sort of chocolate cream cheese like tort - would have been better as a mousse or with dark chocolate. All in all, not a bad meal but we won't be returning. Food will definitely appeal to those who've had a night out on the town (high fat) and I'm sure tastes better after a bunch of beers.
author: V L.

description: Not a good place for brunch. The number of problems with this place makes it clear that there is a management issue. From the hostess to the waitress to even the cooks, every single piece of this place had issues today. The order was wrong twice, on one dish they simply forgot to put one of the main ingredients and so bought it out in a bowl later instead, and servers stood around chatting while all the tables outside needed help. When this many things are bad, it's management not caring. Fine for drinks, but for brunch I'd prefer to hit Belga, Causewells, Rose's, or any of the other great spots in the neighborhood.
author: Raymond S.

description:
Dinner review:

Came here with a group of friends during Halloween weekend for dinner (yes, dinner) 

Started out with a strawberry margarita, because why not start Halloween off right?
It was not very strong and it was overly sweet and the syrup had a strange taste to it. It was drinkable, but when you're buying a cocktail at a bar you want a good one! My friend and I disliked it so much we almost had them make us new drinks, but we aren't quitters. Long story short, don't try to be classy on Halloween and just order a plain margarita. Why change what's good already?

I got the chicken salad. It was okay. Big portion but the size was mainly due to all the lettuce and less due to the other toppings (although there was a good amount of chicken). Chicken was fine but it was dry and lacking in flavor. Again, it's a salad so I really can't be too picky here.

My friend ordered the steak. If you order ANYTHING off this menu, get the steak. It tasted like French onion soup meats a juicy steak. Literally get it, it was amazing. The reason all the stars are on this review!
Fries were good too but you can't mess those up.

It seemed like my friends enjoyed their food as well since all of it was gone
author: Heather R.

description:
Very good brunch. Services was great. Very polite and kept the coffees coming. Smoothie is awesome. And I Got the burrito and it was perfect. Very filling. Very clean. Three the Tapatio hot sauce on it. And it was just perfect. 

My friends got the avocado toast and I had a try. Very fresh and tasty! Other friend went with the scrambled eggs and it was a super generous portion. Bottomless coffees too :) big fan of it. 

I'll be back. Great patio. Want to try lunch here inside.
author: Devon W.

description: Worst customer service I've received in over 25 years. This establishment is a disgrace to the Marina District and needs to be audited by Yelps internal team for potential shady business practices. There's no need to elaborate on the amount of shadiness this so called restaurant implement into their customer experience. Beware before you step foot in this restaurant / bar. Shame on you Brixton, Shame on you.
author: Dylan B.

description:
Came here for brunch on Sunday just before noon. We made a reservation on OpenTable. Walked in and there was a party waiting before us to be seated. Hostess was on the phone, put it down, and picked up another call right after -- instead of putting it on hold and showing the party in front of us to a table, she continued on with the call. Not that big of a deal, but definitely deducted points for customer service.

FOOD:
My friend and I both ordered the Carnitas hash and a mimosa each. Unfortunately, we were unable to sub our potatoes for hash browns without being charged for the entire side order of hash browns. The meet was juicy and cut pretty well. Potatoes were also cooked well.

DRINKS:
Mimosas were decent. I don't drink bloody marys but if I did I would definitely opt for their Bloody Mary bar! It looks fun and also like a good deal!

SERVICE:
Our waiter was super friendly and nice. It took a while for the food to come out and also for us to get the check when we were done.

TL;DR - Would come again if I was on a schedule and had to find a place to each without having to wait. Would order and recommend the Carnitas Hash, but not the mimosa. Improvements can be made in regards to time, but otherwise service was friendly and nice!
author: Lily N.

description: Came here yesterday for the Union Music Festival on Union Street. And actually my friends and I were looking for a place to use the restrooms. Cover fee is $5.00 - CRAZY I know! Anyways we used the rest rooms and we decided to stay here for a bit, they had a DJ playing good music , people were drinking and dancing. Jameson & Gingerale is about $9.00 :) Bathrooms are ok / clean. Bartenders were quick and polite. Weird thing is - this is a restaurant but it just seemed like a lounge / bar with good music !!!
author: Diann U.

description: Great stop. Deviled eggs were perfect. Server was a very nice young man who got us everything we needed and checked in plenty. Very satisfied customers Dark restaurant but beautiful.
author: Ellie W.

description:
Despite being in the heart of Bro-country since this restaurant is in the Marina, The Brixton has a good vibe, and a lot of space for large parties. However, I'm not sure the food (or specialty cocktails) are anything to write home about.

I've heard great things about the brunch, the dinner was average, and probably priced more than it should have been.

Pick this place if you have a large group and wish to be in the Marina.
author: Sejal D.

description: I luv open concept bar / restaurant with in and outdoor seatings. People watching and doggies walking by picking up scraps off the ground. Great cocktail selections and the french fries were not bad. Cool place to hang out and chill with friends. Bartenders are pretty friendly. Will return soon...
author: Vee V.

description:
I am torn between two and three stars here being that we all " have our moments" right? Came with a party of 20 for a 40th B-day Party @ 5p.m. Music was bumping and though I love a good night of dancing I usually wait until after dinner. Our waiter informed us that was how the owner likes it... he who pays the bills makes the rules; fair enough. 

Then the bathrooms were completely closed down due to a plumbing issue. We asked for more water to learn that the water was shut off. The server told us we would have to pay for bottled water. We asked to speak with the owner. Graciously the "owner" comped the bottles of water. 

I will say only one meal was forgotten. Could've been worse. All in all, decent bar however I will not be back for dinner when there are so many other options for good food and ambiance with The City.
author: christa s.

description:
I love the clam chowder and fried chicken salad here. 
                  It seems like a popular spot, pretty casual yet still feels elegant atmosphere.
            It seems Hip/cool, yet still classy. The atmosphere is great . The people are friendly. I had a guy come in and randomly arm wrestle me.  He wasn't rude about it. He was great guy. 
I was hoping someone else wanted to arm wrestle too. They have people here that really make you feel comfortable. The kinda crowd that says what's on there mind too.  There's a huge food menu. The sidewalk out front is heated, they have a patio and weekend brunch. Happy hour is weekdays 3-7pm. On Sundays they have a special on Prime rib for 20 bucks. On wednesdays wine is half priced all day The're open 11am to 2am.  This place is one of the great highlights of Cow Hollow in SF.
author: Luke S.

description:
Ive been to this place only twice and It has everything you want. Great music, great vibe, great food and terrific service. 

Brianne makes the best negroni ive had in San Francisco. Pull up to the bar if you can!!
author: John P.

description: I was in town for a Bachelorette night and we stopped here after dinner nearby. We were walking around trying to figure out where to go haha and we heard some music and wanted to check this place out. We had a fun time hanging out, dancing, listing to the music, meeting people and just having fun! The vibe was fun!
author: Summer C.

description:
First time to this restaurant...Ate lunch on their patio in the sunshine, was totally beautiful outside
I had the Burger, was very tasty, 
Partner had French Dip and it was amazing..
Enjoyed a couple glasses of La Crema, Delicious
$62. for a nice lunch with wine
We walked from our hotel room, parking could be an issue
author: Judy K.

description:
This place can kiss my ass! I'm not going to leave any photos because I don't want to waste my time with this Yelp review. 

Just know they rush you out of there! We were a party of 10 celebrating my cousins birthday while watching the warriors game. We ordered a good amount of food. I had my back turned from my meal because I was talking to the waitress Stacey about ordering dessert for my cousins birthday. Next thing I know my food was gone!! I wasn't done! Stacey was standing there and I told her they took my plate away when I wasn't even done with it! All she said was "Sorry! I would chase him but they probably dumped it already." She walks away while I'm still pissed! When we got the bill, I made a comment saying my meal was still on here when I hardly touched it. She shrugged and walked away! FUCK THIS PLACE!!
author: Darlene M.

description: Been here twice now. Service is abysmal and the food is shitty. Sitting on the patio with no service for over 30 minutes just now was the final straw. They need a new front of house staff. This place relies on location and I'd be surprised if they passed a health inspection. I refuse to come back.
author: Chris W.

description:
Walter, Jorge and Danny are super amazing.
They have been very attentive and extremely through and well .... first time here and I WILL be back
author: Asmara V.

description:
Came here for Saturday brunch with a big group without a reservation. Got lucky and managed to snag a few tall tables.

Food - I ordered the fried chicken Benedict with home fries, boyfriend got the egg sandwich with hashbrowns. Visually speaking mine won out big time. The egg sandwich literally looked like a McDonald's breakfast happy meal. Fyi The hashbrowns are the small patties, not a pile of potatoes. Tastewise, I didn't try the sandwich (since it was only ~3 bites) but heard it was actually pretty good. The Benedict was ok but looked much better than it tasted. 

Drinks - bloody Mary and spicy margaritas were both strong and tasty. 

Service - guy was friendly but we has a hard time getting his attention for more drinks, the check, etc.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Best clam chowder...ever!
Lots of clams in it, nice flavor and actual full shell clams included
author: Steve W.

description: I came here with a couple of friends on a Friday night and we loved it, the hospitality was great and their steak was even better  we went back the next night on Saturday and all ordered the same thing cause we just couldn't get enough. Anyways my experience here was great and would definitely recommend to everyone!
author: Cindy R.

description:
I've passed by The Brixton on many weekends, and it always seems to be brimming with people. Turns out that was just the usual brunch crowd. Late one afternoon, I noticed the place was quite sparse. I was drawn to the spacious dining space with tall columns, damask wallpaper, and ample bar space. We stopped in for a super late lunch or maybe it was a super early dinner. I ended up ordering their Sunday prime rib meal.

$25 Prime Rib - 14 oz prime rib w/ stuffed baked potato & green beans:
Though hearty and filling, I found it mediocre. The prime rib didn't have much marbling, but had a decent amount of fat on the meat. Without the au jus, it would have been a little too dry and lackluster. I thought it could have used a little more seasoning as well. The baked potato with butter, sour cream, bacon and chives was not bad, while the green beans lacked flavor and tasted pretty waxy. 

Grilled Flank Steak with potatoes:
The flank was cooked medium/medium-rare, and came out a lot juicier than the prime rib. However, I thought the portion was rather small.

After consuming quite the meaty meal, I felt sufficiently full. The prices weren't bad for beef, but I wouldn't return for prime rib or steak. However, their cocktails and happy hour menu look more enticing.
author: Joy W.

description: It was pretty slow when we went for dinner over Memorial Day Weekend but the cocktails were excellent and the food was great too!
author: Kirby M.

description: I can only hope everyone will take the time to read this review. Let me begin by saying that I have never had a worse experience. Tonight's service was horrible in so many ways. First, they had some kind of "leak" and the bathrooms were out of order! They were not able to serve us tap water because of this leak and actually wanted to charge us for bottled water!! Insane. They had the music so loud! The owner refused to turn it down, so it was told to us. We couldn't even hear each other! Needless to say all areas of service tonight were despicable and guaranteed to make us NEVER return and I can only ask that you don't waste your time.
author: Serene S.

description:
I end up coming here often because I love the atmosphere + the fact that you can almost always get a table for group on for weekend brunch. It's consistent all around - food, crowd, drinks and people watching. 

The only thing that could improve is the service. While I'm sure they have their fair share of high maintenance marina customers, they aren't as attentive or friendly as you'd hope for. I'll let it slide because their hash browns are very similar in look and taste to that of a McDonald's.
author: Mandy A.

description:
I been coming here for years but normally for drinks and small bites. Came here on a Sunday afternoon after soul cycle with my friends. Their brunch menu is pretty good. I got the pull pork hash. ***Carnitas Hash made with wild slow roasted beer-braised pork shoulder with fried yukon gold potatoes. Topped with a poached egg, crispy corn tortilla strips, avocado mousse, and cilantro. Very tasty and the portion size is pretty big. The pork was not dry. My favorite thing that day was their hashbrowns. I love their hashbrowns! Don't laugh, looks like the McDonald ones but its so good. Not over fried and had a good crisp to them. YUM! We also order the ***Fresh Blue Crab Benedict. Not bad. comes with Salad, Hash or Homemade Potatoes.  

The food came out at a reasonable time but they forgot our fries. The fries are delicious. It's funny tho that the two cooked/hot dishes came out before the salmon bread. The Lox Pizza Bread was not that good. Services was okay. We did have to ask the server for water a few times.
author: Sandy B.

description:
Awesome brunch place. Lots of seating and outdoor seating as well. It opens at 11am if you get there right away there isn't a wait, so that's super! 

Pretty good variety of brunch/lunch items to choose from. I really enjoyed my breakfast wrap (normally comes with just egg whites, but I like the flavor of the whole egg, and they were nice enough to let me to make that change.)
author: Kelly G.

description: I love this place! They play great music and it's such a fun vibe. I'm obsessed with their Brussel sprouts!My boyfriend and I went last night for drinks and dessert. Our waitress put our drinks in right away, because she said the bar was backed up, but they ended up coming out in a reasonable amount of time. Our dessert took a little longer, but we weren't in a rush. Overall a fun time!
author: Ilena M.

description:
First let me say, I've never eaten here so I can't comment on the food.  Ice wanted to, believe me.  I've walked into the restaurant several times (it's my neighborhood) but the music is always loud, so I have never stayed.

If you want a mixed crowd (age-wise), turn down the volume.  The music is way too loud the minute you walk in the door.
author: Lois L.

description: Cool place for bar food and drinks. Nice crowd, clean, modern yet old fashioned pub like. They are open late but be ready to have ID. At the door. We went late on a Friday nigh and it was not crowded at all. Chill place to get together with friends to grab apps and have a few drinks. Not too loud nor rowdy.
author: Virginia T.

description:
HUGH GAMBOA, the short little sleezy looking man who was so angry and rude when we entered the restaurant to day at 11:16. 
We entered and were unable to find someone to seat us. I saw this little man in the restaurant and asked if we could sit at a particular table. He rudely responded that he was going to sit there with his friends. I then asked if we could sit at the table next to it. Mind you both these were tables next to an open door and virtually outdoor tables. He said that since we had a small dog we had to sit outside. I told him that the dog was a service dog. He gruffly replied that it didn't matter. Good for you Hugh, you don't want or like customers. Lucky for you there must be inherited money as you clearly couldn't make it on your own.
author: Christine A.

description: Went to The Britton for Saturday breakfast. The place is not crowded so no line to wait in. The server was nice. We ordered the Crab cakes for starters. But what we expected. They wee 3 balls with some greens on the side. They were none the less good. I ordered the Chorizo burrito. This burrito is quite huge! It has lots of scrambled egg and literally pieces of sausage in it. It has chunks of potatoes and cheese as well. The topping of salsa was good! The salsa was spicy and flavorful. I am not a big fan of guacamole, but this one was descent. I wouldn't rave about the food, but it wasn't bad.
author: Angela M.

description: We were staying at a nearby hotel and walked down Union St.looking for a place to eat. We psssed some nice looking small restaurants that looked very overpriced, especially for Italian food. We came upon Brixton. Rrally cool looking place, nice greeting and seemed responsibly priced. Great waiter named Dave took our drink order. All wine bottles half off on Wednesdays. Score. Grest alcohol list. I ordered hamburger with crispy sweet potatoes. My wife got a salad with some fish stuff and an order of brussel sprouts with bacon. The food was EXCELLENT. Especially those crispy brussel sprouts. Service great, food, price, value and atmosphere. A great surprise...I have owned 6 restaurants
author: scott s.

description: Came to the The Brixton for a late lunch today. I understand today is a holiday weekend but this is still a restaurant. We waited at the host stand for about a good 20 mins. I finally asked twice for the host. She then sat us and told us someone would be back to clear/wipe down the table. After being seated I waited another 20 mins then got up to ask if someone could wipe down the table. The host and busser standing at the host stand together chatting, had the audacity to throw me a blue rag to wipe down our own table.  It took another 20 minutes to order our food and another round of drinks. Our food came quickly, but had no silverware. Our drinks weren't delivered after asking twice. We were never checked back in on.. Disappointed would be an understatement.
author: Brooke M.

description: I loved the pub happy hour food and drink. Also liked the punk rock, Clash, Misfits old school 80s vibe. The waitress was very nice and it wasn't too busy which was great. Definitely order the flatbread!
author: Paul M.

description:
Great venue--wonderful staff and the food was excellent.
My Holiday Party was booked at the Brixton this year.  We had the whole place to ourselves.
Carving stations were set up with incredibly, moist sliced beef with all of the trimmings.
Demoned eggs, lobster rolls, pork sliders and just about every other item on their menu was served either buffet style or butlered throughout the evening.
Clap! Clap! Clap! to the entire staff--they rocked!
I have to admit that Cow Hollow isn't a neighborhood that I often find myself in but I cannot wait to return.
author: Thomas D.

description: Great service,  good food,  and upbeat atmosphere! Nicole is a great bartender and very personable.
author: Misty W.

description: Order the deviled eggs as an appetizer, probably the best I've ever had. The Brixton burger with bacon was delicious. Don't remember the name of the drink i order but it has cotton candy on top.
author: S R.

description:
Came here this afternoon with my family and friend. Overall it was great service. We arrived early for our reservation and they sat us no problem, the waitress was very friendly and they brought the bill to us in a timely but not too timely (trying to get us out of there) fashion. 
My friend wanted a Bloody Mary and she was brought a mug and told to use the self serve Bloody Mary bar. I think that's a cute idea for a party but for a bar where you are paying for the drink? That just feels lazy to me. 
My husband enjoyed his French toast although the portion was large enough to feed all four of us! 
I got their signature breakfast of 3 eggs, chicken sausage and hashbrowns. I could not believe when it came out that the hash browns were just freezer McDonalds style!! It is not hard to make real fresh hash browns. 
The scrambled eggs were a bit over cooked. 
Their avocado toast was a hit. 
So I would recommend the French toast if you want to split it between a couple of people and I would recommend the avocado toast.
author: Elle W.

description:
Waitstaff during dinner was great, bartender at the bar where four of us sat for two hours after dinner and ran up a $200 bar tab was not great.  She couldn't have been more rude and dismissive from the beginning. The drinks were tasty but she was so arrogant i cant bring myself to write anything more positive about this trendy spot.

So three stars to balance out the decent food & drinks with the awful bartender.
author: Christina K.

description: My night was ruined by incredibly disrespectful employees. I realize I was missing my credit card at the end of the night and I wanted to check if I had left it at the bar. The employee refused to check and I even asked to speak to a manager to explain the situation and they refused to contact him. Disgraceful costumer service. It would have taken 30 seconds of their time but no, they said come back the next day even though I was leaving back to my home state. Had to cancel my card and get a new one mailed to me.
author: Nico S.

description:
The Brixton is a solid drinks & grub spot.

More for drinks, less for grub.

When they first opened, it was all about the starters (mac & cheese) & the burger.  I loved that they played classic rock.  It was way too loud for conversing, but I didn't mind because I was just thrilled to be hearing Whitesnake.

Forward to the addition of weekend brunch.  If you find yourself in Cow Hollow (this is not the Marina, the Marina is north of Lombard) on a weekend morning, this is the hub.  

The stars here are definitely the cocktails.  Whether it's brunch or pre/post dinner drinks, this place just rocks.  They play great music, the room is jumpin, the vibe is all positive.  Dark wood & sexy booths round out the evening mood.

The food itself is...okay.  The demoned eggs didn't impress.  I love crab, but found these to be lackluster.  The meatballs I had for lunch were zesty & hearty, but a bit bland.  

That's pretty much the ticket here.  Stick w the staples if you're hungry, & enjoy the drinks.  

3 & 1/2 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
I came here on a Saturday morning for brunch and the usual lively crowd was at it again. This time the large table next to mine just drunkenly finished screaming/singing something and were standing proudly on chairs/tables to take a group selfie. I sipped on my Moscow Mule and prayed for the staff, how they endure this behavior on a daily basis is beyond me. Our server was great, she remained Zen the entire time and was prompt about taking our orders and delivering them in a timely fashion.
To be candid, the food is kind of meh. It's a bar so it's to be expected. The drinks were solid. The service fantastic. The scene humorous. This place is what it is.
author: Leann W.

description:
Better make reservations even for brunch otherwise you have to eat at the bar which is bar plus that long communal table behind it.  

I hate making reservations so ended up at the bar.  It's pretty loud inside there so hard to hear whoever you're eating with.

Prime rib Sun - only available for dinner - bummed out, not for brunch.

Since I had a gift certificate we ordered a bunch of stuff:

coffee - black coffee is $3.  Yikes!  Hubby got it and said just ok.
French Dip $14 - nice meat & cheese sandwich, au jus was pretty gross though, side salad was meh.
Grilled hanger salad $17 - steak and potato w/ green beans, just a serving of steak size of deck of cards, 1-2 fingerling potatoes, some green beans and lots of white sauce.  
Gimlet $12 - damn expensive, hubby liked
Deviled egg w/ dungeness crab $9 - 2 cage-free eggs cuz up and mashed up w/ tiny amount of crab.  Salty, but I still liked it.
Butterscotch pot de creme $7 - tiny portion I thought, tasted ok.

Subtotal $62 + $5.42 tax = $67.42.  Tip we paid cash.

Separate bathrooms in the back Left side.  I have some money left on my gift card so will be back.  Hope to try Ahi tuna salad next time.
author: Ann L.

description:
So I'm sitting alone at the table when a waitress brings my 2 entrees...

Her: "Can I grab you guys anything else - does she need silverware?" ::gestures to the empty place setting::

Me: (Huh? Oh.) "No I'm good, thanks."

Haaahaha #goodtimes. Two things are always funny to me with restos: when my menu's taken away bc they think I'm done ordering #noandthen, and when they think there are other people bc I #orderallthedishes.

(-_^) Iced Tea $3 (http://bit.ly/1X5ZE8r)
Bottomless. Needed at every meal.

(-_^) Blue Crab Benedict $15 (http://bit.ly/1PGY8nN)
Put the hashbrown on top.
Wish english muffins were toasted.

(-_^) Chorizo Breakfast Burrito $13 (http://bit.ly/1NSxSs3)
Amply sized. #thatswhatshesaid

(^_^) Music $0
80's 90's dance-a-thon.

Had biscuits & gravy been on the menu, I might've had to order 3 entrees... for me and BOTH of my wives. #heyyyooooo
author: Dan B.

description: The environment and service were a lot of fun. While we were a little dismayed at the brunch menu (not a lot of options) the things we did get were good. The biscuits and gravy came out a little cold, but had a great flavor! I would recommend. We will be visiting for lunch or dinner soon!
author: kevin m.

description:
Patio for our Yorkie! Great Small Apps and super friendly staff! Our go-to spot...

Demoned Eggs, Housemade Pretzel Knots, Organic Spinach & Artichoke Dip... If you still hungry after that try the Fiery Mac 'n Cheese or Prather Ranch Burger!
author: Madhusudhan R.

description: Horrendously and comically slow service, even when slow, they screw up orders and have mismatched pricing between menu and bill, don't know how to cook a burger, and just the laziest hostesses
author: A C.

description: The bouncer at the door was terrible wouldn't even let us in. Claimed we had "fake ID's." He even took one of our friend's ID's. He wouldn't give it back after we asked twice! Now she will have to go to the DMV for a new ID. Definitely not worth going to especially with so many good bars around. I definitely recommend going to "The Palm" way better and they don't act stuck up. Heed my warning or you'll wind up like we did, with no ID and have to go back home.
author: Aidan L.

description: Ok...while I respect my fellow Yelp reviewers I must respectfully disagree with some of their assessments of the Brixton.  The truth is that this is a very friendly neighborhood bar with an eclectic and mastered menu.  The cocktails are beyond excellent and the entrees beyond, well they are excellent. Don't even get me started on the bartenders and management!  Nicely done one and all!!!!
author: John J.

description:
Tricking into this place an 1 hour before our reservations to drop off a cake was not reassuring. The 1st host was kindly nice enough to take the cake off my hands. I did ask her to place our cake into their freezer. Another host had check me in and saw that our reservation was only set for 3. I had to mention that there was 10 of us, and we went back and fourth a few times. She had a puzzled face and found our reservation, and said sorry. She should of/could of review our reservation more clearly before making her dumb-ass comments. 

When my friends arrived, the same host walked us to our table and it was not ready so we ended up waiting around. Then, our waitress was so impatience about how many of us are showing up and gave us attitude. Due to traffic, my crew made it. Her entire era, face expression, body language and verbal skill were definitely not intact. It seems that she was not happy with her jobs and took it out us.

After bunch, I was sitting right next to my birthday friend, the waitress had approached me saying [abruptly] , "WE CHARGE A $2. cutting fee", she could/should of went towards the end of the table to ask someone else. We don't mind the fees but it was how she said it. She came out with my friend's cake and our bi-rite cake was all melted. Plus, our waitress had a sour face expression, and made a hand gesture- waved [hurry up]. Next, they had sliced the cake and passed it without napkins or utensils. Basically, I would have to say, they need to pick up their customer services skills and be more courtesy. This was far the worst place to have brunch on Union Street.
author: Teresa C.

description: Girls night out to catch up in the city of San Fran. Love this place for brunch, they also have a great variety of little plates and meals for dinner!  Located in the Marina district/Cow Hollow part of town, great gastro pub flare with fresh twists. Their cocktails are a mix of old and new flavors, good craft beers and wine selection and a great upscale pub feel with dark woods, leather chandelier decor, a great ambience to relax with friends kick back and have great food and drinks with your friends.  We had all small plates from grilled shishitos, chargrilled to perfection, Manila clams in white wine chorizo broth, roasted Brussel sprouts balsamic glaze, deviled eggs (delish), they were out of the kale salad, I think the waiter suggested the cauliflower dish (yum), hamachi cruddo (fresh, drizzle of fruity olive oil). Nice and attentive waiter, he was very nice just letting us girls chit chat, as he didn't want to interrupt us, yet very hospitable.  Low key place, quiet so you can have nice conversation without yelling over each other, pleasing ambiance too. Parking, hey it's the Marina, use your mobile parking app!
author: Rhondi S.

description: Went here this evening had a nice cocktail with my date.  Went to order another and was met by the rudest bartender in my life.. ordered the drink and she said it was not available.  She then said "I'm not trying to be an asshole, but look around you".  Yeah I get I was busy but the drink was far from complicated.  I tried to take a look at the menu and she literally grabbed it from my hands and said "have a good night".  I was speechless..  if I was being rude or pushy that's one thing, but I was very polite.  Literally the worst experience I've had as a customer since I can remember.  Will never return.
author: Mike B.

description: Took two hours to get our food, waited an hour in between being visited by our waiter. The owner needs to seriously reconsider how they  schedule their staff.
author: Chas F.

description: Really loved the look of this spot. Cool music posters everywhere and dimmed lighting. Good beer selection. But the food was just ok, especially for its price. The people were pretty stuck up, not the workers but the customers. I was pushed aside by a guy in a suit and he didn't apologize.
author: Gracie N.

description:
This place was cool. I didn't come here for another other thank a couple drinks with friends.
We planned on sitting on their back patio which was a very cool spot but it seemed to be full with the 20s-early 30s crowd.
We ended up at the bar top and order through the bartender. We tried a couple of their cocktails and beers on tap and were happy. I wish we could have enjoyed the outside so maybe we will be back to do so.
Can't really rate on much besides the quick service and decent drinks and the ambiance.
author: Sara N.

description:
Checked this spot out for early Sunday dinner and drinks while visiting a friend.  We had a group of 5 and were easily accommodated. Had a great cocktail list and the menu also had a good variety as well. We ordered a few different things- 

the demoned eggs- nothing too special about these 
The fried chicken salad- chicken was crispy and warm and really liked the crisp green beans in the salad. Wish there would've been a bit more dressing. 
Spicy Mac and cheese- came out bubbling! Was different but tasty 
Pretzel bites- pretty standard 
Chicken entree- didn't try but my friend loved 

Overall food and service was good. My reason for not giving another star was due to a cleanliness issue. The back of the kitchen is totally exposed and we ended up watching multiple staff eat dead food and not wash their hands after. Just simply stand and wait to run food or get sauces. Kind of gross and really if you're gonna let the staff eat food put a curtain up!!!
author: Christina G.

description: This bar has a cool vibe but the caliber of bar staff and management is poor. I get the impression that this is the cheap bar that all the just out of college folks go to for cheaper than normal SF prices. I went here with my four other friends as we were in town from Chicago and they would not accept two of their IDs (and thus would not serve us) because their 'chef/manager' said "they were concerned about the security features but didn't think it was fake". I'm not entirely sure what that means, but it translated to we don't know how to check out of state IDs. I understand that illinois currently has two different IDs, but if you are a well established bar, your management should be able to check identification of all sorts particularly when it is a domestic license. I won't be returning.
author: Samantha F.

description:
Used to love this place but less than good experience this time. Went for brunch and ordered the yogurt granola parfait and the lox pizza bread. The parfait was decent but not enough yogurt at all. Stay away from the lox pizza bread. The salmon was funky and there was not enough cream cheese at all. It just tasted off. Also, the service was extremely slow. We were clearly done and no one came to clear our plates or ask if we wanted anything else for about thirty minutes.

Lastly, way over-priced.
author: Julia M.

description:
Food: 3/5
Service: 4/5
Ambiance: 3.5/5
Value: 3/5

The food here is pretty average, but I love the fact that they take reservations for brunch. It's great not to have to wait an hour for a table, especially for larger parties.

With the funky wallpaper and the high backed booths, the place looks pretty classy. We came here after running the Presidio 10. We were seated right away after they opened and the food arrived quickly. I had the chicken avocado sandwich and it was good post-run food. I wouldn't recommend the bloody mary, though. It was super salty and not well balanced.
author: Alice W.

description: Bloody Mary Review - The Brixton Bloody Mary is like a roller coaster ride of delightful flavor explosions. Prominent notes of horseradish and lemon attack your taste buds from all sides, while a nice hit of Stoli Citros vodka rounds out this proprietary blend of super secret ingredients. Want to know more? You'll have to bribe the bartender. Why go? Get lost in secret ingredients. | Price: $12
author: Shelley B.

description:
I picked The Brixton for dinner out of the convenience of being able to make online reservations quickly and easily. Their menu looked okay, so I figured, why not!

We went during one of the NFL playoff games to a super packed restaurant full of fans watching the game on one of the many big screen TV's throughout the dining and bar areas.  When we arrived, I noticed it was super loud due to the restaurant nearly at capacity and with audio of the the game streaming through the speakers.  

When the hostess returned to the stand, she told us our table wasn't ready, but the group sitting where we were supposed to dine was just waiting to pay their bill.  I didn't want to sit inside at all, so fortunately, they had a few tables readily available with heat lamps above us, so we were escorted back outside.

Service from our server was spotty since it was crowded and they were busy.  My husband ordered another round of the cocktail he enjoyed, but it took at least 20 minutes for it to come out.  I sipped on a Moscow mule that I wasn't in love with, so I didn't bother ordering another round.

We both started off with a cup of clam chowder and that was just okay.  It could have used a lot more flavor, I can't recall the last time I salted my food, but I caught myself salting the clam chowder of all things, lol.  We also ordered the Demoned Eggs served with aioli, shallots, celery and topped with fresh Dungeness crab and bacon bites.  This appetizer was delicious, one of the better deviled egg dishes I've had.  I think the combination of the crab and bacon topping won me over.

On Sundays, they have a prime rib dinner special with veggies and a loaded baked potato for only twenty bucks!  Since we got there at 5pm, our server had to check if it was ready (which is available starting at 5:30 on Sundays).  My husband opted for it and it was a good sized cut, he enjoyed it.  I ordered the cornmeal fried chicken salad.  It was good, but it was way too much salad for just one person to eat.  I loved the taste of the chicken and like that it was lightly breaded.  I thought I ate enough of this salad, but still left a lot of goodness behind since I got full off our appetizers.  I also ordered the combo of sweet potato and regular skinny fries, but hardly touched it.  I guess our eyes were bigger than our appetites during this visit, lol.  It was good, but just too much food for us to consume.

Overall, The Brixton was good, but not great.  Service was slow, but that was because of the game being on and their restaurant completely full. Let's just hope they're more attentive on regular nights since we had to remind our server to bring us water refills twice. If anything, I'd return back for their Demoned eggs, they were worth the visit!
author: Joanne B.

description:
~2:00 Sunday lunch. Promptly seated. Took a bit longer than expected for a server to swing by. I wouldn't even expect it to take that long at rush hour. The server was nice and the do dame out pretty quickly after our order. We had the carnitas hash and the fried chicken Benedict. Add a lemonade and you're over $40 after tax and tip.

The hash was a little over seasoned, actually overly salted. The Benedict was better, but the grid chicken was just ok. I've had much better. I've even had better fried "chicken" and i hate fake meat products.

I would normally are this 3 stars, but the venue and atmosphere knocks it down. Note the date and time: it was ridiculously loud in here. The game was on, though probably without the volume. Then music was on,  but not overly loud. It was the obnoxious self indulgent patrons who think they are each so much more important and better than anyone else. I would NOT bring a baby here. How loud you're asking? Check my photos. It's like every table needs to be louder than the next, just to sound more important than the next.

Overheard: something something trip to exotic place, something something how smart elephants are. In the same breath, I wouldn't work for a place that doesn't do (insert a number larger than infinity here) for their employees. Oh honey, you're in for a rude awakening if you ever need to find another job that isn't twitter, facebook, google, apple. The in accurate use of the word "literally" way too many times.
author: Benny N.

description:
Came here with some friends for a 4th of July brunch. Overall, service was awful: our waitress did not bother checking in on us as we waited for meals, we had to find her to get status on our meal- despite the "2 min" she quoted it was another 10 min before we were served- took an hour+ to get our food, and it was cold.
The food itself was "hungry good," meaning we were starving by the time we received it that even a cold burger was satisfying. 
Unfortunate because this used to be my go-to brunch spot.
author: Roma R.

description: Slowest. Service. Ever. Food isn't worth the wait, avoid and eat somewhere else on this street.
author: Molly Q.

description:
Went here last Thursday for dinner for a GNO. We ordered the miso ahi tuna salad, blackened mahi mahi, pasta carbonara and fries because one of my friends said their portions weren't big. Just as I expected, we couldn't finish everything. The portions were decently sized and the food was delicious and full of flavor in every bite. 

We also had two rounds of margaritas. I could say that I've had better. No complaints in the service. Everyone was very attentive and friendly. I'll definitely come back here again and won't be ordering too much so I can savor the flavor instead of getting stuffed.
author: Kathleen P.

description:
Half off wine bottles on Wine Wednesday and slow roasted prime ribs on Sundays! Brixton is a great place to watch game days and they're happy hour is from Monday to Friday at 3-7pm, Tuesday 11-2am. 

I've had their bloody marry which wasn't too bad. I came here for dinner and they're food is pretty decent. Here is what I would recommend: 

- Demoned Eggs: 2 cage-free eggs plumped with yolk, aioli, shallots, celery, topped with fresh dungeness crab, and bacon. Finish with chives and parsley.
- Crab Cakes: Golden deep-fried blue crab cakes with diced bell peppers, chilies, and onions over fresh greens. Prepared with our zesty remoulade sauce.
- Organic Mixed Baby Greens: Organic mixed mesclun tossed with seasonal fruit and fresh shaved fennel in our aged-sherry vinaigrette. (ordered extra avocados and it comes in great portions!) 
- Grilled Flatbread Meat Pizza: Grilled housemade pizza dough covered with a sweet plum tomato sauce, pickled hot peppers, mozzarella, fontina and molinari spicy pepperoni and italian sausage. (if you like spicy, this is your flatbread)
author: Jenn L.

description: I have been here for 30 minutes and I have heard Despascito four times. Can this place please hire a DJ and stop letting drunk girls control the iPod? Thanks.
author: Cory W.

description: I like this place.  It's a nice room and the food is really good.  For a rock and roll themed atmosphere, the menu stretches way beyond the usual pub grub in to some downright healthy alternatives.  E.g., I ordered the avocado toast and Kale salad and both were excellent.  This is a good spot for lunch on Union over the weekend for sure.
author: Bob F.

description: The service was a little slow but the food and drinks were really good and the workers were super nice and accommodating of us changing our reservation around a few times. I'd say 4.5/5 but be prepared to wait a while if you don't make a reservation in advance.
author: Fallon B.

description: Food was ok, service was good, dog-friendly (heated!) outdoor seating was great! We both had the $14 vegan black bean/quinoa/chickpea burgers on acme buns. The buns were very soft and the burger patties were flavorful but mushy and fell apart on us. After a few bites we had to eat them with forks. My sister's came with thin, crispy, surprisingly not greasy sweet potato fries. Mine came with a side salad that was nothing special, just greens and vinaigrette, and appeared to have bacon pieces mixed in (good thing I'm no longer vegetarian!) The burgers came with a delicious ketchup, which almost seemed homemade, and a garlic mayo. The burgers were definitely overpriced, but I chalked it up to it being the Marina. The waiter was nice enough to bring a makeshift water bowl for my dog (takeout container) and we had a good time people watching.
author: Caroline S.

description: Their food is super salty but it's not bad. What I really thought was bad was the service. Our waiter was nice but very forgetful, we had a big group of 10 and we all got food except for three people, and they didn't get food until we talked to the manager. We were there for a total for 2.5 hours, making us late for our event. Literally three people in the party did not end up with food till the latter part of the 2nd hour, way after the rest of us ate.
