They did give us clams and shots of tequila as a service for making us wait. Two of our group didn't get drinks. Don't come here, I don't understand why you would.
author: Terry K.

description: Stopped in here by chance on a sunny afternoon and got to sit outside.  Not much to say except that the food was excellent. Clean, fresh flavorful, reasonably priced and the staff were sweet and accommodating especially to my disabled mother.  Got it all right.  Looking forward to returning.
author: Stephen D.

description: The "Impossible Burger" is by far the BEST veggie burger I've ever had!!! Sweet potato fries and a great margarita. My new favorite eatery. We will be back :)
author: Tricia P.

description: Decent food, better than other reviewers wrote.  Cool, relaxed vibe for lunch, good for people watching.  Prices are affordable at ~$10-17 for lunch.  Fresh flower at each table.
author: Vanessa O.

description: Best biscuits and gravy. I'm from the south, so I was ready to judge. But damn, they were so good!
author: Bethy B.

description: Omfg I got to say I have never met the most genuinely awesome people in the universe they are the most cordial people, also great meat balls.
author: Chase R.

description: The food was good. The coffee was amazing. The bathrooms were SUPER nice. I thought the food was a little too salty though. Everything we ordered was extra salty. Great except that one small detail.
author: Bailey R.

description: My fiance and I went in for a couple of drinks, great atmosphere! They play a good variety of music (older hip hop). The waitress' are gorgeous and very friendly!
author: Lauren S.

description: Good location and nice ambiance but the food isn't the best quality.  The drinks are good but the severs take a long time to attend the table.
author: Usha G.

description:
I've been here a few times now, once for dinner, and twice for brunch. All were pleasant experiences. This review will specifically focus on brunch though.

A must: Bloody Mary - delicious, generously sized, and a good variety of garnishes. yum! Get's two thumbs up on our roommate bloody mary tour of SF!

Mains: I'm a benedict fan for brunch, so I've tried two of theirs (they have an impressive 6 varieties of benedicts). The fried chicken benedict is good, I'd give it 3.5 stars. Definitely not a healthy choice, but great for an indulgence. The spinach and roma tomato florentine deserves a solid 4 stars - tasty, good portion sized, and fresh ingredients. I'd definitely get this again.

Sides: the home fries are super yum - I love that there is bell pepper and onions mixed in with the potato chunks. The hash browns are much less impressive, they look like they came out of a freezer box. I think they can do better here...

So in summary, my ideal brunch here looks like: Bloody Mary and an Eggs Florentine Bene w/home fries. 

Service is great - very friendly and accomodating staff.
author: Krista S.

description:
Went for brunch yesterday without a reservation... I would definitely recommend making a res for Sunday brunch, we had to sit at the communal table, but were able to save seats for our friends that lagged so it wasn't too bad. I was trying to stay away from hard alcohol this weekend so I ordered a bloody beer, they don't hAve it on the menu so the waitress was a little confused but made it happen. We love their brunch menu so we come here at least once a month.

Bacon was crispy and perfect & the carnitas hash -amazing! My gf got the veggie wrap but ate less than half because she didn't like it, so we wouldn't recommend that. The bloody Mary's were liked by everyone !
author: danielle a.

description:
We were walking around the Marina and came across this place for brunch. We waited in front of the hostess as she was flustered and then walked away and a new hostess came.. it was fine, I understand Sunday brunches are hectic especially with large parties. But it was a start to how the service would be throughout.

We were finally seated and the server asked if we wanted anything to drink, since we were starving and the menu is pretty small (good size) we were ready to order but she only took our drink orders. This continued. We wanted the check, we paid the bill, tonss of waiting. At one point we poured the water ourselves since the pitchers were on the counter near us. 

I got the vegan burger with avocado. The burger was pretty alright, definitely could have used some more flavor. They skimmed on the avocado also but overall the burger was pretty dec. The fries were suppper good. Honestly the 2 vs 3 stars for this place is for the fries. The sweet potato ones are a must get.
author: Aria S.

description: My friend bought drinks with a receipt and we were repeatedly harassed for not paying when we literally had paid with receipt in hand.
author: Justin P.

description:
Awesome place - such huge portions for the price and very very tasty.

The music was a bit loud for this old man... :P
author: Jimmy S.

description:
We came here after hanging out enjoying the air show for Fleet Week.

My bf and my roomie got a beer each and we ordered the Marys Roasted Chicken and Beet Salad, the French Fries, Sweets Potato Fries, 1/2 & 1/2, and the Tacos of the Day. The salad was pretty good, but even though we asked for the dressing on the side, the salad already seemed to have some sort of coating on it. The fries were tasty, thin cut fries, and the tacos of the day were also pretty solid.

It's a cool spot that has some outdoor seating, but they also have TV's inside where you can watch the game on Sunday.
author: Leana L.

description: I went there for brunch and ordered Breakfast food. I ordered their signature breakfast sandwich. When it came out it was disappointing. It was mostly a large bun (bread roll) with one small egg and a half sausage. The side was a McDonald's style hash brown. I couldn't believe that was their signature breakfast selection, which was The Brixton breakfast sandwich. $14 is not bad for a brunch but in this case it was a ripoff. The lunch plates I saw looked better but I don't know if I will be going back.
author: Jacob W.

description: As a person who loves brunch, don't go here without a reservation! Food was okay, but the service was poor. We arrived right when the restaurant opened and were told we could sit at the "communal table" with a party of 9 even though there weren't 9 seats for us and we couldn't take chairs from the the bar. This seemed kind of ridiculous given that there was open seating after we had squished into a smaller area than what we would have liked. We also noticed that the hosting staff seemed extremely unprepared/overwhelmed. We ordered drinks and they consistently would bring one less out than ordered. One meal and one drink were comped, but overall the experience was less than stellar. They also had failed to put any paper towels in the bathroom and have a broken hand dryer!
author: Kendall R.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!! Their cocktails are amazing. The food is fast. The staff is attractive and hip. The wallpaper is my absolute favorite haha. You'll end up here if you spend a night on union street 100%!
author: Melissa B.

description:
First time here on a tuesday for lunch.   I ordered an appetizer hamachi crudo and it was really good!  Also had the taco of the day.  4 mini tacos and they were pretty damn good.  

It also helped that it was sunny and probably like 70 outside on the patio.   Picture perfect september day in SF!.   

Everything on the menu looked good but what I had was enough to fill me up.

Also the brixton bloody mary was delicious!!
author: Eric K.

description: Went to The Brixton last night after a late movie, birthday double date. It was nice to find a place that served food and drinks late on a Thursday night. I really like the look of this place. We got a big booth since it was pretty dead but it still had a cozy atmosphere. The appetizers were so appealing that we ordered them as meals. I love deviled eggs, but they weren't that good for me. I was excited about the crab that ended up being almost non-existent and the bacon made them super salty. I also opted for the mini tacos that ended up being pretty spicy and underwhelming. They have a great drink menu and beer selection but maybe their main dishes are better than their appetizers. Points for friendly service and nice ambiance!
author: Dana J.

description:
The Marina's version of going hipster for the night without having to go the Mission. 

The Brixton is named after a famous music venue in UK and you can see the homage to music with music posters of the Runaways, the Smiths, The Clash bands that i doubt many people in the Marina would listen too? 

As much as I want to hate on this place, it's everything that i love...

Dying to come back try the bloody mary surf and turf.  

Will be back!  

What we ordered: 
$20 Burger (didn't taste like $20.  I would pass on this one)
Sweet Potato Fries 
Spagetti and Meatballs (had a kick) 
Demon Eggs with crab and bacon
author: Sandy C.

description: Forgot food for 3 people, a number of drinks arriving an hour late. The dishes they forgot were salads. In 2.5 hours there they couldn't figure out to send other food to resolve this, mid-meal they sent clams to our tables we didn't order. Then came the bill and going back and forth - they added a number of things that we never ordered or didn't receive, resolving that was another hassle. The wait staff, manager were all polite and apologetic but it just made us feel really bad for our friends who were celebrating a birthday and their going away. This is not why people go out to eat.
author: Ash S.

description:
It took a lot for me to finally boycott The Brixton. A stranger vomiting on my foot at the bar, then walking off silently and without explanation... endless hours of bumping shoulders with hundreds of guys who work in sales, and wear the same shirt, on an almost weekly basis... this was all forgiven. I could still live with The Brixton. 

This weekend, The Brixton actually stole my credit card. Yes. It's true. After handing my card over for a second round of drinks, the bartender simply didn't come back. I asked multiple times to close out, as I had originally asked... asked to close my tab if they had kept the card.. to which I got the most strangely aggressive treatment I've ever witnessed from a bartender.

The bartender who served me snapped at me "I've never seen you before in my life," 5-10 minutes after taking my order. She flatly refused to return my credit card, and denied service in a more rude and abrasive way than I've ever seen before. It was a pretty egregious. 

A different bartender, from whom I had ordered earlier in the night, finally came and tried to help in the respectable way that one would expect. She still couldn't deliver me my card. 

I didn't catch her name, but the thin early-20s, slightly darker skinned bartender who took my order was the most stone cold demon I've ever dealt with. My god bless her soul. 

In the end, I had to call my bank and get my credit card replaced. Goodbye, The Brixton.
author: Jake D.

description: The bouncer honestly.. attempted to fight me. Never had anything like that happen to me. Very low class place and the management needs to reconsider the way they treat patrons... bad experience overall
author: Mosa M.

description: Hey guys, have you ever wanted to travel to New Jersey and visit the cast of MTV's world-famous Jersey Shore? Well now you can, and without even leaving the Marina! This place caters to the absolute worst crowd, bottom-feeding bros who are always looking for a fight. Every time I've been here, I've been subjected to some sort of violent language from someone in an Ed Hardy-tight t-shirt. The food is great, and I shouldn't hate the management for the poor atmosphere as this IS located in the Marina after all. There are plenty of bars in the area that lack the hostility, so keep that in mind when choosing a weekend brunch or late night stop.
author: Luis P.

description:
Came for HH and I've got to say it was delightful.

I had the Buckland Peach.  Delish!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Came here for brunch on a Friday (ok I guess its lunch if its on a weekday), and it was pretty empty. 

I can see that when this place gets going though, it seems like a pretty swanky place to get all bouched up with the gang. 

A few ordered the tuna sandwich, and to be honest, it was way off the chang. Super good, I still think about it and I went months ago. The serving is HUGE, and the bread is fresh and toasted, the cheese on top super delicious and with all of the tuna paired..its like the delicious tuna sandwich of your dreams. There was other food on the table, but I didn't even notice, I was too wrapped up in my tuna sandwich that everything else was a blur. 

The waiter was also really nice, and the service was fast!
author: Molly S.

description: The customer service was great!! However, I had the popular hamburger do not recall the name. However, It was a huge let down. It was just very bland! I wouldn't mind going one more time for brunch if my friends wanted to go and I would give it another shot. But it would never be my first choice for brunch!
author: Paola N.

description:
Food was fine. Wait staff fine. Went with a large group. Overall it was fine, nothing spectacular. 

The avocado toast was the best thing that the Group ordered so there's that. 

It was a bit cold inside. But... it was all fine.
author: Jade H.

description: Crappy food, poor service.    I asked for the check and it took half an hour (timed).    This is another place destined for failure
author: Mark K.

description:
My birthday celebration on Saturday March, 11 at 7:30pm was an embarrassing disaster at  "The Brixton". My party of 15 spent 3 hours of disappointment. #1 our server showed up only 3 times at our table & only refilling waters 2 times during our wait. She was also a know it all so when I suggested she take the order according to the groups paying together she dismissed it and said she would remember, but of course that wasn't the case at the end. & I'll explain further as you continue reading.
 #2. The kitchen took about an hour and 30 minutes to  push our food out.
#3. The quality of our food was extremely disappointing (our server didn't come back to check if everything was okay) the fries where salty, the crab cakes where salty and everyone in the table had a complaint. Unfortunately what do you do when your whole party has already waited that long and they are starving ? It was then 9pm and everyone decided to just go along with it we had to be at the second part of the celebration by 10pm. 
#4. The server (African American female about 5'3 in her 20's) makes a disaster with the checks. Consumed another 30-40 minutes of our time because she didn't listen she ended up charging item by item and everything got extremely confusing. But it doesn't end there, I went up to where she was standing with her co worker and I voiced my unhappy time at the restaurant still letting her know I was understanding about the kitchen that's definitely not her fault and what do I get in return: a fake smile, excuses : our party is large and the restaurant is busy (do they not have assigned sections?), and her starring directly at me with her fake smile that let me know she didn't give a crap about my experience. I even explain that perhaps I should instead be voicing that to the manager And then her co worker (Caucasian female about 5'2 in her 20's) helps her with the excuses and also suggest that yes I should speak to the manager unfortunately the manager is also very busy at the moment. So I obviously get irritated and let the server know I don't like her attitude. I walked away before I had more to say.
 My group spend $500+ on basic food/ over salted + an included 20% tip that the the server DID NOT one single bit deserve.  to avoid more wait time wasted and dealing with more than what we had already experienced I didn't talk to the manager on the spot. For that amount of money I would of rather had my birthday at a fast food restaurant and I'm sure it would been a better experience. I don't know what the restaurant will do to recompense  that experience but I am planning to contact their owner or corporate office if they have one because that was unacceptable! Not ONE person in our table of 15 people have interest in coming back to this restaurant. It was a total embarrassment. The only person who deserved our tip was the bar that's the ONLY good thing we had for the dining experience. I really wish I would of never made a reservation here. It was a waste of everything ! Money, time and my breath.
author: Mabel A.

description:
Slow to nonexistent service, I wouldn't bother with this place, way too many better options within walking distance.  

The space itself, was nice, great table arrangements along with stylish, dark minimalist decor.

I did get a chance to checkout their menu before we gave up & left, and there was an interesting selection of food items along with a tempting craft cocktail menu as well.  

Sadly, I highly doubt I can talk our group into giving this place another try, like I said, the city offers way too many wonderful options.   
And bad service, should never be ignored.
author: Winny S.

description:
Girls Night with the besties happened stumbling upon this restaurant when we trampled around like starving beasts. Imagining a high class candlelight dinner ordeal, we came to find a casual, emphatic mixed music booming throughout the uniquely decorated restaurant. The prices of a plate of dinner ranged from about $10-$30. 

The Brixton Prather Ranch Burger $14 + $1.50 added bacon: Grass fed Prather Ranch burger served on an ACME pain de mie bun with balsamic red onions, roma tomatoes, pickles, green leaf lettuce and your choice of sharp cheddar, swiss, jack, or bleu cheese. Add avocado or apple-wood smoked bacon for $1.50 or add a fried egg $2. SOUNDS AMAZING. but I guess my expectations werent 100% met. The patties were a bit too dried and the buns would have tasted better if it was toasted a little. Other than that it was ok. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-brixton-san-francisco?select=vk47l4nR8Ig8t857RoGBCw#hvqMk2EALuyOQJMLYZsg-A

My friend ordered Roasted Chicken and Beet Salad, but the entire salad was missing chicken... But they were super apologetic and brought her plate back after mixing in the chicken.

HA, almost forgot I am legal to drink now.... but I got...
Strawberry Don Royale $11: Blanco tequila, Falernum liqueur, strawberry puree, lime, champagne. SOUNDS AMAZING right? But when i tried it... it was overly powered by the tequila and it was too strong for my own personal likings. When I asked the waiter for a super girly fruity drinks with little hint of alcohol, I feel like this was a little on the strong side. Or maybe, I'm just too noob with this and cant handle my alcohol. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-brixton-san-francisco?select=vk47l4nR8Ig8t857RoGBCw#vk47l4nR8Ig8t857RoGBCw

Anyways, it was a little pricey and everything sounded good but taste did not meet my expectations. However, our waiter was extremely friendly and service was top notch there. The atmosphere was pretty chill and it felt like a FRIDAY NIGHT WITH THE GIRLS kind of atmosphere.
author: Chena N.

description: $90 for a burger and two appetizers. Kinda overpriced. Came here for a birthday party. Spinach dip was sizzling on top, but I've cold in the middle. A guest in my party had to send back a pizza that was, as she described it, about as good as a Torino's pizza roll. Would come back for happy hour drinks only.
author: Marissa W.

description: Got a nice seat by the windows and staff were really friendly. The brunch was nice - I had the scrambled egg with bacon, avocado and tomatoes. The toast came without any spreads and if you wanted fruit instead of hash browns you had to pay an extra dollar. Would be nice if that wasn't the case considering how cheap scrambled eggs are to make.
author: Lucy M.

description:
Great vibe for Sunday brunch. Open space and patio, but make reservations beforehand if you want to sit outside. 

Waitress was kind enough to allow us to sample the beer before ordering. 

I had the Seared Ahi Salad which was a bit overdressed but good nonetheless. Came with edamame and grape tomatoes. 
 
My girlfriend got the steak and potatoes. Highly recommended! 

Cocktails were strong as well :)
author: Rosanna B.

description:
I was here on Saturday for dinner. They have an extensive cocktail menu so imaging they would be a good choice for happy hour as well. The service was slow, even water arrived late. Got the crab cakes and the grilled peppers as appetizers, both got praise from the whole table. I had the New York Steak wich was a good choice, the burger looked promising as well. 
Around 9:00 they dim the lights and turn on the music which was mainly catchy pop tunes. The people started dancing and singing along while still sitting at their tables & finishing up on dinner.
author: Suna L.

description:
We ate here after a long drive from Orange County. The food wasn't that memorable but it wasn't bad. Luckily, we were there for happy hour so the prices were even better.   Me and the boyfriend split a cheese burger and the salad that comes with steak and green beans.  The salad was different than I expected (no lettuce), but I was pleasantly surprised - it was really good.  This was the better of the two options.  I have my favorite cheese burger spots and I'm pretty picky so unfortunately I was disappointed with the burger.  It was by no means bad, just not as good as what I'm used to.

Our server was nice and friendly and I liked the booth we sat in so overall it was a great experience.  I would go back and order that salad again.   

Pros
Happy Hour is 11-7 M-F 
Nice ambience
author: Danielle H.

description:
Amazing service. They had to move our table because a large group was coming in and the bought our last round of mimosas.

I had the eggs Benedict and it was the best I have ever had. The hollandaise sauce was divine.
author: Wendy M.

description: I had lunch there and the food was disappointing. My daughter had the French dip and the meat was charred and dried out. I had a chicken and beet salad. The chicken was dry, beets were flavorless and the dressing tasted like just oil. The waiter took our order and someone else delivered our meals. The waiter didn't come back until we were done.
author: N O.

description:
7pm on a Sunday evening,  place isn't crowded.  25 minutes and counting and nobody has taken our order.  Asked the hostess at the 10 minute mark and she said she would get somebody. Nope,  another 20 goes by, time to leave.

Fire your waitstaff.
author: Kyle S.

description:
So, a buddy and I came to the city for the Walking Dead convention, and we needed to find a good place to watch the Warriors game. This definitely was the spot to be!

Food: I had two apps, and a soup. 
-the meatball- honestly, I wasn't a huge fan of the texture and flavor. Texture was super grainy, with an overwhelming lamb taste. Probably won't order that again.

-pretzel knots- these house made pretties were on point! Comes with a mustard and fiery cheddar dipping sauce, loved it!

-chicken macaroni soup- the soup was so refreshing. Super flavorful and was very herbal and just smelled amazing.

*service* it was a super busy night and we got a community table. Took 15 minutes before we were noticed, and they blamed us due to not checking in. When we did. So that put a sour taste in my mouth. Besides that, Breanna was amazing! Super nice and attentive.

*summary* overall this place is pretty loud, loud music and atmosphere. Little dark just like a pub, but the food was worth every penny. If you haven't been here, you need to try it!
author: Taylor G.

description:
Great for brunch!  The atompshere is cool, though I wish they had more outdoor seating. I wouldn't say it's great for huge groups as they only have a few booths that we squeezed 9 people into and it was very tight.

The food was pretty good. I got an egg scramble with lox and veggies which I liked a lot. The hashbrowns are delicious! A lot of other people I was with got the eggs benedict (lox, fried chicken, crab, regular, florentine etc) and LOVED them. I don't like hollandaise sauce so I didn't get them but they did look really good.

We didn't get drinks but I know they're really good. I did try a bloody mary and it was nice and spicy.
author: Jenna G.

description:
Whether I'm here for dinner and drinks with friends or a lunch date with my sister and our little dogs, Brixton has always been a great restaurant. The food is delicious and they have good drinks. 
If you go for dinner, the music and noise from the bar is a little loud, so it's not a romantic dinner spot.
author: Couture A.

description: Awesome brunch spot!! Great, friendly service and quick water filling. I ordered the roast beef sandwich with au jus and fries. It was DELICIOUS I wolfed down every bit of it - the dipping sauce/liquid was amazing. I ended up dipping my fries in it too! But I was also able to dip my fries in their fantastic bacon ranch and garlic aioli. My group loved those dipping sauces. How I'm not obese, I do not know.
author: Mio W.

description: My girlfriend and I just had an excellent lunch....deviled eggs w/ crab and bacon, veggie wrap with steak, and creme brule'...fantastic.  And it all came by recommendation from our server, including the beer, bloody Mary's, and shots of bourbon...thank you Sydney...you're the best!!!
author: Dave D.

description:
We made reservations since there was 7 of us last night at 9 p.m. We arrived and were seated right away. The atmosphere was cool. Loud, decent music, Obey wallpaper and a bunch of cool art on the walls.

Our waitress was ok. She was nice but not very experienced. She attempted to take our entire tables order from one side of the table so half of us were literally yelling out our orders. It took a while just to get us all waters.

We then got our drinks. My glass of wine was fine, as was two of the beers we ordered. Three of them were completely wrong though, instead of the Anchor Steams our friends ordered they just got what seemed like whatever the cheapest thing they had on tap was. 

Then our meals came out. The two chicken salads that were delivered to our table had no chicken. When the lack of chicken on the salads were brought to our waitresses attention they were taken into the back and came back with cold, flavorless chicken just thrown on it. One of our carbonaras was with added chicken and was placed in front of the wrong person even though we clearly stated who added it. We didn't realize it until about halfway through our meal and by that time it was too late. It was greasy and bland. We asked for chili flakes and shredded parmesan to add to it and were given chili flakes with an uncooked macaroni piece buried in them and shredded mozzarella! What?! We then had to re-ask for shredded parmesan and it was delivered right away.

Overall, our meal was really disappointing. Definitely was NOT worth the 18% gratuity that was already included in our check.
author: Lesina G.

description: When you buy a bottle of champagne it would be nice to not have to pour the orange juice from a tumbler
author: Taylor M.

description:
When I first read the name "The Brixton", an image of a stiff, overly pretentious white cloth restaurant from the 1930's with men in suits and women in dresses and furs was the first thing to pop into my head.  Thankfully, this place is nothing like that.  Hellooooo Chuck's and jeans!

Although the menu may not fit a purist's idea of what a gastropub should offer (bangers and mash, fish and chips, etc.), I couldn't care less.  If the food is pretty decent and there's a good selection of beer to choose from, it sounds like a gastropub to me!  

SPINACH & ARTICHOKE DIP - baby artichokes, spinach, with jack and parmigiano reggiano cheese...$7.00 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-brixton-san-francisco#7Onvl-TvOrzJrLBfo91_TQ)
My friend ordered it for the table, but I only tried a bite.  It seemed okay - it didn't stand out in any particular way, but that's how I feel about most spinach and artichoke dips at restaurants. 

THE BRIXTON CLAM CHOWDER with clams, white wine, herbs, russet potatoes, garlic, and cream...$4.00 for a cup (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-brixton-san-francisco#Y23n8v3j3QcxyW461YZQ9w)
I can be a little tough when it comes to clam chowder, but this one made the cut.  The consistency may not have been perfect, but they made up for it in flavor and the amount of clams they threw in.

GRILLED NIMAN RANCH PORK CHOP marinated in a hoisin ginger-lime sauce with bacon, Brussels sprouts, and fingerling potatoes...$21.00 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-brixton-san-francisco#Ye-PtmMvu-fGSNY2c_zhLA)
I'm conflicted.  The potatoes and Brussels sprouts were great, and I liked how the chop was largely moist despite its size.  And although it created a lot of charring, the flavor of the marinade wasn't bad.  However, it also made the dish seem so salty!  I don't know if it was just the marinade or the bacon/seasoning as well, but it's a good thing they came by with water as often as they did.

Considering they were able to accommodate our last minute reservations, and since our server was pretty awesome (and pretty hot), the staff at The Brixton was the highlight of the night.  I'd say their aggregate 3.5 rating is pretty accurate, and I would give the same if I could.  Sadly, despite the service/hot server, the salty and relatively pricey pork chop brings it down to a three.  Still, I wouldn't mind coming back to try other dishes, as well as their brunch menu!
author: Mike L.

description:
I feel bad judging a restaurant so harshly on just one visit, but this was one of the most disastrous dining experiences I've had in the US.  

There was a large line getting in at 11am even though we had a reservation.  It took us about 20 minutes to get in.  Then It took another 15-20 minutes to get our drink orders taken - not a good start.

There were 8 of us, and after about 10 minutes one coffee showed up.  Then... nothing.  We asked about our drinks and eventually most of the others showed up.  40 minutes after we ordered I asked about my coffee again and finally got it.

Then everyone got their meal except me.  They went to check on it, and it arrived 5-10 minutes after everyone else.  I got halfway through it and found a large black hair sitting on my egg and fruit salad.  After 5 minutes of looking for our server, I eventually had to get up and go find her and ask for a do-over.  

Our friends' eggs were undercooked when they'd asked for them well done.  We ordered sausage patties and got sausage links.  We then ordered some more sausage links and got sausage patties.  Other food just never arrived, even though we asked about it.  The other food that did come was fine though.

We practically never saw our server, and got no apologies for the late food.  Once things really went off the rails with the bad food we did start getting apologies, and had our coffees and one juice taken off our bill.  But it was infuriating to never be able to find our server and to get such a weird uncaring attitude.  

The hygiene there was not up to scratch.  In addition to the hair on my food, I saw one person taking food out to tables just open coughing over the food continually.  The guy who brought our water out left smeared dirty fingerprints all over the glasses; I skipped drinking mine.

Super disappointing as the place has potential.  The menu is interesting, the food cooked properly was tasty, and the music was great (although a touch too loud for Sunday brunch).  The space is good and it was nice getting sun while seated indoors.  Hopefully they sort themselves out.
author: Miles C.

description: I'm surprised this place only has 3.5 stars. I went and tried the salmon Benedict.. YUM. and so were the potatoes that came along with it. My boyfriend had the fried chicken Benedict and that was also delicious. Their burger on the lunch menu was also pretty good. However, they lost 1-start with their service as they were mediocre, and the hostess was fairly rude.
author: Sara K.

description: Great place! Lots of guys and girls coming straight from work so it's usually crowded - especially on Friday nights! I had the ahi salad which was... SO delicious!!!! This has been a favorite SF hot spot of mine for a while now and it hasn't let me down yet!
author: Eva G.

description: The worst place I have ever been so far. They took my orders but they forgot and got back to me half an hour later saying he has forgot to put my order in. Very bad experience.
author: Amiryousef D.

description:
I came here for brunch on Mother's day, and it was meh. 

Service: Service was great, our waiter was super friendly and helpful. 

Food: This is where the stars start falling off.  My mom and I ordered the veggie wrap, it was a good size, but lacked flavor and was SUPER watery.  It was oozing with water, not even sauce, I think from the cooked veggies inside it.  Not a fan of dripping food. 

Brothers ordered the french toast which was SUPER GOOD it had Nutella, Nutella makes everything better. Get this if you're unsure. 

My bf ordered the salmon flatbread....they forgot it so it came out after all of us were halfway through our meal and it didn't even taste toasted or anything, very plain and uncooked.  Maybe that's how it was supposed to be? But we weren't fans. 

Ambiance: We sat outside and it was lovely, its such a beautiful neighborhood and we literally saw like 50 cute dogs walk by.  I swear they're more of an accessory than a pet in this neighborhood lol.  Inside the restaurant is super cool too.  YOU CAN GO ON GOOGLE MAPS AND LOOK INSIDE THE RESTAURANT.  SO COOL. 

I'd come back for a drink and some french toast, but the other food we tried was  disappointing especially for the price tag :/
author: Christina L.

description:
Wine Wednesday's are the best! They have a great wine selection: we tried a Cabernet Sauvignon and a Pinot Grigio.

The appetizers are great: the peppers, Brussels sprouts, spinach and artichoke... All of it!

The inside is very spacious, which is awesome. The waitor was very friendly. Can't wait to come back!
author: Meaghan H.

description: I came here with a group of friends last Sunday and probably had the worst service possible. Our server, a smaller African American girl only came to our table about three times and every time she came I'm pretty certain she was drunk due to the smell of alcohol left on her breath. She didn't check on our meal we had to ask passing employees for utensils and ketchup. Didn't offer to refill our drink orders. They have a build your own Bloody Mary bar that was a plus but the service was just lacking. We closed out and hung out at the bar after we finished for a MUCH better time and experience.
author: Kristine H.

description:
I only have myself to blame for choosing The Brixton for brunch last weekend, but the Marina bar/restaurant miraculously could accommodate the large party I was with at the last minute on a Saturday morning (on a holiday weekend no less). Retrospectively, that should have been the first red flag.

We were seated quickly, which is probably the best thing I can say about the entire experience. We were soon greeted by a clearly brand new waiter who painstakingly wrote down each word from our order, very slowly, and then went back and forth to people out of order to check if they wanted options like home fries or hash browns, what kind of toast, etc.  It was confusing. To be fair, three of us did order a make-your-own scramble item, but that's how it's advertised -- create your own from a list of ingredients -- so they should be prepared to take a range of orders. Not super complicated. The computer where waiters enter their orders was right next to our table and we witnessed our waiter struggling there for about five minutes to put in the orders. Things didn't bode well for our rapidly increasing hunger.

We also ordered a few coffees and two bloody mary's. (Side note: The waiter asked those two if they wanted to go for bacon in their bloodies; they said yes, and the waiter did not inform them that they would be charged as if they ordered a SIDE of bacon, and they would only get about a quarter of an actual piece.) The coffee and two drinks (visible on the bar for about 10-15 minutes before they were moved to our table) came after the food arrived, and only after we asked about them. 

It turns out that the waiter's painstaking note-taking of our orders didn't help. My scramble was missing two ingredients and I got hash browns instead of the home fries I asked for. My friend was missing one ingredient and another got sausage in her scramble instead of just the cheese she had asked for. My scramble was overcooked and tasteless while one of my friend's was underdone.  

Also, the "hash browns" are clearly reheated rectangular blocks of frozen potato. Not shredded, not fresh. Reminiscent of McDonald's except McD's hash browns are better. Our waiter recommended the hash browns. 

Our waiter did not return once to check on us, refill waters or coffee. Another waitress refilled coffees once. 

All in all, one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. I admit this is not a place known for its food, but it's a popular enough place on Union. I'd at least invest in making some fresh hash browns.
author: Elena K.

description:
My friends and I spent an awesome day in the city to watch the blue angels. We decided to end the night with some drinks down the street at BRIXTON. The vibes were positive, the ambience of the venue was just fabulous... FOR A WHOLE 2 MINUTES. We sat at the bar top, was getting settled in, and immediately JOE, who had introduced himself as so, tells us that the older woman a couple seats down from us had a ridiculous bar tab and hopes the young man she is with "gets lucky" implying that with the type of money she was spending he should be going home with her without a doubt. He prints out the tab, points at the total in disbelief and proceeds to act very nonchalantly of his actions and comments, crumples up the tab and proceeds to point out her new total as the night continues. What bartender/professional would ever do this??? Why would it be the business of any other patron in the establishment? The woman he spoke about bought rounds of drinks for different groups in the bar throughout the night. He made snarky remarks and even worse condescending comments about her to us, acting one way to her face - even calling her "babe" - then turning back to us thinking he was so cool to say such mean and harsh things about her, what a child. 

Bottom line, he clearly took advantage of this woman. Her tab, as he heavily flaunted it, easily tripled in a matter of an hour. One charge specifically was a 127 count of $12!! There was food on the tab which was never rightfully requested as well. He closed out her tab, she signed for it and wasn't gunna mention a peep until my friend called him out on why her tab spiked into the THOUSANDS. He tried to defend himself by saying he didn't know, she ordered all those drinks for half the bar, then tried to blame it on a technical error, never apologized upfront to the woman until I called him out on it. All he did was try to cover his ass, even told her to cross out what she didn't order and give him a dollar amount that she were to pay! I told him no, coming from the business he should know to detect any outrageous charge before presenting to the customer, told him he was to void her closed out tab, split off the charges that did not belong to her, and reprint the tab - which seemed like a hard task for him to even do. He was sweating bullets, you could tell he knew he was in deep POO. He tried so hard to resolve what he thought he could get away with, his demeanor changed from the beginning of the night as an arrogant ape to a dog with his tail between his legs. Poor bartender girl tried getting involved where she clearly shouldn't have and tried blaming the customers for disrespecting her when they tried explaining what was going on. Joe even told her to stay out of it, she had no clue what was going on and butting into the situation making it worse causing more escalation to the defense of the woman that was being majorly screwed over! Only reason I could think of why this girl bartender was getting heated was because the supposed $500 tip was supposed to go in her pocket since Joe is a "manager" or something. Great scam guys. 

To end this rant, JOE... you're a crook and a bad actor and a disgrace. BRIXTON, I would not recommend to anyone unless you constantly want to check your tab for discrepancies, this was the most uncomfortable experience and I would never ever ever ever return.
author: jessica w.

description:
Admittedly, I have just had one visit to the Brixton, and I ordered just one item, and my company for the meal wasn't eating.  So the assessment is quite limited.  But my pulled pork sandwich was DAMN GOOD, and that alone will draw me back in.  Overloaded with juicy pork, this was a winner.  Great, generous portion, and loaded with tasty crispy fries.  The items being dealt to tables around me were good, and the folks at the bar on this random mid-Friday afternoon looked plastered and happy.

The restaurant features a nice outdoor patio to go along with their spacious interior.  The motif is some sort of rock/musical theme- not quite the Hard-Rock style, I'd say more of a Fillmore Theater/Haight-Ashbury poster shop motif.  Regardless, the menu is reasonably priced and expansive, and it will suck me back in again, if not just for the pulled pork....
author: Andy S.

description:
I have been to Brixton a number of times, as it is close to where I live and there is usually a fun, young crowd and decent drinks. Last night, a Saturday, the bar was packed, as per usual and I bought myself a glass of wine and a cocktail for my friend. I made a HUGE mistake of leaving my tab open with them. After we finished our drinks, my friends and I decided we wanted to go somewhere a little quieter. I approached the bar and when I got one of the bartender's attention, I asked if I may please pay my bill. He told me he would be just a minute, which was absolutely fine with me. While I was waiting, a female (brunette, glasses, exercise clothes) was taking the order from a customer whose first language was clearly not English. The bartender asked him if he would like to keep his tab opened or closed. He either could not understand her or could not hear her over the music and other noise. He asked her to repeat herself and she snapped, "Open or closed!?" After he answered, she turned to the register's screen and loudly said to her coworker, "Open or closed! How fucking stupid can you be that you don't know what the fuck that means?" She said this loud enough that not only could I hear it, but the customer she was referring to could as well. 

A few minutes go by and I remind someone behind the bar that I would like to close my tab. He pulls up the open tabs on his screen and I see my name, and point to it. He clicked it, but never gave me my receipt and just walked away. Confused, I asked another bartender if I could please close my tab. Immediately combative and rude, he told me to check my purse because there was no way that he had my debit card. I told him that I just saw my name on the screen. He pulled it up and said very condescendingly, "Oh really? Where? Check your purse." I explained that someone had clicked my tab but I never received my bill or my card back. He said, "You know what? You're really being abrasive and I am not going to look for your card." I was stunned. At no point in this interaction had I been rude. Confused, I asked him what I had done and if I could please just have my card so I could leave. He refused to help me. Two girls who were standing next to me overheard our conversation and they told me that he was withholding their credit card as well. I truly believed I was going to have to cancel my debit card. I asked him again if he could please look for my card and he kept rudely dismissing me. I told him I would call the police if he wouldn't give my card back and he said, "You're not going to threaten me in MY bar." Behind him, a different bartender lifted up my debit card, indicating that he had found it. No apologies. They ran the card but did not give me a receipt. I asked the rude bartender what his name was and he said, "Jose." I did not trust that this was his actual name and I found a manager who told me that his name is actually Joe. This manager, Phil, was wonderful. I was so upset and confused by this bizarre power trip that Joe had taken more than one patron on a ride for. Phil was incredibly apologetic and told me he would look into it. I told him I wanted this to reach upper management and another employee said, "Don't even bother. The management sucks here. They won't give a shit." 

The moral of the story? This establishment does not deserve your money. Go elsewhere.
author: Kaili K.

description:
Went here for dinner with a group of 10. We filled up the back and it was a great time! The drinks were great. and the food was subpar. I got the pasta dish but im lactose so couldn't get any of the cheese. I asked for the clams but there were only 5 of them which was disappointing for $6 extra dollars.

I think I would come back to try something new and the drinks were great and the ambiance was great! Someone was having their birthday there and there were lots of big groups which made it a fun place, though it got loud at times.
author: Bori B.

description:
Positive - Bloody Mary is delicious! And large portions of food. There was also no wait, so we got in immediately.

Negatives - food was pretty bland and the hash browns remind me of the kind that I was served at high school lunches. The worst thing however is the service. We were seated and no one came over to us for a long time. And then when we were finished, we waited a long time to get the check and actually have them let us pay.

Overall, mediocre brunch..plenty of better places in the city.
author: Christa L.

description: The service at this place sucks. Food came out cold and they gave us major attitude when we sent it back. Bloodys Mary's tasted like straight salt, they wouldn't refill our waters or coffees, and when we asked for utensils they literally threw them at us and said "you got it?". They gave us 2 settings too short and we couldn't get anyone's attention so we walked over to the server station to help ourselves and some dude came over and YELLED at us and then continued to tell everyone at the restaurant and point at us the whole time. Not worth your money
author: Lauren H.

description:
My friends and I came here last night for dinner. It is one of the few places in San Francisco where I could make a reservation in advance for a party of 10+ people. The reservation process was super easy, via OpenTable, and they had no problem adjusting our time and the number of people in our party last minute.

I am vegetarian and I absolutely loved the flat bread meat pizza. I know, how can I enjoy a meat pizza? Well, I had them make it without the meat!! And OMG, it was so good! The pickled peppers really added so much flavor. I also loved that the crust was thin and crispy and that they cut the pizza in long thin slices.

Drinks were also very good, and service was good too. They had no issue splitting the bill on multiple cards. Our waitress was wonderful - I can't remember her name but she was short and Asian.

This is definitely a bar type atmosphere, and very loud. Not in a bad way though. At the end of our reservation around 10 PM, the restaurant/bar was definitely packed.

Thanks Brixton! We will be back!!
author: Pri A.

description:
Douchey place on weekend nights but I can easily overlook that since they serve their Mac and Cheese until midnight.  I will put up with the cocky coiffed beefcakes if it means I am sinking my teeth into cheesy, spicy al dente heaven.  

The best Mac and Cheese I've had in the city.
author: Nancy R.

description: Very first time at this restaurant and I must say I was impressed! My friend and I met for brunch on Saturday and had an open table reservation. Thank God because it was crowded! We had a drink at the bar first and the bartenders were very nice! Then we got seated and were given time to catch up a little before we ordered. The menu was excellent for brunch! I opted for the Kale and ahi tuna salad with miso dressing. Yum!! My friend had the roasted beet salad and just loved it. Though it was crowded, we did not feel rushed. Our waiter (forget his name darn it!) was just great and very helpful with the menu answering our questions as though ours was the only table he had. Terrific spot for food, drink, and people watching! Go!!
author: Sandra P.

description: Finally had the chance to check out the Brixton on a random stroll down Union Street recently. With some open seats at the bar and the doors open up front this was a perfect place to stop to grab a drink and relax on a Sunday afternoon.  My fiancé and I arrived around 430 so we missed the crazy brunch crowd and it wasn't too busy with dinner yet so we were able to get seats and immediately greeted by the friendly bartender to grab our drinks.  Reasonably priced for the area ($5-7 beers, $10+ glasses of wine and $12+ cocktails).  The fiancé got a Lagunitas IPA and I got a Chardonnay.  I was surprised by the quality of this delicious Chardonnay, light, crisp, refreshing and just perfect on this rare hot Sunday in SF.  The Brixton reminds me of a lot of gastropubs I used to frequent while living in Boston.  It has an upscale pub feel with nice interior, comfortable seating, high ceilings and some TVs for catching up on the games.  Only grabbed drinks but the food menu looked pretty good (even has an option for a VEGAN burger that I must come back to try!).  The only compliant was the extremely loud music blaring during our time here.  For a Sunday afternoon it was a bit much, but otherwise an enjoyable time and I can't wait to come try the great looking food.
author: Kelsey B.

description: The door man insulated me and my friend and called us bitches just because we wanted to go inside and call my sister to come out! I would never come back here very negative environment!!! 07/29/17
author: Nadia D.

description: What a great place. Good atmosphere and great crew that works here. Ask for Jenna - she is legit the best. Props to her and her service.
author: Ali A.

description: Nothing is more off-putting than a bartender who feels inconvenienced by pouring a drink. Yesterday @ Brixton the conversation the staff members were having with each other was clearly more important than helping out guests, go figure. If you want to meet up with me here next time, I'll have to take a raincheck.
author: Mitchell M.

description: So nice to go to bar with an upbeat staff with great music. Tons of televisions perfect to watch games. Bartender Joseph is the best!!!! Gracias Jose!
author: Trish Z.

description:
This is a neat looking place....kind of reminiscent of some of the old , classic San Francisco restaurants.   Despite the ambiance, we didn't really enjoy dinner all that much.  The food was average and the service, while friendly, was not especially attentive.   Don't expect quiet conversation.  The crowd is lively and loud.  We were there at 5:00 and there was already a substantial crowd.  

This is probably a good place for after-work gatherings but nothing special if you're looking for a memorable dining experience.
author: M.A. B.

description:
Last time I was here I got raw burger and they were surprised I was not ok with it. 

I thought I would give them a second chance and had to beg for one of the four severs at bar to come take my order. I did not feel welcomed by server when she walked to two places and spoke to host is before taking my order.  
A very nice young man severed my salad and even asked me if I would like water. The salad was amazing I will just ask to sit in his section next time.
author: Paloma S.

description:
***THE FIRST DATE***

Guy: "So, how was your day today?"
Girl: "Great, I won candies from a bet."
Guy: "OoOoOoH...your panties are wet?"
Girl: *thinks to herself* "#$@& !&^, MATCH.COM!"
.....

As you can see Brixton is NOT a great date place. It's a good thing, I came to Brixton for my girl's birthday instead because damn this place is LOUD. Well, it IS a bar after all.

Brixton, however, is a great neighborhood gastropub/restaurant  to come with your friends before a night of drunken debauchery for solid cocktails (the basil gimlet is my fav) and hearty albeit mediocre American cuisine. The crowd is representative of the area. The Marina ain't called, "Douchebag Central" for nothing. Even sadder is I'm the Foursquare Mayor of Douchebag Central. Yes, I love me some douchebags...

Last Thursday, we got our fill of booze and food at Brixton for my girl's birthday before heading to Matrix.

F O O D:
*DEMONED EGGS w/ Fresh Dungeness Crab & Bacon ($6)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hg0cuVFIqz2C4w6RsAuohA?select=zH9DJHmXTfyW2gz8n-oCNA 
FISHY. Enough said.

*WARM FRENCH ONION DIP w/ Housemade Chips ($7)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hg0cuVFIqz2C4w6RsAuohA?select=izm7AbghalbpKONcP3b0dQ 
A MUST GET, it was like an oooeeey gooeeey french onion soup in a lusciously thick dip form. Tons of caramelized sweet onions and stretches of cheeses made this for one hella of a decadent dip.

*FIERY MAC 'N CHEESEw/ Spicy Fresno Chile & Cheddar Cheese ($7)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hg0cuVFIqz2C4w6RsAuohA?select=AwB82xL6SSZuuMt2G7pR4Q 
Served in a tiny ceramic pot, the al-dente elbow noodles were interwoven with a rich savory cheese blend with a fiery kick from the fresno chili. A gently topping of shredded cheeses which toasted in the oven added a delicious crunch.

*KOBE TOP SIRLOIN w/ Spinach, Roasted Marble Potatoes, Red Wine Sauce & Bleu Cheese Butter ($24)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hg0cuVFIqz2C4w6RsAuohA?select=TA-NKi0lObFFUQHIxe62eg 
I knew it was too good to be true to get a kobe steak at this price. Though cooked to a nice medium rare, the kobe was tough (probably cooked at too high of a temperature which causes the marbling to melt away) and underseasoned. It tasted like a steak from Sizzler's sans a cup of salt. The red wine sauce and bleu cheese butter couldn't save the tough and bland kobe steak. The mable potatoes didn't fair so well either, they were undercooked and hard. 

*CHOCOLATE DEVIL'S FOOD CAKE w/ Chocolate Ganache & Cream Cheese Frosting ($5)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hg0cuVFIqz2C4w6RsAuohA?select=gaWrY3ABKVAozpfC63qMPw 
A dry and dense cavity-inducing brick, I could have done a better with a box of Duncan Hines at home.

S E R V I C E
The ear-pooping ambiance contributed to the lack of service. Though our waitress was friendly, we had to wave S.O.S. just to get her attention.

Three of my friends got the burger but all got the wrong toppings on their burgers. Since our waitress was no where to be found, one of my friends alerted the manager and he nicely redeemed themselves by giving us a round of shots on the house. Thank you.

A M B I A N C E / D E C O R
Half bar and half restaurant with a classy pub meets romantic goth atmosphere with gold chandeliers and tapestry textured walls.

The large bar and 2 flat screen TVs makes it a great place to knock down a few beers while watching the game.

P A R K I N G
Moderate to difficult street parking depending on the day/time. Nearest parking garage is 2 blocks away on Union/Laguna across from Wells Fargo.

Come for the booze (not for the food). DO NOT, I repeat DO NOT come with a date; not if you want a second date at least.

Do you hear me NOW?
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Salad was OK but fries and pretzel knots were stale and nasty. I don't understand how this establishment served simple bar food stale??! Good location but not much of a selection for appetizers. Never again!
author: Noor S.

description: I'm giving this place one star because of their lack of stating that they only serve breakfast on the weekends.... my mom is visiting from SD and we drove 40 mins to the city to come here for brunch and another 15mins to find parking, after checking the menu, website and Yelp, they all fail to state that brunch is only served on weekends. We showed up on Thursday and we're seated, then asked for the brunch menu to find out they don't serve it weekdays, we left very upset and it's unfortunate for such a yummy sounding brunch menu to only have it on weekends. We ended up going to Sweet Maple which is amazing and serves breakfast til 3pm!
author: Lauren F.

description: Since hiring Martin as their executive Chef everything food related has been nothing short of excellence. Big thanks to The Brixton for bringing Chef in, he has done an amazing job! Great food, great service and great drinks. Love me some Brixton.
author: Calen D.

description:
Not bad not bad. I give the Brixton a thumbs up.  I felt like jay Z the way the place was empty when I dined there.

Bring all your friends.
author: Brent M.

description: Food is decent. Drinks are good. Service could be better. Customers shouldn't have to ask for plates for shared dishes. And when asked for the dishes should be brought soon, not after the waitress spends a few minutes chatting with friends who are there as customers.
author: Joe P.

description: Brunch review.  Super spacious spot.  Extremely friendly staff.  Simple but delicious food.  And hashed browns that look like the McDonalds hashed browns we all grew up on!  (Though, tasted much better).  Coffee could be moderately  better. And music was kind of a bore. But these things push it down to 4.5, not 4.  Try it!
author: mario k.

description: Vintage posters; laid back but efficient staff what more could you want?! Oh wait, the beer selection is impressive and the food is delicious!! Try the heirloom Salad and the Demoned eggs.  Not vegan friendly but tasty.
author: Michael H.

description: Absolutely love this place! But the addition of the Bloody Mary Bar takes brunch to another level :) If they add shrimp to this bar, I'm moving in!!!
author: Zhaldee S.

description:
3.5 Stars is on point. Great neighborhood gastro/American restaurant to come with friends. They have tvs so lots of people come here to watch the game(s) as well.

The cocktails are all quite solid and they do have a good selection of beer & wine. It's your typical American food but great for the hungry or drunky alike!

I liked the service. All the bartenders and servers were friendly and attentive!
author: Veronica S.

description:
Came here last Sunday after a boozy day of wine drinking in Napa the day before. Our friend, a SF local recommended it as good food and a nice ambiance (he was with us). The staff were fast to attend to us (party of 3) and we were seated at the table we requested, by the open doors but not outside (semi al fresco).

The menu has everything! from eggs, to griddle, sandwiches, burgers, seafood.. as plates went by everything looked so good so we decided to go with a few items: lox and cream cheese pizza bread, crab cakes, spinach & artichoke dip, scrambled eggs, hash browns and... mimosas! The food was delicious! everything came out on time and we were very happy. The mimosa not so great.. the juice wasn't fresh and I was surprised that they didn't offer a weekend bottomless option. Nevertheless we were very happy and had a great meal,people watching and a beautiful start to our day in SF.
author: Farrah S.

description: I had the unfortunate experience of having brunch here today.  My husband and I ordered a Caesar salad with avocado and eggs with bacon, hash browns and toast.  We got our drinks, but had to ask for sweetner.  Then we had to ask for teaspoons and a knife and napkins.  Forks were on the table.  I was served my toast first by a bewildered looking server and ten minutes later my entree, so by that time the toast was cold.  The  eggs were cold, the bacon barely cooked, and the hash browns looked like they came from McDonalds. My husband's salad consisted of limp romaine lettuce and completely devoid of avocado or dressing.  We waited for what seemed forever to flag down our server, but no one came around to check on us.  Finally, we got up and left.  The foods here is abysmal and the service even worse.  Avoid it at all costs.  There are better restaurants on this street in which to spend your money.
author: Karen N.

description:
Decked in our Burberry and Louboutin duds with our Chanel, Fendi, and Gucci bags in tow, three friends and I came to the Brixton to celebrate our girlfriend's birthday.

RESERVATION:
My friend made reservations via opentable.com for 8pm on a Thurday night.  We were seated as soon as we arrived.

FOOD:
*Demoned Eggs (4 pieces) - Pass.  Deviled eggs were topped with bacon bits that were a nice touch (since bacon makes everything better), but also topped with Dungeness crab which caused the eggs to have a fishy taste.

*Fiery Mac & Cheese - Good.  Pieces of cheesy elbow macaroni were sprinkled with chili flakes that gave it a nice kick.  My only gripe?  I wish the dish was bigger.

*French Onion Dip - Delicious and definitely a must try dish!  The dip was creamy and flavorful.  The accompanied housemade chips had a great crisp to them.

*Brixton Burger - The burger was okay, but also not what I ordered.  I ordered a medium rare burger with swiss cheese and added bacon and avocado.  What I got was a medium rare burger with cheddar cheese and bacon.  The burger was cooked a perfect medium rare topped off with huge pieces of bacon, but I missed my swiss cheese and avocado pieces which usually gives a burger a less dry taste.  Accompanied with the burger, you have a choice of fries, sweet potato fries, or salad.  Get the sweet potato fries. They're cut thin and cooked to a perfect crisp.  Use the accompanying aioli sauce for both the fries and the burger.

SERVICE:
Although our waitress was nice, she was more than often MIA.  I tried to flag her down several times because all three of us who ordered the burger got the wrong order.  Finally I decided to just eat my burger and complain about it later.  She failed to refill our water bottle and had the manager end up coming over to get our bottle.  I mentioned that all our burgers were made wrong and he ended up getting us a round of mixed mystery shots.  Was it a nice gesture? Yes.  Did it really fix the situation? No.

PARKING:
Metered street parking which can be difficult at times.  There is also a paid lot located on Union Street but is a bit pricey.
author: Nicole S.

description: I wish I could rate this spot on the merit of brunch alone because in that case I'd rate it a solid 3.5, however I made the mistake of venturing out to SF one Saturday evening and immediately the tidal wave of bro's and bro-lovers engulfed us. Crowded. Sloppy. Gross. The normal and classy time I had dining for brunch was absolutely marred by the experience of the Saturday night scene. Broken glass on the floor was an added touch of "never again" for me.
author: Raji R.

description: This review is solely based on sweet potato fries and a couple drinks. I'd be interested to come back here to try their speciality cocktails as I've heard they are fantastic. But for all of the hype about Brixton - I actually wasn't incredibly impressed.
author: Teresa C.

description:
Visited the Brixton for a client business lunch. The  bartender from Brooklyn made some good recommendations, including the warm spinach salad with chicken and avocado. 

The food was great, service was great, the vibe was great. what more do you want!? 


Check it out!
author: Brandon A.

description: Cool spot to hang.  Come here every weekend. Bartenders are the shit.  Get the shishuoto peppers!
author: Srichran I.

description: I love coming here to watch the basketball games! They have a big screen that bring down for these events. The food is good. We had a mix of things from the happy hour menu. My only complaint would be the caesar salad. I'm not sure if it's because they put sardines on it, or in the dressing, but it was WAYYYY too much of that fishy taste. We had a few bites but had to stop eating it due to the fishiness. Otherwise, everything else was great! Will be back soon for the next game-- go warriors!
author: Sarah M.

description:
I highly recommend this place for brunch or lunch--especially on a warmer day. Make a reservation, though. For dinner, though, it gets very loud and it's hard to enjoy your time. 

Atmosphere--4/5. Depends on the time of day. This place has really great decor--retro patterned wallpaper, metal ceiling, band posters everywhere, chic tables, etc. The outdoor seating part of the restaurant near the front is very nice. I love going to brunch here. But at night this place turns into a loud, raving drunk mess! They still serve dinner and you can get a table, or you can go to the bar and hang around. It gets pretty packed and very loud (metal ceilings). 

Service--3/5. It's pretty good but sometimes I feel like they're pushing me out, even if I have a reservation. The food is always delivered very quickly. 

Food--4/5. Any of the burgers are great--my favorite is the vegan one (I'm not vegan!). For brunch, get their fried egg sandwich and hash browns! Their drinks are very good. My favorite is the cucumber basil gimlet. Their sweet potato fries are a very good side. The salads are delicious but huge portions! 

Overall: Come here during the day and odds are it will be great.
author: Kate T.

description: Chianne killed it on the recommendations. Service flawless, food, delicious, beers always good. Thanks for the memory
author: Joseph D.

description: Awful awful service. We were a group of ten. They mixed up our order several times. A third of the table got their food after the rest of us finished. I'd never return for food.
author: Gautam N.

description:
The Brixton has great food in a fun, social environment.  This is definitely a staple in our 'going out for dinner and drinks' routine.  We spent NYE here and have been several other times, no complaints!

Definitely check out the brunch and the happy hour here, also I noticed on the menu they have a Prime Rib deal on Sundays.  I haven't checked it out but plan to soon!
author: Lacy S.

description: It's very loud in here, be prepared to shout to each other.   Even if there is no talking you can here others shouting.  The food it good but s little too salty.  I got the ahi miso salad and it was salty.  My mum got the burger which she enjoyed but she also said it was salty.  The waitress was lovely.  It's definitely a happening spot.
author: Cory T.

description:
My friend and I were in the area shopping today around 4:30 PM. We happened to have two small children with us that were starting to get hangry. (Danger Will Robinson! Baby meltdown is imminent!)

We chose Brixton because it was close and because they have hamburgers and fries, which is kid fuel. We were seated immediately. The waitress brought back two glasses of water and then left again.

Five minutes go by and we still haven't been given our menus. I get up and ask the waitress who was folding napkins for menus. We order drinks for the adults. Then we say we want fries for the kids. At this point the waitress begins to walk away. Uh....wait. We aren't done ordering. We order the rest of the food. It comes out and then we have to hail the waitress to ask for waters for the kids and refills for the adults.

Basically, every time we needed something we had to hail the server. There was a maximum of 12 people in the restaurant and there really wasn't a good reason why this server wasn't providing excellent service.

Truly a frustrating experience. The burger had balsamic onions on it - delicious! The fried chicken salad was huge and the chicken was done well and was flavorful. The food was decent, but the staff just ruined the experience.
author: Tara H.

description:
The weekend brunch at The Brixton may be one of those most underrated and tasty brunches i've had in SF in a long time. 
The fried chicken egg benedict i indulged in had flavorful, juicy chicken, perfectly done poached eggs, creamy hollandaise, all no fluffy english muffins. 
The deviled eggs were pretty tasty too. 

Great service, reasonable prices. The only ding with The Brixton...is the pretty obnoxious Fratty crowd, which can be easily solved if you go early. 
We made 11a reservations (another plus- online resv), took our time indulging in brunch, and left at 12.30p when the fratty crowd started rolling in. 
Perfect timing

Highly recommend for brunch.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Visiting sf and loved this place! Had a chicken salad sandwiches that was a lot better then what I expected! Aside from that, it had a great atmosphere with lots of interesting art.
author: Jackie C.

description: I went here for a late dinner with a group of 4 ppl. We were looking for a loud, party type environment and this place was a good choice. The food was surprisingly good and it's a cool place. The crowd is very young and the music very loud (we couldn't hear each other across the table). It was expected because it was so late and this turns more into a lounge bar at night. It's a good place for dinner and to start a drinking night.
author: Sarah S.

description:
The Brixton is delicious for brunch, lunch, and cocktails. The scene is a class-ish bar with dark walls, a big bar area, tables near the front Union Street windows (that are often open on nice days), TV screens for sports games, and large circular booths. Here's what I've tried and how it was:

- muddled strawberry cocktails (about $10) - forgetting the name but it's amazing!
- demoned eggs (about $6) - complex with bacon on top and delicious
- mini tacos (about $12) - my friend bought them and greatly enjoyed them
- lox and capers pizza bread - we ordered this as an "app" for brunch and it was doughy and amazing
- cheap bottled beers starting at $3 (though $5 for a bud light)

Brixton reminds me more of a Chestnut St bar than one that would be on the slightly-more-chill Union Street but I still enjoy it.
author: Meghan P.

description: Solid spot! I still think about the crispy fried chicken benedict I got here. Bloody marys good too. Was able to get in without a reservation on a Sunday after a long run to Marin.right after we sat down the place started to fill up quick. By the time we left there was a line outside. Great spot for sundays.
author: Thielson D.

description:
Hands down, brunch is my favorite meal of the day...
Buttttt this place didn't exactly hit the mark.

I chose to throw my birthday brunch here because a) they take reservations, b) it's not an itty bitty place and c) it accommodates big groups. That morning, I was the first to arrive. I made reservations a week in advance through Open Table so checking in with the host was easy peasy.

After waiting no more than 15 minutes, my group of girl friends arrived. We placed orders for their French toast, three different kinds of eggs Benedicts, Carnitas Hash, and a vegetarian burrito. Overall, the food was satisfying. My two favorites were the Carnitas Hash (super moist and savory) and their French toast (stuffed with Nutella and Bananas and coated in Chex Mix - crunchy!)

However, I was a bit disappointed with my order, which was the eggs Benedict with fried chicken. The two pieces of chicken was dry and looked depressing sitting on top of two plain toasted English muffins. I think it would've tasted better if there was lettuce and tomato. I also swapped out the hash browns with fruit. C'mon... no strawberries? Instead, my fruit bowl consisted of squishy purple grapes, honeydew, and diced apples. I wasn't very happy about that.

What was more disappointing was the disgruntled bus boys. They were rude and looked like they hated their job. I have never experienced such lousy service... one of them spilled liquid on the floor which smelled like vomit (blech) and a couple of them tried to clear our plates when we were clearly still eating.

Would I be back? I don't think so.

However, I do want to give a shout out to our wonderful waitress, Jenna. Thank you for being such a sweetheart and making sure that my group of friends were enjoying their food and having a good time. As well, thank you for the complementary ice cream puff on the house. It was delicious!
author: Annie S.

description:
Only come here for booze. The food and table service are mediocre.

We stopped by with a group of six for brunch. Almost all of us ordered something different and I think only one or two enjoyed the meal. My breakfast sandwich arrived cold with unmelted cheese and stale muffin. The waitress was kind when I asked for the sandwich to be reheated (they just gave me a new one). However, the new sandwich was only slightly better and certainly not worth the price. The drinks were good, no problems there.

I would NOT return for a meal. Maybe for a beer but definitely not for the food.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Worst place and service in the hile US. 

Bad faced service, accompanied with overpriced dishes that involves hard meat and unflavored pasta. Small portions, overpriced.
DO NOT COME HERE!!!
author: Daniel G.

description: This place was really cute, and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. I came in here after walking for 5 hours all over SF, and it felt so great just to sit down and have some beer and appetizers. The place was crowded enough, but still quiet enough to be able to speak to each other. There were a ton of people standing by the bar, which I probably would not have enjoyed, so get there early enough to grab a table and you could sit there all night.
author: Emily G.

description:
Terrible service, pretty bad food and weak drinks.  I would never ever go back unless it was paid for and I was so drunk that I didn't care about the ridiculously slow service.  

Service: 
- it took the restaurant 15 minutes to figure out how to put our group of ten at 2 tables.  Seriously? 

- the service is so inconsistent, one of our tables finished up 30 minutes before the other.  Since I was at the table with the slow and totally idiotic waitress my group finished eating later and couldn't meet the rest of our friends at the bar until 30 min later.  So fun......

- waitress hardly came by our table

- brought half of our orders 10 min after the first half 

- We actually called the host from our table to ask where the heck our waitress was because at one point we waited literally 30 minutes for her to come back...!!!!! 


Food:
- drinks are way too sweet and not strong  

- food is typical, might as well be at an Applebee's
author: Lindsay S.

description: Our food was freezer burned and cold when first served. My mother had to walk to the bar to get her drink. We were overcharged and the waitress disappeared after dropping the bill on the table. This place is usually great, but it REALLY missed the mark today.
author: Cordes H.

description: Nice bar, went there during happy hour. Friendly staff, and decoration/atmopshere looks nice inside! Enjoyed the terrace in the sun, sweet potatoes were finished unfortunately but had some nice other fries and aubergine dip.
author: Christy V.

description: I popped in for lunch and ate quite a bit - I wanted to sample a lot.  Anyhow, I had the Demoned Eggs, but they were missing the Demon.  They weren't spicy at all!  Nor did they have any flavor.  Then I had the Fiery Mac & Cheese.  Again, where is the "Fiery" at here?  Bland and boring.  I had the crab cakes and they were alright - nothing great, nothing bad either.  Then I ordered the Brixton Steak Burger.......... and they were out of it.  The waitress brought me the Prather Burger with optional Apple-wood Smoked Bacon and fried egg.  The burger wasn't bad, it just didn't have any flavor.  Nothing really, had flavor.  The place seems to very busy on weekends, so it must be a cool place to drink.   I can't imagine seeking this place out for food.  That said, the staff were nice and I like the building/location.  I wasn't able to try out their drinks, so no comment on that.
author: Shaun W.

description:
Went to dinner here on a random weekend in SF. 

The food was ok, I had the fried chicken salad and a glass of wine. My wife had a dish she was not wild about. We spent over $100 and was nothing was really memorable. 

The problem was it was insanely loud on a Friday night. I guess it is a hot happy hour spot, but people were blacked out screaming basically. Not a good place for a romantic dinner HAHA.
author: Mike H.

description: The drinks and service were super but they have hired a super aggressive bipolar bouncer who just knows how to f@&$ things up.  The dude was shouting aggressively at patrons for no reason. There is a tone and way to say things but this guy was on a power trip.  When I was leaving he was super nice and said good night.  But as I was waiting for my Uber he can running to me cussing because he thought I was leaning against his car.... which I was not.  Very rude guy.  Aggressive for no reason. Tattoo on his face and a shrimp's height, which may explain his nepolian complex.
author: Neil S.

description: First time to try this place. Came for brunch. Wait staff was very very slow. We ordered 3 coffee first but never received them even after the food arrived. Had to remind our waiter. They never asked us if we wanted a refill afterwards and didn't want to ask for it may take another 20 minutes to wait. Our water was not refilled. Waiter delivered a cup of clam chowder but did not hear us ask for a bowl over the very loud music playing. It was hard to hear each other talk. So instead of letting us keep the cup of chowder, they took it back and made us wait 15 minutes for a larger size. A good restaurant would have just let us eat the cup and brought more out but instead they made us wait to receive a runny, sour chowder soup that was not edible.  The bus boy picked up our dishes and spilled mustard on the table and floor. I'm giving this place a 2 star because some of the food were good but customer service was very bad. Maybe if I start reading that customer service has improved that I may come back. But for now, I would not recommend this place.
author: Joyce W.

description:
Not ever coming back here again.

The one star goes to the service by our bus boy and the atmosphere. 

I came here for a party of 8 birthday dinner. 

Half chicken is dry, sauce was alright, nothing spectacular. My fiance's beer can chicken is better than theirs.

My server basically added a 20% tip because we had big party. But she doesn't really have to serve us because you refill your own water cup. Never came to check up on us. Table was messy. She didnt dish our food out. Couldn't find her. I think she deserved a 15% tip maybe 18%.. Not twenty. Then on top of that she didnt even give me back all my change. I might as well have gone to a casino and ate there instead.
 
On the other hand, I loved the music they played. I liked the environment and atmosphere. Laid back but upbeat. 

I don't recommend this restaurant though, well maybe not for parties where they can add their own tip.
author: Terinna R.

description:
