I came to have lunch here finally after always walking by it on my way to Umami burger. I always see a nice crowd and happy faces every time I walk by so I just had to give it a try.
The restaurant is beautiful. Has that lounge feeling with beautiful decor and art work on the walls. The staff is very friendly which always makes for a good sign of a good restaurant. The food was excellent to go with that!
I started with their clam chowder. It was delicious! It was velvety creamy smooth! It wasn't thick like most clam chowders, but more textured to like that of heavy cream. It was excellent.
I then had the French dip. Another heavenly dish! Thinly sliced ribeye beef, that was tender and juicy, snuggled between two crisp toasted soft roll slices. It came with a warm au Ju'. First bite without the au ju, sooo good! I wanted to taste the meat as is first and it was really tender. Then a dip! Even better! The warm beefy au Ju just brought even more delicious flavor to the sandwich. The bread makes a big difference in this sandwich, and it holds up nicely. Buttery crisp and tears apart easily with every bite. Show string potato fries accompanied my sandwich and made for a perfect lunch. Can't wait to go back and try other items on the menu....
author: Roger P.

description:
Good food and lively.
We were here on Friday night I had Chorizo Clams my friend had the half chicken and we shared the spinach deep for appetizer. My clams is a bit too salty but my friend really enjoyed his half chicken.
I also had run and coke my friend had couple glasses of Stella the bill came to about $65.
The only down site is the server never once checked on us, we had to waved at her three times to get her attention to get me a spoon.
Overall 3 stars.
author: Ty N.

description:
Great brunch spot in the Marina and equally a good spot for first drinks in the evening.  

Highlights: Outside seating, consistent food quality/taste, great for people watching and awesome bloody mary's.  

Make a reservation for brunch because it does fill up quickly.  

Very casual but fun place on Union street and is a reliable neighborhood bar.
author: Allie Y.

description:
This place was awesome. I highly recommend you look at my sisters review (Sarah "SMK" M.) because she put it perfectly in her review. This was my first visit to the Brixton and I loved it. There is video my sister took of me just ranting about how I loved the food just to send to my other brother to make him jealous of not coming out to brunch on a gorgeous Saturday to enjoy some very good food.

We ordered two items to split. The chicken eggs benedict and the stuffed french toast. Both were AAAAAAAAAAMAZING.

The chicken: To die for. It was perfectly breaded and had the juiciest meat on the inside. Just taking one bite sent my mouth into overload.

The egg: A fairly basic and easy thing to do, and the yolk was the perfect consistency to cut into and let it spill all over the chicken. I would for sure call this the Yelp yolk, because it was Yelp quality.

The Hollandaise sauce: It brought together all the above mentioned items and tasted amazing.

Stuffed french toast: This was as my sister put it, bomb dot com. There were bananas and nutella in it, was perfectly cooked and oozed when you put a fork into it. But the real kicker on it was the breading they used on the overall item. They threw some chex on top and made this one of the most delightful breakfast items I have had to date.

The area this place is located is really classy and is perfect for any weather in the day. Everything was really clean and I loved the interior decorations and found that all the music was on point the whole time I was eating there.

You gotta be here, its to die for.
author: Michael M.

description:
Went here for Sunday brunch.  Excellent bloody mary, excellent food, great seats by the big windows.  Excellent first time experience getting brunch there.

I got the The Fried Chicken Brixton Benedict.  It was awesome.  Some restaurants the english muffin can get soggy or just crumble to pieces, but here it was perfect.  The poached eggs and Brixton hollandaise sauce was so good I might add it to my 'list of foods I could eat for the rest of my life if I could only choose one.'

The Bloody Mary is really good.  Compared to what I usually get at the Tipsy Pig, worlds better.  Rather than using so much spiced liquor and things, the Brixton Bloody Mary had the spiced rim, and for whatever reason was easy to drink, alcoholic, and exquisitely spicy, rather than just thick and bland hot flavor at the Tipsy Pig.
author: Scott H.

description: Average. Highly overpriced for the service. Drinks were ok. Food..meh. Service..awful!! Waitress couldn't be bothered to ask everyone's order at one time. People had to go to the bar to get drinks. Then they had the nerve to add gratuity 20% which would be fine if the service had even been mediocre...but it wasn't.
author: Tiffany S.

description: On Sunday 12/18 I was served at the bar, sirloin steak and potato salad. The bartender was a very young rookie who had never heard of the word gristle, which is something that my meat was filled with. Also I sat at the bar because I wanted to watch the 49er game. There were two very large TVs, but lacked the simple technology to watch Raiders on one and 49ers on the other. Also, there was not a single employee who knew the wi-fi password. The crowning insult was the $3 charge for two slices of white bread. There was no offer to exchange my meal or remove the charge. No manager or owner on the premises. Very bad PR.
author: Abe B.

description: I came here with a group of 8 folks and had the most horrible experience. Prior to being seated, we requested that everyone had their own tabs since this was a company function. The waitress brought a single check and made a fuss at being asked to split it. She declared that she couldn't split the check but collected our credit cards anyway to ring them. The waitress ended up making each member of the party pay one-eighth of the tab and gave everyone an itemized receipt showing this. We spoke with the manager about how to make the scenario right and he emphasized the difficulty of the request and the amount of time needing to be spent on it. Instead he encouraged that everyone use Venmo to help pay each other back. While the group is content making the situation right for each other, that is hardly the point. The waitress had fair warning at the time of seating our party regarding our request for individual checks. The manager, one would expect has enough knowledge of the POS system and creative thinking to come up with a solution. Frankly, the food was average and the manager and waitress both suck at life. If you want to see a couple of folks struggle at the peak of their intellectual capabilities, I encourage you to come share our experience. If not, McDonald's may be able to provide you a better dining experien
author: Corey H.

description: The service is what drops the stars, which is too bad because the venue and the food is pretty good. Our waitress was MIA pretty much the whole time. We had to place an order the very busy busboy! Also, we had six people dining and three people had to wait almost 15 minutes for their food after the first three had already been served. I hope Brixton can pull it together!
author: Caroline C.

description:
The staff here looks frumpy and miserable ...perhaps a clear sign of low employee morale. Our waitress, Hoang, was the absolute worst. She would roll her eyes so far back at our requests that I thought she was on E. It felt like she was upset she had to serve to a group of Asians. Wake the hell up, you're Asian too, HOANG!

I handed an ICE CREAM birthday cake to the staff and asked that they keep it in the freezer (should go without saying, right?).  They of course did NOT and when the cake was brought out after our meal, it was melted into a big blob. Are you freaking kidding me??? What a waste of a $50 cake. 

The food was terrible.  There is certainly nothing special about this place.  

Would never come back here again.
author: Unkle L.

description:
Fun bar with awesome atmosphere!  If you're looking for a dive bar, try something else.  The Brixton has definitely got a cool sports bar type vibe.  TV's playing sports but the ambiance is dark and cool.  A couple of friends and I stopped by here for drinks while we were waiting for a table at the restaurant next door.  We popped in around 8 and were able to find a table for my party of 5 to sit at.  The drinks are just like any other drinks... I had a greyhound (Grapefruit & Vodka... Yes... Vodka.) and my friends had beers. 

Pros:
-Cool ambiance
-Stiff Drinks 
-Lots of seating

Cons:
-PARKING IS A BEAR

Tips:
-Save yourself the frustration... Take an Uber or a Lyft!
author: Michelle H.

description:
I ate brunch here with a few friends and had a pretty dreadful experience. The waiter did not have attention to detail and ended up leaving ingredients off of our meal and bringing things we didn't want. I asked for herbal tea and he brought me black tea and didn't understand what was wrong, my boyfriend didn't get bacon on his burger like he asked, the problems never ceased.

Our food was cold. My toast was so cold that after I put butter on it it didn't melt at all. We asked them if they could heat up the bread a little bit so that the butter would melt , and they stuck it in the microwave if you can believe that. It was chewy like bread gets in the microwave, only the top piece was warm, and the plate was very hot. It was really obvious what they did, something that I wouldn't expect the most amateur of chefs to do. They just did not care.

Cold, tasteless food and a waiter who couldn't do his job? I won't be coming back.
author: Shushannah A.

description: Seriously, you can only rely on this place being unreliable.  In the many years that I have dined on Brixton fare (which is tasty, and the only reason I have continued to patronize this establishment this long) I have only had them give me the proper order a total of 3 times!  I cannot believe how often they screw up an order that is typed up on a POS system!  It's annoying when this happens in restaurant, but worse when you have waited an hour for your food to be delivered and then find it is completely wrong.  Sorry, Brixton.  Consider this a goodbye.  There are so many other options on Union Street alone.  I entreat others to try those out instead.
author: Colby J.

description:
When we were reading the reviews, I shrugged and said that the crowd wouldn't matter to me, and people were probably exaggerating. But the reviews were right: it's almost unbearably loud, and I couldn't believe that there were guys seriously wearing pastel shorts to a bar on a Saturday night. At first it was amusing to watch them try to sing along to 90s hip-hop, but it quickly became irritating to be jostled aside by these pretentious jerks.

We came here for with the Thrillist deal of 10 drinks and an appetizer for $38. All of the drinks were decent or even good (Lima Ocho, mm), except for the Scottish Ale, which tasted like weed in a bottle. The bartenders were awesome and efficient, but our waitress was barely there. We didn't even get water until we'd already been there over an hour and finished our entrees - and even then we had to ask for it. The food is legitimately yummy, but portions are small for the price.
author: Cat N.

description: Nice place in the marina and very accommodating. I'm vegan and allergic to oil and they were able to make the vegan burger oil free for me. Our server was very sweet too. Thank you!
author: Pooja S.

description:
I have been wanting to do brunch in the Marina for the longest time. On a lovely Sunday morning, the Brixton was perfect for a girls' brunch especially since they took reservations. No one hour wait needed here. 
  
We were promptly seated and everybody ordered a round of Irish car bombs and I ordered the bloody mary. The blood mary was delicious. Spicy enough, but did not have a overwhelming taste of horseradish.  

I ordered the carnitas hash. Let me tell you, this is THE best I have had thus far. The pork shoulder was slow roasted beer-braised with fried Yukon gold potatoes. Topped with a poached egg, crispy corn tortilla strips, avocado mousse, and cilantro. Every bite was like I was in heaven. Add a couple of dashes of tapatio, it was perfect! 
 
Service was great. Our waitress continuously checked up on us to make sure we had everything.
author: Becky Q.

description:
This place kind of sucks. I've been here twice (once on a Grouper date, that was a bad experience but had little to do with the location) and this past weekend for brunch. 

I had the chicken and avocado salad sandwich. Lacked flavor, zero salt. I felt like I was eating something you'd find on a menu at a senior citizen living center. My boyfriend had eggs benedict which arrived with 1 egg missing and no sauce so they had to take it back to the kitchen.

+1 star bc I think the interior decor is nice. 

Honestly I wouldn't come back to eat, the food leaves to be desired. Maybe I'd try one more time for the cocktails. 

Verdict: There are better places to eat in the Marina.
author: Michelle A.

description:
It's a pub, so your expectations should be set at low for food and service--which will both be mixed. 

As proof of this, I had an exceptional egg sandwich on homemade English muffins while two items were forgotten. 

Your food will not be exactly memorable, but if you want to eat some eggs and watch football you're in the right place. Yes, it will get loud.
author: jason c.

description: The food was outstanding, service was very good, ambience was great except for us the music was a little too loud.  We all agreed afterward we wouldn't hesitate to go back,  even though when we first walked in we paused to ask if we really wanted to eat in a place this loud,  I didn't think we would be able to hold a conversation but it turned out OK.  But again, the food was spectacular.
author: W. H.

description: Just had brunch here. The hostess was very stand-offish when we first walked into the restaurant. We then sat outside, where we had horrid service for the entire meal. The bloody marys werent good. The potatoes were cold. Very cold. And gross. The ketchup was disgusting and spicy and they didn't have regular ketchup. And they did not have soy sauce. Our waiter Eric barely came outside. He practically forgot about us and overcharged us for avocado which we did not receive. We asked for olives with our bloody marys in the beginning of the meal and Eric brought them out 20 minutes later when we were almost finished with our meal and drinks. Come here at night time to get drunk with friends but do NOT make the mistake of eating a meal here.
author: Daisy M.

description: Attempted to come here the Sunday of memorial day for brunch. Was not really busy, outside was but inside wasn't. We stand at the hostess stand. The hostess comes over, doesn't say anything, quickly walks away.  Someone else comes up behind us, 2 people, she grabs menus, takes them, and still doesn't say anything to us. We are really confused. Then, a couple comes from the back of the restaurant (where? we aren't sure....secret entrance only important people know about?) She comes to get them menus, says to us "I'll be right with you..." and then walks away to seat them. We then watch as she seats them, and walks to the back of the restaurant into the kitchen! We just walked out. Was so bizarre, and a bad look for service. We were wildly confused. We will not be going back again.
author: Becca R.

description:
Great place, good for watching sports. The burger was good, but not great, fries were organic. 
It was a lot of noise, hard to keep a conversation. 
Great service, prices are average to expensive.
author: Sebastian P.

description: Excellent cocktails, cool and mature ambiance and great food. What more could you ask for? Oh great service? Yes, Sasha served our table of three and was very fun, professional and on it. She didn't miss a beat! I will definitely return and bring my friends.
author: Samantha H.

description:
Cute spot if you're in the Marina and looking for a good brunch or lunch spot. Decor is beautiful. I would definitely make a reservation, especially if you're planning on going over the weekend.

I had the crab Benedict- portions were so so. Muffin was burnt and got stale as the food cooled down. Hash brown is literally the same hash brown you get at McDonalds (in true patty form). Service is great and it's reasonably priced, so for those reasons I say go if you're in the area. Not worth a trip out of the way...
author: Esprit S.

description:
01.28.12 || bookmarked 01.19.11

The Saturday early afternoon brunch.  The sun is shining bright, and no amount of pulling the covers over your head will hide the light.  You force yourself out of bed to seize the day.

Why not start with a bloody mary [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hg0cuVFIqz2C4w6RsAuohA?select=ZR-gYaLPjrZEFx5vPDL_wA], extra spicy?  Definitely packs a good kick, and jolts your system up!

We shared the spinach and artichoke dip [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hg0cuVFIqz2C4w6RsAuohA?select=EIF5RECH16lohFzUDyBS-g] before delving in to our entrees.  This is a hefty portion, so tread lightly!

I had the flatbread pizza [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hg0cuVFIqz2C4w6RsAuohA?select=IxWRbz076q4GZiYXgpSuhg]: fresh housemade dough, sauced and topped plum tomatoes, sausage, pepperoni, pickled hot peppers, fontina, and mozzarella cheese.  This was SUPER delicious, and I wish I had a second stomach to devour it whole.  (It was good the next day, too :D)

Total damage for two: $55.55 + tip
author: Jenny L.

description:
It was alright, but I wouldn't return for brunch/meals at least.

Was on a cleanse when I got the quinoa, mixed greens, beets, walnuts salad. Sounds good right?? Not. At. All. I almost gagged eating it 1/3 of the way and just stopped. The greens weren't fresh at all, the quinoa was overcooked and bland, the beets (one of my fav foods) was so soaked in vinegar that it made me nauseous. I'm honestly horrified for the price they put on that salad that has honestly traumatized me from eating one of my favorite foods, salads. (It's been a week already) Still gagging thinking about it. My utensils weren't clean also (pet peeve)

My friend and I get eggs benedict every time we get brunch and the portions here were the smallest compared to other places with one small mcdonalds style hash brown thrown onto the side. Very underwhelming for another one of my favorite food items.

Not sure how their drinks are or other menu items which is probably what they're better known for but I would say it's okay. For the price, I wouldn't say you're getting what you pay for and I'm all for quality even if it's more $. 

Overall, very good service, cool waitresses and cool vibes. I'm just a bit of a food snob- hence my honest opinion on just the food
author: Nina K.

description:
PROTIP #1: THE PLACE TO GO FOR DESSERTS. They are all ridiculously cheap at $5 each and the biggest portions you will ever see. I swear these desserts were made for tables of four. They frequently change the menu and the two that I've tried have both been amazing. 

PROTIP #2: DO NOT ORDER THE STEW. I made fun of my date for ordering this without realizing it will actually result in him violently vomiting all night and sleeping in the fetal position on his bathroom floor. Really though, who orders stew at a restaurant? 

PROTIP #3: THE PARKING GARAGE ACROSS THE STREET CLOSES AT MIDNIGHT. No exceptions. I didn't even see the sign until we were walking back at 12:15 when another couple came out telling us they've tried everything to get their out and they were going to cab it. Motherfucker. After the close to $40 cab ride back to my place so I could drive my date home and back combined with the fact that he now has to pay for overnight parking at the garage, I think it may have been cheaper if we just flew to LA for dinner. 

*I also just realized this is the second time I've had a first date here after not being able to get into Nihon Whiskey Lounge wtf?! The first time it was closed and the second time they didn't have a table until 10:45. Never again.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Yes, I normally avoid the Marina but I figured a Monday was fine. Sat at the bar and female bartender was awesome. Not to be sexist, but really the first female bartender I have encountered who poured good drinks.

Had the giant meatball as well. Fattening but good. I will definitely be back.
author: Karen S.

description: I love the vibe, food (sweet potato fries) , drinks (Moscow mule). It's a nice go to spot to start out for the weekend and even weekday.
author: Danielle C.

description:
If you are looking for a yummy and inventive take on brunch on a Saturday, come here by 11 or 11:30am at the latest, and you will be in for a treat! True, they don't open until 11, and Tamsen D. and I were the only one there at first with one other pair of people, but minutes later the whole place including the few outdoor patio spots they had filled up quite quickly! 

And plus, any place that pours water out of old bourbon bottles is a winner in my book too. How clever, and it is a great use of bottles that already exist in the world! Yay for recycling! 

It is also pretty nice here, with high ceilings, nice decor, warm colors, all that jazz. It definitely is a nicer, classier brunch spot, but the food is all in the $9-15 range which is great. I got their carnitas hash which was slow cooked pork and avocado, a poached egg on top, cilantro, spices, and potatoes. A great great way to start my day for sure. And the dish had good presentation too. Tamsen D. got their eggs benedict with hashbrowns that definitely resemble those awesome hashbrowns you get at McDonalds, which of course also made our morning. And the fact you can get either bacon, ham, spinach, salmon, or even crab with your benedict is just plain sweet. Brixton, I like you.
author: Sarah G.

description:
I must admit, I've been here twice and each time was either before or after Umami Burger (I'm seriously obsessed with that place and it's right next door)! The Brixton is such a CUTE, yes I said it, cute bar!  It's actually pretty huge and it has a great ambiance.  They have large communal tables as well as smaller, more intimate tables. And of course, you can grab a seat at the bar.

Great wine list! The drinks weren't that good - sugar overload.

This is honestly a great place to sip on some vino if you're in the Marina and also a good idea for a drink if you're waiting for a table at any of the restaurants nearby ;)

I'd really like to try the food next time I visit!
author: Suki B.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Saturday.
The place is quite big and seems to be a great place for drinks....as it has more of a bar vibe. They also have a big screen TV playing the game, so I can see it could be a good spot to come and catch a game while getting food.
I ordered their ahi tuna salad, and the portion was large. The seaweed and edamame really compliments the ahi tuna, and the seasoning were nice and light.
My friend got the crab cake, which she sad was very fresh and contained good portion of fresh crab meat.
author: Nancy Z.

description: I have been to The Brixton at least twice and the food & drinks were good. I went last night after the Union Street Wine walk and the service was poor and half of our food was cold. I was embarrassed because I bragged to my friends about how good this restaurant was. The half and half fries were a minute away from being burnt and they served them practically cold. The macaroni and cheese was not good and my flatbread pizza had way too many peppers. Our waitress was not attentive and it took at least 30 minutes before she took our food order. I don't usually write reviews but I was disappointed with the overall experience.
author: Shondra R.

description:
We had a really good meal with some friends here this past weekend.  The wait staff was very friendly and gave us time to catch up on conversation since we hadn't seen each other in a while.  For my main meal I got the half chicken and it was cooked perfectly.  The sauce was amazing and the potatoes different than what I'm used to but super tasty.  The meatballs as a starter and brussel sprout chips should not be passed up.  Dessert wasn't the best but it was still tasty as we got the maple cheescake.  The blue cheese stuffed olive martini was really good as well.

Cool spot to check out.
author: Blake B.

description: Not from the area and was looking for a place serving food late at night. When we got there we asked the bartender if the bar was open, she said yes and gave us a menu. When our waitress came to get our order I made the mistake of asking if the kitchen was still open. While she went to check I realized the menu clearly stated kitchen hours were until 12am, it happened to be 10:30pm. The waitress got back and said that the kitchen was now closed. Now normally I wouldn't be so angry, but why go to the trouble of stating your kitchen hours on the menu and then not stick to those hours? Really disappointed that they wouldn't accommodate us during their hours of operation, thanks for the false advertising and empty stomach.
author: Brandon R.

description:
Food? No idea. Beer selection? Kind of sad. Moscow mules? Hell to the yes.

I only come here for the moscow mules. They do it right here. Copper cups. Delicious. Do it.

The ambiance is really nice, too. Great place to start/end a date! It gets pretty crowded and full to the brim of bros, but hey, what can you do?
author: Jade R.

description:
Came here for dinner on a Saturday night with a friend and didn't need a reservation (which was lucky). We had a couple of beers each and a couple of gin and tonics before bed but didn't order any wine or cocktails. Started with a spinach, artichoke and cheese dip which was fantastic - and there was plenty of it. I then had a grilled chicken salad, and my friend had the kale salad. Again, large portions, excellent prices and really tasty.

Service was A+ as well. Constantly checked on to see everything was OK and if we needed more drinks. I'd go here again and recommend it to anyone looking for a nice dinner in San Fran.
author: Harry M.

description: I would say The Brixton misses the mark, but I don't even know what the mark is. Thanks for seating us right away, but no thanks for the over-priced vodka-less Moscow mules, the non-delivery of the French fries and water we ordered, and the indescribably shitty "mac n cheese" served in a doll-sized ramekin that cost nine -- nine -- dollars. Great crowd, though LOL.
author: Rachel H.

description:
WARNING: NO BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS

Once you get past the initial disappointment, brunch here is actually pretty fabulous.  Bloody mary's are nice and spicy, and the carnitas hash is bomb.com.  Friends got the french toast which was seriously yummy, but way too rich for me to take a second bite.

Overall great spot for brunch but $13+ cocktails make it hard to booze on a budget.
author: Lindsey G.

description: This is an extremely late review! We came here for New Years Eve & it was SUCH a great deal. We weren't expecting much given they were one of the only places with tables available & it was a $35 set menu, but thought "what the hell!". We're really glad we did. The food was surprisingly tasty, the atmosphere good & the server was lovely. We haven't been back since but we definitely will!
author: Fi M.

description: The owner's signature "spark plug" is one of the best morning after's we have ever had.
author: Michael G.

description: I live a block away and maybe a little bias but this place is amazing. The bartenders are the best in the city, managers seem nice, and the crowd kills it. I am 37 and even my 21 year old niece loves it. Ask for Joe...he kills if there and makes you feel welcomed.
author: Drew P.

description:
Sad, sad, sad but true.
This place gets a lot of good reviews, Apparently folks like it. 
My girlfriend and I went last Saturday. It was crowded and loud. We ordered burgers. I had the brussels sprouts on the side. She ordered the sweet potato fries. The food was so so. Pub food I guess. Definitely on the greasy side.
But more so, my girlfriend got really sick that night after we got home. Even the next day she was bed ridden until she started to break out of it by Sunday night.
I recall glancing at the kitchen once on the way to the bathroom and it was filthy! They didn't seem to care. Sure didn't mind folks looking, on the way to and from the bathroom. 
If you can avoid it, please do. I sure won't get near that place again. My health and the health of my loved ones is more important than a noisy greasy pub.
author: Sniff It Out L.

description: Lov3  the Brixtons wine Wednesday's, one minor issue, we gave the waitress enough money to cover bill but she never came back with the change. I guess she kept it as tip without asking us. Courtecy is everything
author: Roxy T.

description:
Brotastic bar and brunch spot. 

The food isn't bad - I love the Chicken and Beet Salad here and often pick it up to go.
author: Britney R.

description:
The two stars are only because my friend says that she loves it on Wednesday nights. Based on her recommendation, we went on a Friday night. Big mistake. 
 We were happy to get a table without reservations and didn't even need to wait too long. The bar was crowded but the bartender was super nice despite being busy. He even smiled! Rare for a busy Marina bartender these days. As we were being sat, the place really got busy and there were way too many butts in our face as the bar area swelled into the table area. I'm sure that wasn't our servers fault but it made the meal difficult to enjoy. They really need to figure out how to keep that from happening. A barrier of some sort maybe? 
 The food was fine. Nothing great but nothing to complain about. OK, Ill admit, the fried chicken salad was rather amazing. 
 The biggest issue I had with the joint besides the table side asses in my face, was the music. Awful douchebagel dance music played too loudly. Lots of dumb restaurants confuse themselves with dance clubs theses days, I get it, these retard owners wish they were Vegas club moguls and decide to punish us with terrible music in a vain attempt to be relevant with the "young people". In this case however, the decor is a homage to great music. Tons of Clash posters along with lots of other great rock n roll memorabilia. Perhaps even the name is from " Guns of Brixton"? So, with great music being lionized on the walls, one question. WHY THE FUCK ARE YOU BLARING SHITTY, STUPID, FUCKED OUT EDM? Its not a SF ordinance! No one is going to accuse you of being out of touch with the "youth". I'm not thirty yet and I would have loved to hear some Clash during my visit.
author: Amy P.

description:
Sticky seats galore!
I tried three before I finally found one that didn't stick to my jeans. This is an all time first. How can a restaurant not notice something like that?
Plusses: Caesar salad, demon eggs.
Just ok: vegan burger, side dish of squash and tomatoes.
Boo! Clam chowder was way too salty (waiter graciously took it back and didn't charge)
Maybe it was because it was Halloween and the Giants won the Series, but the place was really noisy and there was no area that was sheltered from ambient noise.
Owners: please clean those seats!
author: Liana T.

description:
The food is great and so is the selection of drinks. This place is very club like and not family friendly. 
The deviled eggs are fantastic!
author: C B.

description: I am sure for the young bar scene this place is great, my review is just based on a quick stop for a in between day and night time drink and snack. I ordered some cucumber basil drink (forgetting name) and it tasted like vodka with sweet&sour mix and nowhere on the ingredients did it list using sweet&sour mix as if it did I would not have ordered it, needless to say I didn't order a second one. We also got the spinach artichoke dip with crostini which is a favorite of mine but this was bland and the crostini seemed stale-ish. Again clearly this is a place for 20 somethings to drink and mingle so not sure what I expected.
author: B P.

description: Nice place. Good food and fast service. It's very casual but still with a bit of a upscale style. Would def come here again if I visit SF :-)
author: Michael F.

description:
We rarely plan...we found a space nearby and just parked.  Brixton was the first place we came upon that was opened.  After taking a quick look at the brunch menu, hubby decided to stay.  We were sat at the first table with the bench inside but we opted for the nearby tall bar table instead.  

We had coffee.  It was good, strong and piping hot.  

Started with the 'demoned' eggs - $6 - four halves, cage-free eggs plumped with yolks, fresh dungeness crab, bacon, aioli, shallots, celery, parsley & chives.  The crab and bacon are the stars of this dish.

I had the lox & pizza bread - $13 - sliced smoked salmon atop just-grilled pizza bread, schmeared with meyer lemon crème fraiche and topped with chopped chives, pickled red onion, and fried capers.  This was borderline of cold to warm, just odd in temperature.  It was ok,nothing special.

Hubby had the carnitas hash - $13 - beer braised pork shoulder sauteed with yukon gold potatoes topped with tortilla strips, avocado mousse, cilantro leaves and a poached egg.  This dish was warm so I'm convinced our waitress left our orders sat waiting for a while.  The poached egg is the best thing of this dish - perfectly cooked with the yolk running over the hash.  The carnitas are in big clumps, the potatoes are like breakfast potatoes...everything is big.  

We had to ask to have our coffee refilled.  Lack of service and ok food, it'll be a long long while before we would even consider returning.

The bar itself looks cool.  Definitely like the fireplace and the skylight.
author: Gloria H.

description:
Came here for the first time to meet a friend for drinks and it was a great experience!  Super friendly staff, literally, every single person had a smile and were attentive without being intrusive. 

Danny, my bartender, welcomed my newbie status with enthusiasm (wow, in this neighborhood?) and made me a delicious gimlet.  Even though my friend and I basically overextended our stay, being the last lingering crumbs in the place, he didn't urge us out or rush us in any way. He even made a point of saying goodnight/goodbye when we finally did leave!  

Very chill spot with some good comfort foods (I only had appetizers and drinks) though they were a little on the heavy side.  Good lighting and it's a nice spacious spot with plenty of seating. Will definitely return again!
author: Annie W.

description: We stopped in during one day of sightseeing because we were starving and the menu looked pretty good. We had a kale salad, burger and half/half fries, and another sandwich that I cannot remember the name of. It wasn't that crowded and the cocktails we had were also very good. The service could have been better, but it was a great on the hunch find with some outdoor seating in a cute neighborhood. I could see it being a good happy hour, after work spot!
author: Vanessa M.

description:
Good tuna salad sandwich but TINY! Really overpriced for what you get. 

For the price you'd expect a normal person sandwich and not a snack. Drinks are pricey and it seems that this place is focused on the wealthy Marina crowd. Would not recommend.
author: Dee K.

description: This bar/restaurant is usually great for both eating and drinking. The cocktails are well crafted, the food is flavorful, and the service is mostly competent. I especially appreciate the high ceilings and the social table, as they make the space seem larger. Enjoy!
author: Mike S.

description: This place has potential (at least for brunch), and the wait staff was nice and efficient. Coffee was pretty good for a bar/restaurant. However, the edibles just weren't great. Nothing was bad, per se, but a restaurant shouldn't be charging that much for what seemed to be frozen hash brown patties. I feel like the menu is vast, but not a lot of attention seems to be paid to the food--execution or presentation. I feel like if they consolidated the menu and focused on better preparation, it could be a different story.
author: Alex C.

description:
Cool spot.  We were randomly walking around one weekend night and stopped by. A difficult area to pub hop since there's usually no seating in almost all places of Moo Hollow---this place had some, and we lucked out. Nice crowded area, nice little corner area with a homey decor. Service was great, drinks fantastic and the food was delicious.

The door man/bouncer was extra friendly and recommended lots of other places to visit...and because of that we came back here and drank some more.
author: Reyz A.

description: The chicken soup tasted like water! SUPER BLAND!!! But the Carnitas Hash was delicous, as were the Pretzel Knots and the Chorizo Breakfast burrito.
author: Corinne E.

description: The servers and everyone working here was very friendly and nice place for brunch. Good however, not so good. Nice menu, but cold potatoes, greasy eggs and undercooked pancakes are not what makes for a nice brunch. Get some help in the kitchen, Brixton!
author: Robert S.

description:
Oh brixton, you are so mediocre. 

I don't expect much from a place like this, but I expect at least a little.

Well, the fries were good.  Half sweet potato, half regular. Also happy hour prices are ok.

Unfortunately a rude bartender and a generally unprofessional atmosphere make this a place  probably won't visit again.

It probably does look good at night, though.
author: Mara S.

description:
+ London-like hang out w cool posters, + good brews, + awesome  1/2 chicken, + good music, - could be cozier

If you are looking for a London-like pub atmosphere The Brixton gets close. The dark wood bar is spacious and the beer selection contains many great local and micro brews.
If you are on a budget don't miss on the happy hour (Mon-Fri 11am - 7pm, Tue all day) that comes with $4 drafts and $5 appetizers. 

If you come for dinner try the  1/2 chicken that comes with a yummy potato gratin. Unfortunately the restaurant area is wide open, for the coziest spot go for a table at the window.

Average entrée: $20
author: Travelin- M.

description: Met some friends for brunch on New Years Eve and what an amazing little place this is. The food was excellent and we worked our way through the cocktail menu as well. Service was amazing. Love this place!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Great fratty place to hang out!

This place is exceptionally loud and fratty, but fun. they have some great beers and drinks. good place to watch a game. always loose my voice when i go there. 

The food is mediocre - the pretzel is awesome, the fries are disappointing. 

Be warned - this place is full of men in plaid.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Food was fine but not memorable. Was prompted to write this review a week following... and was hard pressed to remember. I ordered the blackened Mahi Mahi, fine. Wife ordered vegan burger, disappointing. Friends ordered the burger, and another the half chicken. I think the burger review was okay and the chicken review was good. 

"Fun" scene = loud.
author: David B.

description:
Food has really gone downhill here. Pretzel knots came out hard and burger was really greasy. 
Adding insult we waited 45 minutes while other groups were seated in front of us and several tables were wide open. Doubt I will go back anytime soon.
author: Roger G.

description: Worst service I have ever had in my life. There was no courtesy at all during my experience. The entire staff were totally unprofessional. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant or bar to anyone going to have a good time. Check out a blue light, palm house, instead.
author: Breanna S.

description: The bartender Phil was very helpful about other bars to go to on our night out . We ended up having such a good time there talking with him that we didn't make it to the other bars he suggested! There were some VERY intoxicated guys there from another bar who causes quite the scene, he handled it perfectly! The bar back Axl was on it! Always moving and keeping everything in check. we'll definitely go back to try the food if we have time, it all sounded great!
author: Ashlee S.

description: This review is entirely because of our server, Robert, at the Brixton. I had reserved a table for 20 people for a birthday brunch, and a few more people (~10) showed up than expected. Despite this, the host was extremely accommodating and let us take an extra booth, and Robert helped us get extra chairs, etc. He remembered everything and was extremely prompt, and remained nice the entire time. So thanks Robert (and Brixton) for an excellent birthday party!
author: Stacey H.

description:
I'm definitely changing my opinion of Brixton. Initially I thought the service was slow and the drinks left a lot to be desired (when they first opened).

Well the service is still a little on the slow side for the food, but it's well worth the wait as the pizza, the chicken salad, the burgers and the sweet potato fries are becoming our SOP every time we sit down here whether it's brunch, dinner, weekend or weeknight. I'd rank their burger over the "burger" places like Roam and Marengo but not by much.

As for the drink service, VAST improvements.  not afraid of ordering a Manhattan here anymore (when it started, I won't like, I feared ordering most any mixed drink with more than two ingredients).

Way to step up.

(and still people don't realize this is a great place for food, fine by me as we get seated quickly whether we're a two or a four every time)
author: Mike V.

description: Very adamant to not help a homeless person with a donation, no matter how i'd 'word' a request, or know the better moralistic side in me to be outnumbered by these 'rich' ... people...
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Please note this is about Happy Hour:
My husband and I do in-home wine tastings all over the Bay Area.  When we have one in the city but we need to eat, we first find the address where the tasting is to take place.  Then we drive around until we find parking.  Yesterday we just happened to find parking right in front of The Brixton.  Even better, it just happened to be Happy Hour!  I ordered the Organic Bee's Knees cocktail (yummy, not too sweet, very refreshing).  My husband and I shared the 1/2-1/2 fries (1/2 potato 1/2 sweet potato) for only $3 during happy hour.  We also had the French Onion Dip for with homemade potato chips for only $5 during happy hour.  And as an extra we had the deviled eggs with crab.  I really couldn't taste the crab, but the eggs were delicious.  

The building is beautiful.  Our server was very friendly.  It was a happy accident that we found parking in front of the Brixton.
author: Becky T.

description:
super great bar and food place to frequent in the 
triangle area. its a local neighborhood place so expect a lot of beautiful people esp on weekends
author: Jojo V.

description:
Brixton as a bar= 3 out of 5.

Brixton as a restaurant= 2 out of 5.

Their drinks are good and it's a sure bet place for a good time with a rowdy crowd. The bar gets very crowded on the weekends so expect a line if you go past 10:30 PM. Full of marina boys and hungry girls looking for connections beyond their weekly Hinge dates. 

The food is decent but not out of this world. The best thing on the menu is the sweet potato fries. They usually are booked with reservations and I don't think it's because the food is epic, I think it's just because it's a popular spot with a good location and high demand. One time I went here with a girlfriend and she ordered chicken noodle soup and they forgot the noodles. They apologized for the mistake and then brought the soup back without a spoon. We then had to wait over 20 minutes for the server to bring a spoon. Ridiculous!
author: Ashley S.

description:
We used to love this place! Great atmosphere and friendly customer service. Unfortunately not so much anymore. Went in for brunch with my family today, the server was new and very friendly. I ordered the breakfast sandwich was described as a fried egg, with cheddar cheese and bacon on an english muffin. What I got was a half cooked sunny up egg on top of the worlds smallest english muffin (about the size of the silver dollar pancakes, smaller than a Starbuck's breakfast sandwich) and a tiny half a piece of bacon hidden underneath the uncooked egg. We all got a great kick out of it, being that it was bite sized, and then called the server over. I apologized and said it was way to small to be $10, and that the egg white part of the egg was not cooked, she agreed and laughed at the size, told me to keep the fries and no charge. 
About 15 min. later the manager came over with the same sandwich in hand and showed it to us, asked me what the problem was and went to hand it back to me and told me to order another one if its not big enough! It was pretty rude and pathetic, we were all shocked, I told him I did not want it anymore everyone was finished eating and the egg wasn't even cooked. He got an attitude and then said fine, and asked for the fries back. I mentioned that the server said we could keep them and he just took them out of my hand and walked away. Sadly me, my friends and family will not be back. Some of the food is pretty good, the servers are nice, but the unfriendly, unprofessional and combative manager pretty much overshadows everything. It was prime time for brunch around 11:30 and the place was empty, reading the reviews on here it sounds like this place isn't doing so well, which is probably why it was so easy to get a table for six at 11 am on a Sunday. There are a lot of great places to eat on Union that appreciate their customers and have great food. It's too bad we used to love do brunch here on Sundays with large groups. I think they should just stick to drinks, and they could use a new manager who has a little more customer service experience. Good Luck!
author: Sarah A.

description:
O.M.G.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! First let me start by saying that I really hate to give a bad review to a place. But when the service absolutely sucks so bad that the stupid girl taking orders can't get one thing correct I feel compelled. 

1. 20 min to get a coke-cola, what are you making it or just pouring it into a glass. (The reason this seems so strange is because the place was practically empty. Maybe 7 tables up and three servers on the floor.)
2. When you order pasta Alfredo you expect SOME pasta. Not just a bowl filled with onions (which I hate), sun dried tomatoes (which I love), and leaves. Not a pasta noodle in sight. I would have sent it back but that would've been my third re-order since the waitress had already messed up my order twice. The possibility of spit in my food was too high!

So in conclusion, I paid 25$ for a lunch and didn't even eat a whole bite. I took my "pasta" to go and gave it to the nearest bum on the street. But this was union street so there were no bums around at 3:30pm on a weekday.  

Hey, on the bright side I did drink two cokes.
author: William M.

description: No mayonnaise , only aholi, uhh this is America , beer is good waiter is cute , had good time
author: Wdfa W.

description: I just had lunch here. First timer. I ordered a pork sandwich with a salad. The pork was over salted and the salad tasted as though it had no dressing. Ordered iced tea to drink with it. They offered no sweetener of any kind. I would have asked for salad dressing or sugar but my waiter was busy serving other customers around me and never even looked at me to see if I needed anything. Meanwhile the tables around me were seated, fed and left. I asked the busboy to tell my waiter I'd like the check. Nothing. Finally my waiter came and asked me if I wanted the check. YES PLEASE. Then waited another 20 minutes before he delivered it. While I  watched other who'd gotten their checks first pay and leave. It literally took over half an hour to get my check. When it arrived I was sitting at the empty table with my wallet in hand already wearing my jacket and glaring at the waiter. Needless to say, I left a lousy tip.
author: Johnnie R.

description:
This place is great!! I've only been here for lunch and Happy Hour but definitely want to pop in for brunch sometime. 

First off- the atmosphere is wonderful. Great music, awesome framed concert posters, fun velvety walls, dark wood, fireplace, and very comfortable with a variety of seating options (patio, high tops, fire side, bar area, booth seating) Plus, the service has always been great.

 Regardless if i'm sitting at the bar or at a table i'm greeted immediately and they're always happy to help me pick out some new favorites off the menu. (everyone is SO nice from servers & busboys to bartenders and managers) 

The happy hour is amazing and all day if I remember. I really love the carnitas tacos and found the spinach dip delicious! I really like the 1/2 and 1/2 fries too. I'm loving this place.....can't wait to come back!
author: Jina E.

description: Awesome food. Drinks. Service. Dog friendly outdoor area. Cool staff. Can't remember my waiters name but I loved his tattoos. Believe he got them done at a lace called 13 in Oakland? Will be back.
author: Tatiana G.

description:
Oh Brixton. You are seriously every Marina-boy's fantasy play land. I've been here on different occasions for both dinner and drinks and have always maintained a very laissez faire nonchalant opinion about it. 

I don't hate Brixton. But I certainly don't love it either. I'd classify the place as a nothing more than a pit stop on your bar crawl nights. The food is mediocre, flavorless and extremely non-noteworthy. In fact, I'd say it's noteworthy for being non-noteworthy. The only appetizer/side I'd recommend after going through many iterations of their menu is the sweet potato fries. They are admittedly the only thing that I can remember about my meal and I'm someone who remembers the texture of even the tiniest peas in the smallest side dish that I've ordered. 

I wish I could say the drinks more than make up for the lackluster food. But of course, I'd be liar if I did. The basil gimlet I had was overly sweet and the Riesling was just so-so. I'd stick to beer here as that's a pretty safe bet. 

So why 3 stars instead of 2? The ambiance/scene. If you're into the Marina-bar scene with large open space and a great way to congregate with your friends while getting scoped out by the bros, you can add Brixton to your list.
author: Priya S.

description:
Had dinner here last Saturday evening and was very impressed. 
It was very busy, which is a given for a Saturday night on Union street, but the service certainly didn't reflect it. Our waiter was very attentive, and never kept us waiting too long, but also didn't rush us if we needed more time. The food arrival was prompt, and the drinks were strong. The mahimahi and chicken were delicious! All around good experience.
author: Kay S.

description: This place sucks. Food was mediocre at best and our server, Huong, was absolutely rude and needs to find another career path because customer service ain't her thing. There are far better restaurants to dine at on Union Street. Avoid this dump at all cost.
author: L H.

description:
Infused cocktails, gourmet bar food, indoor and outdoor-esque seating.

Basil Gimlet:
Not too sweet, a hint of basil, fresh lime, and vodka, shaken so a sheen of ice shards sit on the surface.  Awesome cocktail for a lady.  It's not too sweet, so you can have one right after the other.

'Twisted' House Made Pretzel Knots ($7):
Soft and warm pretzel rolls with stone ground mustard  and cheese dipping sauces for each bite.  I highly recommend this one! (3 pieces).

'Demoned' Eggs ($6):
The best deviled egg I've ever had.  It had crab and bacon on it! (4 halves).

Spinach & Artichoke Dip ($7):
Creamy, hot, and gooey dip.  Pretty standard. Served with toasted baguette slices.

Black Tiger Prawn Cocktail ($10):
Good!  The prawns were chilled.  The slaw was flavorful too.  The cocktail sauce had a bit of a kick.  (5 pieces).

Roasted Chicken Breast Salad ($13):
Yum!  Shredded chicken breast, quinoa, pickled red onions, candied walnuts, on a bed of mixed greens and spinach.  So good!

Great food, ambiance, drinks, and happy hour!
author: Elise G.

description:
We came in here on the Sunday of Bay to Breakers but it was surprisingly slow.  They sat us in a booth in the far back, which was fine, as all we really wanted was some food and a few drinks.  

First of all, our server was either drunk or high because she looked completely out of it and made no sense the entire time she was helping us.  She gave us the "Late"  menu and when we asked her if we could have the regular dinner menu, she said it doesn't start until 5:30pm, and we looked at our watch and told her it was 5:45.  So she said she would grab the dinner menus for us but she never came back.  Finally we waved her down and she brought them out.

We ordered the pork chop, demon eggs (their spin on deviled eggs), and the tacos.  The only thing I really liked were the tacos.  The eggs were inedible.  They tasted like they had been sitting in the fridge all day.  GROSS.  The pork chop was okay.  It just had way too much sauce and wasn't tender enough.  

The bar seems fun and we'd probably come back for drinks. I'm pretty sure I won't eat here again.
author: Mandi L.

description: This place is amazing! Great service! Our waitress Ashley is the sweetest/fun and very knowledgeable of the menu! I got the half chicken entree, and swear that it's some of the most delicious chicken dish I've ever had! Even my boyfriend can't keep his fork of my plate! I highly recommend the half chicken. Great drink menu and omg the desserts are awesome! Had both cheesecake and devil's good cake! The cheesecake is nice and light, so fluffy! It's the Chef mother's cheesecake recipe, the chef is super nice! The devil's food is rich and will satisfy your sweet tooth! I'll definitely be back because they got me so hooked!
author: Keerati C.

description:
20% off brunch after 4sq check-in.  SCORE!  Unexpected deals are so satisfying.

They had good demoned eggs and pretty good french toast.  Great service and no waiting for brunch.  There are some Marina families with their children at brunch.  At its regular price and for their selection, I have to say I'm not likely to make plans to come back.  All in all, it would be worth a convenient and unplanned revisit.
author: Erika C.

description:
I came here for drinks and decided to eat cause I didn't have any plans. Place is really pretty.  The service was great.  The drinks came FAST!  The food... was not impressive.   Which is why I'm keeping this review short.  I couldn't think of anything that tasted good.  I guess the fries was good.  But it's hard for people to screw up fries. 
Great place for drinks is all I can really say about this place :)
author: Ying F.

description: Originally has a reservation at 11:30 but thanks to traffic we didn't get there until 12 but it literally only took 2 minutes to get seated, SCORE! Shout out to Amanda for being attentive and giving excellent service. Had the 3 eggs any style with sausage and potatoes. Yuuuum. Brunch is alway good here I once again highly recommend it.
author: Lisseth R.

description:
The Brixton....  My girlfriend and I came here on a Saturday morning on a nice day for brunch because we wanted to sit outside and take advantage of the sunshine. 

While we both enjoyed the environment, the food and drinks were a little lackluster.  To drink, I ordered a Moscow Mule which was standard and my friend ordered their Strawberry Don Royale, which I wouldn't recommend.  We started with the strawberry-chicken salad as an appetizer which was quite bland (2 stars).  For our meals, we ordered the breakfast sandwich (2.5 stars) and the french toast (3.5 stars).  The breakfast sandwich was similar to one you may get at a Starbucks, but the french toast was pretty tasty and the portion was huge!  

Overall, the food and drinks weren't very satisfying, and the service was average; but I guess the atmosphere and location are what draw people to The Brixton. 


This place is good for groups and the social scene, but as far as the dining experience itself - not very impressive.
author: Juliana K.

description: Just awesome! Friendly service... Fast seating... Great price on wine and everything else.
author: Gary H.

description:
Stopped by during happy hour with a friend and my children.
While the food was good, the service was crappy.
My waitress was CRAPPY.

1.  Waited 10 minutes until my friend went and asked the waitress to get menus.

2. Waitress provided water for me and my friend, ignored the children's needs until 30 minutes later when I asked for water for them.

3. Half way through taking our order -  started walking off.  SHE WALKED OFF WITHOUT TAKING OUR COMPLETE ORDER.

4. Never checked back in on us to see if we had everything we need.

5. Was extremely slow in checking in on us and our needs.  The restaurant/bar had a totaly of 2 other tables and maybe 8 other customers.  The waitress was folding napkins and avoiding our general direction though we tried to wave her down a few times. 

I get it. We were there during happy hour and happy hour doesn't involve a mother with toddlers. 
 
I'm ok with the fact that they had no kids menu but the point was this - the restaurant was no where near busy and the waitress treated us like we were clearly not wanted and that the children were a nuisance that shouldn't exist within her 50 yard perimeter.

Normally I pay a "parenting tax" when I eat out - 20-30% tip to cover cleanup inconveniences and the extra efforts it takes to make sure that the children are taken care of.  I left a tip of $2.75 on a $65 bill to make my point.  

Service. Was. Shitty.
author: Min Jung K.

description:
Great place! Its kid friendly by day and def a good spot to hang out at night time!

Great burgers and good bartenders.
author: John G.

description: Happy Hour Review - As I'm not here for dinner I'm only reviewing the drinks at happy hour that I experienced and it was a 5 star for drinks, atmosphere and staff.  Very good across the board.  Drinks were made very well, fresh and CORRECTLY :) Moscow Mule was fresh and tasty and well balanced.  Brixton Bramble was gin, lemon and fresh seasonal fruit (black berries) not sweet, but extremely refreshing! Again I want to stress, as I'm a HUGE foodie this review was strictly happy hour cocktails ONLY :)  With that said..... very very good!!! Sweet server Nikki made it enjoyable too!
author: Dani S.

description:
For my first brunch back I'm SF - this place was great! We had:

Drinks: Strawberry Royale-heavier than a mimosa and very yummy!

To share: Demond Eggs, Lox Pizza Bread and Silver dollar pancakes - all very delicious and a great experience :)
author: Pamela G.

description:
Shopping on Union and famished for brunch, but too bad for me - it was a weekday mid-morning and the server was mildly scandalized at my question.  No, they do NOT serve brunch at that particular time on that particular day.  I expect servers to be welcoming.  I just DO.  Past that kerfuffle, I like the place.  The space has an air; spaciousness, dark wood,.. a pleasant personality that is matched by the chef's creativity.  As a budding vegan, I was thankful for a wider variety of vegan / veggie options than most establishments offer.  I chose the Ginger Vegetable Stir Fry (wow, that was a lot of ginger), and he selected the Cornmeal Fried Chicken Salad.  We were both quite satisfied.  I enjoyed my Pinot Noir - and again, was happy to have several options.

There are about five small tables outside and eight or so with sunny window views for people-watching.  I appreciated the convivial vibe, the coolish decor, lively conversation at the long bar, and attentive service.

We'll definitely stop in again as we're in the Marina often.
author: Liana R.

description:
Visited for the first time and thought their sweet potato fries were terrific, but I was surprised that the menu didn't feature any meatless salad. 

Their mixed drinks were attractively presented, the lemonade was excellent and the waitress who served our table could not have been nicer. Our group was able to get a place outdoors and enjoy the sun, so of course this is a spot we will bookmark for a return visit.
author: Lynn S.

description:
Skip Taco Tuesday and head over to The Brixton instead! 

This review is just for their happy hour, specifically their all day happy hour on Tuesday. I've been here twice and have yet to be disappointed. 

If it's a warm night, definitely snag a table outside. They have heat lamps outside, so you'll be plenty comfy. Chillier night? Try to get a table by their cute fire place! Their happy hour menu has some solid options. 

If you're a white wine fan: they have one of the best rieslings I've ever tasted on their happy hour menu. Kung Fu Girl for $7 a glass. Totally worth it. 

I also recommend their tacos... 4 mini tacos for $5! They switch it up weekly (I think?). I've had their beef and their pork tacos, with a side of guac and salsa. It's honestly great for the price and infinitely better than the crappy tacos down the street at Blue Light. Also you can't go wrong with their $3 basket of fries. Regular, Sweet potato, or half and half. Definitely one of the better happy hour locations on Union. 

To top it off, the service is quick and attentive. 4 stars! :)
author: Krithika H.

description: This place is pretty cool to grab a drink, they have a wide variety beer/wine/cocktails. Don't eat there though, the food isn't bad but it's definitely overpriced.
author: Leo L.

description:
Good food, poor beer and wine selection. A really big "marina" crowd. Saw a lady who was trying to look younger than she was feeling up an older guy at the high top bar seat area yesterday. Mother's Day is a really sexy holiday I guess.
If you still like to take shots and you're past 30, this is a great spot for you.
author: Kajal G.

description:
Slow service, and forgot my order twice (missed my drink order, then also missed my food order) and both came very late.

Don't recommend for a big party appeared they aren't equipped for big groups.
author: David C.

description:
This past Friday 11/28/14 I looked forward to hitting up The Brixton for Happy Hour, the demoned eggs are just one of my many faves at this cozy establishment.  The hostess seated us and presented the HH menu and my guest and I perused the items, decided, and were ready to order.  Sadly, a male employee came swiftly walking over, snapped, "we're not doing happy hour today, I don't know why she gave this to you" AND LITERALLY GRABBED THE MENU RIGHT OUT OF MY GUESTS HANDS and stormed off.  I know we all have bad days but please don't make your bad day the customers problem.  We sat there dumbfounded and walked out of The Brixton within seconds, extremely disappointed.  

** Please, review the words "respect" and "courtesy" next time you have your hands on a Webster's dictionary, or better yet, flip out your handy phone and do yourself that favor even quicker before you ruin more diners' experiences..  It was unreal, disrespectful, and we are guaranteed lost customers.

All he had to do was approach us kindly and communicate the change to their menu.
author: stacey t.

description:
Meh.  The food was fine.  Nothing remarkable or special, but good food.  The kind you could get just about anywhere really.  I went for brunch, and the bloody mary was outstanding, so big points for that, because a really good Bloody Mary is a tough thing to find.

That said, I felt a bit like the servers thought they were doing me a favor.  We didn't ask for much....Simply ordered our food and then asked for the check after the meal.  I didn't feel like were were high maintenance guests, but the servers we interacted with, and the hostess, were lukewarm and dismissive.  Not even remotely friendly.

Overall, if I want good food, I can go to a million other similar places and get good food with much better service.   And for the prices, I'd expect the service to have been much better.
author: Michelle D.

description: Nice place on a warm sunny day. Been craving deviled eggs. Their Demon eggs SOOO good!!  Chives, Dungeness crab and bacon how could it go wrong.
author: Luey H.

description: Wow I really hate this place. Came here for brunch with a large group. I ordered the salad with ahi tuna. The tuna was off. Instead of making a big deal I just ate the salad and left the tuna. I mentioned it to our waiter. He came back and said yeah I tried it it was definitely bad. Like he didn't believe me in the first place. He took off $9 for the tuna. Honestly if you serve spoiled tuna to your guests I think minimum would be to take off the whole crappy salad. The service was crap, food is crap, you can find better. Even in the Marina.
author: Yana K.

description: Get the mac n cheese!!! Drinks are really good here, great place to watch sports and grab some yummy food. The service is great, i recommend making rezzys though.
author: Beckie P.

description: The appetizers are amazing! Every time I go I just a get a variety of appetizers, and even one alone is very filling. Great portions, satisfying tastes. I highly recommend the deep fried peppers and tacos of the day. What ever day of the week, your taco craving will be met! The staff and owners provide wonderful customer service as well. Super friendly and personable to all guests :) This place is always busy and hype any time, any day of the week but never an impatient wait for a seat! LOVEEE IT! Favorite spot on Union.
author: Alyssa P.

description: Two female bartenders need an attitude adjustment. One accidentally sprayed some sort of beverage in the air and it got on me. No apology no acknowledgment of any kind.  Sad bc the place has a great Bloody Mary
author: Ka C.

description: I loved it here. I ordered a Moscow mule which was perfect and it was happy hour so it only cost $6 or so. I ordered the pasta carbonara with creamy sauce and  thick pieces of bacon..so so so good. The service was excellent. We were seated right away and our waiter paid  close attention to us. We sat in a round booth in the back--super comfortable. I'll be back.
author: Patricia L.

description: I really wish Monterey had a place like this. Great crowd and fantastic drinks. Price is about what you'd expect. I recommend booking a table before coming, as this place gets pretty packed - at least on the weekend.
author: John H.

description: This is a favorite for a happy hour in the sunshine. Their mixed drinks are great- the Irish coffee has homemade whip. Yum! Plus, that beet quinoa and chicken salad is the stuff my dreams are made of.
author: Jaclyn T.

description:
7 of us came here for lunch before a day of sight seeing in the city. The decor is very modern with a classic comfortable feel. Love at first sight.

We ordered:
Sweet potatoe fries with roasted katsup - YUM!

American breakast for my daughter who was craving hashbrowns - basic but solid

I split the roasted chicken salad with my mom and a bowl of chowder - chowder was good and the salad was absolutly large enough to share.  My only boo was that the dressing on the salad was a little flavorless but the pickled beets were AMAZING!

My older brother got the breakfast barrito and inhaled it so I'm assuming it was a hit.

My other brother and his wife split the house burger with Avo and bacon with a side of firery mac-n-cheese.  The burger was good but not outstanding but my sis-in-law LOVED the mac. 

Dad got a cup of the chowder and the french dip and really like it. 

This place is not cheep but I'd say it was average for the area and we'll absolutly be back to try the deviled eggs, and the gimlet! Can't wait.
author: Christie B.

description: I love this place! Always good food and has some amazing options for us celiacs and gluten intolerance peps. I found this place this the 1st week I moved out here and have been coming back all the time over the past 3 years. My family enjoys it as well when they visit!
author: Jennifer H.

description: We were recommended to go here by a friend, and it did not disappoint.  We had to wait about 15-20 for a table, but there was space at the bar so we got the amazing Bloody Mary with bacon and a prawn. Very tasty and one drink got me pretty tipsy. For breakfast I ordered the fried egg breakfast sandwich and it a perfect sized portion for 1 person. We also got the 3 eggs any style, with fruit and hash browns. Everything was so fresh and tasty and the place itself was very nice.
author: Shadan S.

description:
I had the carbonara - it was a complete disaster.....
1. The portion was surprisingly small - I don't like tons of food but this was probably half of what you get elsewhere.
2. The food was cold.
3. The cream sauce was watery and tasteless.

Do not go here for lunch - the kitchen staff is out to lunch already.
author: Alexander S.

description:
My friends and I walked upon this place after yelping - of course, again. And I heard few good things about this place from my friends.

I was a bit skeptical at first because the servers weren't that nice to me at first when I asked, "how long is the wait?" and I told them I'll come back. Well, makes sense - they probably though we weren't going to come back... but we DID! One  recommendation to the service people - be nice to people because some people will come back. 3 stars.

Other than that, here's what I got at The Brixton:

FOOD: One of the coolest thing is they served their food in cool little dishware. 

1. French onion dip with potato chips: the French onion dip came in a small little pot and homemade potato chips on the side. Delicious french dip, very thick in flavor and creamy! Lots of caramelized onions blended with cheese, and aioli. Works well with their homemade potato chips. $7 - 4 stars.

2. 1/2 & 1/2: thin french fries and sweet potato fries with ketchup and aioli something like ranch). Sweet potato fries seemed a little burnt and french fries were soggy, but there were some crispy ones - and those were good. 

3. THE BRIXTON BURGER $14. Apparently, the it's grass fed burger? Burger is huge with red onions, tomato, lettuce - the usual stuff. We added avocado and bacon, which made our burger to be $17. For $17, it wasn't worth that much... I can probably get this burger for at least $10 else where and with the same quality. So, I'm sorry I have to give it a 3 stars, just because of that price - it made me sick to see a $17 where I can get it for least than 10 bucks.

**OVERALL: I'm fan of this place, but the price is way to steep.. $17 burger? But, I will come back and order not a burger ... but maybe some drinks next time. THREE STARS.
author: Mindy Y.

description:
Shout out to the Brixton because of the good food and pretty decor! 

We sampled a lot of food. My favorite was the flatbread pizza. Something on the pizza gave it a major heat kick (which I loved but my friend couldn't take) so beware non-heat eaters.

Also loved the half chicken and ricotta gnocchi, Both were delicious, 

My friend and I went 'family style' with our food and shared. Definitely would consider doing it this way because portions are big and pretty singular (meaning not many other embellishments to the plate). 

Service was friendly and efficient despite all the Marina party go-ers in the bar area being loud, etc.

Overall, a fun friendly environment with good hot food. This isn't really a romantic/quiet place to go but more so a place to eat good food and drink nice cocktails with friends or family.
author: Stef E.

description:
The Brixton was introduced to me by one of my friends and it has to be one of my FAVORITE restaurant/gastropub right now. Awesome place to get drinks with a group of friends. Young professional crowd with a loud atmosphere. 


We reserved for a table for 5 of us. We all ordered the signature cocktails and I'd say the popular ones turned out to be the blueberry lemonade and strawberry don royale. We also ordered and shared some starters: 

-Spinach Artichoke Dip
-Flatbread Pizza
-Twisted house pretzel knots
-Tacos del Dia
-fiery mac n cheese

They were all yummy! My favs were the pretzel knots and fiery mac n cheese; items that are unique to the Brixton.

Great location and you can find parking easily. Service, food, and drinks were on point. Couldn't ask for anything better will definitely return and recommend to anyone!
author: Sandhya R.

description:
I had just completed my run and so I was ready to eat when I hit Union St. to start an afternoon of browsing/shopping. The friend in SF I was visiting was at work so I was alone and it was about 1pm.

I was greeted at the host stand and was told any table I wanted was fine. I chose the one in the window. It was for 4 people, but they told me no. I asked about 2 others nearby and was told those were for larger parties. Apparently they were expecting a late 2pm lunchtime rush? The restaurant was more than half-empty, way to make me feel welcome.
I was shown to another table, even though the busboy had cleared off one in the window and offered it to me, I said (in front of the host) 'no, I'm not allowed to sit there'.

Anyway... I started off with the blue crab cakes. Delicious. My favorite part was the sauce.
I also had a cup of the clam chowder which was also really good. The best part of the meal was the massive salad I had- the roasted chicken and beet. Oh my, that was fantastic.

What was off was the service, as you can tell I didn't start off on the right foot here. Also, I had 2 waitresses throughout the meal and I just hope my tip was split between them.

The decor is cute, I liked the atmosphere, but I can see how this could become bro/d-bag central at night.

I would come back for lunch.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
This is my favorite place for brunch in the city (let me clarify - for non-all you can drink brunches in the city).  The food here is always excellent - from the decadent fried chicken Benedict, to the salads, the smoked salmon flat bread...all good!

The bar tenders are speedy, and the bloody marys are spicy and delicious!  I also like to enjoy a nice glass of champagne with my brunch when I sit outside on the sidewalk and people watch.

This place is always my go-to spot to bring people who are visiting me, it just has a great atmosphere, and I always know the food is going to hit the spot!

Make reservations on Saturdays/Sundays if you are coming after 11, it definitely gets busy!
author: Nic S.

description: Ordered food for pickup: a burger, asked for an extra patty (because protein) and avocado. Came out to a pretty expensive burger. Got home and opened up the box. No extra patty. No avocado. Too hungry to walk back and gripe so I just ate it, flavoring each bite with my tears.
author: Brian T.

description: Do not go to this place for the food. This was by far the worst brunch I have eaten in the city and the worst eggs benedict I have ever eaten. The muffins we're cold and stale and the house fries were soggy too. The price was not reflected by the poor quality and worked out to be an expensive meal. The service was really the only good thing about this place - quick and attentive. Won't be back anytime soon.
author: Olivia C.

description: This is just great, excellent food, great serivce. My wine fell down coz a big wind. Server saw that and bring me another one even thought I m almost finished. Very good!
author: James F.

description:
Solid 11:30 am onwards happy hour!  Cocktails (the one vodka one whose name i'm blanking on is pretty good), wine, beer....and during the day, they'll let you sit at tables, despite only drinking.

Came in a few times on my current visit, both for happy hour (at normal happy hour time, 5 pm onwards), and midday for a bloody, and both experiences were pretty good.  

I was a massive fan of Left at albequerque circa 2005, so was sad to see that go (albeit it went enormously downhill), but was glad to see the space is nicely done, with a fireplace up front, and large bar area.  Don't expect any patrons to be any more dressed up here than anywhere else in the marina, and personal space isn't too well respected, but as long as you don't' mind being bumped by hoodies, fleeces, and yoga pants while consuming your happy hour cocktails, grab a seat at the bar.  Otherwise, get here early, and try to score a larger seating area, where you might not feel molested while throwing back your drinks.

Bonus points for the awesome bartender who gave us blue cheese stuffed olives AND regular olives for our dirty martinis last friday!
author: Danielle J.

description:
Went to this place with a group of four for dinner and drinks. Seated pleasantly with cutely dressed servers and hostesses. The ambiance was lovely. There were younger and some older crowds meeting for dinner and a lot of other fun people crowded around the bar. 
The salads were great! I got a kale salad and added quinoa and avocado to it and LOVED it. The rest of my crew got the chicken salads which they loved too. Perfect proportions. Pretty large but light and say just right. 
The drinks were great too. I got one of the peach vodka drinks and my friend got a minty one and they were delicious. Overall great.
author: Sormeh K.

description:
Really enjoyed the food & atmosphere.  I relished the steak & potato salad ~ so glad I sprung for the avocado ~ and despite the dressing being a tad heavy on the oil for me, the combinations of flavours (green beans, onions, bacon) was scrumptious.  

14 year old was really happy with the pulled pork sandwich and the skinny crisp fries.  My highlight was a fabulous Malbec and the sun shining in the front window.  The waiter was pleasant and not overly attentive.  

For tourists, it's easy to get to - right on the MUNI 45 bus - and close enough to walk to the Presido - which I'm glad we did; needed to walk off the pretzel bites.
author: Bev T.

description: I really like the Brixton but my Louis Vuitton handbag was stolen here last Saturday night.  The management was nice enough to let me view the surveillance footage and the SFPD is investigating. Ladies just please be careful with your purses.
author: Anna L.

description:
This place simply rocks! 

+3 stars = The food is delicious and their service is outstanding. 

+1 star = I think there's something about this place that attracts really good looking people :-D

+1 star = The drinks are extra yummy!

Top 5 Take aways (in no specific order):

1)The "Demoned" Eggs - So tasty! 

2)The Devils Food Cake w/ Cream Cheese Frosting - Moist like you wouldn't belive. 

3)The ice cream is to die for. Our amazing  waitress that served my party of 4, told us that the ice cream we ordered for dessert was made by Humphry Slocombe and it's an exclusive flavor that you can only find at The Brixton called "The Brixton". I love it when San Francisco businesses collaborate to offer better customer experiences. 

4)The Clam Chowder is so creamy. Best chowder I've ever had by far.
