5)They had this amazing Blue Cheese Stuffed Olives Martini that quenched my cocktail thirst 3 times last Friday night.

I will definitely be returning to The Brixton again in the very near future to try a few other items on the menu.
author: Lily N.

description: Very spacious with a cool ambience. The walls are lined with artsy show posters and images from some of my favorite bands - Mudhoney, the Foals, Mogwai, the Clash, and more. I came here with my husband and 6 month old in a stroller and they accommodated us no problem. It's loud enough that my daughter's screams were overcast by the white noise of patrons enjoying their dinner but not too loud where you can't hear each other! We ordered from their happy hour specials - hot, yummy pretzels, the Braxton burger special and drinks! Will definitely be going back for dinner or brunch again
author: rita N.

description: This place just gets worse every time I go...Horrible customer service and the food disappoints. The acoustics make it nearly impossible to have a conversation but again it's the service/bartenders that make this place one to avoid in my neighborhood.
author: Schmelp S.

description: Love this place! The spinach dip is fire and so is the Brixton Steak burger. Can't go wrong with any of the cocktails so delish. The decor is so awesome. Obey wallpaper and all different posters from concerts held in SF. You definitely have to check this place out!
author: Jenny J.

description:
I enjoyed this as a brunch spot. The decor is lovely - a nice classy-modern bar feel, with wooden slats and tall ceilings, even with a wide skylight.  The only downside would be the stereotypical Marina crowd that of course would be dining here.

Oh, and of course the food..... delicious!
We ordered the Demoned Eggs to share, which were my favorite!  This comes with 4 halved deviled eggs that had fresh dungeness crab mixed with bacon.  (corner right photo below).  I also tried the Carnitas Hash, Chorizo Breakfast Burrito, and the French Dip.  Everything was a win!
https://sphotos-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash4/2521_10100785568596359_2093694787_n.jpg
author: Jeanne L.

description: This was a very sad night. My very close friend arranged a birthday dinner for 16 people and the reservation was confirmed. They called to make sure we'd be on time, etc. We arrived for our 8pm reservation and they couldn't figure out how to get us the confirmed table. We weren't seated until after 9pm, they were non-apologetic after we were super nice, the food was mediocre, and it ruined my friend's birthday party which was scheduled for afterwards at a nearby bar-  we showed up an hour late due to the delays. So sad. Hopefully they find a way to improve service and reliability. The food is ok (not stellar) but no real complaints there.
author: Samantha H.

description: Imagine being stuck in: either a white frat house reunion dinner party, or a young conservative party meetup. The atmosphere had a very obtuse and shallow feel to it. One of the few remaining places in SF with that particular singular clientele. Unfortunately, the atmosphere ruined the good food for me, and I left with a ill feeling in my tummy.
author: Melody C.

description: Try get there before 7 to catch the HH, otherwise it can get pricey.  However, the food is great, and the wait staff very friendly and professional.  The bar is rectangular and big, so no one has to stare into bottle shelves.  Columns are in the way, though, but it is an older building and they probably needed them.  Can get very loud, so take romantic / biz / trouble conversations somewhere else.
author: Peter D.

description:
I really like this place. 

I mean that.

I don't like it for the crowd or for the fact that it is on Union....I like it because they have great food and even better drinks...hands down one of my favorite restaurants in the city.

I mean that.

I love many things here, but my favorite is on the weekends for brunch- the Monte Cristo! 

Hookay- Its made with fresh made jam (everything here is fresh including the ketchup) different cheeses, stuffed with ham, battered and fried twice- covered in powdered sugar and partnered with more strawberries. YUM!

Order yourself a Drexel (a drink so good, my friend proclaimed that he couldn't feel his face after) Its packed with strawberries, fresh mint, poured with ginger beer and rum.

So from now on if you want to drag me to the Marina- I will happily come to the Brixton.

I mean that.

$160 for so many drinks we lost count + lots of food for 4.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Late evening bar-seat on a weeknight, 
The men's synchronized diving event for the 2012 London Olympics lightly within an audible line of sight as faintly illuminated on the flat screen..  My date and I had just enough time to savor 1 drink each before being paged for our table right down the block at Umami Burger.. Our bartender really knew what he was doing, asked all the right questions for my extra-dry Hendricks martini with a few bitters and a twist, and kept at a convenient distance..

The warm woods bring a lot of warmth and old-world charm to this space, and I definitely think that the space is divvied in a very ingenious way: spacious bar in the center, small intimate tables up front, and communal tables to larger rows of seating towards the back.  What a fabulous precursor to dinner, I doubt I would come here for dinner because I do know this place to become a bit overwhelming.. but I would gladly come back for another round of drinks.
author: Ty T.

description: They couldn't accommodate our big party, so we had to sit in 2 different tables. However, the food was delicious and our server was very nice. I recommend the nutella french toast as a splitter for the whole table! Nom nom
author: Veronica F.

description: This is apparently where all the good looking people go. A little dude-bro-y and pretty loud, but otherwise, a pretty good atmosphere. Our server was fast and friendly. Came here for dinner and drinks. The cocktails were pretty good and the food was pretty good. We got the giant meatball as an appetizer and the vegan and beef burger. Nothing awesome, but I would come back.
author: Joseph K.

description:
In my second installment of my gastropub trek since moving back to the Bay, I came here on a Saturday brunch. We got here around 11:45am and were seated immediately. I expected it to be busy, but maybe it gets packed later in the evening...I'm sure it does. Okay, so on to the food.

We decided to share two plates to get a good feel for the place and see what the Brixton was all about: 

1. Crispix Crusted Stuffed French Toast - It comes served in four half-sandwich-like pieces with a mini pitcher for syrup. It was on the dry side, but the flavor was good. The syrup didn't add anything to the dish and there was a slight after taste. I was very disappointed.

2. Carnitas Hash - This was GOOD. This dish contained tender beer-braised pork shoulder sauteed with yukon gold potatoes, topped with crunchy tortilla strips, a silky avocado mousse, cilantro leaves, and a perfectly poached egg. I would come back for this dish.

I love the ambiance and the decor of this place. It's a place I need to experience at night because some of these places are just better at night. It's just that simple. For now, the Brixton gets the meh.
author: Karim V.

description: Great ambiance for the 20-30 year olds. Music, brunch and beverages are all great. Even if you want to watch a couple games while at the bar.
author: JUSTINE M.

description: I went here for a friends 21st birthday. It was empty for a Friday night. Over all, my experience was pleasant. The drinks were great, but the food was okay. I had the flat bread pizza and wasn't impressed. I would definitely recommend going to this place to hangout and have some drinks.
author: Leanne D.

description: We came in to watch the NBA finals and the this place had a good energy flow where people were enjoying themselves. Server and wait staff were very helpful in stabilizing our wobbling table. Food was great but no wow factor only negative was no happy hour prices during NBA final games - really?
author: Rome N.

description: Came here for brunch. The service was terrible; slow and inattentive. The bloody Mary's were watery. I'm a strict vegetarian and found chicken in the bottom of my veggie burrito. The portions of food that some of my friends had seemed to be pretty small too and I would have compared to an egg mcmuffin.  The only thing that saves this place is the ambiance and the manager did bring us a round is shots to make up for how mortified I was that I just put a dead animal in my mouth.
author: Paula D.

description:
My dude and I went to the Brixton on a random suggestion from a friend Sunday morning, and I am SO glad we did! 

We got a perfect open-door-window-ee seat on a beautiful day - everyone sitting around us was friendly, and the service was great! 

We shared a smoked ham benedict which was tasty - but the REAL winner of brunch was the CARNITAS with a poached egg over homestyle potatoes... OMG SO GOOD! Sooooooooo good! A MUST! 

Finally, brunch isn't brunch without a bloody mary....and oooh yea mama this one was tasty yummikins. We'll definitely be back!

Oh and not that it carries weight for my return... but.... I love that the owner is a fan of the Deadweather. :-)
author: Jodie B.

description: Great food, quick service - also had heaters on the patio so great spot to bring your dog and stay warm on the cooler nights. Happy hour menu is great - clam chowder is a little on the watery side but still good. Wasn't impressed with quinoa veggie burger but I still ate it all!
author: Diane T.

description: The service was excellent. Our waitress, Breanna, was/is fantastic. We went for brunch, and the amazing fried chicken eggs Benedict. My friend who wanted the crab cakes, didn't really get the "cake", but instead picked crab. They didn't charge us the crab, which was very generous of them. Service and food is awesome. Must come!
author: Vinson H.

description:
Story about service:

I walked into this place with a piece of luggage, as I was going to SFO that evening and had just come from San Jose. I sat down and although my bag was fine next to our table, an employee came up and offered to hold the bag in the back for me. When I was ready to go, I grabbed my bag and was gone. Easy.

It may seem very subtle but it's service like this that makes you appreciate places like this so much more. 

I just want to say thank you for that service and I hope everyone goes there and sees what I'm talking about!
author: Hiro R.

description: Love the Brixton -- great food, ambiance, and drinks. Our go-to Friday spot.
author: Hope C.

description: We had a reservation for 8 people, two families including my pregnant wife, a 10 month old baby, and two 6-year old kids. They set us in a spot where the sun was straight into our eyes - very difficult to endure for the adults, let alone the kids or baby. The place was mostly empty, with another 8-seat table right there available. I asked politely that they relocate us. They said quite rudely that they can't because "it is a reservation. I relied: understood, we're a reservation too, and we got here earlier so we can simply move to a spot that's livable, as opposed to the worst table in the place. The hostess was rude and said: "well, they reserved it on yelp and on yelp you can choose your exact table." I was blown away by the BS and decided to talk to the manager. The manager was as rude, and said the same thing. She added that those that reserved the other table were "regulars".  told them this was BS, and that we were regulars too, and that the place was quite empty so it didn't matter!! After I clearly expressed my discontent we were moved to another much smaller table. I took it, decided not to argue. As we had our brunch, i realized that till the moment we left the place was still quite empty, and that the table they refused to seat us on was never filled! When I asked about this on the way out I was told "yeah it's those couple of folks at the bar and they decided to drink instead". Seriously? Enough said.
author: M K.

description: i would say that the brixton is just really really average... been here a few times for late(r) evening eats, drinks and more drinks. it's nice that when it's warmer out, they open the floor to ceiling windows.  it's about as scene-y as the marina gets, minus maybe the tipsy pig, so perhaps that's why it's not my thing..? the most memorable thing ive tried here is jameson ice cream that they had for st. patty's day one year. hehe. that was nomsies. drinks are priced reasonably..
author: Christina L.

description: Food is good. Service is horrible. They straight up just forgot my entree, no apology. Id be ok with it if I could at least get a drink, but no such luck.
author: Sam M.

description:
This place just doesn't inspire an intricate, intimate review - so here's what it does:

The Good:
Cheese Steak Egg Rolls with Chili Pepper Dipping Sauce
Pretzel Knots, Honey Mustard Dipping Sauce is tasty - Cheese Sauce is watery and grainy.
Fried Chicken Salad, overdressed, but chicken has cornmeal in the batter, good crunch, juicy chicken.
Basil and Cucumber Vodka Gimlet, refreshing - one is good, 2 is better.
Decor is swanky trendy cool with posters of all different artists who have played the Fillmore - they even have The Kills.

The Bad:
Beef Stew, flavorless, sever lack of seasoning.
Service - watch out, once your main course is done, you will wait at least 20 minutes and STILL have to flag down your missing waitress. You wanted dessert? After waiting that long, no you don't.
Noise Level. The floor is wood, the ceiling is wood and sky high - nothing to absorb the volume of the other customers, so you are yelling too.

The Ugly:
Every one else dining there. You're in the Marina. Expect waifs and preppies that are BEYOND wasted, literally swaying in their seats and staring meaningfully at a point in one another's throat instead of in their eyes - guess it's all they could focus on.
This is literally the description of each and every other diner, save our table and it was only 7pm.

This place is just trying too hard to be the end-all be-all of cool that it is making it's way down the other end of the spectrum. That coupled with all the pretentiousness and sheer prissiness of the surrounding guests will save my money for greener pastures.
author: Katie W.

description:
Speakeasy decor but definitely not a speakeasy place...this joint gets loud but that's because everyone is having a good time.   The setup is pretty sweet.  Nice solid bar in the middle of a large room.   Table seating all around with booths in the back.    The seating in the front is a little more intimate and keeps you away from the bar bustle.  

Service is great for such a big place.  Staff is friendly and on top of it.   Came in with a GF that had to get to the airport in a couple hours and asked the waitress if we could put a rush on it.    She asked what time we needed to be out and had our bill on our table 5 mins before that.

Not the healthiest place to eat but they have some solid dishes that are damn tasty, on the light side but still generous in portion.   We shared 3 dishes and it was more than enough.   I can give two thumbs up for the shrimp ceviche (that could be a touch spicier), pears and pecans arugula salad and this amazing salmon dish with a corn compote sauce.

They take reservations but I've been there different days/times of the week and never had to wait for a table on a walk in.  

Looking for a solid night...this is the place.
author: Deena B.

description:
My friends and I were planning to try out Umami Burger, but they were closed. We saw Brixton and decided to check it out. 

The place was packed but mainly around the bar area, which makes sense since it was Saturday night. The dining area wasn't as crowded so we weren't bothered by the crowd. I wish the music was slightly lowered because it felt like a club - where I have to yell into my friend's ear to have a conversation - but that could just be because I'm not a loud music listener. So most people would probably like the noise level. 

My friends and I ordered a caesar salad, spinach & artichoke dip, two brixton burgers, and a couple of drinks. The food quality was between good and great. The baked croutons with the spinach & artichoke dip were a little on the crunchy side so it was difficult for me to eat but the dip itself was good. 

Even though the place was pretty packed, service was still very good, which is rare nowadays because most places have moderate to bad guest service. 

I will definitely be coming back here to try more food.
author: Martin N.

description: I'm still new but this my favorite bar so far. Great selection of beer and the food is fantastic. Great atmosphere too.
author: Nick F.

description: Definitely a fan of the atmosphere here! Went for dinner on a weekday with 3 other people; we were seated right away. Prompt service the entire time. The drinks I tried (a vodka-based cucumber basil gimlet and the Bee's Knees) were a bit sweet, compared to what I'm used to when ordering renditions of those cocktails elsewhere, but that's a matter of personal taste. That burger, however. I definitely recommend it. Overall a very good experience.
author: Chris M.

description:
So, my girlfriend and I ate here once before, and it was just ok food wise.
Then we went back for a second time for lunch. We noticed a 'steak salad' on their menu, and both decided to order that. What they gave us.. was in no way shape or form anywhere close to being a 'steak salad'  It was steak strips on top of greasy, greasy fried potato chunks and greasy ass string beans! No lettuce at all! WTF? And it wasn't like a cold potato salad or something. It was like a skillet diner! Then it had a really nasty ranch dressing they expected us to poor over this hot skillet like dish.
It was the weirdest thing that has ever been served to me yet. We wanted a regular fricking steak salad! Not steak and potatoes with string beans! Lol
author: Kirk M.

description:
Went there for dinner on Monday. No wait and the service was great, very attentive staff. Ordered the grilled pork and it came out black like a brick. I don't know why they think its acceptable to send that out. Sent my order back, but by that time my boyfriend already finished his meal. 

Other than that the appetizer, sweet potato fries and philly cheesesteak rolls are good. 

I wouldn't come back or recommend the place tho- not worth the price if my food is black and I can't even cut into it. Ruined our meal
author: Kris T.

description:
Went on a date here and had the kale salad for dinner...bomb diggity is an understatement. Way too much food, but I thoroughly enjoyed the 73% of the plate that I did consume. He got the steak and really liked it, too. 
Moscow Mules never disappoint here, although he's Russian and said the amount of vodka didn't meet his throat-burning standard (meanwhile my American-everything was feeling woozy after one mug). 
Cool vibes, great music, and a perfectly intimate setting in an open layout that is perfect for a night out with your main squeeze.
author: Courtney M.

description: Went out with a group of friends to this bar on a weekend. Drinks were good and the atmosphere was fun. Got a little crowded, but still fun place to hangout. "Last call" was a little too soon, but overall fun place to go in the Marina.
author: William H.

description: Great Bar and a cool ambience to hangout but the food is average at best.  I ordered the flabread and am fairly certain it was purchased from the Safeway frozen foods section
author: Ian S.

description: OMG I got food poison, I went this last Thursday and order a salad, everything looks fine when I realized that the lettuce and other greens look saggy and old, I let the manager know I think his name is Ray or something like that, he took my plate and left without making any effort to help, he just make a stupid joke, I was in bed for 3 days and almost went to the hospital for the pain. Please check your food prior and be careful, you never know if this place can make you sick
author: JR B.

description:
I can get a $10 glass of Domaine Chandon in an uncrowded, beautiful bar/restaurant in the wee hours of the morning. I have not dined here, but that alone makes this place top dog in my books.

The only downside is the clientele on weekends. Not very classy, but I signed up for it when I moved to the Marina.
author: Jeena C.

description: This restaurant/bar is right down the street from my apt so we eat here all the time. The food is good if you are looking for more of the appetizer type food. The vibe is fun and young which is nice and they have a full bar so it get crowded. All and all I always enjoy myself
author: D L.

description:
I love the atmosphere! We went for a late lunch on dreary Memorial Day and had a relaxing time. I love the fireplace, decor, and music. The drinks were OK, I had a coffee drink with baileys & tuaca. The food was so-so, not bad but nothing to rave about and the prices were good.

We had the spinach/artichoke dip which was really watery with too thick toasted bread. The cheese separated and I ended up eating mostly the spinach and artichoke bits. I had the crab cakes as my entree which were nice, plump, and had a good aioli with them.

My husband had the sweet potato fries and mac n cheese (a side). The mac n cheese was dry but nicely spicy and better when you get to the bottom where there is some extra cheese. The highlight was definitely the sweet potato fries with the roasted red pepper ketchup and some kind of aioli which was out of this world!

I'd come back for cocktails and the fries!
author: Amber M.

description:
Needed a place with broad menu and reservations for our party of 6. Worked out great. Salads, sandwiches, burgers and eggs Benedict's were all tasty. There were 2 gluten free diners in our group, which is NOT a category of diners that Brixton cares about. We muddled through ok. Sunday noon was packed,but service was decent. Food was good. Would recommend using Open Table for res. I left 2 voice mail requests but call was not returned although their recording said they would confirm.
Acoustics are not good when crowded.
author: S K.

description:
The food is fine, the service is HORRIBLE!

I've eaten at Brixton 3 times (2 for dinner, 1 for brunch) and both times we have had completely inattentive waiters, rude hostesses, etc.

Yesterday's brunch was a joke; despite making reservations for 11am, the hostesses didn't start acknowledging anyone (in a line that went out the door) until 11:10. We sat down, ordered quickly...and didn't see any food for another 50 minutes. No drink refills, they completely forgot our appetizers for the table...it was straight up awful. Then when the food finally came, they forgot 2 peoples' entrees, and didn't even notice. Those came out 10 minutes later, without an apology.

Despite us repeatedly requesting things, our waiter NEVER apologized, and instead chatted/laughed with his buddies by the bar while he ignored us.

Never again, Brixton!
author: Kelly B.

description:
Just what the doctor ordered! Had the Spinach Artichoke Dip with a Brixton Burger and it was phenomenal. I went 50/50 with Regular and Sweet Potato Fries and this was just average. 

Ambience was awesome for a Saturday night.

4 Entrees, 1 App and 8 cocktails for about $150 after tip. Not too shabby.
author: Will G.

description:
Decent upgrade from Left at Albuquerque.

Great pretzel apps, salad and brunch items. Definitely just another Marina/Cow Hollow restaurant bar, you know, THAT crowd...which I'm never against you just have to be aware of that's what you are getting yourself into. 

I've always had wonderful service and a good time while here. Decent cocktails and good food for the price.
author: Meredith M.

description: Decent good and drinks, but nothing special.  Found the breakfast to be relatively tasteless and at the same time, pretty unhealthy feeling.  That said, good environment and a fun place to go with a group of 4-8 people - especially when a game is on.  Not sure that I would plan to go back here, but at the same time wouldn't go out of my way to avoid it.
author: Jeff A.

description:
Bar time on a sunday, um of course!
Came in to have a couple cocktails. bartender Zach helped us out & made some suggestions...he even created some specialized items to ease our womanly cravings.

+What I craved: PALOMA: made me a specialized one w grapefruit
+What My friend #1 craved: SPICY/habanero: he creáted a martini delight
+What friend #2 ordered: SIESTA: delicious tequila cocktail, grapefruit minús the syrup, puré delight.

Fun atmoshpere, Sweet & welcoming staff, perfect for a sunday funday cocktail stop. ask for suggestions or just order something from the menu. There is also a vanilla vodka espresso drink, it sounds yucky (dislike vodka) but its a wake-me-upper & actually quite tasteful.
author: Priscilla N.

description: Awful staff. Not sure why this place ever got more than 1 star. The staff all the way from the door bouncer to the waiters are the rudest I have dealt with. The bouncer went all the way to tell us he didn't want us there.
author: Selma C.

description: Came here with my boyfriend and was greeted by a VERY rude hostess who told us it would be a minute of a wait, as we looked at a sea of empty tables. We went to the bar for a drink, as the hostess forgot about us and sat people who arrived after us. Finally we flagged a server down, who sat us. After sitting for another 20 minutes, with no one to help us, we decided to leave. Management needs to step in and see what going on. Thumbs down!!!!! Don't go to this place!
author: Mon J.

description:
I had their famous burger and it is true -- perfectly cooked, bun was great, fries were amazing (both sweet and regular.) At first, I couldn't figure out whether it is because I haven't had a burger for awhile or if I truly thought it was an awesome burger, and I know it is the latter because it was cooked well, the meat was flavorful, the bun nicely toasted. The mayo on the side for dipping was yummmmmm. Their dessert (brownie with ice cream) was really good. The three of us couldn't resist finishing it.

Service was great but our waiter scared me. He was very pleasant and appropriate when we sat down and ordered, but then I had gotten up away from my party to ask him if he could bring more olives for my friend as I had eaten hers. He said, "we don't do that, you shouldn't have done that. i will bring you some but it will not happen next time." He was deadpan serious and did not look up at me once. Then he comes over with his big fake smile the rest of the night. I was really kind of freaked out by the different attitudes he expressed. 

I don't think I'll go back there again just because I'm still so creeped out.
author: Vicki T.

description: I called and came in person to see our reserved table in advance of the Warriors - Thunder game 7. We arrived for the game and were told that the table we had been promised had been given away by the owner to his friends. So they put us a table whose only view of a TV was totally obstructed. No apology from the owner. Not impressed - if you want to come as a group I would suggest going elsewhere. The Manager did give us a free round of drinks - hence the star
author: Christian E.

description:
Very Poor Service. Small, overpriced portions.
The staff on this place is rude. They took more than 20 minutes to offer us our drinks after having given us a table. Waittress didn't smile a lot, brought water with ice when we specifically asked her with no ice, refused to heat my bread when I ordered bread to eat with my pasta, and the portions were small and overpriced. The "chicen breast" they offer with the pasta carbonara were just tiny bits of chicken. Wouldn't recommend it and won't be coming back. The place has a very bad vibe too.
author: Javier R.

description: Love Brixton! Love the owners! Fabulous food, energetic atmosphere, great drinks always have a great time!
author: Elisabeth R.

description:
BEST SPOT ON UNION! I have to say, the Brixton is one of my favorite places in the city. I live in cow hollow and this is the spot to be...on any given night, or day.

For brunch, i'm a sucker for the breakfast burrito with chorizo. And maybe a bloody or 2.  Dinner, the chicken is amazing! I also love to start with the onion dip and homemade chips. Be careful. highly addictive. The prezel knots are amazing too.

They have great happy hour prices too. Theres a late night happy hour that starts at 10 PM. Wine and salad  or burger and beer specials for $15 i think. Its awesome. 

Great vibes, good music, lounge like, beautiful space, creative drink menus and great service! 

My recommendation: stop by for dinner...and then stay for a drink.... then get brunch the next day. :)
author: Heather H.

description: So we're here right now and it's great and all! The music is wonderful! Which leads me to my one issue with The Brixton (and my friends agree).... there is NO dance floor! Like WTF?! (They just started playing Where Are You Now and we are freaking out). All I can complain about is the fact that they play the best dance music and no place to dance besides our seats/where we are standing! In our humble opinion (all four of us), we think the front area by the windows should be cleared of all tables, and turned into the most epic dance floor. Nothing required. The music is already good, the booze is reasonably priced, and the hangover brunch is to die for. All we want is a proper dance floor to flail about.
author: Ellen M.

description: I've been here twice so far, once for a drink with a girlfriend and encountered some of the douchy-est patrons I've ever met, so I waited to write a review until I could come back.  The cocktails were decent but suuuuuuper sweet, so would probably stick to wine or beer next time.  The pretzel knots were fabulous and the other food my friend's ordered looked good (entree salads & the burger).  Very average place but in a good location to wander into when hanging out on Union St.
author: Raina D.

description: Average everything. Oil soaking fries and really small burger patty...music's good though..lotta rock
author: Frederico E.

description:
Their crab cakes are really good! I only go for the crab cakes, I wish they were a little bit bigger not a sharing portion. still delicious!

great for groups, i love sitting outside and soaking in the sun with a glass of wine!
author: Kiran J.

description:
I've been here for brunch twice and I'd definitely recommend it. Portions are pretty big, food is tasty, and this is one of the only brunch places in the area that takes reservations!

I really liked the French toast (stuffed with bananas and nutella, topped with Crispix cereal) as well as the carnitas hash and 3-egg scramble. The 1/2 and 1/2 French fries (sweet potato and regular) are a delicious side if you like your fries thin & crispy. 

The interior is mostly dark wood with a rock music theme, and I imagine the bar gets pretty busy in the evening. It's a nice place to bring friends from out of town, as you can get a reservation easily and stroll around the neighborhood after.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Brixton can be many things; a bar to see and be seen, a place to get a nice dinner, or a fun place for brunch. I recently came here for a birthday brunch celebration with a group of 10 or so, and the atmosphere is great. I had a 3 egg scramble with mushrooms, fontina, and bacon, and although tasty, was left a little disappointed with how small the scramble was. It's also too bad these guys don't have bottomless mimosas; $9 for a mimosa and $45 for a bottle of champagne was more than expected. I'll give these guys 4 stars instead of 3 because it's a lively place, with ample seating and arm space, and the food was actually pretty good.
author: Thomas D.

description: Sat down with friends tonight for a bite after drinks out front. After ordering dinner they informed us that our table was reserved and they needed us to move. Literally asked us to get up mid dinner..  Indeed the hostess saying you need to get up during dinner. Ha ha. Ridiculous. The manager came over yet had nothing compelling to add. This place is for kids and run by kids. Thanks for declaring your colors. Cheers.
author: Greg C.

description:
I went to the Brixton at 7:45 on a Saturday evening and the place was SO LOUD. It's an awesome spot to go day drinking, but it can get quite loud for dinner. Regardless we had Moscow Mules and they were delicious (although, no copper mug for us). Drinks a bit pricey at $11 a drink but the beers are around $6. The burger was really good and the fries came in a mini fryer basket. 

Then I came here on a Wednesday for Happy Hour and it felt like a different restaurant. We went with the Spinach Dip which was a bit too gourmet for me. I think it was the owner who came around and gave us a free stir fry...which was excellent!

Overall - The Brixton is a great spot that you should go to!
author: Ryan E.

description: Enjoyed a wonderful salad and basil gimlet for lunch at a sidewalk table.....  My friend had the vegan burger and really enjoyed it as well.  Awesome way to spend our birthdays!!
author: Jody G.

description:
Cool spot.  We landed here randomly after no one else would seat a party of 7 on a Saturday night. Service was great, drinks fantastic and the food was delicious.

Decordated in Punk Rock sheik (if that's even a thing) complete with Shepard Fariey wallpaper. Nice touch!

I reccomend reservations for The Brixton.
author: Brandon P.

description:
I met a friend here for brunch. Made reservations the day before for 1pm and requested an outside table. 

We arrive - table was not ready and so we waited at the bar. 20 minutes later - the table was ready. Not sure if it was worth making the reservation... 

Honestly, that wouldn't have been a big deal. We are excited to get food, my friend's fried chicken looked amazing. I started eating mine and find not 1, not 2, but 3 really short dark hairs in my potatoes. The waitress was sweet, apologized, and didn't charge me for the plate of food... but, totally killed the experience. 
Would not come back here.
author: Ev w.

description:
My first adventure into the Marina. I enjoyed it for brunch, but I think I probably would have been overwhelmed by anything that might happen after the 7pm hour. 

Brixton is big, and they have some (limited) outdoor seating. The brunch food was good--I had some demon eggs (with crab! and bacon!) which was pretty delicious. I also had some kind of omelette--but now I can't remember what... which I guess doesn't say much for their omelette.

The Bloody Mary's were pretty good though, and so was the coffee. 

Would recommend pairing your brunch visit to the Brixton with a walk down to the water. Lovely.
author: Allison S.

description:
We popped in here for Sunday brunch yesterday and had a pretty delicious meal.  We split some sort of bread to start that can best be described as a slice of sturdy bread pudding.  It was quite good and the three of us devoured it.  I had the hash, which was very good but did not sit well with me (and I have an iron stomach) - so immediate enjoyment was high; long-term was low.  Our waiter was nice and attentive; the decor was chic and attractive.  Crowd was young and good looking.  So why not four or five stars.  First, a definite half star deduction because the music (which was good) was insanely loud.  We literally had to yell and fake our way through conversations and we were just three people.  A slight decrease would've made all the difference.  But then, hey, maybe they want to create a natural cut-off mechanism for anyone over 30.

The second and serious deduction (almost bumped it to a two star rating) is for the busboy service.  I found three things totally unacceptable: first, when the busboy grabbed our bread plates before the entrees arrived, he picked up the plates and dumped the silverware off of them on to the table.  I'd never seen that nifty move before; really classy.  Second, as we were finishing up, he came over, said not a word and nabbed our bottle of water.  A good "f*ck you!" from him would've verbalized his actions.  Third, we were seated along the wall and I was facing out able to see the entire restaurant.  I was surprised to watch the buser setting up a table because he dumped the silverware onto the chair so carelessly that he had to stop it from going to the floor.  I thought, "there's no way he'll put that on the tables," but sadly, I was wrong.  I know there is nothing unsanitary about silverware that sets on a chair used by a bunch of unrelated people, but it wasn't a very appealing thing to watch and wonder if that's what happened with my silverware.  It was especially unappealing because I had to clean my bench seat before sitting because it looked like a 2-year-old had just finished up brunch on it when we were sat.

Anyhoo, I've never had a complaint about the bus service at a restaurant.  I think busboys have a really tough job with little thanks and always with a great attitude.  But watching the two busers at The Brixton convinced me that they might not all be so well trained for their job.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Great place for cocktails and meeting up with friends. The drinks are well made - the manhattan is my favorite, but they also have a great beer selection (both draft and bottles). The bartenders are pretty quick and do a great job of managing the crowded hordes of thirsty patrons attacking the bar. 

The food is so-so and pretty hit or miss. I've had the tacos, which were pretty bad bland and less than spectacular. On the other end, the tuna salad and the chicken are pretty good. The Tuna is seared perfectly and they give you a healthy portion. I'd say other than the burger, the chicken is their best dish. It is incredibly well cooked and well priced.

Waitress service is a bit hit or miss as well. I've had a few instances of lack of attention from the staff once you are sat at the table.

Overall, prices are a bit high for what you get, but the scenery is pretty good and it s a great place to grab a drink.
author: Justin O.

description:
Solid brunch in the Marina/Cow Hollow area.

The interior is absolutely fascinating, be we skipped on that and sat outside to savor the sunny day and people watch. Munch and watch if you will.

The brunch menu is comprehensive enough to satisfy any post-drunken appetite, from custom omelettes to gourmet sandwiches (I had the French Dip with regular fries, delish).

Most of all, the drinks here are top-notch. Great collection of cocktails, wines, and beer on tap. Nothing like a couple of shock-tops on a sunny afternoon. I'm getting thirsty just thinking about it.

I will be coming here again.
author: Nick A.

description:
Came here for brunch on Memorial day. They were obviously understaffed and heard one of the servers talking about it. Saw two customers storm out because they had been sitting and hadn't seen anyone come by to take drink orders or anything for awhile. Well we gave them the benefit of the doubt and sat. We REALLY wanted sweet potato fries, but they were out, BOO!

The server seemed anxious and wayyy too busy. We ordered the "demon eggs" and spinach dip for appetizers. The demon eggs were NOTHING special, supposedly there is crab in them? The spinach dip was good but comes with way too salty way too hard bread. 

My boyfriend got eggs benedict florentine with hashbrown (the square kind you just buy from the store). He said it was nothing special. I ordered the chicken avocado salad sandwich, pretty yummy I must say. Probably the best food of our meal. All in all, it was definitely "meh"
author: Sara K.

description:
1) really nice ambiance / decor.  very clean :)  came here for the superbowl.  we were at bar none before, which was grimy.

2) they sell arrogant bastard soooo that's freaking awesome.

3) food looks really expensive, but portions are huge!  i got the burger, which was $14, but the burger itself was pretty big, and it came with a side of salad or fries (i chose sweet potato fries) so i couldn't finish it!  if the service was faster, i would have asked for more of their aioli sauce, but it was hard to flag someone down!

someone had ordered the nachos at the table next to us, and they looked heavenly!!  piled incredibly high.  no wonder it was a $13 plate!  seemed well worth it, though i didn't try it.

4) service was incredibly slow... it was superbowl sunday, though.  it was kind of annoying because one of the servers was watching the game next to our booth and kept slamming his fist on the booth when he got excited, which shook our booth.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I gave this place 2 tries, sadly it's just the little restaurant that couldn't. 

On my first visit I ordered the spinach salad and cup of clam chowder for take out. It wasn't until I got back to my office that I realized they had forgotten the bread I had requested with my soup. What good is clam chowder if you can't dip a warm baguette into it? I went back and the hostess was super friendly, giving me a large portion of bread to go. The salad was good, a decent amount of spinach, probably the only thing on the menu actually worth the price. 

On my second visit, I dropped in and placed an order to go for the potato leek soup with the bartender. He charged me $9.00 for a bowl, I made the ridiculous assumption that it would be a large portion. Upon getting back to my office, I pulled out a plastic container with the same portioning of a cup of soup. The soup was an unappealing beige color, kinda like when you cut up potatoes and let them sit out for a few hours. There was no trace of any 'leek' in the soup what so ever. It was pureed into a runny mush and then topped with some green parsley. $9.00 for a super small cup of brown mush... and to top things off, the bartender forgot about me sitting right there and carried on his conversations with other staff. 10 minutes to pour some mush into a container? Never again Brixton. 

GROSSLY overpriced for some seriously SUB PAR food. There are some great restaurants in the area, no reason to even give this place another thought. 

I am giving it a few stars for a great décor and ambience; the fireplace at the front with the large windows is super cozy. If I didn't feel so ripped off from my previous orders, I might have given this place a go just for drinks.
author: Carlynn A.

description:
After a day at the Exploratorium with my wife, brother and sister inlaw and their 3 daughters, we hopped over the the Marina area and were trying to find someplace that could take a party our size and quickly because we were near meltdown mode. Well it was about 6pm on a Tuesday and the Brixton was pretty quiet. We walked in and asked if they had 2 high chairs and a kids memo. They came up big! The adults enjoyed some great gastro pub eats with a tasty cold adult beverage the girls all enjoyed the great kid friendly options. 

Great Job Brixton you saved the day!
author: Joshua M.

description: Horrible service, waiter messed up at least 5 times for a group of 5 of us. Toast was cold. Avoid.
author: Russell S.

description: Came by for brunch with a group a month back. The food was good but nothing super special. What I did like is that the place is huge. It has so much space for big groups. And when the weather is nice, they open up the panel walls, which lets in lots of light/sunshine.
author: Rowena L.

description: Went here for their half price wine Wednesdays & happy hour. The good part about Brixton is the actual space and the staff. The food, however, is terrible. If you order their 'caesar salad' don't expect if to be a caesar. It's actually a salty vinaigrette with bacon bits. Sounds good, but it's gross. Also gross is their flatbread pizza. It tasted like a cheap, frozen pizza. And it was cold. Ordered fries and got what must have been the last of them. Aside from the service, it was a terrible experience. We won't be coming back anytime soon.
author: C W.

description:
Stopped in on a Wednesday night.  Cool spot for drinks, especially the peach martini.  Ambiance was decent, lots of late 20's/early 30's, who were there to grab drinks after work.  For the price, seen better but for the Marina/Cow Hollow area ok. No one super sexy..

Terrible food.  Too much salt and grease, even if hungry and drunk.
author: Malia A.

description:
Main problem I had with this place is the price. Very high for what you get. And I came during Dine Out week. Actually, I did the quick math on the dinner menu for that and it was silly because it came out to the same price if you ordered a la carte.

The 50/50 fries are ok, nothing bad but nothing memorable. The pretzels were great with that fresh soft and crispy texture and the dip was flavorful. The deviled eggs were ok as an appetizer, again, nothing memorable.

Environment is extremely loud. This couple with the high price knocked two stars off for me.
author: John N.

description:
Brixton succeeds in the very narrow niche of a chill bar to meet up with friends for a quick drink or to watch a game.  While I give them credit for upping the food selection from purely bar food, most of the offerings have been mediocre. Additionally the mid day menu is limited to apps and salads with the burger being the only entree. 
    It's on my short list of places to meet up with friends until we decide on a final locale.
author: Mark N.

description: The worst racist experience of my entire life...after spending over $400 with the worst service ever. I was approached by a waitress asking if I'm from another country because the $40 tip was on the low side and essentially the waitress had to pay for me to sit at the table.  No lazy ass, I'm not poor or ignorant and I know the customs of your land. I was born and raised here although that shouldn't make a difference. I just paid $400 to sit at the table, not the waitress.  I'm  not paying extra for bad service or you being a racist. So offended, unbelievable. Taking my yellow money elsewhere.
author: Linda Y.

description: What's up bro!  Personally, I like a table outside on the street - it's entertaining when the drunk people walk by at night and greet you.  Hard to get a drink but that's cool bro!  We're in the Marina!  I had brunch here after a half marathon and it wasn't bad at all - I'd go again.  Lots of space inside to sit at a table if you want to do that. I don't have much cleavage, so it's kind of hard to get a cocktail bro!
author: Charles C.

description:
Foods is whatever - average bar food. How does a restaraunt attract the crowd it does, though? I can't blame Brixton for the people who frequent their establishment, but they must cater to them in some way to keep the same crowd coming back.

The crowd is...douchebag central (at least on a Saturday night)! Chics with the worst combination of insecurity, overcompensating by sending judging glares at every woman who walks by that threatens them. Insecure guys desperately looking for validation with one-night stands. 

I don't mean to sound bitter, people, and I hope a second visit proves me wrong. If you're looking for quality food, enjoyable conversation and relaxing ambiance, you would probably have a better experience at Extreme Pizza...
author: SanFran F.

description:
This review is for their delicious ahi tuna salad. It was a generous portion of perfectly seared fresh ahi atop a mound of mixed greens, edamame, seaweed and cherry tomatoes drizzled with a delcious miso dressing. Loved it. 

We sat outside on a nice sunny day and perched for prime people watching which is a lot of fun. Service was super friendly and the Strawberry Don Royale was a refreshing treat that complimented my salad nicely. The drink was a little small for my tastes, but the mix of tequila, champange and strawberries is always a home run in my book. 

I'd go here again in a heartbeat to bask inthe sun and eat a seemigly healthy and yummy salad!
author: Stacy T.

description:
Great drinks and good food. I'm usually not a huge fan of the American cuisine (i.e. burgers) but this place takes it to the next level without hurting the pocketbook.

Try their Strawberry Don Royale cocktail if you like the sound of puree strawberries in your drink. ;)
author: Keika L.

description:
Just finished dinner with 4 friends. Consensus is the food is pretty sucky. We had the steak, half chicken, pot roast, and a fried chicken salad. Bland  and a little off all the way around.
With all the good restaurants on this street, do yourself a favor a skip Brixton. 
They're trying a little too hard with the faux rock n roll pub theme too. Just sayin...
author: Jon D.

description:
Good food and generous portions at a reasonable price. The staff is friendly and the service is fairly quick. 
  
I took one star off for the disgusting Marina frat trash that gathers there on weekend evenings to drink, scream, watch baseball, etc. and makes the place feel a bit noisy and chaotic but hey - if it helps Brixton stay in business, make more money and do well, while serving food, all the more power to them.
author: Arkady I.

description:
Is this an improvement over Left at Albuquerque? Yes, but naming themselves after the legendary London music venue (http://www.yelp.co.uk/biz/o2-academy-brixton-london) just makes me slanted and disenchanted. Outside of some rock and roll prints on the wall, the atmosphere is not much better than a Hard Rock, perhaps because the place is more interested in being a sports bar than dedicated to music in any form. 

I'm getting mad just writing this, I mean I don't think they even have live music here (please correct me if I am wrong). It kinda reminds me of Bullitt (http://www.yelp.com/biz/bullitt-san-francisco?q=nish) on Polk Street, another bar that has taken something epic like Steve McQueen (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p-y1VUdnQXo) without any real homage or respect. 

As for the food, it's relatively uninspired, but works for basic grub. Definitely a plus that it's kid-friendly (but that also goes to demonstrate the identity crisis going on here). I'd say the closest the menu gets to anything British is with the Demoned Eggs, but otherwise it's a hodgepodge of Marina blandness.

After three different visits, my next Brixton experience would/should rather be here: http://www.o2academybrixton.co.uk/. Musically translated, our local Brixton is more Rebecca Black than Black Francis (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xbcdi5FhNG0).
author: Nish N.

description: Excellent vibe & spark plugs were delicious
author: Alex B.

description: Came here with some friends for lunch. Had the ranch burger because it sounded delicious. When I got the burger I devoured it. It wasn't until looking back at the menu that I realized it didn't have any of the cheese or other goodies promised. It was literally bread lettuce tomato and meat. Since I had finished the entire thing I couldn't exactly say anything but I was pretty mad about it. I should have gone to ROAM down the street.
author: Mike T.

description: Fun atmosphere for drinking, go elsewhere if you want a bomb brunch. My breakfast burrito was pretty good, bf's scramble not so much - their hash browns were frozen Mickey-Ds like. If you want to keep the clubbin dance party going, come here, they blast top 40s-ish and electronic stuff during all times. Being that they adorn music posters all over (they have a large space) that is just their thing I suppose. I think I'll only come back for late-night drinks.
author: Stella H.

description: This was the first place we went to in San Francisco & we had a great time. It's located in a good area with lots of shopping around in walking distance. There is indoor or outdoor seating available. The service was very friendly, & the host was very cute! We ordered drinks & a burger & they were delicious. This place is a good bet if your a tourist wanting to try something local. :-)
author: S G.

description:
Nestled between the world renowned Perry's and the 'Hollywoodized' Umami lies The Brixton, and I'm going to put this relative newcomer to the 'burger guru' test and just ordered their burger with Swiss and a side of their highly touted fries.  It's a great looking and well designed restaurant and saloon.  The designer deserves mucho gratitude for crisp, clean, sexy style and class with a French Door look out to Union Street with four well spaced and placed tables outside.  Walls the color of used brick with a wood slat and Tim ceiling, nice hardwood floors, a fireplace and the back wall covered in a handsome black and white print, and vintage rock and roll posters with a 'U' shaped bar in the center.  Three deep, luxurious booths beckon guests toward the back of the room, and a 16 stool bar height Island acts as another space divider.
I've been pointed toward the really comfy bar to get my between lunch and dinner burger fix and I'm a happy camper looking out all the windows and not long after ordering out comes a white oval platter with a beautiful open face burger, a three hole condiment container and a 4th with some house made pickle slices.  The show stopper on the plate is a small stainless French fry basket overflowing with fresh, hot fries.  Presentation is a scholarship winner and now let's talk burger.  The bun is fresh, lightly toasted, brushed gently with Olive Oil touched with a hint of garlic.  The excellent grass fed beef is cooked perfectly, the high quality Swiss is a melted blanket of goodness and I was bowled over by the Balsamic grilled onions, what a brilliant discovery.  Good lettuce and thinly sliced, chilled fresh tomato and a handful of housemade pickle chips conspired together to make this one of the best burgers I've enjoyed in recent years.  If you're opening a restaurant, pub or Gastro Pub, heed the details and focus to perfection going on at The Brixton.  The staff are totally chill too, this is a great place.
author: Stu S.

description: The pretzels were ok and the pizza flat bread was tasty but oily. Not my favorite food option in the neighborhood.
author: Elliot H.

description:
Service at this place was 110% lacking for a Saturday brunch with 10+ friends. We waited over an hour for the waitress to take our order. We probably weren't clear that we were ready to order, but she never checked in. And instead of apologizing she flat out told us that she was busy with other tables and they were short-staffed. Fine. I get it. But don't make up excuses, even if they are true... just apologize and rush our food. We're hungover and starving!

It took a while for food too. This place is super cute and I would definitely come back for drinks, probably not dinner, and maybe give brunch another try. My french dip with sweet potato fries was decent. Friends got all types of eggs, which they loved, and some even got the monte christo which is more of a heart attack than should be legal to serve... but still looked delicious none-the-less.

One thing: why is Chris Martin on the back of all of the menus? I like all the other decor and cool posters and the Obey wallpaper, but Coldplay on the menus... what?
author: christine c.

description:
I really like the over all vibe of this place.  Open space, high ceiling and plenty ops for people watching.  It doesn't feel so "marina" (where all your white jocks seem to crowd all the time), which was a big plus.  They were showing sports on TV the night we came but people were nicely dressed up.

Had dinner here with a friend.  Our server was really nice despite of the mistakes he made.  I ordered their special, the angus steak.  He forgot my sweet potato fries and when it came, he gave me regular fries instead.  He was apologetic, so no biggie, and he took care of it.  For the check, I needed to ask for the pen, wth? It was funny I thought...

I liked my meat.  I always have it well done and our server suggested medium rare.  I agreed and I'm glad for the decision.  I know how I like my meat from now on.  Portions are good too.  My plate was clean - I definitely enjoyed my meal.

We skipped on desserts.  Next time I'm here I'll make sure to check it out.

Also, I can see this place as a good party choice for any special occasion.
author: Pam S.

description: I do not usually write reviews on the restaurants that I go on the regular basis but Brixton impressed me quiet a bit. I love their Benedict, burger, and the TUNA SALAD! Honestly, the tuna is not always in the freshest condition but most of time it's great. The reason I'm writing the review is because I went there a couple fridays ago, and as a local, I knew Brixton would be super busy on a weekend night. However, I was very impressed with the service I received from my waitress, Brigit, and the busboy, Jose. They were so busy running around all night long, yet they did a great job checking in and making sure my friend and I were well taken care of. We never needed to wait long to order another round of drinks/food or stressing not able to locate the servers when we need her. Thumbs up!
author: Jenn M.

description:
I would say solid 3 stars.  I like the location, ambiance, and decoration.  We came here on a whim one Saturday for lunch.  Luckily, it wasn't crowded.  So we were seated right away.  I saw some other families here, so I thought it wasn't too bad of a family venue.  I was confirmed that it wasn't all that family friendly... or maybe not family familiar.  I should've just been thankful that they have high chairs.

Our waitress took awhile to get to us, which I personally didn't like.  She didn't introduce herself.  We ordered when we got the chance, because I wasn't sure when she'd be back.  She didn't know if the sweet potato fries had any breading in it.  We ordered them anyways and hoped for no gluten.  I'm still not quite sure, but I thought this was something that as a waitress she should've known in case of allergies.  

I ordered a chicken salad, which was alright.  They were trying to be creative with quinoa, which I think would've worked if everything wasn't so cold.  I was hoping that the chicken would be off the grill since this was a nice establishment.  But I think it came straight from the fridge, which I personally didn't like since it looks like leftover chicken.  The quinoa also could've been cooked awhile back.  I liked my husband's ahi salad better since I knew that one had to be cold.  Maybe I just chose wrong.

The blond waitress didn't come to check on us very much.  One redeeming quality about the staff was the one dirty blond guy w/ blue eyes who seemed to be hanging out w/ the staff, but I think he works there because he was helping the other servers move chairs around.  He noticed that we had a toddler, and he gave our boy some crayons to keep busy.  I know I can't expect every restaurant to be child-friendly, but if you've got crayons... just give them out!  I think the hostess and the waitress both just weren't familiar on what to do with a kid.  So I'm very thankful for this one guy, whom I think the management should promote as he seemed kind-hearted and observant of the guests.  When you're a parent of a toddler (even they're pretty awesome toddler), it's great if someone can help to keep the toddler occupied while eating.  It leaves a great impression on the parents that the servers and management care.
author: Kaela H.

description:
Ambiance is nice here. I like the set up of this place. Happy hour friendly, big bar, lots of seating and standing room. The booths and lower tables are by the wall away from the bigger area so that's nice. They have tall tables and stools closer by the bar area. 

I love the Obey wallpaper on the back wall, haha. 

The food! Went with my boyfriend and his mom. We got the ribs, ahi tuna salad, burger, artichoke dip and 1/2 & 1/2 sweet potato fries & regular fries. The dip for the fries was crack. Kept dipping & dipping & dipping...

The artichoke dip was good too. We were able to share it among 3 people. It usually comes with toasted baguettes but we requested untoasted baguettes. 

My boyfriend requested blue cheese for his burger. The cheese was pretty potent lol. Burger is a good size and comes with 3 dipping sauces for you to choose from. The ribs fell off the bone and it was served with a squash puree. My salad was pretty big although I would have liked a couple more pieces of seared tuna. It was a lot of salad to eat and I didn't end up finishing it & but I was still hungry.

Free soda refills

Stays relatively busy all night long, even after happy hour. 

Good location. Lots of shopping on the street
author: Jessica L.

description: The Brixton has a very "Marina" vibe but I can't help but like it. I've enjoyed tequila cocktails here on several occasions and the appetizers are great too. Crab cakes = 2 thumbs up. My favorite thing is the outdoor seating where you can people-watch on Union.
author: Paige D.

description:
We came fairly early for happy hour on a Friday and immediately scored seats at the bar. They had basketball playing on all TVs.

* The atmosphere was laid back.
* The warm onion dip was really good.
* The happy hour wine list was diverse.
* The bartender was knowledgeable and attentive.

I will be back to try more food and wine. Their full wine list was one of the best I've seen in town; they have a lot of local wineries represented!
author: Kristin F.

description: Excellent for brunch: highly recommend the crab Benedict and the carnitas hash. Very good for lunch and dinner as well: the burger is well above average, and the fried chicken salad is delicious. Good scene and the service is usually very solid. Nice selection of drinks (cocktails, wine and beer). Recommend reservations for brunch, but if you can't get seated at a table the bar isn't a bad bet.
author: Elliott Z.

description:
Fellow Yelper and dental student Painless W. and I took a long lunch break a few weeks ago and headed down to The Brixton for what we hoped would be a hopping marina power lunch scene: Junior Leaguers planning a fundraiser, thirty-something lawyers and finance guys brokering deals, and a few others sprinkled in. Well we were wrong as the restaurant was mostly empty, save a few tables of tourists. Oh well. 

But, the food was actually fantastic. We split their flatbread pizza to start. For my main I went with the warm spinach salad with chicken. Both of these dishes were quite tasty and well-portioned. Painless had another salad that looked excellent as well. We both spent probably $25 on lunch, but were in agreement that the food was good and we'd eat there again, even if the midtown-Manhattan atmosphere we were hoping for was lacking.
author: Jonathan G.

description: Food? Not very good. Drinks? Good. Atmosphere? Fun. Packed? Yes. Came here on a Saturday night around 8:30pm to grab pre-drinks before dinner right around the corner at Umami. It's trendy, fun, and very Marina. Lots of bros everywhere. It was a little challenging to get a drink because the bar was packed, but nonetheless, it was a fun spot to start the night out at. Just keep in mind you'll be waiting for awhile to order a drink and then finally get your credit card back. I like this place though because it's well-located right on Union Street around lots of restaurants and bars and it's easy to go there first.
author: Priya G.

description: Had the Prather Ranch burger, and whether it was the way they cooked it, or the fact that it's from grass fed beef, it was delicio-so-good! Juicy & tender, the balsalmic red onions, avocoado, and bleu cheese compliments it well and I regret not getting the fried egg which probably would have pushed the review to 5 stars - Fries were just so so and TVs were blocked by columns throughout the bar which made for more crowd than football watching.
author: David K.

description:
When I lived in Cow Hollow, Left at Albuquerque was where The Brixton now stands. It's a huge space in prime real estate so I'm not surprised that it didn't last. The Brixton may have a better shot if they play their cards right. Although their current three-star review doesn't look too promising. 

I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed my meal here. We started out with the pretzel bread which came with cheese and mustard dipping sauce. Soft, chewy dough + sauce = YUM. As a slightly healthier option I went with the Cesar salad and onion soup for my main meal. The salad was fresh, well dressed and had crumbled croutons mixed throughout. I added the shredded chicken on top which was a nice bonus. The onion soup was a little too sweet for my liking but good nonetheless. 

I can totally see The Brixton being a great spot for the Marina crowd to party in at night. It could be a great space for dancing and mingling.
author: Julia N.

description: They did not let us sit at 4-people table because we were only 2.  It does not make sense when I see many other couples sitting at 4-people table.  I did not appreciate the way they treat people.  When I went back there 10 minute later, one lady was sitting at the 4-people table which I was declined to sit.   I am not sure what I did wrong, but I do not like restaurants who discriminate customers for whatever the reasons.
author: Integrus I.

description:
Wow this place looked so promising with the impressive dark wood paneling, high ceilings, and crowd during a late Sunday brunch. I ordered a cappucinno which tasted like something my office coffee machine could make. The greasy flatbread on my lox flatbread dish came out barely even lukewarm and there was just too many dollops of creme fraiche. The ingredients weren't very fresh and I just felt ripped off paying $25 for my meal. I felt gross after eating it and had to get a juice from the juice shop on union to get rid of the greasiness settling in my stomach. 

Demoned eggs were tasty but nothing special.

I might be back to check out their drinks, but I won't be back for the food.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I've come here twice now, once for brunch, once for dinner. This place is grossly overpriced for subpar food. I hate to say it, but I could do better winging it in my own kitchen.

For brunch, I ordered my staple: chicken apple sausage with hash browns, toast, and eggs. Nothing stand out here, but really, nothing that you could screw up either. I will say that the hash browns resembled those served at McDonald's; they came in patty form.

For dinner, we started with their spinach artichoke dip, which my whole party thought tasted like canned soup - watery and lacking in flavor. As my entree, I tried their angel hair with tomatoes, mushrooms, spinach and chicken. I can't put my finger on what was off, but there seemed to be a trace of wine which did not mesh well with the dish. I also had a bite of my friend's fiery mac and cheese, which was overpowered by the taste of pickled jalapeños.

Other than the food, 90s music was blaring through the speakers. Nearly impossible to hold a conversation... I guess that's to be expected in the Marina.
author: Tina A.

description: So the food was great and the drinks were awesome but the people that work here are rude and unprofessional. Our waiter Chianne gave us dirty looks the entire time and picked up our dishes and drinks before we were done with them. She was passive aggressive and rude. I wanted to like this place but it's SF, there is always somewhere else.
author: Maria W.

description:
Definitely better than I anticipated, and my friend Anthony wasn't even working that night to beef up the experience. The experience, however, was pleasant. FOH was pretty and very nice.

I went with a girlfriend from work, but we looked around and noticed a ton of possible online dating dates around us, the lighting is good for that. They have a really well-balanced decor, manly dark wood furnishings, and feminine paisley print wallpaper and upholstery. If something could be done about the acoustics, the place would be perfect. It got quite loud at times, when people would get to talking excitedly.

The bar was hopping, in case anyone wanted to get their date sauced. 

We had a smorgasbord of yumminess, from combo sweet potato fries, french onion something or other-not soup, veggie pasta (which was so full of flavor!), and chicken salad. Aside from the cheesy french-onion app, we tried to keep it healthy. 

Next time, bringing a handful of friends so we can family-style it up with other and more items to try. Humphry Slocumbe's ice cream is one of them!
author: eVa J.

description:
To my everlasting shame, I have been a Yelp freeloader for many a year. You know, a user that benefits from a myriad of reviews, everywhere from where I get my haircut to where I get my suit tailored.

My experience at the Brixton has marked a change for me, a paradigm shift... perhaps as a result of a new lunar year, but my experience at the Brixton is forcing this Yelp freeloader, into the throngs of reviews.

To put it succinctly, don't frequent this place if you want a meal. I've read the reviews, been privy to friends who have had similar experiences, and the one thing we can all agree upon is the service is horrendous. 

So, if the food was amazing, waiting 45 minutes or even an hour may be worth it. Yet, this isn't a French Laundry or an El Bulli. The Brixton was half vacant, with most patrons there for drinks. It took us 20 minutes to even place our order (after flagging down our waitress), which was 10 minutes after our reservation time (showed up 15 minutes early to our Opentable reservation). 

The good: the drinks pair well with the atmosphere (Shepard Fairey wallpaper).

The Bad: Expect an hour before you get your food, which is not horribly good or horribly bad.

The Ugly: The wait staff were unapologetic about the food being late. It seems this is the norm at this joint.
author: Manny G.

description: Another stop on the Marina bar hopping tour my friend and I decided to embark on one Saturday evening.  We ordered drinks and enjoyed some demoned eggs and fries.  I thought my basil gimlet drink was pretty refreshing, and my friend seemed to really like her blue cheese stuffed olive martini.  We definitely did some people watching and were amused by some of the crazy behavior of the crowd there.  I could see myself back here if in the area again.
author: Pam S.

description:
Came here for dinner for someone's birthday with a group of 12 back in March. Drinks were delicious. I had their signature cocktail, the Brixton blueberry lemonade. I like tarty things, so this was the perfect drink for me. 

For entrees, I shared the hangar steak and the crisped pork confit. The beef was cooked to my liking--medium rare, but it wasn't anything amazing. The pork didn't stay true to it's name--it was very much like pulled pork (shredded) and it wasn't even crisped. The beans were pretty delicious though but that's the only positive thing I can say about that dish. 

I tried someone's fiery mac and cheese and it was incredible. If they offered that as a main dish, that would probably be a winner. It had a good spicy kick and I was tempted to steal that dish and devour it. Too bad I didn't order it myself.

The service was good. Our waitress was on top of it, considering there were 12 of us. Good company, young crowd, loud, and a good place to socialize. Too bad the food kinda lacks, but I'll go for drinks.
author: Victoria B.

description:
I was pretty excited to check this place out. I've heard good things from friends who spent some time there over the weekend, etc. 

Getting a reservation made it sound like it was the latest hot spot (nothing available between 6:30 and 9:45...on a Tuesday). When I showed up, the restaurant was 80% open, with the exception of a few small tables and one 8-person group. Nonetheless...we waited 5 minutes for someone to great us and then another 5 before she could find a table to seat us at. 

But alas...we are seated. Certainly someone will greet us here, bring us water, ask us if we'd like something to drink or an appetizer. But  no...not for some time. However, this gave me plenty of time to read over their mediocre menu. It looks like they've got some staple high quality bar food and their burger looked pretty good...sweet potato fries smelled pretty good...but still, no one ever came up to greet us. I even waived at 2 servers who each assured me someone would "be right with us." 

15...now 20 minutes go by. The table next to us has 2 attractive girls sitting at us while one employee (who later turned out to be the owner) went on and hit on them completely ignoring the couple sitting next to the girls he's trying to get a piece of ass from. 

The table on the other side is seated and within seconds...a waitress arrives with a smile and a menu, asking for drink orders. 

That was it...I was out of here. Approached the employee at the hostess table on my way out. When I asked him he worked there (just for confirmation) he cockily smirked and said, "I'm one of the owners." 

I understand the growing pains that a new restaurant will go through, but this was ridiculous. Don't think I'll rush back to The Brixton any time soon.
author: Frank S.

description:
I stopped in for a quick drink during a 7x7 bourbon event.  It was nearly impossible to navigate to the bar to get a drink but luckily my gf and I met someone who knew someone and they got our drinks poured ASAP.  

The space is pretty and I would come back to check it out on a regular night for some food.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
Not only is the food terrible, but the restaurant was so loud I couldn't even hear myself chew the awful salad that I ordered. I do NOT recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a decent meal or ambiance. The décor is trying to appeal to the yuppy cow hollow crowd, but is not conducive to speaking with other humans at the table...which might be precisely their point. 

Either way- bad food, bad ambiance, bad service. Go to Perry's instead!
author: William H.

description:
If your goal is to go hang out in an overly-loud, extremely crowded bar full of vapid Marina types and wait for an indeterminate time for a table that may or may not be available and eat what I've heard is some pretty average food*, this place is for you.  

If, however, your goal is to sit down, enjoy some good English pub food and *ahem* English beers, perhaps people watch, then I wouldn't bother.  

(*Why don't I know about the food? After checking in 15 minutes after the hostess's original estimate of a half hour, we were told they were holding FOUR TABLES for reservations and it was a HALF AN HOUR AFTER THEY WERE SUPPOSED TO SHOW UP.  I don't think so  This is San Francisco, people, there are good waitstaff /hostesses EVERYWHERE.  Locate some, and hire them).
author: Jennifer A.

description:
I like the ambiance here a lot! The food is fine - what you would typically find after 10 p.m. (I've only ever had their late night eats.)

I went for a drink last night and have to say I was highly disappointed. Their peach martini is more like a lemon martini. I didn't taste any peach :( I've had their blueberry lemonade before though and that is very tasty. My friend ordered the chicken and heirloom tomato salad and it looked amazing. She said it was really delicious. If I ever go for dinner I will definitely be getting that salad!
author: Jeanette L.

description:
The Brixton and I have a pretty dysfunctional relationship. Let's face it, Brixton - I'm not that good to you, yet you keep having me back and giving me the best cucumber basil gimlet of my life. I talk trash about the pretentiousness of your decor and the homogeneity of your crowd, yet I return every time, without fail, when I find myself in the marina and in need of an in-between-stops drink.

The people here are generally pretty. The bartenders are pretty cool (except for that one blonde chick whose pour is stingy and pout is cold). The drinks are probably pricier than they should be but it looks like some thought was put into the menu. All in all, I gotta say - i.like.you. 

But don't make me say it again.
author: Joanne S.

description:
A friend of mine and I walked in around 7pm on a saturday night, and were able to get a table so that we could grab a few appetizers and drinks. The atmosphere is odd. Almost as if the Brixton is contemplating whether to be a frat bar or nice restaurant. This place really runs the gamut! There were girls half naked that were questionably 21, standing around the bar (which was by our table) drunk beyond belief. Then a minute later a little boy was walking around our table (maybe 2?) 

Anyway, we ordered drinks, which were good. I stuck with wine, my staple. And shared the meatballs and artichoke dip. The meatballs were delicious, but the artichoke dip left much to be desired.
author: Kristin N.

description:
I went in with high expectations hoping that there was a new spot to eat on Union.  There is!  Though, you might not eat there twice.

Had lunch with my girlfriend at 1:30pm on a Tuesday.  We were one of only 8 tables eating so, the kitchen staff was not stressed.  

I ordered the Brixton Burger, no onions, medium rare.  I received a well done Burger with a very burnt bun and onions.  My girlfriend ordered a tuna melt and compared it to a catfood - was over-cooked and slathered with yellow mustard.

They asked how our meal was and we told them and to their credit, they comped the food.  The staff was very nice.  I feel though that I have to give this place a one because unless they do something about their kitchen, this place cannot last.  There are lots of  other places to drink heavily in Cow Hollow.  I would hate to think that this is The Brixton's only purpose.
author: Steven R.

description:
Hit this place earlier this evening and at 7:30PM on a Friday night, this place was a jumpin'!  So happy to see that they were able to turn the old Left at Albuquerque into something special.  In it's previous incarnation, I often used to joke that I was probably the only one in there that had actually ever been to Albuquerque.  I remember how one night, after returning from a business trip to New Mexico, I had come straight here, just for the amusement factor.

Anyway, didn't have anything to eat this time, but this place was packed so I could only tolerate it for one drink.  Honestly, this place has the absolute worst acoustics of any bar or restaurant I have ever been to in San Francisco.  Hello...ever hear of acoustic sound deadening?  Yikes...it was so loud and all the echos made the place into an acoustic nightmare.  In all sincerity, I really thought it sounded like an aviary.  I love birds, but that was not a compliment.  I soon found myself leaving in search of a place that was quieter and less in the moment.

I did like this place a lot and believe that it definitely has potential for a five star review, but I'll hold back for now until I actually try the food and have a few more drinks in there.  Curious to see how it is as the newness wears off a little.  Regardless, this is currently one happening place and I saw happy people in there.  The bulk of the crowd this evening was young, but there were some older people too.

Also, for an upscale place, I felt that the single, cheap paper towel dispenser in the bathroom looked out of place.
