That unit was also poorly placed and bothered me almost as much as the too short faucet which inevitably caused your freshly washed hands to touch the dirty far end of the sink in the men's room.  A little Monk here, but still a real issue when washing one's hands.

Regardless, so happy to see that despite the dismal economy, places like this are still opening and Union St is slowing finding it's rightful place again as a fun, upscale destination for nightlife.
author: Roy N.

description: Cool spot! Used to be left at alberqurque (or however u spell that!!). Nice vibe here. Not the usual Marina crowd, at least not this night, it was filled with Santas!! Santa Con was in full effect. We got a table, no problem, and the peach martini was to die for. Great 80's music on the speakers. Alcoholic beverages in both my hands. It was a good night!
author: Michelle I.

description: Visited for lunch when shopping on Union street.   Underwhelmed - ordered salad with corn-meal fried chicken and it was very oily.  Salad was tasteless, needed more dressing and some seasonings.   My companion had the chicken avocado sandwich and he said it was average.  Fries were decent.  Service was fine.
author: Greg B.

description:
On a search for the perfect restaurant on Union Street. Ya know - good food, cool vibe, moderate prices, trendy atmosphere?  We found it at The Brixton.

I got the Kobe Sirloin.  It was delicious. Cooked just right, quality meat, and perfectly tender.  My friends got the burger which they were equally satisfied with.  

We also ordered the the 'demoned' eggs.  They forgot to bring them out, so brought them out after our meal.  A bit dissappointing but they were yummy!
author: Kelsey S.

description:
I've been coming to Brixton since I moved to the Marina 5 years ago. It's a go-to spot, always busy, with lots of locals and bridge n' tunnel folk alike. 

Perhaps they think they can rest on their laurels and reputation among the Marina-going crowd. Well, they can't. 

The manager - I believe his name is Anthony - is an utter failure. This is the 3rd time I've personally experienced the disdain he has for paying customers 

I ordered a drink and politely asked the bartender to please put on the Warriors game (local basketball team instead of what WAS on - the BUFFALO BILLS and MIAMI DOLPHINS on a Thursday night in San Francisco...) and he said he would twice but didn't. Finally he told me his manager wouldn't allow it. So I asked the manager (Anthony, I think). He told me they would put the Warriors game on after the football game was over. He told me the football game was "almost over" (there were 8 minutes left in the 4th quarter of an NFL game....) and pointed ambiguously at random guys in the restaurant saying "uh he wanted it on" when the guys he pointed at weren't looking at the TV in the slightest. In fact, NO ONE was looking at the TV, which is why I thought it would be no big deal to change the channel. 

After the manager (again, Anthony, I think) refused to turn the channel, I informed him that my party would likely need to go somewhere else as our plan was to watch the Warriors game. He cockily shrugged his shoulders and said something to the effect of "fine by me" as if our business didn't matter to him. 

Clearly, he did not wish to change the channel because it was "his bar" and the wishes of a paying customer were secondary to his ego.

Eventually, he cowered and relinquished and turned the Warriors game on (there were still 3 minutes left in the football game, so clearly he was lying about the need to keep it on). But that was after he had already embarrassed himself by trying to be a tough guy and exert his *authority* as manager. It was brazenly obvious that he simply didn't want to do something because he was asked to do it. 

Pretty pathetic operation. I would encourage people to check out Stock n Trade or Lightening or even Brickyard - really anywhere else - than continuing to encourage the type of "customer comes second" approach this place takes.
author: Jeff T.

description: In particular, the Brandade (codfish) croquettes with lemon aioli - so good as an appetizer we ordered a second portion.  They're about gumball size, I think they may be rolled in Panko (very light), and may have had just a touch of cheese in them, so they don't cool quickly.  There are both pan roasted and dry roasted mussels - a generous portion each and I had boned (and defatted) short ribs over pappardelle - perfectly al dente - with just a touch of carrots and kale. The salad Lyonnaise with ham hock, frisée, coddled egg, etc. looked great.  Dandy desserts, extremely well done.  Attentive, informal, seamless and very unobtrusive service.  I would give the experience 5 stars!
author: George D.

description: Great Bar! Awesome Staff! Best Closing Time French Bread Pizza Ever. Will definitely be back for more debauchery.
author: Craig F.

description:
Can't comment on the food, have only been here for the bar.

Large, spacious and cool urban luxury design. I liked the large open windows which let in a lot of light. Marina crowd, but a little older and more refined, less undergrad crowd, more grad school crowd if that makes sense. And small but cool beer selection.
author: Binh D.

description:
Come here for: Nice vibe, awesome Shepard Fairey wallpaper, great convenient location on Union, great drinks and dips
Could do without: main entrees, pretty hit or miss and mediocre at best

Sipped On:
Ketel Vodka Cucumber Basil Gimlet- refreshing
Peach Martini- Belvedere vodka and peach puree
Strawberry Don Royale- tequila, mint and strawberry puree
Rising Sun- Silver tequila, pineapple, lemon
Blue Cheese Stuffed Olive Martini

Munched On:
French Onion Dip- carmelized onions, cream cheese, aioli, parmesan, served w/kettle chips....MMM this was seriously good and devoured in seconds, so good that I made mental note of the ingredients to impress in future dinner parties..
Flatbread Pizza- good
Fried Chicken Salad- good
Fries- thin and crispy just how I like them
Fettucini- very bland, in need of more sauce, flavor, spice, something anything!! not recommended
Pork Confit- not bad, have definitely had better more flavorful and tender pork medallions..

Guilty Pleasures: 
Pana-cotta w/Strawberries- creamy and not too sweet, yummm
Chocolate Devil's Food Cake w/Cream Cheese Topping- I've had better...
author: Mahsa K.

description:
We have not been on a very good restaurant streak lately. The other night was a miserable meal at Ristorante Milano, we walked into Cafe Des Amis...the place reeking of bleach had us walking out and today we had lunch at The Brixton. What a mess.

If you haven't been, be prepared for a shriek-fest. All hard surfaces, huge volume and parallel walls means you have to scream across your table to be heard. Our waitress told us she lost her voice after working here three days. The loudest restaurant I've ever been to with the sole exception of the auditory hell that is Chez Papa at Mint Plaza. In the front of the restaurant is a large open area near the door. I believe it's open because the door offers a torrent of cold air which serves to keep the customers a bit iced. I was chilly the entire time I was there. As far as additional ambiance, I couldn't figure out if the place wanted to be Hard Rock Cafe or a sports bar. What it really was was a place for the Marina crowd to come and be *really happy* and show it. Lots and lots of shrieking girls. 

Now...the food. My burger was a generic burger with generic stuff. One bright spot was the sweet potato fries. Unfortunately they were so thin in the frigid air they got cold quickly and were...uhh...sub-optimal. The two gals at the table next to us were seated some time after we were but were served before us. I guess that speaks to service. 

All in all, this place is a mess. I'm sure it's fine if you're a twenty-something in the Marina and want a place to come to be noticed. If you're hoping for a decent meal run as far and fast as you can from here.

What is going on with restaurants in SF lately? The bar has really fallen.
author: Gary C.

description:
We went for brunch on mothers day and it was somewhat crowded. We were seated after our initial reservation time but once we were seated the wait staff was attentive. The breakfast burrito was good but it could have used a side. Other people at our table got the French toast which was good and someone else got their burger which came with a lot of yummy toppings like bacon, blue cheese and avocado. 


The garlic fries and the pretzel knots are good too. The mimosas are good, just small and there is no way to get a pitcher of them for the table. I was a bit pricey for what you got but it is a gastropub so your mileage may vary.
author: David S.

description:
I'm surprised with the mixed reviews... as my experience was top notch.

I can see why people would think the clientele is a bit douchey (we are in the Marina, after all) and that the place gets loud (there are a lot of people there) but I think that kind of comes with the territory of being a trendy new hipster gastro-pub like it is.

We made reservations on Open Table so there was no wait.  The decor is sleek and subtle.  I actually like how they pay homage to London's Brixton without being OBVIOUS and kitschy.

The staff wasn't amazing but they knew their stuff and had great friendly recommendations.

The drinks were more than decent... with the Cucumber Gimlet being the standout of our group.  There were always people at the bar on this Friday night... and the crowd grew as the evening went on.

The FOOD was a lot better than I had anticipated.  They aren't trying to reinvent anything... just doing it right.  They  have lots of tasty appetizers that are good to share.  The short ribs (evening special), the pork entree, and the dutch apple pie (and various flavors of ice cream) were my highlights.  I'm curious about their weekend brunch.

We left this neighborhood gem satisfied and content.  What else were you expecting?
author: Miss Bonnie B.

description:
We went here for Saturday Brunch.

The most obvious feature was that 80% of the clientele were young single women, most unaccompanied by young single men.

An excellent and varied brunch menu, well cooked and presented. Pleasant waiters and not expensive for Union St. Main egg dishes $12, a glass of Chardonnay $8.

The best Brunch we've had in a while.
author: John M.

description:
First of all, I want to give a "shout-out" to Jeff G. (below), for this awesome comment:

"Seems like most of the negative reviews have to do with the so called 'd-bags' in the neighborhood, too funny.  Guess you should hang out in the hipster haight? or take a bullet in the mission?  I mean sorry, too bad you can't clone yourself so you can find people you are comfortable hanging around?"

Since Jeff only has 3 reviews, I fear his opinion may otherwise linger in the abyss of the Yelp Algorithm. 

Since I am most likely one of those "d-bags", I assure you my low review is not related to the patrons of this place. Basically, the food isn't very good. The staff is nice. They did a pretty good remodel (although I think they could have upped it just a notch - it's on the verge of being posh, but never quite gets there).

Also, I miss L@A, despite it being one of the most hated places on Union.
author: Scott W.

description:
The Brixton...an interesting choice of names to attract the gentile Cow Hollow crowd.   Do they even know where Brixton is?  London's answer to Southie Boston and NY Bronx, something named "The Brixton" would be better placed in the T-Loin.  Noted as the cannibis capital of London, the locale of a McD's murder, the Brixton Bombing, the Brixton riots, and even a nod from Monty Python, something doesn't quite add up. 

Likewise, the ambiance at the Brixton is lacking.  Like it is out of touch with its own identity.  On a torrential stormy afternoon, I walked into a collage of wet umbrellas in the hallway.  As I rustled the rain out of my hair, I was greeted by a Stepford smile and vacant stare.  

Pause.

Pause.

"Hi!  Um, there's two of us??"  

"OK, where would you like to sit?," smiled Hostess Barbie.  OK, she was very nice, I'll admit.  Just out-of-it.

The choice of seats was a difficult one, as there were several equally tempting options.  The short bar tables near the window, the tall bar tables on the side, the bar itself, or the sexy leather banquettes- big enough to seat 6.  

The banquettes, it was.  Why not?  It was too early to be crowded, so we weren't wasting precious space for four more.  

Like her hostess counterpart, Waitress Barbie was equally vacant.  And, yes, it's Waitress Barbie, not Server Barbie - that would be way too PC.  This is brash, bawdy Brixton anyway, not the mild-mannered Marina.  Isn't it??  Waitress Barbie was very sweet, but I cannot recall hearing more than one sentence from her in the 2 1/2 hours I warmed the banquette.  And she was never rude, and always attentive enough...just out-of-it.  

Now, I can only write of the ambiance, not the food, as I opted for the liquid grape diet on this day.  And that did not disappoint.

I scanned the room to see if maybe I was just being picky.  Everyone appeared to be having a good time.  The bar was just busy enough to be fun, but not overcrowded.  The short bar seats were scattered with a few couples here and there.  The banquette next to us was filled with a party of 6, hushed but enjoying themselves.  Maybe The Brixton was meant to be an evening affair, not a happy hour one.  

I don't know what it was .  It reminded me of many an LA lounge - trendy,  beautiful, manicured, yet flat and one-dimensional.  Perhaps taking itself too seriously.  Or not taking itself at all.  And maybe that's the issue I have with it :  to be named after Brixton - so steeped in soul and history - I would expect the same of the restaurant.  So, I was left unfulfilled, underwhelmed.

As I strolled out of The Brixton, three Barbies graced the hostess stand.  In unison, they turned and smiled that gleaming Stepford smile.

"Bye! Thank you!," they chimed, adding their best pageant wave.

I touched my arm to make sure it hadn't turned to polyethylene, and turned to my guest to make sure he hadn't changed his name to "Ken". 

Now, my point is not to slam The Brixton.  There are a lot of nice elements going on in there.  They just don't quite come together for me.  That being said, It is certainly worth checking out, and I will go back there to at least try the food and test the ambiance at a later hour.   

I fished my umbrella from the pyramid, and exited The Brixton. The rainstorm waged on, and I was, for once, glad for it. 'Cause now I was out-of-it.   But the rain was real.  I closed my umbrella and let the cold droplets bring me back to life.
author: Monique B.

description:
Yum yum yum. The best deviled egg I have ever had. It was topped with crab, some sort of bacon pieces and seasoned perfectly with lemon. I am soup person but not really a fan of clam chowder but everyone kept raving so I decided to try it. Delicious. Creamy, well seasoned, not to chunky not too thin soup. I am a convert, I like Clam Chowder. I saw shrimp cocktail going around and thought, eh always the same. Wrong again, the sauce stepped this up to an amazing appetizer with hints of sriracha in it. Yum. To top off the eating night we finished with ice cream that was specially made for Brixton. I think it was a bourbon, ginger snap vanilla goodness mixture. I am going to say it was the best ice cream I have ever had, no joke. I think the chef got in my head and made exactly what I wanted.  I can't wait to go back to try the French Dip, the brunch menu, and anything else on the menu. 

The bar is great, with casually framed posters and pictures perched on the wall. I love the crackle detailing on the ceiling and all the lighting. The long high pub table near the bar is great. This is a great location not only to eat but to lounge and hang at the bar. 

I think I found my new spot.
author: Jessica G.

description:
The interior space is hip & cool, but seems a little unfinished and cold.  I'm sure that doesn't matter very much when it's packed with hotties cocktailing it up, but the space doesn't hold up to daylight very well.

We went for a late lunch on a Saturday.  It was between the lunch and dinner hour, and the spot we wanted (Rose's Cafe) wasn't open.  We were greeted promptly, and seated fairly quickly.  Our server was initially friendly.  The menu seemed a little strange: all soups & salads with some dip and a burger, but we were starving and pretty easy to please at that point.  

Our food took too long, but not by much, and why quibble with a brand new restaurant?  The burgers were fine, but one was medium and the other well-done.  Both had been ordered mid-rare.  The hunger factor over-rode any will to get this fixed, and we didn't see anyone in time, anyway.  The dip that we ordered to share (spinach and artichoke) arrived after our entrees, and basically tasted like cheese.  The romaine salad with chicken & green goddess dressing might have been the best thing to eat on the table, but wasn't special enough to warrant a return trip.

Where we ran in to a problem was with paying the bill.  We asked to have it split three ways, and one of us had cash (o.k. I had cash).  Not only was our server unwilling to do this, suggesting that I just give each of my dining companions $20 (my third of the meal would have been $26+tip, not $40), when I asked her to please split it three ways, and offered to do the math, she just took the cash and cards and walked away.  She returned with the wrong amount on each of the cards and NO change.  The money isn't such a big deal among friends, but it just seemed stupid, in this day and age of POS systems, that you can't or won't split a check.  We gave up on trying to get her to make it right and just left.

I won't be back, and I won't send friends.  I'm sure they won't miss me, as it's not really my demographic, but they might want to consider some training around basic arithmetic, and they really should consider some training around courtesy.
author: Lisa R.

description:
I live nearby and always wanted to go in when I walked by. I finally had lunch there today. I am not impressed. I had miso wild ahi tuna salad. The tuna is good. But the salad is way too salty that I couldn't even finish it. I had a strawberry food cake for dessert. It's okay. 

I might come back for a drink, but not for food.
author: Julia H.

description: I loooove this place! Such a great vibe, that is if you like the Marina. I do! Hipsters seem to be at war with the Marina, but there are some really nice places here, and this is for sure one of them! The food is wonderful. You can sit down and have some drinks, with some upscale appetizers. We had the pretzel twists. I wasn't a fan of that, but the boys sure liked it. For my meal, I think what I had was a special because it's not on the menu anymore. It was braised beef with sweet potato/squash puree. It was amazing. But I like their salads too.
author: Queen B.

description:
I am a born and raised Cow Hollow girl, so needless to say I have seen it grow and develop into the "scene" everyone loves to hate; myself included. That said, I definitely walked into The Brixton already judging it. Here's what I think...

Pros:
-Decor
-French Onion Dip appetizer: I loved it! Actually liked it more than my main dish. They serve it with homemade potato chips and the dip itself is rich and flavorful with different types of cheese and caramelized onions
-Our waiter was nice and down to earth

Cons:
-SCENE to the max! Even on a Monday night. A lot of "bro" language, and a guy who came in wearing sunglasses at 8pm at night...I'll stop there
-My skirt steak was a little over cooked and the creamed kale was more like kale with warm milk poured over it. My friend had the 1/2 chicken though and that was really good! Both my friends got different chicken and I liked theirs better than my steak 
-I got there on time for my reservation but because my friends were late I couldn't be seated, and the place wasn't even packed! I get it, it might just be a policy thing and I won't blame the hostess. But instead of having me wait in the walkway she could have just seated me. There were plenty of open tables for walk-ins, and I had a reservation.

2 star review because an appetizer shouldn't be more memorable than the entrée.
author: Shirin M.

description:
How can you not love them when they serve two of my favorite wine by the glass; Turley and Seghesio!

Great day here on Saturday! Service was great and sweet potato fries hit the spot! 

Happy Girl!
author: Kelly B.

description:
Stopped in here on Saturday night.
1) the design: dumb. HUGE floorplan, tiny U shaped bar... FAIL -1
2) the music: horrible/way too loud -1
3) the service. cute bartender. loved to chat with her co-workers. messed up my drinks (maybe she couldnt hear what i ordered? (see #2)), then couldnt even remember what i ordered to charge me -1
4) the product: WORST manhattan EVER -1

overall: F'n lame azz place. Stay the hell away!
author: MJ R.

description: I loved the space and environment at The Brixton. There was inside or outside seating, great for big groups, and no brunch line. The food was OK, nothing special.
author: Cherise K.

description:
I need to preface this review with the fact that I feel slightly bad about giving only a one star review.  Here is the deal; I work in the industry and had just gotten off work the Wednesday before thanksgiving and had some buddies hanging out there so I went to join them.  There were two men behind the bar one blonde guy (I never got his name), the bartender, he was amazing.  He was happy to make me a couple drinks and talk to me about the menu even thought the kitchen was closed.  Then there was Anthony the manager. Also AMAZING.  We talked about how we were from the same area and chatted a minute.  Really great guys.  Thats why I feel bad about giving one star. 

I had a couple drinks but my friends had quite a few and our tab was pretty high.  I noticed my friends getting pretty wasted and I requested the bill.  Turns out Anthony took care of it for us.  That was one of the nicest things and I in no way expected it.  So I slipped $30 to the bartender for taking are of us.  Right after that the owner, Hugo, who was wasted and smelled of booze was extremely rude to me.  Lets not forget that I was sober.  Well by this point I had had 2 drinks and was relaxing after work.  He made some slurring comments I couldn't make out.  I asked him to please let go of my shoulder.  At this point he asked me to leave.  I turned to tell my friends we were leaving when he mentioned that they were staying.  

I have always hated being in the Marina not entirely sure of why.  Well this is it.  I think it is absolutely inappropriate that he grabbed my shoulder as I sat quietly at the bar.  But I think it is even more inappropriate that he was so drunk.
author: Jessica C.

description: Thought the space was hot. And the happy hour tacos delicious. But, the food otherwise was...watery. Bad flavors. Overpriced. Not good. Go for the wallpaper, not the food.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Pretty good, standard fare from a typical marina restaurant. Overall not bad, but not outstanding. It was virtually empty on a weekday during lunch. Most of the group ordered the pulled pork sandwich, which looked good. I ordered the ahi salad, which was good, but as good as any ahi salad I've had. 

I would come back if I were in the area, but wouldn't make it a point to go out of my way.
author: Leily P.

description: We sat outside on a cold night but with the heaters it was quite nice, good service too. As for the food I found the 1/2 chicken to be a bit dry and I think it could have used a brining or something to make it tastier but the sauce that came on the plate helped a bit. We also had a steak that I liked a bit more than the chicken but it wasn't anything super special. I will say that they have good beers and I appreciate that they don't overcharge for the food quite as much as others in the area so I'll round up my 3.5 and say 4 stars for Brixton.
author: Christopher Steven O.

description:
I stopped by for lunch today.  The Brixton is brimming with great vibe, sexiness, some terrific libations and wonderful service.  The decor is plush.  I had a wonderful and generous Ahi tuna with Japanese seaweed salad.

I will be back for the Pisco Mule cocktail!  Oh, and they have outside seating on nice days!!!
author: Angela N.

description: Still probably my favorite bar in the city. Love the atmosphere. It pretty large considering most of the bars and restaurants in San Francisco. Even has a little patio area. Drinks are made well and the snack food is good.
author: Robert F.

description:
I think Brixton is fabulous! So happy to see some new cool spots popping up in the Marina and on Union. Brixton is hip and a twist on a modern rock bar with dark wood booths, a great bar and really tasty food.

I went Friday night after the Warriors game and it was already PACKED. We got a table for 6 immediately (unheard of at a new crowded place in the Marina). We got some drinks off the drink menu to start. I highly reccomend the peach martini and the whiskey/raspberry drink. You can tell whoever made the drink menu is a true mixologist. Original ingrediants yet very strong!

We shared the French onion dip, artichoke dip, pizza, fried chicken salad and pretzel bread. I thought everything was really tasty and reasonably priced. I highly reccomend the fried chicken salad (you can tell the chicken is brined and fried)- the meat is nice and juicy and all the salad ingrediants are fresh.

I also loved the artichoke dip and the pretzel bread (think biscuits). They come with a delicious cheese dip that I couldnt help dipping my fries in- I am a total sauce girl. 

The highlight was however, the dessert. They serve Humphrey Slocombe ice cream and if you've never tried it you absolutely need to. This isn't ordinary ice cream, and the owner informed us that Humphrey Slocombe made Brixton their very own flavor. 

Definitely check this spot out whether its for drinks and apps or a stop on your Marina bar crawl at night time. You won't be disappointed.
author: Sarah A.

description: I went once when they first opened and the recently after a show. Been pretty mellow both times and I think it's because I've avoided the weekends. Had a snack of Pretzel knots with an interesting cheese dip and  Pisco Mule. Mostly employees from  various other establishments in the area drinking and they were rocking "For Whom The Bell Tolls" on the soundsystem. Interesting mix of things from something in Cow Hollow.
author: Kim N.

description:
Recently stopped in for lunch and to watch the Giants game and was happily greeted with a friendly crowd and great food. Its refreshing to see the actual owners of Brixton working there,serving guests, making drinks, seating reservations and clearing tables. I originally thought this place was just a bar but realized they have a great menu and outdoor seating to boot!

The menu was diverse and the food was fresh and the Tuna Salad was huge, you have to try the MEATBALL appetizer. Overall this is one friendly place on Union St with a good mix of drinks and food. What really was great was a enthusiastic Giants crowd rooting on the home team and the owners, the one I met was very welcoming and genuinely wanted to provide a above avg. experience! Thanks!
author: Sam B.

description:
I ordered the: GRILLED AMERICAN KOBE LIFTER STEAK SALAD $15
Marinated in cilantro, chilies, and lime & served with warm fingerling potato salad, green beans, bacon, & our crème fraîche-whole grain mustard.(Copy and Pasted from website)

It was absolutely amazing. Not sure where I'd categorize it but it doesn't seem fit under Salads. I ordered my steak medium-rare and it was perfect, nicely marinated and tender. The green beans were delicious as well! Mimosas weren't bad either. Definitely will be back.
author: Kate J.

description:
Wow, I was really surprised when I tried their flat bread pizza and it was actually really good! It's definitely big enough for two people to share. We also liked the skinny sweet potato fries. The salads served around us looked plentiful and fresh and the presentation looked nice. Our waiter was very attentive and nice.

The main reason you come to the Brixton is probably for drinks and atmosphere, which are both good. It's the perfect place for dinner with a friend or to drink on the weekends with a group when it is more crowded.
author: Jenna Q.

description:
Came here for brunch with my family and enjoyed it. Came back to have dinner on Monday night. Place was empty . Took forevery to get our food. But the staff was good.  Had a to go order: steak and French fries.
When we got home ten minutes later the French fries were so soggy from the steak they had to be thrown away. So we paid a lot of money for a filet Mignon and got meat and nothing else, stupid move. Packaging the fries separately would have save the meal and the low mark.
author: Cari H.

description:
Probably not representing the average Brixton crowd, but we had a great time and a great dinner the other night.  What started out as a small family dinner quickly grew into a group of 16, with 6 kids (ages 3 - 12), my 90 year old aunt, a diabetic, several visitors from Humboldt and a NY uncle.  So we were pretty much covering the dining spectrum.

The notes say the Brixton isn't good for kids, but I'd disagree.  We went early (5:30 pm) and maybe it gets a little louder and rougher at night, but they had a pretty good if standard kids menu (pizza, pasta, homemade chicken tenders) and even my picky eaters liked it.  If you have kids, you know that you like some noise in your restaurants so that your kids don't bother the other diners.  This more than worked for that need.

Across the table we had a number of good dishes. The half chicken was well prepared, the fried chicken salad was good (maybe a little heavy on the dressing), the short ribs were very tender, soup was delicious, etc.  The wine and beer list was extensive, the prices were pretty reasonable and the service was really outstanding.  And the hostess on the phone was super nice and accommodating as our reservation time and then numbers kept changing -- on a Saturday night even.  Of course, it's Union Street so don't drive.  Especially don't drive an XL SUV like we do unless you want to look for parking for an hour.
author: Todd F.

description:
I think I've died and gone to rock dining heaven!

We headed over here on a Thursday afternoon for a business lunch.  For a group of four we wet our palates on the French Onion dip with a side of home made potato chips and the Spinach Artichoke dip with crostini.  If you like French Onion soup, you'll love the cheesy French Onion Dip.  Both appetizers arrived in these tiny cast iron pots, to keep each dish warm and both ooey and gooey (that's right, I did say 'ooey and gooey').

I ordered the roasted chicken salad with the dressing on the side.  I know what you're thinking..."Boring".  But, it was quite the opposite.  This was the all inclusive salad, especially if you're looking to get in your protein.  It was topped with shredded roasted chicken breast, quinoa, beets which tasted like they were marinated in a vinaigrette overnight, all over a bed of sonoma greens.  My counterparts ordered burgers and fries and such, I was not jealous.  I would brave the Marina/Cow Hollow parking, just to come back and have this salad again!

Did I mention that the venue is outfitted in Fillmore, early rock era posters!  If your luck to secure a booth, the tops are high for extra privacy.

If I wasn't on a business lunch, I'd tell you about the drinks.

Oh, well.  Until next time Brixton!  I hope you stay around for a long time!
author: Rochelle D.

description:
Its more around 3.5 stars, but I went up because it hit the spot, the wait was not too long, and the service was great. Good spot for brunch with plenty of shops to browse while waiting for a table!

I had the fried chicken eggs benedict: It was good, but nothing I would run back for. My boyfriend's dish was delicious.
author: Ashley W.

description:
Love this place!

Upon arriving we were warmly greeted by the hostess. She sat us down and offered us the evening's drink options. 

On with the yummies--

I normally never eat shrimp but for some reason I decided to try their shrimp with cocktail dressing, it was perfectly blanch!

Clam chowder served in little miniature espresso cups. I absolutely loved the presentation on this as well as the taste :)

Devils egg with topped off with fresh crab meat - who friggin knew crab would compliment devils egg so well?!

Lastly, Service was impeccable! Our waiter,  i forgot his name but he was Indian or something(:x dont be mad if i got it wrong)... he's so funny! He was very on point

Will definitely return :)
author: linda L.

description:
The ahi tuna salad was fantastic, the wine was tasty if not just a hair over priced.  Based on the friendly service, the good food, the wine, the open space that makes you think you are drinking in the suburbs, and the fact that they are open all day so you start your happy hour at 2 pm on a Friday and stay through the evening, I have to give 5 stars to this great addition to Union St...although it is a terrible idea as I sit here with a horrible hangover typing this review on Saturday morning...
I have no one to blame but myself, and The Brixton.
author: Nilu r.

description:
The Brixton is suffering from an identity crisis -- is it a bar or is it a restaurant?  I'll help out -- it's a bar -- or at least it was last Saturday when I decided to try it out for dinner.  The drinks were great and the crowd was lively.  Unfortunately, it was so loud that our waitress couldn't even hear us order.  

And the food...sigh...definitely meh.  The gnocchi was rubbery and tasteless.  The roasted chicken salad was just a heap of romaine lettuce.  The best thing we had was the deviled eggs and onion rings.  In other words, just order bar food.

The Brixton has potential.  It just needs to grow up and accept itself for what it is -- a bar.
author: Robyn P.

description: Great food, amazing drinks and fun ambiance in the marina? What else could you ask for? Our "go to" spot any day of the week and has never let us down! I recommend the breakfast sandwich and pizzas.
author: Sameer K.

description:
Enjoyed the spinach-artichoke dip.  Pisco mule was tasty cocktail.

However I was upset that they 'could not' remove the OPTIONAL San Francisco health care tax.  I pay 100% for my own healthcare and do not ask for subsidies from anyone else.  Every other restaurant I've eaten in in San Francisco has removed it when asked (which is the law).

Stand up for your freedom and the law and ask that they remove it from your bill (or ask that they pay for part of your healthcare!).

OK, I'm off my soap box now.
author: Jefferson L.

description: Had an early dinner here the other night with a girlfriend. We sat outside because we had a dog. It was nice out there with the heat lamps on even though it was super foggy out. The food was delicious. We shared the shishito peppers, the fried chicken salad, and the burger. Everything was really yummy and to top it off, we happened to go on the night that all bottles of wine are half off! Service was a little slow but very friendly. Definitely worth checking out if you've never been :)
author: Anna K.

description:
I went here on a Saturday night for a birthday party. The atmosphere was fun, and music was good unlike the service.The group ordered appetizers, took around 40 minutes  plus longer for the actual entres to come out.

Most of the people at the table got the Burger, which i should have done, they were actually good. Do NOT get the ribs unless you are expecting some sort of stew-like mess. It was awful. I had a few bites of the steak, it had a nice flavor, but the meat was so chewy.  There are better places to eat at the Marina, just come for drinks.
author: Elena B.

description:
Sometimes you pick a place for brunch because it's been highly reviewed. Other times because a dining companion really wants to go. And then there are those special times when your favorite DJ group Above & Beyond are here. One of their biggest 2010 shows was at London's Brixton Academy, and well, coming here the day of the show felt like the most appropriate way to celebrate..

Above & Beyond @ London's Brixton Academy: Five stars http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z95QfHbZI5g

French toast & house granola @ San Francisco's Brixon: Two stars.

To be fair, it was their first weekend serving brunch so things might improve. So far, not impressed. Good but not good enough. The french toast is described as being topped with bananas, which it was, but four slices. Maybe five. House granola was good, but for $8, disappointed fruit was not included.

I would imagine dinner will be better, and I'll definitely give them another shot. It's a cool, expansive space, lots of life and Brixton Academy concert art. Maybe we'll be back when Above & Beyond come back. After moments like:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aZ_Ua450TDI
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x8SGfQy2lV4

I hope it's soon. Really soon.
author: Jason B.

description: Great place to hang out with friends. Came here for dinner: cornmeal fried chicken salad and spinach-artichoke dip. Great cocktails as well. Service was generally good, though we had a hard time getting our check at the end. Gets really crowded after 10:30 with the Marina crowd.
author: J L.

description: Stopped here for a late night snack tonight. Got the tacos of the day and an heirloom watermelon salad. Both were really good. Capped it off with a couple Moscow mules. My wife wasn't crazy about the taste so she didn't drink it, but I did. Regardless the bartender noticed and he comped the drinks!  That was a great gesture. That alone is worth the extra star for great service. If I lived in the area I would definitely return.
author: Joel S.

description:
Rolled up on a Saturday night, ready for some cocktails and fun.  Nice bar, great atmosphere, not ridiculously crowded.  Easy to get a drink, good menu, great fries.  

The night we came here?  D-bags left and right, and I hate to say it- but Cougars-in-training were in attendance too.  But as my sister reminded me- we were in the Marina.  You get what you pay for.
author: Sarah F.

description:
We stumbled upon The Brixton last night.  The interior is awesome and the staff was very on point.  We didn't realize that last night was a soft opening so for a new restaurant they were really together.  I've been to many places within days of their openings and always have been disappointed by the wait and slowness.  But not this place!  We were in and out and out waitress Hana was great!  Very impressed.
  
Now on to the food.  We started with the deviled eggs and french onion dip.  Eggs were great but did not care for the dip.  Too many onions and the flavor was just okay.  We then had the crispy pork and the ahi tuna salad.  The flavor and crispiness of the pork was incredible but the side dish of beans was too much.  There were too many and it took away from the incredible pork.  The salad was amazing and I will def go back just for that!  Very light but full of so many flavors.  My new favorite!  Also, I can confidently say they have THE BEST sweet potato fries around. Cooked to perfection.
author: Megan S.

description:
My bf's sister and I share the same birthday, so for her celebration with the fam we decided to eat dinner at this spot on a friday night.

+Interior is sooo awesome! I love the wallpaper and layout.

+Food was delicious. So devine!!

- Portions are ginormous!!! I do love to eat alot... but I hate leaving a restaurant feeling like my stomach is about to pop all the buttons off my pants.  Next time I will split an entree. 

Food I tasted:

Warm french onion dip---- OMG YUM
Spinach and Artichoke dip--- Deliciously creamy and flavorful.
Sweet potato fries-- Nice and crispy
Tacos del Dia--- Small and cute. Nice little bite sized treats
Roast chicken breast salad-- Alright, seemed overly dressed
Miso Yellowfin Ahi Tuna Salad-- Delicious. Next time I need to split it!

Drinks of the night: Gin basil ricky, and looots of wine.

Conclusion: 
*Satisfied with everything I tasted
*Good place for dinner on a busy night
*Can get extremely loud when busy and have to shout at the person sitting next to you.
author: Julia D.

description: Came here on a Sunday night and it wasn't too busy. It's a cute little hangout spot. We started off with the flatbread pizza. The flatbread was crispy with a generous helping of meat over it. I had the Kobe 'Lifter' Steak. The steak was cooked well with spinach and marbled potatoes. The sprinkling of sea salt flakes was nice, added a little extra flavor. I also had a side of fiery mac & cheese. I'm not a mac & cheese fan to begin with, but I thought it was ok. It was a bit too cheesy and creamy for my taste.
author: Adelina W.

description:
Made a reservation for bunch last saturday.  They seated 2 out of 4 of us. Points for that!  Its really really annoying when places wont seat you until your entire party is there.  Wake up!  The people there will order drinks and make you more money.

The ambiance was great, I think we got there around 1:30 when the crowd was clearin.  It was pretty chill and we got a booth in the back.

Bloody Mary...great
Ahi Tuna Salad....great
hashbrowns.....awesome
Salmon pizza.....great

I can't comment on dinner, but based on the stuff we had I'm sure its decent. Good space, nice servers.  Will have to try for dinner.
author: jessica b.

description: I came to Brixton last week for a birthday dinner.  I ordered the $14 burger, given that it was one of the cheaper items on the menu.  The burger was fine, but didn't blow me away.  Service was helpful and courteous, which was especially nice given the large party size.
author: Bill H.

description: Fun atmosphere, especially on the weekends.  Wine and drinks are $$ but competitive for SF.  Food menu is so so, but again, it is the atmosphere you would go for.  Fun for after dinner drinks.
author: T L.

description:
My fav brunch spot! This place is 1 of my top 5 restaurants all around in SF so far. Only downside is it's in the Marina, but I don't hold that against the brix.. it can't help where it was born ;p
On to the foods!

I love this place! At the time of typing this I've been here 4x for brunch. The menu items I've tried, pretzels, fiery mac & cheese, monte cristo (very interesting), sticky buns, hash browns and the 1/2 & 1/2 fries are yummerz! I've also had the demoned eggs..they were alright. Could be more flavorful. 
As far as booze, the signature drinks change pretty often, so I can't tell you the names of the ones I order, BUT every one I've ordered is a winner..bloody marry & bloody maria very tasty as well :)
The type of crowd Brixton attracts is pretty decent for the marina area. And they do brunch til 4..very important for us whom like to sleep in. 

Can't wait to for for lunch or dinner some time soon. They serve til midnight! whoop whoop.
author: Brandyy S.

description:
I've been here quite a few times for drinks during the evening hours. It's a fun and spacious spot with decent cocktails and a nice sized bar. The crowd is typical Marina and a bunch of older men thrown in there. Not really my cup of tea crowd-wise, but with a group of friends this place can be alright.

I came here for lunch with a friend once and enjoyed it. I ordered the fried chicken sandwich with a mix of regular and sweet potato fries ($14). The sandwich and fries were really good, and the service was friendly and attentive. The price point for lunch was a bit higher than I expected, but I enjoyed my food nonetheless.
author: Ashley D.

description:
Great place to chill / drink on a weeknight! (and really cheap)

Came here on a Thursday night with a girl friend. We got a table without any wait / problem.

Shared two appetizers (1) flatbread pizza and (2) spinach & artichoke dip. 
***WOULD GET BOTH AGAIN!!! 

I would only recommend the flatbread pizza if you can handle a little spicy because it has various peppers on top. But both were DELICIOUS (and only $7-10/appetizer)! 

We also got couple glasses of wine to go along with it :) Staff was friendly and attentive. Given the weeknight, the place was filled, but definitely not too crowded - just perfect!
author: Sarah C.

description:
This is a very "generous" 3 stars.  It's more like a 2.5 actually but I will round up.  Here's the breakdown:

Ambience:  decent.. not over-the-top drop-dead gorgeous but it's got some nice decor.

Drinks:  Average

Food:  Average

Service:  Just plain bad.  While our waitress was friendly, the runners brought out the wrong food at first.  When our food was finally brought out (30 min later), they screwed up the order up.

Bottom line:  I might be back for the bar scene but likely won't be dining here again.  What's up with all the "average" places opening up on Union lately?  Is it really that hard to open up a GOOD restaurant?  I will stick to the Mission/Castro/Noe Valley for great food
author: Toby C.

description:
I went here for brunch this past weekend, and found it quite HAIRY!  I found a piece of hair in my butter, my brunch guest found a strand of hair lying on his french toast, and he also noticed a piece of hair in his water.

Our waitress was sort of snobby, and not "all there".  She was wearing a black tank top, which is fine, but who wants to see someone's armpits while eating breakfast... Let's just say that was the only part of the restaurant not hairy! LOL.

All jokes aside, I would not come back here again; the wait staff was not hospitable, the restaurant sanitation was lacking, and the food was sub. par.
author: Anonymous U.

description: first time there on a sunday....not that packed....sat at a table with a date and waited for a server to come by.....that never happened.....so date got up and got us drinks at the bar. Work on your service people!
author: Ricquel N.

description: We came here hungry and wanting a good meal. So as I soup lover I immediately went for the bowl of the chicken macaroni soup. It was fantastic, hot, bright, and the noodles weren't mushy like many restaurants. It was a perfect bowl of chicken noodle soup just like mom made it. We also ordered the watermelon and heirloom tomato salad which was so well done. It's flavors mixed together perfectly and was a great size. The ambience to this place was groovy, open aired, and welcoming. I loved the music posters especially the Clash one. Would definitely recommend.
author: Stella G.

description:
We stopped by for some Sunday fun-day drinks and a few little snacks (Pretzel Bites were delicious). 

We'll absolutely go back ... once the ownership changes. 

Our server was so embarrassed by his complete disregard for customers, she ended up buying our drinks. 

Hope to hear about changes at The Brixton. The food is great and the drinks are delicious.
author: Bryan T.

description: Much better places to eat on Union.  They had a limited menu when I went so I cannot comment on the full dinner menu, however it left much to be desired.  I have a $16 ahi salad that would have been great if it cost $8.  We also ordered an appetizer that was never delivered.
author: Josh P.

description:
Brixton is great!

Cool decor, good location and STIFF DRINKS most importantly.  The definition of what I'd want in a 'gastropub'.

Will be coming back often.
author: Chase N.

description: Amazing french toast and eggs benedict. Highly recommend you get a res though, it's very busy.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Went to the Brixton today and the hostess Ashley was super awesome. She was accommodating and very timely. She encouraged me to grab drinks while I waited, and as soon as the table was ready she showed us the way. Amazing restaurant & experience. Ask for Ashley!!!
author: Brandon D.

description:
Toto, I don't think we are on campus anymore!

This place is a refreshing break from the oh so typical sports bar scene of the Marina.. long awaited and much appreciated. 

The girls and I ended the night here and were not only (1) significantly outnumbered on a gender level - ALWAYS a plus - but were also impressed with the (2) service, and (3) drink quality. Can't wait to try the menu!

"Oh, Guns of Brixton"...
author: Valerie W.

description: Went here a couple of weeks ago while visiting SF (had been there once on a previous visit) and gotta say, despite the atmosphere not being completely my cup of tea (kinda preppy, although pleasant enough), these guys take their food seriously. I had a dish with mahi mahi and asparagus that might have been the best meal I had on the entire trip. Well done!
author: Paul F.

description:
I usually try to avoid the Marina crowd on late weekend nights, but since I was invited here by a friend, I thought I'd check it out. First impression? It was loud. Mind-numbingly loud. Ear-hurting loud. Can't-have-a-convo-with-anyone-unless-their-ear-is-2-inches-from-your-face-loud. But, hey, if that's the type of atmosphere you like, then this might be your type of place. It's definitely not mine...

I ordered the blue cheese olive stuffed martini which was decent and the sweet potato fries which was pretty good.  Since it was late night (and a headache was starting form from the noise), I didn't try anything else. One extra star for serving food late - not easy to find in SF.
author: Stephanie L.

description: I was there after dark, when it turns into a lounge. Very cool place, with tons of beautiful, well-dressed people. Overall, a cool stop in the marina.
author: Zach H.

description:
We went here last week with a large group (12) on a Wed night overall the food was good and the ambiance was very fun. The food didn't blow anyone away, but was solid. I had their signature burger with a side salad since my friend got the mix of regular and sweet potato fries. The burger was a correctly cooked and the patty itself was pleasantly meaty. The salad was completely overdressed to the point that the greens had wilted.  
I'd rather come here share small plates of "bar food" and drink away than come here for a good meal. Food was 2.5 stars location and ambiance was 3.5 stars. I'd totally come here for drinks though.
author: Mike K.

description:
I'm really happy with what the owners have done with this place.  The decor is amazing and they totally got rid of Left at Albuquerque interiors! I have to say - the could have softened the place a little as conversation can  be hard to hear at times.

I got the Miso Ahi Tuna Salad and it was perfect and the dressing was not heavy at all. Overall, my waitress was great and the food was great.

It is a little pretentious in there, but I guess when you are in the Marina you gotta be or why bother going........
author: Alvin M.

description: LOVE this place, and not just because I'm friends with the owner :)! Great food, amazing drinks and one of the best brunch spots in the Marina! Try a "spark plug" for a morning pick-me-up! Vanilla stoli, kahlua and esspresso - AMAZE!
author: kee h.

description:
Not gonna lie - this place blows.

If you can't tell by my reviews, I'm always out and doing social things and with groups of people.

This place is the old Left at Albuquerque. They haven't changed much on the inside, except take down some old Christmas lights.

We went in for a drink and a nosh. Mistake. Serious mistake. My friend and I ordered what was like an apple tartine with ice cream. Yeah, we couldn't physically CUT the pie/cake/creation. It was SO damn hard/stale/over cooked. It was crap. Even the ice cream was bad. The drinks were over priced. The waitressing staff was super inattentive. They even got my drink order wrong, and had some fruity girly drink with like peach or something in it, and were out of key ingredients. Really? Did you not think people would order your specialties? Did you not think to stock up?  What's a bummer is that everyone in my party was super polite, overly patient, high tipping, well dressed, and what you'd want in clientele - and all of us left feeling like it was a complete waste and like we were treated like scum of the earth. Disappointment.

For a place trying to compete with the luxury of the Matrix by having a door man....you should maybe boost your standards, not your prices.
author: Leanne D.

description: It was adorable. The food was fantastic and the server was great. Kind of noisy and hipsterish, but I enjoyed myself
author: Layse F.

description: Finally found the dictionary definition of crappy service after visiting Brixton. We literally called the Maitre D on our cell phone in order to get anybody to pay attention to us. Food is decent but not worth the torturous service.
author: Gordon G.

description:
For a place that has posters of The Kills and Pavement in the ladies room, I was horrified when someone turned off The Pixies' Caribou halfway through to play Clapton's "Lela" unplugged.  C'mon!!!!  Music was not what the place presented itself to be.

Don't think I would hang out here at night, but was an ok spot for happy hour sitting in the window.  It was also sort of lame there wasn't even a $1 discount on wine--just on well drinks and beer.
author: Che W.

description:
Went out to brunch, we had a reservation for two but ended up to be three and they seated us right away. Service was good although at the end we felt that we were rushed out and that's why it didn't get 5 stars.

We had mimosas, which were delish and then shared the monte christo sandwich and the croque madame. The first one was amazing. I am always torn between french toast or something savory for brunch and this had it all!and came with a side of french strawberries-yum! Beware though the portion was huuuge! 
The croque madame was just ok. I will defi come back for dinner and cocktails.
author: Sarita V.

description: Look the location is great, the food is pretty good and it is open late Sunday night.  For all of that it should be 4 or 5 stars.  Unfortunately service was among the worst I've been to in SF.  Our server pretty much did whatever he could attitude wise to make sure we did not want to return.  Maybe it was just not his day, maybe it was the late hour, or maybe it was because he was only server on shift, but while everything was delivered at some point, every request felt like a huge favor and this is not a way to build a bar/hospitality business.
author: Daniel Y.

description:
had an afternoon business meeting at The Brixton on a Tuesday 3pm.  We ordered a variety of starters which were all really good.  Pizza, onion dip, and 2 kinds of fries - sweet potato and parmesean.  Decor of the place is cool - and they had a good music selection which was nice beacuse it wasn't too busy.

Service was attentive and accomodating!  Reasonably priced...
author: Katy M.

description: Im in SF a fair amount and The Brixton has become a staple for me. Their menu is classic but fresh and the wine list is right up my ally. I always have friendly servers and though its usually pretty crowded Ive never had to wait too long.
author: Marcia S.

description:
Came here for Brunch one weekend. We brought the dog with us so we requested outdoor seating. it only took about 20 minutes to get seated and the hostess was kind enough to call us on our cell phone when our table was ready so we can walk around Union Street.

Let's get down to the food. Their sticky buns were a nice talk on a cinnamon roll! Served warm and definitely sticky it was the perfect starter to our brunch. I highly recommend their Carnitas Hash if you want a meaty brunch. Served with crispy potatoes and topped with a poached egg it was a great combo!

We also ordered the Ahi Tuna, which was like any other Ahi Tuna salad you'd get at another descent restaurant. No bells and whistles here, but certainly a good salad. Overall I'll definitely be coming back to the Brixton!
author: Andrew S.

description:
I am not much of a Union Street denizen,  but when I go there  I always stop at Brixton and sit at the bar.  Usually I have one glass of white wine and then I order the sweet potato fries!  Very tasty!  I eat about ONE THIRD of them, and then take the rest home for later.  The bartender ALWAYS give me a box and BRAND NEW little containers of the two sauces: ketchup and the garlic/aoli one.  This is very thoughtful,  considering that I just have one drink and a snack!  Great place!  great ambience,  especially during the day!  Considerate employees,  and delicious sweet potato fries.
Looking forward to my next rendez-vous.
author: Colleen H.

description: So, just left this place quite shocked with the service. I waked in with my husband and my mother for lunch. Seeing they have around 15 tables open, I figured we'd be able to get a table right a way. It turns out I was wrong. Obviously if I have to wait to get a table somewhere, that's not a problem. The issue was the service we got. The hostess couldn't explain why we couldn't be seated right away. There were people sitting at the bar, but as per what she said, not all of them were waiting for a table. They would certainly have had seats for everybody. Well, I'm actually nine months pregnant and wouldn't mind waiting to order my food, as long as I could sit comfortably at a table while I wait. But she would only offer us a seat at the bar, without a hint of empathy that sitting on a high chair is far from ideal for a person in my situation. We called the manager to understand what was going on. His response was that the kitchen was backed up and that they had to wait to seat people. No apology received. No empathy given. And he didn't really even care about the feedback he was receiving from return customers. Horrible service and a place I'll probably not returning soon.
author: Camila T.

description:
After reading a recent review about the Brixton I felt the need to come out of review retirement and share my experience. 

I went on a sunny Friday afternoon with my Dad and best friend. We sat right by an open window and were greatly quickly by our extremely friendly waitress. She was so friendly, in fact, my father wanted to adopt her. Sorry I have enough sisters. 

Bestie had the ahi salad that I snuck bites of. The Tuna was a little tough but the dressing and everything else was the right mix of sweet and tangy. 

Dad had an open face tuna melt. I had a couple bites too. It was cooked to perfection and next time I am there I might need to order this for myself. 

As for me I had the chicken salad sandwich. Shredded chicken mixed with avocado. I didn't even give anyone else a chance to have a bite. If you know me or have eaten with me then you know it is pretty damn good. 

We all agreed the fries were to die for. Totally delicious. 

Cocktails. Brixton Lemonade hit the spot for me and we actually went back later THAT night where I indulged in the blue cheese stuffed olive/dirty martini. 

Well done!
author: Nancy B.

description:
Nice to sit and eat outside, particularly on a sunny day and people watch/catch some rays. 

Make sure you have the breakfast burrito for lunch - it's massive!
author: Lisette P.

description:
Ok, so it is a tad on the pricey side, but I'm willing to treat myself once in a while. I have been to The Brixton twice now: once with my hubby and once  (today) alone. The first time I had their French Dip. It was THE BEST FRENCH DIP I have had in a long time. Today I had the tuna melt, in which they use a yellow mustard in the tuna salad. It was a little to mustardy for me. It kind of took away from the taste of the rest of the sandwich. The fries rocked, both times, but they also offer a side of mixed greens instead. They have both regular, lightly seasoned fries and the oh-so-popular sweet potato fries. You can also get a mix of both.

My tab today came to $22. That was for my tuna melt and a glass of Prosecco. But hey, I deserve a little self-pampering on Friday, right?
author: Kathryn M.

description: Good for brunch and cocktails. Great for groups, too. Fun scene, good service.
author: Vicki L.

description: If you're looking for some decent food with table service, try the Brixton. Nothing is too fancy on the menu that you wouldn't know what it is, but it's not basic diner food either. I had the pork chops and they were cooked perfectly accompanied by beans and bits of bacon. Entrees are in the 20-something $ range, and most of the clientele appear to be in their 20's and 30's. It's a big place without any rugs or drapery to absorb the sound, so if you are hard of hearing, come early before it fills up. Since it is very loud, it may be an ok place to bring kids.
author: Cathy P.

description: Ok, so I'm puzzled as to why this place is always full. I don't get it. We came here before a game and while it was a game night, we were there well before the game and way before the place was even a quarter full. I ordered a beer that took at least 25minutes for me to get it and when I went back to claim my beer, the bartender had completely forgot what I had ordered. The service was horrible, to say the least. On top of it all, I got the artichoke spinach dip that had gone bad! It tasted moldy and some component of it was definitely expired. I have experienced better and even though this place is close to where I live, I can't say I will be back.
author: Mimi C.

description: I had a great lunch here on Monday and would definitely revisit for brunch if I was nearby. My boyfriend and I split the fried chicken salad and the burger - both were delicious! I love that you can order your fries half and half (sweet potato and regular). We also had a couple different drinks, including a Moscow Mule and a Vodka Cucumber Basil Gimlet. YUM!
author: Shruti N.

description: The French toast is good for two bites. It's too much. The service is terrible. I wouldn't go here for brunch. There is much much better in SF (like sweet maple)
author: Megan C.

description:
What a perfect scene balanced between lounge & and lively urban atmosphere. The food was great & the assortment of different versions of Moscow Mules was my favorite! 
I've had both Chase and Drew as my server... Both are so nice and have such great costumer service skills... They're the type of folk you'd like to have a beer with. Definitely a fun place for a bigger group too!
author: Kimberly R.

description:
I really like the Brixton, especially for brunch.
The menu isn't expansive but has a few items I really like that I can rotate. The best part is their bloody mary! They rim the glasses with celery salt/pepper and it's incredible. And they're nice about bringing me extra celery.

There is often a wait and almost always a group or two of douchebags or ditzes (neighborhood hazard) but the service is consistently decent, the food is consistently good, the bloody mary is significantly better than others in the area!
author: K C.

description: Excellent for Sunday brunch...service attentive & friendly, we really enjoyed everything there but the Benedict with crab was a stand-out...still thinking about how good it was at dinner time...
author: Brad P.

description: I used to love this spot as a late night default. They have a decent wine selection and I loved the cucumber basil gimlet with Swan's Neck vodka - so smooth! However - it was delicious the first time and the bartenders make it differently (annoying) so I had to have it redone a couple times. Tell them beforehand to go easy on the lime and you will have a dangerously delicious cocktail. Since they stopped the salad and glass of wine for $15, my girlfriends and I go elsewhere - now it's just over priced snacks with hit or miss drinks. I also tried to bring a colleague there Monday night but he wanted to leave as soon as I showed up, I guess the bartender was coughing all over the  place. I wanted him to try the cucumber basil - but alas - we went to Perry's.
author: Shannon O.

description:
I came here with a group if guy friends during the union street fair and was impressed by the overall vibe of the place. Sure the front was pretty crowded as expected because the beautiful French doors opened out to the street for fresh air and sunlight.
I'm not sure if it was only for the festival, but they had huge planter boxes blocking off the front I think to maintain security as they only allowed 21+.
The menu was pretty expensive, $8 for a draft bud, and fairly limited during the festival. However limited, I LOVED my miso ahi tuna salad! The dressing was nice and light, and you can never go wrong with a side of sweet potato fries! 
Overall I would give it a 3.5 for handling the crowds at the street fair, and can't wait to go back to give it a real go!!
author: Alyssa A.

description:
I give it 5 stars from a bar/lounge perspective.

The latest SOMA-esque restaurant/bar in Cow Hollow/Marina brings much needed liveliness to the sleepy end of Union Street (b/w Weber and Fillmore) and a great upscale alternative to the typical sports bars that predominate on Union. Very slinky, dimly lit interior with a "typical Marina" crowd... Everyone is right that it is loud up in thurrrrrrrrr. 

We came here looking for drinks at about 10pm on a Thursday evening after leaving the Balboa due to a SFIP (sausagefest in progress). It was 80% full... composed of a good looking, evenly-ratioed crowd and ordering drinks was fast and easy. It's hard to screw up a Goose tonic and theirs worked. 

What can I say... latest hotspot in the 'hood. I don't think I'd be brave enough to ever eat there for the same reasons many people have already noted, but definitely a hoppin' social scene for those on a liquid diet.
author: Shawn C.

description: Went here for brunch on Sunday and some football.  They only have two tvs so was competing with which game was on but it wasn't as crowded or rowdy.  Decent food and the moscow mules actually come in a copper mug.
author: Paige D.

description:
Great spot for a group, solid food and drinks, a bit too loud for my taste. Every time I eat here all I can hear are other people's conversations (in their defense I go on busy nights).

One thing that has always impressed me with this place is the celerity of the bartenders. I never feel like that awkward guy waiting for a drink for his imaginary girlfriend -- my imaginary girlfriend gets her drinks speedy and on time.
author: Jason M.

description: We went to the Brixton because we wanted burgers -- I am a carnivore, my fiancé is vegan. When we arrived -- with a reservation -- we waited for at least five minutes at the host stand without being acknowledged by anyone.  We finally caught someone's attention (they just looked at us and went the other way, so we finally caught someone passing by), and were seated in the front of the restaurant near the entrance. The server promptly brought us menus and water (without asking if we wanted water) and we placed orders for drinks (one glass of wine and one beer). After almost 20 minutes and no server or drinks, we had to get up and ask someone if we could get our drinks, which had been sitting at the end of the bar the entire time. The food took 25 minutes to receive after ordering.    We moved tables because there was such a draft that we were freezing. Once moved, the very attentive bus boy took our flatware and side plates -- TWICE -- and tried to take a plate of food we were still working on without asking us.  He was so fast that we didn't notice. Overall: go there for a loud atmosphere and drink at the bar, but don't expect outstanding or quick service.
author: Mary Beth S.

description:
Airy and open space but the dark wood and the classic wall paper bring the buyer a warm feel.  The fried chicken is succulent with excellent flavor.  
The bar swarms with young, hot, and the need to be seen, making it fun to watch from a table as 'Gina meets Kevin'.
When we went on Friday night the place was busy in the barcentric way the hosts were really busy and the atmosphere was almost club like upon entrance.
I really enjoyed the various musical scores heard here and the light bite.  I shall go again!
Lunch the week before was alright.  The spinach salad was meh, the dip was so so, but the tables outside were fantastic.
author: D B.

description:
I would have to say this place has the best wine list in all of Cow Hollow/Marina.  It's obvious that  whomever is running the wine program here cares about what goes on the list.  Bottle prices are on point, and with selections like, Darioush, Turley, Charles Smith etc.. its difficult not to have your server open more than one! 

-last visit had the Sea Bass and this new Sancerre, I think they recently added. The GF had a bacon cheddar burger with, my favorite red on the list, the Caravan Cab.
author: Michael D.

description:
ok, let me start by prefacing, yes there are d-bags all around...marina prissies galore, and even some coug pups in training. BUT people, you forget, YOURE IN THE MARINA, actually the heart of the MARINA. So dont go getting your panties in a fluff about the crowd expectations.... 

That being said; the decor in the Brixton is awesome. Its dark and rich, very "rock n roll-esque" Def reminds me of a something I would expect to see out of a Hard Rock Cafe. And Im not hating, I actually like HRCs. 

The food, in my opinion was good. Not great, but good. The miso ahi tuna salad was delicious. Everything tasted real fresh and the ahi (done medium) was bomb, it reminded of the tuna I used to get in Hawaii, very fresh. The cascade steelhead salmon was also very fresh and flavorful. This dish came with some sides: brussel sprouts and potatoes. Both these dishes were filling but light. So if you plan to down several beers, these dishes would accompany great, because they would leave you with plenty of room. 

Overall, I would def come back here for some late night grub (weekdays of course). If your point is to avoid the "marina" crowd then I would highly recommend avoiding on weekends, happy hours, and weekend brunch/pre-going out times.
author: Jenn H.

description:
I'm kinda surprised by all the "meh" reviews. My hubby and I went here after seeing a sweet UrbanDaddy write up. Didn't even look at Yelp before coming. And we had a killer experience.

First of all, the ambiance of the place is awesome. It has a feel of swanky british pub going on, but it's also comfortable. I feel like I could go in looking snazzy or just in jeans and sneakers and be fine either way. The bar looked pretty fun but small, but there were some long tables in the general bar vicinity where it would be fun to get drinks and possibly meet other people too. The whole restaurant has a very spacious feel to it. 

The menu doesn't particularly wow, but the food is really delicious. I had the Pork Confit, and I have to say I have never had pork that way in my life. 3 pork medallions, completely tender but crispy on the outside...holy holy. My husband had the beef stew. It was delicious, but I mean beef stew is beef stew (I'm talking about when cooked properly, not out of the bloody Dinty Moore can). For apps we had the Pretzel Knots. They were ok, but the sauces they come with really make them - a homemade cheese sauce and a whole grain honey mustard. I had the Little Gems Caesar. It was perfectly dressed and had delicious crumbled croutons and shaved parm. Yummo. 

Their drink selection is killer. Try the Ketel 1 Basil Cucumber Martini. You won't be sorry. And they don't give you pansy ass drink portions. It's a big martini glass filled to the point where you can drink it without spilling on your first sip. Yes, please.

Finally, dessert. SAVE ROOM! They have Humphrey Slocombe ice creams and they are flipping ridonkulously good. We had the trio of Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Creme Fraiche and The Brixton (maple bourbon goodness). I just about made a wet spot on their sweet little leather booth. Good god.

Don't listen to what the haters say about the douchebaggery. Don't be a snob. Try this place. It's yummy, portions are good sized, and overall reasonably priced with some interesting twists.
author: Celeste R.

description: Were walking by and decided to go in. Very nice, very lively, great selection of drinks, good food, and the service was fantastic despite the busy crowd. Makes me think I'm in London to some degree
author: Aziz S.

description:
Get the martinis at the bar.  The bartenders here do a great job.  Friendly and they remember your drink. 

Yeah, it's busy and loud on Fridays and Saturdays but that's expected for this area.  Sundays are sneaky relaxed here.  Not a bad place to grab a solid bite and drink while watching a baseball game. 

The ice cream is fabulous.  Must get it every time. 

Awesome decor.
author: David L.

description: The Brixton is always a good time. The servers and bartenders are always pleasant and attentive. Ahi tuna salad is a good light meal. Try the prime rib if you're there on a Sunday night. Can get a little loud and crowded at times, but if you don't like that, then stay home.
author: Jack R.

description:
Came here for dinner and drinks last night. I have been wanting to come here since I've heard such great things from my friends about the place =)
It was a little difficult to find parking, but can you expect from this area?
The staff was very friendly and attentive, and checked on us regularly to make sure that the drinks & food was flowing! =D
We ordered:
Demoned eggs - these were delicious! Had a really nice balanced flavor. I am not a big fan of the pickle/sour taste in most deviled eggs, which these didn't have yay! Just creamy/buttery/fluffy yolkness nom nom nom. The bacon bits add a good crunch and everything just tasted so wonderful together =) Make sure u stuff the whole half in ur mouth all at once ladies for the right taste.
Shrimp cocktail - The sauce had a very nice kick, and I like the slaw that came with it.
Mac n cheese - comes in a lil cast iron pot, I always love mac n cheese, you can pretty much never go wrong! Nice crunchy bread crumbs on top =)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hg0cuVFIqz2C4w6RsAuohA?select=SSZ8SQTykr4bgsM5TRUNlw
Flatbread pizza - had a nice kick to the flavor as well, lots of peppers and spice, loved it!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hg0cuVFIqz2C4w6RsAuohA?select=EXHMn5dwG09kPMjIqwbwtw
We also had the salmon, sorry no pic. The skin was very nice and crispy, and well seasoned. On a bed of onions and squash mmmmm so good!
For dessert we had a trio of ice cream/sorbet. Of course I had to try the brixton flavor. It was really good! Creme fraiche was delicious. Who would've thought of creme fraiche ice cream?? Chocolate sorbet was very yummy and chocolatey, never knew sorbet could be chocolate flavored! The gingerbread cookie shaped as a B was actually very good as well, and I am not even a gingerbread fan.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hg0cuVFIqz2C4w6RsAuohA?select=KFb32aodDmivj3cKcnK_ew
Can't wait to come back for some more demoned eggs! And to try more items on the menu. =D
author: Jenny W.

description: Don't be fooled, the food doesn't taste nearly as good as it looks. Cool atmosphere. Just don't eat.
author: Tracy S.

description: Best burger in the city for sure!  I always order the demoned eggs before and wash everything down with a nice cold Lagunitas ipa.  The owners are staff are awesome and very courteous.  I bring my kids down often for brunch on the weekends.  They love the sweet potato fries and grilled cheese sandwich.  This is also a great place to grab a drink before you go out, be the place to go out to and the place to come back to when everything else sucks.  If you frequent this place often, it will be the place where everyone will know your name.
author: Dave K.

description:
Honestly, the only thing that the Brixton has going for it is location.  Take away the prime Union St. location, and there is nothing particularly interesting about this place.  The menu isn't particularly interesting or original and the preparation is absolutely so-so.

The service ranges from so-so to completely uninvolved, which almost seems to be a point of pride for The Brixton.  Asking for a table seems to be like asking to get into the cool club as an ugly single guy - except that there is very little that is "cool" about The Brixton.

Really, if you are in the Union/Fillmore/Chestnut area, you have so many more options - the Brixton should absolutely be your last choice.
author: Matthew D.

description:
The eggs and burgers were pretty damn good. The drinks can get exotic but they make reliable and strong standards. 

Overall, I'd say this is a great way to start a weekend or night out with friends. Additionally, if it's a weekday, the vibe is chiller and you can easily see this working for business dinners and having friends in from out town.
author: Shane W.

description:
I am a fan of this place. I met my girlfriends here for brunch one rainy Saturday morning. We definitely didn't need reservations, but were seated in a big cozy booth, perfect for the cloudy Saturday. The atmosphere screams comfort and old San Francisco.
The food was good. I would order differently as my scramble came with those little mushrooms that I fear will break into song and dance. 
At the table were two scrambles: both delicious, served with toast and the hash brown cakes that make you thing of a pop-tart. Delicious
The Eggs Benedict also received rave reviews. The pesto chicken sandwich was HUGE and served with frites (i love frites). So yes, the food was great. The drinks on the menu are great as well. Tasty combination of coffee, amaretto, baileys, etc....all the things I can never figure out how to mix up.
Best part is, they serve food until 1 am and drinks until 2am.
author: Emily N.

description:
Me: I don't understand, I made a reservation, do you have my reservation?

Brixton: Yes, we do, unfortunately we don't have a table.

Me: But the reservation ensures me a table. That's why you have the reservation.

Brixton: I know why we have reservations.

Me: I don't think you do. If you did, I'd have a table. See, you know how to take the reservation, you just don't know how to *hold* the reservation and that's really the most important part of the reservation, the holding. 

Anybody can just take them.

45 minutes later we get our table - bummer
author: chris l.

description:
Brixton is actually a pretty dodgy neighborhood of London, not something you would associate with the 'gastro-pub' vibe I think the owners are going for. Never the less, odd name aside, this is a good drinking bar, with large open spaces and dark wood decor. The sound track is a nice change from the euro beats you might expect in marina/cow hollow scene, with some classic rock and smattering of brit-pop (think Led Zep followed by Supergrass).

As others have mentioned, don't come here solely for the food. Its just okay, and the service is friendly but slow. Also, they were "out" of several of the red wines I wanted to order. That's just plain annoying.

In conclusion, come here to get a quiet drink on a Sunday afternoon, or to put on your best "score shirt" and work the room for digits on a Friday night.
author: Tom M.

description: Our waiter was awesome, but unfortunately I can't remember his name. Drinks are very weak. Overall a great experience.
author: Jonathan K.
