description: One of my go-to's on Union street. It's American cuisine with a twist, at times. While other places can be quite packed and hard to get into, this place always has seating. The outdoor seating is quite attractive as you can people watch and have a good meal. While it's a great place to go just to have dinner - it might not be the best place to go for a good conversation.
author: Jane E.

description: Food sounded better on the menu than it tasted in person. Kind of disappointing.  Service and ambiance are nice, no wait time for lunch during the weekday...seems like a cool place to have a drink and sit outside. I don't think I would really want to eat a full meal here again though.
author: Natasha F.

description:
I just wanted to give credos to the new owners (Andy), The Brixton is a gem. A complete transformation from the last venue. The food and drinks are fantastic and very unique. The service there is very professional. The only negative thing about it, is that its packed Thur-Sun.. Go on a Monday night and you might be able to meet the owner like I did and have a wonderful time. 
I suggest you come and try it out yourself, you won't be disappointed.
author: Alexis V.

description: Great food and outdoor seating! We had the pate, fries and bread. The pate was decent. Baker street bistro has more flavorful paste tho. All and all it was good.
author: Ammala B.

description: This place has a good bar area... Sat night was packed.
author: Jana A.

description: had the prime rib special a couple months back during a post season giants game.  great projector for watching the game, great job!  service was excellent on a friday night that was super packed, i mean people were standing next to our table.  dessert was the highlight of the night and a big surprise to be super delicious.  definitely had a fun night!
author: Kevin L.

description:
This looks like a cool place and they ended up having tasty food but the service provided was pretty bad. Another one of the buddies I was with also posted his take on the situation so this review might look familiar. 

We were sat by the host and no server came to our table for about 10 minutes even though the adjacent three tables were being served.  Finally a buddy from table got up and asked the host about it.  The host said it was her fault and that she'd get a server.  A server from the bar came to start taking orders and such even though all the tables around us had a dedicated server who seemed to be doing a good job. After we gave the order one of received the wrong starter.  As we waited patiently other tables around us ordered and were served before we saw our order come out. After about an hour from when we ordered we again went up to the host  to ask about our order. When the food finally came out it seemed like it had been sitting awhile.  The server probably just forgot about us since she was busy at the bar.  The manager came out but she was really quiet and not very apologetic.  We really felt  forgotten.   I'll give it two stars because the food was good and they ended up compensating us two meals. I might be willing to give them a second chance but there are so many other options in the area I don't think it will happen.
author: Derick B.

description: I came here on a Friday night to meet a friend I hadn't seen in years. For that reason, we chose to sit outside so we could hear better. Good choice. It was bumpin in there. Nice decor, nice menu, nice prices. Not a very "chill" spot, definitely more of a club vibe, at least on a Friday night anyway. Nice spot, would go again, but would rather go to party than to chillax.
author: Danielle P.

description: I ended up coming here for a brunch on a Sunday with my girlfriends mainly for the dine about San Francisco promo.  The only disappointment of the day was apparently they didn't honor that on Sundays even though the website said they did.  Other than that, the food was SCREAMIN!!  Probably had the best bloody mary EVER!!  slightly tart (usually notmy style) with plenty of horseradish.  I had a roasted chicken and avocado sandwich that was on bread that tasted like it was made in house..  KILLER!!  I would totally come here again.  It was super packed but fortunately we had reservations.
author: Brittany E.

description: Great experience. The service was fast, even though we went on a Saturday night and the whole place was packed. I got the squash alfredo pasta and it was BOMB. My boyfriend got the porkchop and loved it as well. I had a great pinot noir and they had a great beer selection as well. It was a really fun place for dinner and a great location for going out after if you wanted. Although we just got frozen yogurt on the corner =)
author: Alexandra W.

description: Had the best time at the brixton on a friday night. It was full house at around 8:00 but my best friend and I managed to find a seat at the bar. The bartenders were really cool and tried to make sense of the chaotic-ness and made pretty decent drinks.  I had the bloody mary (yum) and peach ciroc with cranberry. But what made the best impression is their fries! Holy cow!!! They were the bestttt half fries half sweet potato. Even our bartender had a little nibble from our plate haha. Overall a great place and great vibe.
author: Ash P.

description: Go for the booze and hot girls. Not the food. Period. It's far too expensive for the blatant lack of quality.
author: James F.

description: I went to The Brixton yesterday with a group of about 10 girlfriends to celebrate a birthday.  The birthday girl made a reservation for 11:15, and they gave us space at a huge table toward the back.  What I LOVED was that, in true San Francisco form, we all rolled in over about 45 minutes (we didn't all show up at 11:15 on the dot), and yet they seated us, which most restaurants in San Francisco won't do.  The food was quite delicious, and the portions were terrific for the price.  I shared a breakfast burrito, hash browns, and bacon with a friend, and it was perfect - maybe even a little too much.  The decor is fantastic, with a big bar in the center of the space.  My only complaint was with the bartender.  I needed quarters for the parking meter, and the waitress directed me to the bar.  At first the bartender was attentive and checked for quarters for me, but realized that he didn't have any in his drawer and would have to get some.  No biggie - I went back to our table (literally right next to the bar) so I wasn't standing there stalking him, since I had a few minutes until my meter ran out.  About five minutes later I went back to the bar, and now the bartender COMPLETELY ignores me.  What the...?!?!  Literally ignores me.  He even came over to the register at one point (I was standing at the end of the bar with the register), and didn't even look at me.  I was the ONLY person standing there.  Finally one of the customers at the other side of the bar, seeing my growing frustration, told the female bartender that I had been standing there, and she came over and gave me quarters.  It was genuinely bazaar, and where it not for the rest of the experience being so awesome, I would have given a 2 star rating.  It's a good thing the kitchen has it together!  I'll definitely go back, especially with a group.
author: Cori D.

description: Very nice restaurant with a great happy hour!! GREAT AND AMAZING SERVICE AND STAFF (including Emma)! The food is very tasty but a bit pricey. They give you a huge portion of food though, so it balances out.
author: Joseph P.

description: Went here about a month ago with a few friends for a night on the town. The atmosphere, food and drinks were stellar. The only gripe was service was a little slow, but they were packed and it was a Friday night. I just wish I lived closer to the city so I could come here more often.
author: Sean K.

description:
Went here for a late lunch on a Saturday-there was no wait!

We had the pulledpork sandy and the chicken salad/avo sandwich- both we decided were really bland and my friend who had the pulled pork said it was dry.

The sweet potato fries were scrumptious and so was the Brixton Buck cocktail!

Overwall it was just an OK experience.
author: Kate M.

description: Great for brunch especially if you can sit outside or by the window. Food was great and the mimosas were awesome. They were insanely busy but the service was still up to par.
author: Carly G.

description:
This review is only for cocktails. 
Organic bee's knees and the gin basil ricky are both excellent.  Want to go back for happy hour and try some more dranks. 

The crowd was super random.
author: Athena W.

description:
This is a great spot to come for drinks with friends. Very neat and fun atmosphere. 

I had dinner here last week with a group of friends. Service was really nice and fast. 

However, the food was mediocre. Nothing that special or that tasty...kinda sad tasting actually.  I don't think I'll come here for food again. But come for a drink!
author: S G.

description:
I recently went to The Brixton for a friends birthday in a group of 20. 
The food was very good ( I had a salad and hanger steak) as was the service. My only issue was that it was just so noticeable that we were eating in a bar! The volume of noise was very loud and at one point a couple of randoms from the bar came over and started talking to some of our group-a bit weird when you're eating dinner!

Our reservation was on the late side (9.15), so I'd recommend this placevas a lunch or early dinner eatery!
author: Leigh M.

description: Really great service and menu.  One of the best Ahi Tuna salads I've ever had.
author: Patrick B.

description:
I normally don't hang out in the Marina but we ate lunch here because we wanted to go to Rugby down the street. Everything was ok but nothing was memorable. I  had to ask my friends to refresh my memory on what we had cause I had forgotten..... not good. 
Our server was really knowledgeable and nice and the place is big. I think we would only go back if I had a large group of people with me because they have the space.
author: Rolo A.

description: nutella and banana stuffed french toast. enough said.
author: Erika P.

description:
came here for a Sunday. brunch to celebrate my bbg's 23rd. it wasn't bad extremely packed at 12;30 which was good. Our server Jenna was great. really friendly, patient, and accommodating with our group. i ordered the infamous french toast...which tasted really good. it does get really sweet so maybe this dish should be shared. i also tried many benedicts and their hash brown but i think my fave would be the carnita hash. one bite packed a kick of flavors! of course what's a birtthday without some singing and ice cream puffs?! believe it was comp-ed not sure. so our server Jenna was great but uhm the bussboys? were straight up rude. they didn't even ASK if we were done with our dishes and they just started stacking plates....WITH EDIBLE...UNTOUCHED FOOD ON TOP!!! that really pissed me off and to make matters worst, they go "excuse me....HELLO! can u pass that" I'm drinking sittin here like wtf? RUDE!!! and no thank u after that. like not to be mean or w.e but he could have came around ... i mean he has legs and its not like he asked very nicely... that just ruined thee wholeeee experience because the place was nicely decorated. food was great. our waitress was beyond awesome! the bussboys? not so much ..and that's why i'm giving 3 stars. 

i do wanna try their happy hou!  hopefully it'll b better.
author: Kristina L.

description:
The place seems to have so much potential - good location, nice spacious place, lots of sunlight and street views, big bar and good menu - but then you have to actually interact with the employees, and it all goes downhill from there....

It always seems there are some nice employees (and you always have to deal with multiple - hosts, bartenders, waiters/waitresses, etc.) but I've never been able to avoid employees that either are rude or just plain ignore you. I've literally gone in on a weekend afternoon when it most definitely could not be described as busy, sat at the bar, and watched the bartender do almost everything imaginable to not serve any of the 4 people in our group - wash glasses, cut up lemons, talk with the other bartender, etc.

Once you do get your food and/or drinks, they are pretty good. I've never had dinner here, but of the starters, I've thought all of the below were at least above average
 - French Onion Dip
 - Spinach/Artichoke Dip
 - Flatbread Pizza (its got a good spice to it, not too hot, but tasty)
 - Pretzal Knots
Their drinks are also pretty tasty, although I think a bit pricey. 

Overall, I've been here probably 4 or 5 times over a span of several months and always had similar experiences. Hope it changes, or changes ownership at least, because it could be a great place.
author: Patrick M.

description: I staggered into the the Brixton recently with 6 friends in tow, after a chaotic hour in which a reservation mix-up left seven girls running around the Marina trying to find somewhere to eat. At 8pm on a Saturday. Ha. Finally we wobbled our stiletto-clad selves up the hill to the one place that said they could take us. It turned out to be well worth the walk. The Blueberry Lemonade (beware, they taste innocent but sneak up on you), the sweet potato fries, the salads and desserts, everything was excellent. The bar  was completely packed by the time we were leaving around 10/10:30, but our table was toward the back and we could still hear each other. I'll be back.
author: Ariana S.

description: Came here for brunch....it had a fun ambiance but the music was a little too loud for even small conversation. The service was on point and the food was decent. Simple and tasty. Casual vibe and the outside seating looking nice (though full).
author: Zara S.

description: I've been here a few times now - once for brunch, once for lunch, and once for dinner. Each time I've had a pleasant experience, and I really like the vibe of the place, but it's yet to be considered memorable. I came for dinner with a huge party, and the place gets so loud that it's hard to hear anyone! Personally I think brunch is the best value here as a meal is no where near as expensive as the dinner menu. Plus if you get lucky, you can sit outside on a nice weekend day and people-watch (err, look for walk of shamers) on Union which is allllways a treat.
author: Laura C.

description: Thank you for still being open at 1AM on a Monday night, thats all I got to say.
author: Linda L.

description: Awesome place and even better when the weather is great!! Great happy hour and patio seating to sit outside, drink beers and play cards all day and people watch!! Excellent food as well and very friendly wait staff.
author: Vito F.

description: If you want lunch served with a side of poor service, come on down to the Brixton. Ive eaten here three times in the last 4 months and each time its been bad. Slow service, wrong orders being brought to the table, lukewarm food...its not worth the money or time wasted.
author: Michael G.

description: I got the alfredo pasta with the squash-- it was really good. My boyfriend got the fried chicken salad and wasn't too pleased though. The drinks were strong and it was a fun and trendy environment. Overall, we had a good time at the restaurant.
author: Megan F.

description: The Brixton is a cool spot to grab a drink and a quick bite to eat. The decor is cute and reminds me of an upscale British pub. Don't expect much of the food and stick with the appetizers if you really want to eat something here. We ordered 3 entrees: Grilled American Kobe Top Sirloin Steak, Cabernet Braised Pork Short Ribs & Mushroom, Spinach, Tomato Angel Hair Pasta with Shrimp. The pasta was not good. The noodles tasted like ramen for some strange reason. I'm a pasta girl but even I could not stomach this dish. The steak was chewy. The short ribs were passable. The standout dish was the sweet potato fries. They were so good that we got 3 orders. The demoned eggs were also tasty. The Cucumber Gimlet was tasty and refreshing. Stick to the drinks and apps here and you'll leave happy. If you're really hungry, save your money and grab a slice of pizza at Pizza Orgasmica a few blocks down.
author: Chi N.

description:
Overall, Three stars because the bar is amazing - I'm a sucker for wood paneling. And the staff was super nice.  Drinks, specialty ones, were fantastic and reasonably priced - $9/drink. This includes martinis.

The food is another story. I think they need to change the chef or step up the menu. The menu seemed too random. Is it upscale pub food? Or are you trying to be a gourmet place? Honestly, overpriced for what you get.

The skirt steak came out okay warm. It had three onion rings piled on top. No sides. $20. That is a little ridiculous unless you're at a well known 5 star place - like maybe Harris' Steak House. Then they had a $13 burger below. Some pasta dishes, and seafood? Weird.  The skirt steak had no taste, no seasoning.  Either use better cow, or season it. I put horseradish on it to add taste - and it was super hot. Beware of that one. But it was a bit better.

My advice to the new owners. Change your menu otherwise you're gonna loose business quickly. Small plates, cheaper prices.

Wait staff was nice though. Wonder how long that'll last. Seems like most of the marina places - wait staff think they own the world. We'll see. 

Hoping this sticks around because it has a nice open bar scene which is awesome.
author: Lar P.

description: Fun place for big group dinners. Full bar, and the Caesar and pizza I had were awesome.
author: Lauren C.

description: Open Table was right when they say vibrant bar scene! The decor was nice but if you're not a drinker definately not the place for you UNLESS you want a good bang for your buck on dinner. Sunday prime rib is where its at. Share this monstrous meal or you will need an ambulance to carry you out! We made reservations for 6PM but they're not really necessary. Maybe because it was Sunday? But if you do have to wait it's in a nice neighborhood around Pacific Heights where you can shop at Z Gallerie or American Apparel..etc. It's more of 3 1/2 but hey..maybe next time I'll try something not so "hunky".
author: Cheryl G.

description: Adorable place! Mimosas were great and the artichoke dip came in the cutest mini pot! Another great brunch spot.  The wait was not too long and the staff is very friendly!
author: Jessyca M.

description: This review is for the Weekend Brunch. Service while dining was outstanding (thank you Israel) but the wait was super slow. Came in on a Saturday for a later brunch (around 11:30 am) and it was not a busy hour. The hostess had many tables available but took forever in seating us.  The server, Israel, changed our experience by truly understanding my culinary desires. Best thing that's NOT on their menu (but you can inquire with the chef): Fried Chicken Benedict. Came highly recommended, and the chef delivered! Quite the culinary delight!
author: Tammy H.

description:
The pluses: good specialty cocktails (especially liked the Strawberry Don Royale), tasty desserts and bar food, reasonably priced for a trendy sort of spot, and cool looking decor.  Plus, the bar is really large, so despite being amazingly crowded, it wasn't impossible to get a drink.

The minuses: the acoustics - seriously, who thought that much wood paneling was a good idea?  You can barely hear anyone, but I guess that is part of the scene.  As others have said, it gets really crowded and really loud (we were there at around 10PM).  The other thing that was strange is that the bar area blends right into the dining area, so as the crowd gets bigger, people end up standing right next to all the tables - not a good place if you want to sit down and have dinner without people hovering over you.  Also, the hostesses were initially not very helpful, until the rest of our large party showed up.  They made up for it, but I thought it was a little annoying that it took a large group (and presumably large tab) to get their attention.

I'd give it another shot once they have been around for a while, but it isn't in my neighborhood and I don't see myself making a special trip out there.
author: Marienna M.

description:
typical marina eatery, not that there's anything wrong with that.  fairly loud and quite the scene.  food was fair.

'aight:
cucumber gimlet
pretzel rolls
tomato watermelon salad
ahi salad

pass:
sweet potato fries whimpy

overall, not too shabby, but nothing to write home about.
author: Josie M.

description: Best chicken avocado sandwich I have ever had bar none. Service was quick and friendly. Water was served in a nice bottle (free). Prices were, considering this is San Fran, very reasonable.
author: Jan A.

description:
Great atmosphere, fun, great servers.  Been here for lunch and dinner.  I WANT to love this place.  I want it to have amazing food.  I want it to be more creative with its food choices.  I wanted things to be a bit more delicious.   The fries were perfect - everything else was just good.  Nothing amazing,  nothing too creative.  

But we will come back.  And hope for a bit more progression from the kitchen.
author: michael d.

description: More than just a yuppy bar - the food is really good.  The ahi tuna salad is great and you can't pass up the bloody mary's for brunch. If you want to watch a popular sports game, they have screens that drop from the ceiling. Get reservations though - it fills up quickly!
author: Karin Z.

description:
you are awful
your staff is rude
your crowd is lame
YOUR DRINKS ARE WAY TOO EXPENSIVE
...cool decor though, there is my positivity
author: Lauren V.

description: A friend and I went here.  This place makes you feel like you are in Walnut Creek.  It is brand new, very loud (singles mixer at the bar) and has nothing interesting going on architecturally.  Whatever the architect was going for is destroyed by the installation of a massive, indeed impressive, projection television screen.  I would give this place a bad review but the food was decent.  I got the chicken, which was moist and pretty good.  It was Tuesday, so a glass of wine was only $7.  And, our waitress was very nice.  I might try this place again if I am in the neighborhood and, after popping my head in, have determined that it is reasonably quiet.
author: Greg W.

description: This review is long overdue. Stopped in for Sunday brunch, because i heard this place was good. It wasnt crowded, but boy was the service slow. I wish i could remember the name of our waitress. So disappointment in the service. Food was ok. I left the waitress a bit of advice on the receipt to make her alert that just, because i tipped doesnt mean she deserved it. I wont be returning, but i want to find my receipt now to add her name to my review. Will not be returning. I think i'll much rather go to Zazie's
author: Crystal C.

description: Been here for brunch and for dinner and I'd have to say that their dinner menu is much better than the brunch menu. It's great for groups except that on weekend nights it gets very very loud. They make a mean martini though. Great if you need a lively atmosphere, but would skip dinner and just come for the drinks
author: Katie D.

description: For some reason, I like going to this place. I think it's the tasty cocktails and the decor that keep me coming back. Otherwise, the food is ok, the crowd is very "Union Street", it's a bit noisy if you actually want to talk to someone, and the service is only so-so. The bartenders look like they're irritated for having to make your drink (and this has happened on multiple occasions!) Keep trying different cocktails off of their menu though, and each one has been great!
author: Amanda R.

description: This restaurant is just not competitive for the area.  The food is uninspired and average.  The service is initially friendly but not very competent.  For example, three people in my party ordered avocado on their burgers for an additional charge - the kitchen forgot to put them on.  By the time we got the attention of our server - we were half way through the meal.  About 5 - 7 minutes after we alerted the server, she brought out a plate with a sliced avocado - no apologies.  We were still of course charged the full price for the addition.  Unfortunately, this type of omission was a pattern - for example the kitchen forgot french fries and other sides.  Not a big deal by itself, but at the price point and given the options in the neighborhood - it just wasn't competitive.  As a side note, the atmosphere of the restaurant is incoherent.  It seems like a converted steak house - with a theme featuring The Clash and other late 70s bands - it just doesn't work and seems grafted on.
author: Robert F.

description:
The nice thing about the brixton is there is always an open table, but that's only because the locals know this place is horrible in almost every way.

Service:  I had the worst waiter I've had (in SF) in years.  He actually bitched about us while taking our order, too FOREVER to handle our bill and delivered food that did not reflect our requests.  There was another server (female) who actually compensated for some of his shortcomings, but it still kind of ruins your brunch when your waiter is bitching about your order or your attempt to see to it that the women's orders are taken first.

Food:  We're talking about Eddie's cafe type fare, maybe not as good, at much higher prices.  Hash browns look like they're from Trader Joe's frozen aisle.  Ask for well done potatoes and they'll be nearly raw.  Ask for tapatio and your waiter will simply say 'No.'  Overall, the stuff is edible, but not worth the price (which isn't crazy expensive or anything).

Atmosphere:  Not all that bad.  It's open to Union street, so there's plenty of people watching and it has a modern feel to it.  However, the decor is beyond chincy, with faux aging and faux this and faux that everywhere.

Bottom line:  I'm not going back.  Bad service is inexcusable, especially in such a crappy economy.
author: Otto D.

description: Very meh. Came for brunch with some friends. The waiter forgot about special instructions on our order, the soft drinks were flat, and the sunroof let in such bright light that we had to sit around like big divas with our sunglasses on. Wouldn't go back!
author: Heather K.

description: I am not from the neighborhood. But the few times I've been here the hostesses are clueless; completely misquoted the wait times, and the end result is utterly not worth the price. While I appreciate the classy digs, I'm not appreciative of the inept process of housing guests. If I'm going to pay the premium, it needs to be on drinks, not wait.
author: Andrew C.

description: We only had drinks here, so this review is only based on that. Basically the service was non existent if you were sitting at a bar table. My husband went to the bar, since we had been sitting for 10 minutes waiting. He was then told by the bartender that we had to order from our server and he couldn't help us. So we waited at least another five minutes, then our server who was miffed that we had asked the bartender, finally took our order. Time for second round, no server in sight. The table next to us was also receiving no service. My husband went to the bar again and told the bartender that he isn't waiting any longer for the server, so he agreed to serve us. Approximately ten minutes later the server came over and angrily asked where we got the drinks. When we told her "at the bar", she (in a snotty tone) told us that she would transfer the other drinks to the bar and we could get any other drinks from them. Basically she wasn't dealing with us anymore...which was fine with us.
author: Amy L.

description: Thought I was sitting down at a simple but solid diner. Found out otherwise. The food was fine, but the coffee and tea were horrendous; the prices were high, and the service was mediocre. This place is a cheap diner with posh restaurant prices. Look elsewhere on Union, or better yet, leave the neighborhood.
author: Garrett P.

description: This is one of the best restaurants and bars in San Francisco! They are so accommodating and made my friend's birthday so special. We also had the most amazing/fun waiter, Eric! HIGHLY recommend The Brixton.
author: Liz P.

description: We went here for Saturday brunch. The service was pretty good. The food was nothing special. We had the make your own scramble (3 scrambled eggs + 3 toppings of your choice, hash browns, and toast) and it was mediocre at best.
author: Monica T.

description: Best clam chowder in the city. I work in the neighborhood and have always been a big fan. Yesterday we had s big seafood dinner and called Brixton for chowder. The were very accommodating in getting us a large order. Everyone at dinner was impressed with the chowder. In fact, people were pushing aside fresh crab and oysters and loading up. I recommend it very highly.
author: Brad S.

description:
I was really excited to try out the Brixton, one of several new restaurant/bars in the neighborhood. The decor was all charcoal gray, and dressed for halloween, nothing noteable, but a nice Marina/Cow Hollow Bar. 

In review:
Deafeningly loud We had to shout at each other across the table just to be heard over the other shouting guests.
Super super weak drinks
Wine was below average
The toughest Kobe steak I've ever had in my life
The waitstaff was attractive and attentive
The  bar scene / World Series crowd was lively

My takeaway:
Best for drinks at the bar for a loud crowd
Not a great place to eat dinner unless you need something to eat with your drinks.
Enjoy!
author: Jeremy B.

description: Such a cute place on a sunny afternoon. My coworker and I happened to park right in front of this place  when we were heading to Z Galleries to pick up some artwork. It seemed like a good crowd of people, 4square deal, plus good stuff on the menu, so we hopped in here for lunch. Most of the people were sitting outside or towards the windows catching the warmth of the sun. We sat by the fireplace and ordered the corn flake fried chicken salad. Mmmmmmm it was so good. The chicken was crispy, crunchy outside and tender inside. The salad only consisted of fresh lettuces and a light dressing, which made a delicious and yummy light lunch to counter our greasy burger from the day before.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: This place is a SCENE - very social - and the food is quite good.  Great place to hang out and eat, both.   In particular, they make excellent burgers (unlike the greasy Umami Burger up the street).  Half chicken is fine, choice of several IPAs and interesting wines.  A real asset to Unions Street.
author: Art A.

description: Came here on a Saturday night with my husband after passing up other eateries on Union St. Since it just the two of us among parties of 6 or more, we got a little table right away without reservations on a busy night.  The food was better than we had expected.  I loved the pretzel knots and miso yellowfin ahi tuna salad, and my husband raved about his burger.  The drinks (strawberry don royale and vodka cucumber basil gimlet) were outstanding, and the dessert was pretty good but will pass on it next time.  The service we had that night was really attentive too.
author: Julie P.

description:
Don't know why I never reviewed them before. Came here plenty of times for lunch or drinks. Today, we stopped in for lunch and it wasn't  busy at all thank goodness. But poor waitress...she was the only one there. Nonetheless, she was sweet and did a really great job. 

Today's lunch was light. Seared ahi tuna salad. Still delish
author: Lola D.

description:
I have such mixed feelings about this place.  My true star rating is 3.5, but Yelp won't let me do that.

I have been here several times, for brunch, lunch, happy hour time, and dinner.  As you can see, I really really want to like this place.  Sometimes I do, and then there are the other times... 

The food is good (I mean who doesn't like pretzels and cheese dip), there is a variety of items to choose from, the aesthetic of the restaurant is gorgeous, the service sucks.  I mean really sucks.  Only one time have I had a decent server and I am pretty easy on servers.  The rest of the times it has taken me a VERY long time to get my food (even with a small party) and it was as though bringing my food to me was a favor that the server could not be bothered with.  One time we waited 15 minutes for water. No joke.  I hate the fact that the servers in this place live up to the snobby, too good for your reputation that the marina has because it could be soo good and you are giving us marina-ers such a bad reputation.  Change the servers and you get a solid 5 stars from me.
author: G A.

description: The Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable about the wine on their drink menu.  The crowd was a mix of people, probably due to Bay to Breakers Race.  A very trendy bar to visit.
author: Samantha J.

description: Great place for brunch or watching sports. Came here to watch the Superbowl and had an amazing time. Recommend the carnitas hash, beer braised pork shoulder sauteed with yukon gold potatoes topped with tortilla strips, avocado mousse, cilantro leaves, and a poached egg, and the french toast.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
This place was terrible!  It was so freezing that I had to wear my winter coat in doors.  The hostess rolled her eyes at me when I asked if we could be sat in the back since it would be warmer away from the door.  She did sit us in the back, which was still freezing.  

After my boyfriend and I sat waiting for over 20 minutes for someone to greet us and maybe even take our drink order, we decided to leave.  The owner was busy flirting with two girls sitting a couple of tables down.  On our way out, my boyfriend decided to give him the benefit of the doubt and explain why we were leaving and he didn't seem to care.  Also, nothing looked good on the menu.  

I might have liked this place when I was in my early 20's if I wanted a new bar to check out, but anyone who is looking to have a good meal with good service, stay away!
author: Carolyn B.

description: Kelly, one of the bartenders, is awesome. I ordered a crazy custom drink and she was accommodating but not ready to let me go without asking if she could give it a little something. Way better!! That is good bar tending. Never let a person leave knowing they have a bad drink. Also, heard they have a good brunch. Will be back to check that out. A good brunch is one of my favorites and shops they measure up.
author: Rachel S.

description: Came here for Mothers day brunch, made reservations on open table....seated fast, great atmosphere, and wonderful service from Christina.  We got our food fast and enjoyed every bite (cinnamon French toast, omlets, granola, hash browns, etc).  Totally going back for brunch again!
author: Hillary B.

description: Nice place.  I came here w/ my sister a while back for lunch.  The inside is very nice and we had attentive service.  We each ordered a salad and they were hefty portions, which is always nice.  I should go back to get the more temping things on their menu.
author: Andrea B.

description: The Brixton is one of my favorite places for lunch on Union! I love their sweet potato fries, and my favorite is their chicken and avocado salad sandwich! Great decor, and awesome window/patio seating.
author: Bridget B.

description: Great music. Good ambiance, I'm sure this place gets pretty awesome on the weekend.
author: Scott W.

description: What a cute lil place this is!  I loved the dark wood, some of the details around the place, and some of the art work!   So we came in round 11 pm so we had the late night menu which unfortunatly was kinda limited!  So we ordered the taco app, philly cheese steak roll app, and a side order of their mac and cheese.   Mmmmm everything we ordered were so good!  We also ordered a glass of white wine that our waitress recommended and it was also so good!  I had a really great dining experience here!  Mmmm...mmmmm...mmmm so good!
author: Angelica E.

description: Love the vibe, great place to go day or night! Mainly night time! :)
author: CoolMc M.

description: Let me begin this by saying I have worked in the service industry in San Francisco in the past for several years.  I made a reservation here for 3 adults for brunch tomorrow.  I have twins that I could either have kept them in their stroller or but them in two high chairs next to one another.  The hostess called shortly after I made a reservation online and lectured me that I did not accurately make the reservation and that I should have said 5 people.  (I had explained the situation when I made the reservation).   I explained to her that I can put the stroller  (which is very compact) up to the table if needed.  She said that there were no tables in the entire restaurant that could accommodate us.  She had a really rude tone throughout our conversation.  We had to cancel the reservation.  Too bad we have eaten there before and people were kind and had no problem seating us.   We actually have sat at multiple tables with the stroller and there was no issues with room.  Our babies are accustomed to eating out as we do it quite often and are well behaved.   I feel completely discriminated against for having kids!  I used to recommend this restaurant to my friends with and without children.  Not ever again.   I will just take my business to the Elite café or another place that has better customer service.  I will not be spending my money there ever again.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Giving this restaurant one star is generous....the food took forever to get to the table was when it arrived it was cold and tasteless. It appears to be a very successful bar with lots of eye candy but if you are going to dinner don't bother as there lots of options in the area that are much better.

I would have said something to the management but it did not feel like anyone would have cared.
author: Bob C.

description: We booked a reservation here through open table a week ago for this afternoon at 4:30 for the Giant's game.  They just called (2 hours before the reservation) to rudely let us know they are too busy to accommodate us.  This is unacceptable customer service.  If they weren't smart enough to plan for the game in the first place, it's not a great idea to spoil somebody's plans 2 hours before their dinner reservations. Brutal customer service and I would not recommend this establishment.
author: Adam A.

description: What an amazing Restaurant Bar.  Lucky enough to get the best seat in the house at the bar with the best bartender Chelsea and some complementary Spark Plug espresso shots from Adam on of the owners.  The Chicken Avocado Sandwich was amazing and their home made ranch is top notch.
author: Taylor M.

description: Used to love this place and bring all our out of town guests. Went here his morning for brunch and noticed quite a difference in the quality? Is this place under new management? Out pretzel knots were stale, food was bland,and sandwich bread was hard. We even found plastic in our salad! That being said, they did take the salad off the menu and apologize. (We appreciated this). Drinks and location still makes this place a possible stop in. Hope our next visit is better..... If there is one.
author: e w.

description: I was looking forward to a casual dinner with my wife. Food was great, however, we did not feel that we got good service at all. It seemed the waiter does not understand that the salad and soup comes first then follow with other parts of the meal. Also all of the food came at once. When we sent back the second course to finish our first course. They then seemed to forget us.
author: Tim R.

description: We were able to watch the 49ers-Saints game, sitting at the end of the bar (I was the small one sitting next to the server station). The atmosphere was electric and the restaurant was packed - standing room only! The servers and bar staff never, never stopped running and did a great job. The Ceago Sauv Blanc was a fabulous wine that complemented a really great Seared Ahi Salad (oh, the dressing...) and Flatbread Pizza (loved the jalapenos). Great game, wonderful atmosphere, and just downright FUN!!!!!!
author: Robyn W.

description: The interior designer did an amazing job on this used to be mexican fast food joint!  Youl would never know.  The space inviting, the cocktails are delicious and of course the fried chicken salad makes you feel good about eating salad....even if the fried chicken is some of the best I've had.  I'll definitely go back here for a lazy Sunday brunch and for some people watching.
author: Sarah C.

description: The food is just ok.. Good place for lunch. Their salads are pretty decent and their meatballs are pretty tasty, but make sure you have plenty of time to eat since service is pretty slow.
author: Ann L.

description: I went on wednesday night for a "secret location speakeasy party". I paid 5$ online and then the night of the event they directed from a store on Union to the Brixton, where the staff was wearing 20s outfit. The place was empty, except for few people eating and some at the bar. The music sucked and was just a playilist, not dj. The drinks were very light, my vodka blueberry had to be made twice to get some vodka in it (for 10$ btw!!!). Also, the party was not really a party, b/c nobody dressed up and also the patrons could just walk in the place. So I have still to figure out WHY I paid 5$ online, since I could have just walked in myself. A vary awful way to plan party, and the Brixton people are a freud!They just steal my money with a lame "party" excuse.
author: Nino C.

description: I hear that the cocktails are good, so maybe stick with them. They serve incredibly inexpensive wines at comparatively expensive prices... When you're this close to wine country, it's weird when people will charge you $11 a glass for a $13 bottle of wine...
author: C B.

description: I love this place! Its fun, open late, and everything on the menu is great! The music is fun and the fireplace is so cozy. Their brunch is the bomb and they serve food all night :/) love love love.
author: Julie K.

description: Very good wait staff. My Blackened Mahi Mahi was prepared perfectly and was delicious. Our two orders of the Flank Steak were prepared as ordered, tender and delicious. We would go back there.
author: Ronald Y.

description:
I think most of the people that left positive reviews must be friends of the place. 

Positives: 
hostess was nice, yes they greeted me at the door (which they should) and they were able to accomodate me and my friends even though the place was busy on account that it is only 2 weeks old.

pretzel was tasty 

negatives:
food was so-so.  we tried a variety of apps and meals..but overall everything tasted ok.  the menu was odd (not in a good way), dishes didnt make sense and the combination of the dishes were strange.  the fried chicken was decent..the chix was good but it sat on a bed of lettuce with some blue cheese type dressing, which didnt seem to complement each other.

the pork confit dish was not so bueno...dried pork, so so sauce, again a strange combination

presentation was awful..

even the sundae was average..dried brownie with a scoop of ice cream with chocolate drizzle.

sorry...just an average restaurant and would only go back for drinks...which brings me to another negative. the way the place was laid out was not efficient.  they should have used the front area for bar and not dinner...open it up and make it a larger bar area.

overall, it felt like everything was slapped together with no real vision
author: rin c.

description:
I was really torn about whether or not to review The Brixton.  


On the one hand: 

The Brixton seems like a venus fly trap for the people that I would prefer not to be enjoying a meal or drink with.  If it stays popular I will have the dual benefit of having an easier time getting in everywhere else and be able to enjoy those places without the crowd that I don't enjoy.

On the other hand:

1.  the food was below average -- this is, after all, the most important factor about a restaurant, right? I got a burger and fries.  I was excited that they were serving a grass fed burger.   Very average, though.  I can think of at least a half dozen places in Cow Hollow or Marina that have a better burger, including multiple within a few blocks of the Brixton (e.g., Roam, Gamine).  In fact, there are probably more than a half dozen better ones; any place that has a burger has a tastier one.

2.  the prices for said average food were somewhat expensive.  $19 for a burger and a standard beer.  Remember those places that have better burgers in the area? They are also cheaper or equivalent prices.

3.  the restaurant is louder than any restaurant in San Francisco .  By far.  Some nearby restaurants/bars are loud -- think Mamacita or Tipsy Pig -- but not like this.

4.  worst crowd i've ever seen in a restaurant.  As I've told people before, the Marina and Cow Hollow aren't the same thing.  Forgetting that for the moment, the crowd that gives most "Marina" bars their bad reputation is largely people from outside the Marina that come over for evening.  The Brixton had the largest accumulation of this type of people that I've ever seen.  Whether they live nearby or other parts of the city, the restaurant is a magnet for some of the most ridiculous individuals I've seen.  Think a combination of leisure suits, Eminem wannabes, etc.  On top of that, the management appears to care less about how people behave.  At a nearby table a dude was standing next to his own table gesticulating wildly in conversation with his table for 45 minutes.  Why wasn't this stopped? Well, in part because, unlike other restaurants, most people had no clue it was going on because it was so loud (see #3).  But even the wait staff that saw just seemed like it didn't care -- perhaps this is common there.


In the end, I've decided to review it.  If I'm not going to review my least favorite dining experience I've had yet in the Cow Hollow/Marina area, when would I review something?  Plus, the Brixton is already at 3 stars (thanks a number of other bad reviews), so I might as well participate in its eventual slide below 3 stars.
author: Brett J.

description: Normally great service and atmosphere. Went recently and was kicked out for complaining about a weak pour (to my wife, not to the bartender). The dude overheard and still felt the need to kick us out! The pour IS pretty weak for a San Francisco joint.
author: Sameet M.

description: I had dinner there on a Monday night. One of the most flavorless dishes I have ever had. Although the gnocchi was homemade, there was almost no flavor, even with broth/sauce that was on top. It came on a bed of squash, which was undercooked and flavorless as well. I had the artichoke dip for an appetizer, which was ok, but I was thrown off by the poor execution of the gnocchi and would not return to the Brixton to eat again.
author: Whitney M.

description: I have to give The Brixton 5 stars.  I have been back 3 times already.  The food is tasty and the staff is professional and ultra friendly  I have been here for both lunch and dinner and everything that I have tried so far has been amazingly delicious and well priced.  The spinach artichoke dip is as good as Houston's and their roasted chicken is, I dare to say, better than Zuni Cafe's.  My friends and I had the Ahi tuna salad for lunch one day and we all think its delish.  My friends say they are going back every week for that dish alone.  Cocktails are well made and the decor is beautiful.  SF has been lacking a place that can be both a solid restaurant and really fun bar, and I think The Brixton might finally be that place.
author: Roberta W.

description:
re-reviewing this spot... After dining her AGAIN it still sucks. The food is borderline gross and I think my high school cafeteria served better food and it was a hell of a lot cheaper. I really am not that picky of a food person, but really, truly, do not eat here. You will regret it.

The only reason I will step into this establishment is for alcohol. Popping the top off of a beer bottle is apparently the only thing they can't screw up.
author: Kelli P.

description: Vegetarians stay clear. They only offer one veggie pasta dish on the menu (and go figure, they were out of it when we went). It's a big place, but man, it's loud! I had a hard time hearing my dining partners across the table from me. Drinks were decent (hence the two stars). There are too many other great places in the area.
author: Kalie M.

description:
So I met my boyfriend here, where he had already met up with some friends to talk about a future fishing trip. A couple more people met us as well, so it was a whole new party. I'm sure the waiter wasn't thrilled that we basically took over the table a second time while the restaurant was full, but we all were drinking and ordered a bunch of food.

We shared the Tacos del Dia, which were chicken that day. The salsa was very good and the size was perfect. We also shared the pizza, which was really good, and again a great size to share. 

My boyfriend and I shared a cheeseburger that was very moist, not too big and came with all the condiments on the side, which was perfect for sharing. We chose a side salad that was a nice size and well dressed.

I had 2 (or maybe 3) vodka sodas that were well poured. 

The one thing that was weird was a random waitress briefly took over for our waiter mid-way through our visit. Maybe he was taking a break or had worked a double? Anyways, she was sort of a moron and proceeded to tell us she had 16 piercings because one of the guys commented on her ugly face piercing. She then said we would have to guess where the other piercings were. SUPER CLASSY! Aside from being, um, special, she messed up one of the guy's orders by forgetting it completely. By the time we got our food and realized something was missing, our waiter came back, so we had to tell him that she messed up and then she came back and apologized a million times because she didn't want to screw his tip up. We knew it wasn't his fault and they fixed it quickly, so no harm, no foul. 

Aside from the ridiculous Marina scene and the really classy waitress, I would return.
author: Carmen C.

description: This looked like a nice place for myself and three buddies. We were seated quickly at a nice table outside. That was where the niceties ended. We waited a long while before we were attended to even though a waitress walked by numerous times. We had to go in to ask for service. Our server finally came took drink orders and brought these out fast. She then disappeared for 10 minutes before she reappeared to take our dinner order. We awaited for approximately an hour before we went in again to ask for the manager regarding the long wait on food. The food came shortly thereafter and was cool as if it had been sitting, the Manager came out and gave half a$$ed apology and left. The server kept forgetting to bring requested items BBQ etc. In the end we were compted two meals by the mediocre food and bad service so I would not return.
author: Florian L.

description: I finally got a chance to check out The Brixton last Saturday night and had a great time. It has a great vibe and was pretty packed, definitely one of the best places on Union street. There are still some kinks to be worked out...it is super loud (very bad acoustics) and the drinks are pretty bad. We tried a couple drinks of the menu (the gimlet and their tequila drink) and both were very bitter and sour. I would stick to beer/wine/simple mixed drinks for now until they make some changes to the drink menu. I didn't get a chance to try the food but have heard good things. I will definitely be going back for the vibe/crowd/decor.
author: Gina C.

description: This place is growing on me a bit. Still not my #1 choice in the Marina, but it can have a fun crowd and the service is usually pretty good. Also it is on the expensive side, but it is Union St.
author: Juan S.

description: Good to have a cool bar, restaurant on union. Great for lunch, food is good, i like the tuna melt and the steak salad. Most servers are cool. the atmosphere is kind of rock and roll not your regular marina flare. you can sit outside for a drink or lunch and that is a plus...reminds me of home.  i am a repeat customer...it works with my employees, my clients, overall a good experience
author: Thierry H.

description: Had the half chicken.... amazing!!! Also the staff are pretty damn hot!!
author: James R.

description: This place is great. Something a little different for Union Street. Finally! I have been back several times since discovering this place. The vibe is fun, the food in tasty and the staff is really friendly. The restaurant is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner and so far I like all three menus which is really hard to find. If you are hung over, check out their brunch! The portions are huge and they have something for everyone. I have been in with girl friends and even took my grandmother to dinner here. Everyone had a good time! That's cool.
author: Natasha K.

description:
I like this place.  It a fun and casual place with good food.  I went there few times already and last one was for my birthday celebration.  

What i liked:
1) Good food
2) Good service
3) Free dessert for my birthday :)
4) Fun atmosphere/vibe

What i didn't like:
1) Pricey
2) Skinny margarita is my fave drink and its pretty awful here
3) Too loud
author: Anna S.

description:
As far as watering holes, it's fine. And bar menu is fine.  But this is a bar, nothing more.  Posing as a restaurant is where they run into issues.  We had reservations and they would not seat us for 30 minutes, b/c there was a lingering group who was simply there to drink and was occupying the dining table.  

As obnoxious as that was, I was spilled on twice by the wait-staff.  They are friendly, not malicious in any way.  But a terrible dining experience.  Just a drunk crowd on a sunny weekend in the Marina.  Not a restaurant.
author: Eric A.

description: Awesome (seriously great) bloody mary.  Above-average food.
author: Efjm M.

description: Bad service! I have experienced better service.  Food's fine, drinks are great.  Stick to the bar and you'll do fine.
author: Link A.

description: Insanely loud -- made major mistakes on acoustics in this pace.  Don't plan on talking to anyone - they won't be able to hear you.
author: scott g.

description: Food is actually really good, but so so so overpriced for the atmosphere, which is a loud bar!
author: Katrina H.

description: Crowded as hell. Too loud to talk. $5 Budweiser. I guess it looks cool though.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
I had been here for lunch on a Saturday and thought it was pretty good. The staff was friendly and assertive and the food was fresh. The restaurant wasn't to busy on that Saturday, but it was still early. I then decided to go back on a Friday night. Not such a great ideaI was first annoyed at the fact that when I called to say we were running late to make our reservation, no one answered and got a message machine. I knew why when we got there and I could barely even hear the hostess, and she could barely hear me. I just kept on thinking that it would get better when we sat down. Not the case..

My friend and I were practically yelling at one another to understand what the other was saying. With putting that aside we decided on sharing some dishes. We decided on the tacos of the day, the pretzel knots, and then the Miso Ahi Salad. The pretzel knots weren't anything out of this world, and didn't go into too much effort into making them that special. The taco of the day was a pork shoulder taco. The tacos were actually really good, and had a lot of flavor. It was a perfect dish to share. As for the Ahi Salad. The salad was really good, but they decided to go a little too heavy on the dressing, which made our plates laden with dressing and our salad wily. I guess we learned our lesson, and should have asked for either light dressing, or dressing on the side. The salad would have been much more enjoyable if it wasn't for the dressing situation.

All in all the food is just alright, and with it being so loud it just made it so much harder for me to enjoy my meal. It was packed and full of people. I find it to be much like a Tipsy Pig, and don't see myself going back.
author: Cortney H.

description:
great food-best place to have some of "mama's cooking" 
drinks are up to my high standards. (strong n' tasty)...I like the location the best...great place to hit at night but also during the day-it's classy without feeling too upscale..

prices are perfect-I don't feel like vomiting when I look at my bank statements the morning after.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Sometimes you are looking for a place where you dont want to think about the menu;  a place where there are a lot of items that look good in a comfort food type of way.  That is what I was looking for last night after a miserable day at work, and found it with the Brixton.  The overall vibe was casual and lowkey, although music was very loud.  Our waitress was adorable; making conversation, never rushing us and giving helpful advice on what to order and how much.  We felt well taken care of.  The menu is definitely comfort bar food with a twist but not enough that is takes time to decipher the menu.  I ordered the demon eggs and they were delicious.  Served at the perfect temperature with a nice flavor of crab and a sprinkling of bacon.  My friend had the mixed greens which was the right size for a starter.  There were a lot of other apps that looked yummy that we would have loved to try.  Again, not wanting to think we both ordered the burger- served on a pain de mie bun that was tasty and cooked perfectly, on the side was a nice mixture of sweet and regular  potato fries.  A lot of food and if we were not such piggies, we could have split the entree and our waitress said the kitchen is happy to do that.  But my leftover burger destined for my husband was heartily enjoyed by my puppy because she got there first.  
The wine list was great.  Happy to see a Turley Cinsault on the menu and very reasonably priced, which the waitress let me taste before committing to a bottle.  Overall, it was exactly what we were looking for on a weeknight after a tough day at work.  I will go back.
author: M B.

description:
Was there Sunday at around, 3 pm.  I had the scrambled eggs with choice of 3 add-ins for $12.  It was really good, but it seemed like the eggs might have been on the smaller sized version... I also had OJ, which is not freshly squeezed, a bit dissapointing, but I didn't asked about it before I ordered...
The waitress was nice and friendly but I bit ditzy...
Also, it was kind of noisy, but overall a good experience!
author: Xavier C.

description: Ick.  Had hoped it would be in the vein of either Delarosa or A16 (which somehow avoid the full-on Marina frat attack) but sigh. Not the case.
author: chloe w.

description: I would avoid. They acknowledged but would not honor our reservation last night saying "sorry things got busy, you can wait in the bar area with everyone else, it will be at least an hour."  Nice! Is great they are so popular now that they can not honor reservations and seat walk-ins in your place. We were even early.  No offer of a complimentary glass of wine even. They will never see me again.
author: John A.

description: Brixton is a bright spot in the  Marina. The food was surprisingly good, the music was great and our waitress Christina was a doll who even gave us tips on where to go out at night around the City. Visiting from LA we made this place our home and it  probably made our trip.  The warm spinach salad with chicken is outstanding and all the burgers were excellent.
author: Ray Z.

description: Best bar food in the marina/cow hollow area.  Love the pork chops and the chicken. Plus they will always substitute vegetables for potatoes when you ask. Service is consistent and the portion sizes are excellent for the price.  This is definitely a go-to place for a good quality meal in a social setting.
author: Z A.

description: Its fun to sit at the bar with a friend and stare at all the characters who walk in.  The fresh baked pretzel knots with hot cheese sauce and honey mustard sauce was delicious!  Pass on the demon eggs, the canned crab is stinky.
author: Wakako U.

description: Great service, love the food & sweet potato fries, the decor is also awesome
author: Johnson H.

description: Came here with my cousins last week while visiting SF   It was a good time.   Food is good, drinks are good.   service was nice :)   Didn't have to wait to get seated.    I like the ambiance, even though it's still the same as the prior restaurant that was there.
author: Sherry C.

description: Good service. Nice ambiance. Good drinks. Peppered beef stew..... AMAZING!!
author: Honest Y.

description: 3 orders of fried chicken Benedict and bacon bloody Mary's ...let's see if it lived up to its name........................YEP it was awesome.
author: Elmira K.

description:
Wow - a little surprised by some of the complaints on here, the place is awesome, great drinks, friendly wait staff and bartenders, and delicious food!  Loved the 'demoned' eggs (with dungeness!), just delicious.  The flatbread pizza was fantastic too and the apple pie dessert was the clincher, loved the maple bourbon icecream on the side, gotta figure out how to buy a pint of that to take home,amazing!  The prices are extremely reasonable, and you can definitely get well fed for around $20, which in this neighborhood isn't easy to find.  And the atmosphere is perfect, cool vibe with good neighborhood people having fun. Definitely a little noisy, but isn't that part of the fun of going out?  

Seems like most of the negative reviews have to do with the so called 'd-bags' in the neighborhood, too funny.  Guess you should hang out in the hipster haight? or take a bullet in the mission?  I mean sorry, too bad you can't clone yourself so you can find people you are comfortable hanging around?

Anyway - I liked it and probably be my go to for a quick bite and drink whenever I'm in the neighborhood, something Union St. needed.
author: Steve R.

description: Love love LOVE The Brixton! I came here for dinner with my coworkers and we enjoyed the most amazing appetizers and drinks! Everyone who waited on us was so helpful and accomodating. Definitely going back :D
author: Olivia G.

description: This place is a must while in the bay area!! Great food great service great crowd and decor! :D GREAT FOOD!!! Cocktails are amazing.
author: Lidia C.

description: I went here with my family for brunch and it was delicious. Their granola is home made and really good. I also had some eggs, toast and hash browns. Good food and reasonable prices.
author: Chelsea H.

description: Love the vibe here.  Eaten here twice and enjoyed it both times. The demoned eggs, clam chowder, cabernet-braised short ribs and cocktails will satisfy. Interior is very cool and bartenders are friendly.  Will be going back.
author: Christie Q.

description: Brixton is a great place for brunch, dinner, or even happy hour. The food is great, and the fun and friendly service is ever better!!! Sit outside on a nice day and soak up the sun while enjoying the great food and awesome music. The cocktail list is unique and amazing so make sure to try all of them!!
author: Dru B.

description: The Brixton always delivers! The Manhattans are THE REAL DEAL HOLYFIELD (deliver a knock out punch), and the tacos del dia son muy buenos, ayyye yai yai
author: Ben W.

description: good food, good atmosphere, good prices, awesome brunch on a nice day when they open the patio doors.
author: Rachel S.

description:
I loved the vibe the minute my boy friend and I walked in. It was trendy, with great music playing. We felt important the minute we walked in. We were greeted by not one but two very friendly ladies as soon as we walked in. We got sat quickly even though it seemed to be pretty full for a Wednesday night. Great specialty drinks, the Brixton Manhattan was best Manhattan I have ever had! 
Our server greeted us instantly with water and specials. She was very friend and very knowledgeable. Food was delicious and great for the price. The ahi tuna salad was AMAZING! and so fresh. But my favorite part was the dessert! The pretzel brownie sundae was soooo good and for only $5 how could we resist! 

it was an excellent experience and a really happening place to go.
We will absolutely be going back. Great place to go even on a week night!
author: Kelly R.

description: My roommate and I are native New Yorkers, where you can get a good meal at any hour. Not such an easy feat in SF. We were looking for a bite just before midnight and walked into The Brixton. Anthony, the chef, was kind enough to make us one final meal before closing the kitchen, and it was awesome. Piping hot mac & cheese, and a burger. The burger was cooked to perfection. And Anthony even hung out with us while we ate and we had a great conversation. Super nice dude. I think sometimes this place gets a bad rap because of some of the patrons and the post-dinner club atmosphere, but we had a great late night meal from a fantastic kitchen staff. Thanks again, Anthony!
author: Rebecca J.

description: brunch just kicked off this past weekend @ the brixton so it was quite hectic. our waitress was also fairly new. service wasn't the best, but I guess that's expected. she tries though. food wise was decent. there wasn't a WOW factor. but the hashbrown was pretty impressive. the table next to us ordered the salmon flat bread, which looked really delish! guess I'll order that next time. won't be back for at least a couple months. hopefully, things will be a bit less hectic.
author: Ann T.

description: Great Eggs Benedict.  Unfortunately the music was way too loud for me, so, I will not be going back : (
author: Melissa G.

description: My boyfriend and I were looking for a low key night and some easy American food, The Brixton had a great atmosphere for a Tuesday night. I had the (huge) roasted chicken salad and it really hit the spot!  My boyfriend had the Brixton burger and he enjoyed it as well.  We shared the sweet potato fries that were served in a super cute mini fryer basket.  They were tasty!  Our server was great, attentive and very friendly.  Our first drink was a little watered down but the second was just right.  We would definitely come back!
author: Rebecca V.

description:
If you're looking for a spot to have a lot of fun at with amazing drinks and food, then go to the Brixton! Their Vodka cucumber basil gimlet is soooo delicious as well as all of their other drinks! The food is delicious, especially the half chicken and the burger! Everyone always says, "get the burger at the Brixton, best in town!" and it's true, first time I tried one, I had to come back. 

Oh and if you're looking for a spot to go to when you're hungover on a Saturday or Sunday for brunch, this is also the best place to be! The bloody mary's are delicious, especially with the celery salt around the rim! $10, but well worth it. Oh and I'm sure you want something big and fattening when you're hungover, get the Monte Cristo Sandwich, deep fried french toast with ham and cheese in the middle with powdered sugar all over it and such a huge portion! Mmmmm so yummy! 

Service is also always great when I come in, everyone seems to be having a good time and enjoying themselves. I give this place 5 stars!! You have to try it out, once you try the food and drinks, I'm sure this will be your regular spot to stop in at.
author: Melanie J.

description: I really want to like this place. I just can't. We have tried to eat here twice now and both times the staff was rude. I'm not saying that they were mean or nasty, just the 'I'd rather text on my iPhone than serve you' kind of attitude. The food was good, I had some tasty sliders. The decor is pretty awesome. I just can't get over the poor service. I know this is a new restaurant, but get it together guys. You've been open for months now!
author: Ryan A.

description: We had a large group of 50 for a trolley bar hopping adventure. I called the Brixton ahead of time to see if they could accommodate our large party late in the evening and they did not disappoint! The manager was extremely helpful and accommodating. She even set aside tables for us in the front of the bar. Our guests loved the atmosphere, the drinks and how easy it was to get in and have places to sit. I would definitely recommend the Brixton for your large group if you want to have space, be near taxis at the end of the night, for a fun/chill atmosphere, and for some great drinks!!
author: Jen S.

description: There is one thing that keeps me coming back to the Brixton...the cucumber basil gimlet! It is so refreshing and absolutely delish! I can't speak much for the food as I haven't really had it, though the pretzel knots are a pretty good snack to munch on. Definitely recommend it if you're looking for a place to have a tasty drink!
author: Keri W.

description: Loved the place!!  Great staff and cool place to hang out!
author: Mike M.

description:
It was Friday night and we had a party of 8.  I had made a reservation but since there were so many of us we needed to move it back.  Called the Brixton and asked if there was any way we could move it to 8.  They were more than accommodating. 

Staff was all very nice and helpful.  The ambiance was perfect.  All in all a great night!
author: Sarah V.

description: I am so happy that they put something cool in this location.  The food is amazing...try the mac and cheese and the pretzel, yummy! .Great, fun atmosphere....going Sat. for my boyfriends b-day, cant wait!!!!!!!
author: teri s.

description: We had Sunday lunch today and overall were quite disappointed in both the food quality and service. The espresso order was slow and the cappuccino was served in a chipped mug with overflow sloppily dripping over the side. We had to make 2 separate requests for sugar and then a spoon - and were brought a soup spoon! We had to wait 45 min for a fairly simple food order. The chicken salad sandwich w/ avocado had no special flavor and the side salad was just seasoned with oil and salt and very bland. The lox pizza was fairly good and the only reason for one star. The restaurant staff and standards fit the Brixton, London name.
author: Michael B.

description: I did my birthday dinner here with about 12 friends. I have to say the service was FANTASTIC! I was very impressed with the staff and how helpful / attentive they were. When a water glass would be even just half full.... someone was there refilling. We had a birthday cake delivered early to the restaurant and they did a fabulous job bringing it out for dessert. They even allowed us to come back the next day to pick up the extras as they stored the extra cake in the fridge. The food was great and the service was even better. Really like the whole scene at the Brixton! Highly recommend and so grateful for this new addition to Union Street!
author: Kimberly M.

description: It was ok... Ordered the demoted eggs and was disappointed bc it didn't have much crab or bacon... Just a pea size amount. Fried chicken salad was good as well as burger and carnitas hash.
author: A E.

description: We stopped here after shopping in the area. I had the open face tuna melt with sweet potato fries. Everything was pretty good. The place wasn't too busy, but it seemed like the food took awhile to prepare.
author: Kelley T.

description:
fun scene and good for a night out with friends

loud as hell

slightly better than average food but nothing all that special

they do a good job with cocktails
author: Jaime M.

description:
The Brixton exists because you can't go to Tipsy Pig everyday.....
or can you???
the pretzel sure is a million times better at Tipsy
come on Brixton, those thirsty Marina kids need to eat sometimes too
author: Jen S.

description: it's ok.  brunch is so-so.  bloody maries are not bad.  the mac and cheese is excellet (4 stars) but all else is passable.
author: Carlos S.

description: This place presents itself as a laid-back (yet trendy) neighborhood bar & grill. The food was pretty good (I had the salmon entree, my tablemates had the pork ribs, half chicken, and hangar steak and we all cleared our plates!). The cocktails were tasty, the wine menu ok. I just thought the prices were high for what this is - a fancier place to watch sports and eat well-prepared basic food. But the service was good, the ambience festive, and the decor predictably trendy.
author: Carrie L.

description: Food okay but not great, staff rude and condescending--other than the super nice chef who brought us our food! He was the only tolerable one there.
author: Madeline M.

description:
Mister Chao's friends called and said "Lets go to the Brixton".  Never hearing of it before, Mister Chao looked it up on his phone and thought, "hmm must be next to Left at Albuquerque."  Little does he know that it is the former Left At Albuquerque and the restaurant has been open a total of 2 days.  

Mister Chao then flagged down a waitress and ordered a beer, the deviled eggs (with crabmeat), and a flat bread pizza.  Alas, Mister Chao thought the beer was excellent and the eggs divine.  Mister Chao's friends really liked the flatbread pizza, but Mister Chao thought it was a little dry.  

Mister Chao will be back, but just for the eggs, beer, and next time maybe the salad.
author: Mister Chao ..

description: Pretty good spot for a few drinks weekdays or even weekend nights, and the food for lunch/brunch is tasty and nicely presented.  The decor inside always draws compliments, and the staff is generally friendly and attractive
author: Erik G.

description: Went with some work friends,we started out with the pretzel app. nice besides the two nice sweet and sour mustard seed and a creamy yellow sauce, reminded me of a ballgame or state fair. Two of the four had open faced tuna, they loved the mustard kick. one had a huge salad w/peaches but looked really full of flavor. I had a chicken salad w/ avacaco saled mixed together on ACME bread, simply great, one of my new faves. The french fries were like I've had in Paris, frites', nice, I should have had a side of aoli.
author: C W.

description: Pretty nice place with great decor.  Newest hot-spot on Union St. = mucho people crowded at the bar on the second day of opening.  We did, however, able to find a seat near the bar.  Ordered some beers and snack foods.  The deviled egg was good...while the flat bread pizza rocked!!  It not also tasted good but it literally rocked my mouth as it was spicy!!...I like spicy...if you can't handle the spice...don't try peoples.  I will definitely come back soon to check out other items on their menu.
author: Patrick C.

description: Nothing insanely good but not bad either. If you want quality food at a decent price where things are pretty consistent, go here. BTW, the pork ribs that have been pulled off the bone with tarragon is one of the most delightful things I've put in my mouth in a long time.
author: Shaz D.

description: Fun drinks. Classic Marina crowd and the food is pretty good. Try the chicken and beet salad. Yum!!
author: Lauren W.

description: Awesome atmosphere for dinner, but if conversation is on the menu, you might choose elsewhere.  We dropped by for my best friend's bday and, without a reservation on a Friday night, we were seated within minutes.  We started off with a bottle of Prosecco... awesome that they have good sparkling wine and don't charge an arm and a leg.  Then we moved on to the french Onion dip with kettle chips. . . to die for!  The pear salad with a walnut champagne vinaigrette was great paired with the prosecco and our entress were the crisped pork confit, half chicken, and sweet potato fries.  Our server was adorable and really made our experience. She even brought out a scoop of bday ice cream at the end! Total bill was $125 with tip and I think it was a great price for all we ordered.
author: Amie W.

description:
Had a brunch reunion with cousins there and everyone was pleased overall with their dishes. I had the fried chicken salad (the anti-diet salad) that was good but the entire table was eyeing my sister's Monte Cristo sandwich, which was great - at least we told her it was. It seemed to be dipped in a very light waffle batter served up with fresh strawberries and syrup. 

They also serve a terrific Bloody Mary. I'm pretty happy that this place came in to fill Left at Albuquerque; the rest of the menu looks like great comfort food in a more contemporary Hollywood Regency style atmosphere.

The hostess and server were a bit interesting but pleasant all the same.  It can get pretty loud but it's bearable.  Great place to get together for brunch or lunch.
author: Mic D.

description:
The decor is awesome - love the sliding open windows and outdoor seating. They did a really great job w/ the place; however, the food lacks vision. It's very boring and limited. 

I am excited for the "build-your-own" scramble; however, when we went there for brunch, that menu was not yet ready, which was a bummer. Maybe this place will just be a better brunch place then dinner place or hopefully they revamp their menu and I would definitely come back for dinner.
author: E G.

description: I decided to take advantage of the 1,000 dining points on OpenTable to lure me to a new restaurant. I was meeting up with a friend I hadn't seen in months, so much catching was in order. Unfortunately, we constantly shouting in order to be heard. So, it's not a place conducive for "real" conversations. That said, the atmosphere was very lively and vibrant for groups and parties. As far as food is concerned, it was just average (although the mac and cheese tasted like the Kraft boxed stuff but with chili powder and the flatbread pizza was very bready). Lots of acceptable things on the menu that WOULD NOT warrant a poor rating, but you wouldn't go here for the foodie experience.
author: Linda R.

description: This is a loud, fun bar with better than expected food.  We had the Ahi Tuna Salad, which was excellent, the prawn appetizer, which was very good, and the flatbread, which was quite good--more thin crust pizza than flatbread.  It all exceeded expectations.  Some sports TV, excellent drinks, nice people.  Crowd mostly in 20s, good-looking people but all sitting at tables that were single-sex!  They need to get up and go to the bar and mingle!  Only drawback we found was the noise.  It is hugely loud--hard to hear others when you are at a table.  Really hard!
author: JP C.

description: Really good for watching sports games. The boody mary's are awseom. Food is slightly above average. Service is a bit slow.
author: Samantha S.

description: Went for a late lunch yesterday and will gladly return. Remembered reading about the place from my Daily Candy email and wanted to give it a try. There were probably half dozen tables for this hour of day and people seemed to be enjoying their food/conversation. Ordered the chicken salad sandwich and the roast chicken salad.
