Both were fantastic. Fresh, flavorful, and generously sized. Loved the decor and the service was prompt and friendly. There are lots of eatery options on Union St. and will happily add this one to the list for a good lunch spot.
author: sunny m.

description: Love the vibe and atmosphere at Brixton. Great prices and perfect menu. Chef does a great job bringing a healthy flair to traditional bar food. Drinks are fun and refreshing too! Can't wait to frequent this go too spot on sunny weekend when the weather is nice. Open window seating is refreshing and always welcoming. Easy go to spot in my book.
author: mariah B.

description: Have dined at this place multiple times and have had great experiences! Friendly, prompt service that gives you attention, even on those crowded Saturday mornings. Have yet to have a bad thing on the menu...such a variety of healthy choices as well as those food options to get you through that hangover! Lastly, order the Bloody Mary!
author: Brittany L.

description: Diva Nite, minus one. The Brixton seems like a good place to hangout. It's loud/noisy because the drinks are worth the money and the bar stays packed, yet still had plenty of seating for dining in. Service or Michael was cool too. I liked the Brixton Blueberry Lemonade (Yum!) especially since I ended up with 2 drinks for the price of one. Appetizer: Philly Cheese-Steak Rolls w/ Chille sauce, different & delicious. Entrée': ZucchiniAlfredo Pasta w/ Shrimp/Prawns, very satisfying.... Filling..... I don't know how I was able to complete the meal. Dessert: Chocolate Devils Food Cake, TO GO!!! My friend loved the clam chowder, hint of cheese, but it was a little watery. The chicken was crispy & cooked perfectly on the inside. The potatoes were interesting but she wasn't able to detect the cheese, more like they were just flattened and fried in the same skillet as the chicken in a puddle of gravy.
author: Mia B.

description: OMG...I dont even know how to say it without being too mean...this place is gross and waaaay overpriced!.. I had dinner here for a friends bday.. I ordred a cup of clam chowder and the taste was nasty and it wasnt even hot not even luke warm!.. I also ordered a cesar salad and it was nasty... the leaves were huge and it had no dressing tasteless..... Thumbs down for this place totally gross food ..no joke never going here again!
author: Michelle R.

description:
Seems like the reviews are getting better for the Brixton and I am glad because I went their today for the first time and created a yelp account just to write a review.  The food was great, our waitress Christina was so helpful and even let us in the restaurant a little before they opened so we could look around and see the menu.

Making this short because I'm not trying to be one of the yelp wannabe journalists, but definately check it out for brunch and I imagine anything in the evening.  Delicious salmon lox brunch plus bloody mary!
author: Tess P.

description: If out in the Marina, The Brixton is a must. Large wine menu, along with awesome cocktails, and huge array of bar food! The staff and waiters are always friendly, and the vibe is just what you would expect!
author: Lianna T.

description:
Three of us came here yesterday for lunch. We were seated and ignored for at least fifteen minutes. Employees were running around everywhere but we couldn't get water or a server to stop by. I actually held up my empty water glass until a busser noticed. When we finally did get our server he told us how busy he was. There are so many things wrong with that! Be professional!
Our food took forever and our server never checked on us after we got our salads, which we obviously sitting for a long time because they were warm and wilted. 
We had to ask for the check and then our server disapppered again! I asked another server for change so we could get out of there and he told me it wasn't his table and I should ask my server!! 
The manager passed us multiple times but never looked our way and looked like he wanted to fight someone. 
Come here for drinks when you want a science. Otherwise stay away. There are too many good places in the City to waste your time and money here.
author: KTO B.

description: I REALLY LOVE this place!  Finally - a nice bar with a restaurant you actually want to eat at on Union Street!!  Stayed away opening weekend because I figured it would be insane...but ventured forth this past weekend and I was really impressed.  They have done a great job on this space - I love the wood and the posters - and having the horseshoe shaped bar in the middle was a great move.  Plenty of room to meet for a drink and conversation if you're not into full on dining.  We did eat though - and I have to say the food was really good.  I figure some of the early reviews are maybe opening weekend working out the kinks kinda thing cause the deviled eggs ROCKED and the tuna was AMAZING.  This is definitely a destination and the people here (staff as well as customers) have a great energy.  So glad we have this place to go to in the neighborhood...we'll be back soon!
author: Emma L.

description:
I decided to try out The Brixton with my boyfriend for our Valentines date, having seen decent reviews and a constant crowd. I was underwhelmed to say the least...

PROS
- While waiting at the bar for our table I had the Bourbon Rasperry Splash, it was delicious and the bartender great. Definitely the best part of our evening

CONS
- Freezing inside the restaurant
-Ordered the spinach artichoke dip for an app. Waitress brought out the wrong thing then started going on about how unorganized the kitchen is. When we finally got the right appetizer it was runny cheese with no flavor, added salt which helped some. Served with crostini so thin it broke when you tried to scoop anything.
- I had the gnocchi which was served on a hot plate, yet the entree was cold. The gnocchi was rubbery and undercooked, awful presentation also. I am a pasta lover and for the first time in my life didn't finish a pasta dish!
- My boyfriend ordered the burger medium rare, It came well done. He also found a decent sized bone...in a burger! I'm a vegetarian and don't know much about meat, but never in my life has someone bitten into a burger at a nice restaurant and pulled out a bone. He left about half of it uneaten
-Review of clam chowder from bf: stick with Campbells
-Waitress was overly flirtatious with my boyfriend, which i did not appreciate on our romantic night out. 

I will definitely not be returning to The Brixton. If crappy food and overly pretentious people are your thing, by all means, be my guest
author: Corina T.

description: A diamond in the rough; one of few places in San Francisco of this size that has a staff who unconditionally care about the quality of the food and drinks being made as well as the customers coming through the door! Definitely give this place a try!
author: Oliver T.

description: Unbearably loud, and very mediocre food. The menu -- spinach artichoke dip, stuffed mushrooms, pretzels with cheese, shrimp, seared ahi salad, fried chicken salad -- reminded me of the Tipsy Pig's, but the food wasn't as good.  However, the drinks were delicious, and I would go there again for this reason.
author: Laura C.

description: This place made me feel like I was 92 years old and deaf. It's the loudest eating experience I've ever had; I went with a group of girls and I had literally lost my voice by the time we left.  We were all just reading eachother's lips the entire time at the table. It's stuffed full of marina idiots and the food is definitely nothing spectacular. The only sweet thing this place has going for it is it's collection of old school Fillmore posters they have adorning the walls. They get one star for the posters.
author: Kit V.

description: I would give it more stars, but the service was AWFUL.  Our waitress never came over to our table, so I had to get up and ask the hostess to send the waitress over.  When our waitress finally did come over, there was no apology.   To make matters worse, our waitress acted like work was the last place she wanted to be.  Not even one smile at our table, or any other, the entire time we were there.  Some people just shouldn't be servers.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
This is my first review, which I felt compelled to write after my experience at Brixton.

I'm all for the great space, decor and lively environment - especially on Union.  It could be fun for drinks, as others have mentioned, because it's the happening spot now so it's drawing a good crowd.  All that said, my experience was frustrating and strange.

I made a reservation for dinner on OpenTable over a week in advance.  I was meeting a friend on a Thursday night and was pleasantly surprised to receive a call that morning/afternoon confirming my reservation.  When I arrived, I checked in, gave my name and received what I thought was an acknowledgment of my reservation and said I would stop in the restroom until my friend arrived.  When we went back to check-in, I was very abruptly told that there was no reservation in my name.  I repeated my name and spelled it - nope, I was told again that it didn't exist.  Then I explained that I did it on OpenTable, so maybe that's why they weren't seeing it.  Didn't matter - she insisted I didn't have a reservation.  Finally, I told her I received a call earlier to confirm my reservation and to that she answered that she had been working all afternoon and no one made a call to me.  I was totally perplexed, turned off and yet somewhat amused if this was an attempt to be some sort of Manhatten "it" bar.  At that point another girl stepped in and offered another table that was open, even though I "didn't have a reservation."  Wow.

Once seated, I proceeded to scream to my friend the rest of the evening.  MAJOR problem with the acoustics in there.

The food was mediocre at best.  I had the pear salad and spries.  The drink was good - Pisco Mule.  We left a generous tip since we hadn't ordered entrees, which was more than kind considering how we were treated.

So, if you're someone who likes to check out the new spots, like I do, then go for it - at the bar.  And be prepared to go hoarse trying to socialize.

Too bad.  Hopefully they're taking these review to heart to make improvements so they stick around.  Like I said, they've got a great location and decor going for them.
author: Anonymous P.

description:
I'd be lying if I wasn't apprehensive about eating here, after reading some of the experiences thru Yelp.  My fiance and I were among the fortunate ones, as our service was prompt and the food was delivered on time, at a good temperature, and tasted good.
We were seated right away, in the back, on a rainy Saturday afternoon around 2PM.  I will agree with the other reviews, the place is a bit noisy.  There were a few large groups dining around us, who seemed to be in competition with each other--trying to drown out each other with their high level obnoxious voices.  But once they left, everything turned pretty enjoyable.  We could even hear the music being played.
A major highlight was when I asked for change for the meter.  With no change on hand within the restaurant, our waitress, Nicole, dipped into her purse and provided us $2 in change.  Wow!  To me, that definitely went above and beyond what I would expect.  Thank You very much.
Perhaps our perspective on the restaurant was different than most on here.  As mentioned, we showed up at 2PM, and that was on purpose.  Both my fiance and I are not big fans of the crowd that frequents this establishment at night, so we felt 2PM would be a great time to avoid that particular crowd and experience this restaurant.  Luckily we were right.
Overall I would say we would return, most likely around the same time for the same reasons.
author: K W.

description: its really four and a half, everything was absolutely excellent and the only reason they don't get five is because of one incident; i asked the waitress (that was super nice BTW) to choose the wine for me and she did the ' tip killer' and got me one of their more expensive bottles that was very bad for the price, she got only 18% tip instead of the 30% that i thought she deserved and the rating for the place lost a star, too bad. over all everything else was flawless!
author: MICKY T.

description: Stopped in here for a drink and a snack in the middle of the afternoon on a weekend. It was pretty empty. The service was awful. After seating us, the waitress didn't come back until she saw us standing up to leave (we decided we didn't really want to get drinks or food from them after sitting, with our menus closed, for around 20 minutes). During the time we were sitting there, we saw the waitress go around to other tables and check on them. We actually saw her go to one table, take drink orders from a bunch of people, then go to the bar, put in the drink orders, stand there for five minutes while the bartender was making the drinks, and then serve the drinks. We tried waving and making eye contact, but she never looked in our direction a single time.
author: Steve C.

description: was here for drinks only. the drexel is good. also like the service. waiter and bartender was cool. it was a slow night.
author: M S.

description: I am an awful Union Street neighbor because I don't know when this place popped up and after eating there last night, I am mad at myself for not combing my hood enough.  I met the bff for a quick dinner and she wanted to come here.  I love the atmosphere - what a change from the crappy Mexican place that it used to be!!  The inside was beautiful and swanky - and it was definitely a place to go even on a Wednesday night.  We started with the pretzel knots - amazing.  This is totally my style.  Julia ordered the onion soup and caesar salad - I decided to get the tacos of the day.  The tacos were good but Julia's salad was to die for.  The chicken on it was moist and delicious and the salad was unbelievably fresh.  As soon as I took a bite, I knew that I would have to come back to have one all to myself.  To top off the food, our waitress was on it and did a great job.  We were seated quickly, well taken care of and the food was good.  Who wants to go back with me?
author: Arica V.

description: I went there last night for a late dinner and was.. well not too impressed.  It was really loud and I could barely hear the person in front of me.  The french onion dip app was the only great dish we had.  I had the burger which was just ok (esp for $13) and the bf had the risotto gnocchi which he only ate about half.  Seems like an alright spot to grab a few drinks but def won't be back for dinner.
author: C. K.

description: Stoked off this place. Super delish food and drink and a great atmosphere. I don't usually like going to the Marina (more a Mission girl myself) but this place rocks. I think I might go here for my birthday!!!
author: Ally W.

description: Food was good, but I LOVED my martini!  It's a super loud place so you almost have to yell to talk to someone, but it is fun and seems like a lot of people come here for drinks after work.
author: Leslie M.

description: Awesome burger! Especially with their Manhattan on the rocks. Make a reservation.
author: Thomas K.

description: Went here for dinner last night and the experience was OK. We were a few minutes late for our reservation but were seated right away. Yes it gets very loud, it's a bar, what else would you expect, so no loss of points for that. If you want a quiet, romantic meal just don't come here. Crowd was young and lively and mostly young professionals. I thought the atmosphere was pretty cool and something different for San Francisco. As for the food and service, good but not phenomenal. I definitely recommend getting some things to share. And also maybe stick to bar food type things. We got the spinach artichoke dip and cod tacos for apps. Major stars for the spinach artichoke dip, awesome and delish!! Cod tacos were OK, wouldn't order them again. Entrees we shared the chicken was was very solid and the pork spare ribs, also good. We didn't try any of the cocktails at this place as we settled for beer and wine but they looked really creative, solid. Prices were fairly reasonable. The service was average, waitress was very attentive but first round of drinks didn't come untll after our apps, despite being ordered a good 10 minutes before.....Overall a good place to go for some bar food, drinks, and mingling but if you want a knock-out meal probably not the place for you. I enjoyed it though.
author: Kate N.

description: Love the Brixton!! Food's amazing, decors edgy and fun, staff is excellent, drinks get you drunk...'nuff said. Try it!
author: Ashley C.

description: I went with some friends and we all had a great time. Good vibes & friendly ambiance. The drinks and food - all yummy. Especially the Ahi Salad, Grilled Skirt Steak and my favorite cocktail - The Brixton Buck.
author: A W.

description: Disclaimer:  I have only eaten the cheeseburger at Brixton.  But on both occassions it was tasty, well prepared with a nice bun and great sweet potato fries.  The decor is nice and the service was attentive without being pushy.  All in all it is a pretty good dining experience.
author: D G.

description: I love the Brixton!  Their cucumber basil gimlets are the best!  Fun place to come for happy hour or brunch.  Their food is great too- the salad with the quinoa is my favorite!
author: Bianca J.

description: I love this place! Great atmosphere, good people, strong drinks and delicious desserts... what else could you ask for?? So many of the fun spots in the marina are overcrowded and overrated. Try Brixton instead next time and you won't be dissapointed!!!
author: Ashley W.

description: Wandered upon this place 2 weeks ago.  Food was excellent ($11 flat-bread pizza rocks).  Staff was great and made me feel like family.  Came back the next week with friends and tried the eggs Florentine and carnitas breakfast bowl, both were excellent.  Prices are reasonable for the area and good selection of drinks.  My friend ordered a sangria which wasn't on the menu and one of the bartenders made it on the spot - it was great.  Great music and vibe in the place as well...
author: Karl M.

description: I went here for lunch with a few friends on their first day of serving food. Everything we ordered was wonderful! Their desserts were fab too! It screams Marina in the sense of the crowd, but beyond that it's really unique and a welcomed different approach to other typical Union Street antics. It adds a little class at an affordable price for the less in-the-know people. You know who I am talking about. I loved the service and the drinks were all poured well. Everything was reasonably priced and we ended up sitting at one of their outside tables for at least four hours! Haha day drinking at it's finest. Only in SF. It was a gorgeous Saturday day. You know how that goes. The three of us left paying a bill of $160, and I didn't feel bad about it one bit. I thought it was well worth the money. It's all the way across town for me, but I'll certainly make another trip over soon. I'm excited to try their new brunch menu. It's the perfect place to sit outside and enjoy brunch, so I know they'll do well with that!
author: Ryan B.

description: My friend and I had brunched on Union St. and decided to do a bit of a Sunday Funday bar crawl. Since The Brixton was new, we decided to give it a try....4 hours later we stumbled out. The owners have really turned the place into something beautiful. It is a huge space and they haven't jammed it full of tables, so it feels very open and there is a lot of room around the bar. Their cocktail menu has some interesting drinks and they make their margaritas right - no syrupy sweet and sour. I was sad we had just eaten, because their menu looks great - the pulled pork sandwich being devoured next to me smelled delicious. Next time I'm coming to eat (I want that gingerbread dessert), but definitely 5 stars for a great place to drink.
author: Kerry C.

description:
My husband and I have been wanting to try this place since it opened and finally got a chance today.  I booked a table on opentable.com and under "Special Requests for the Maitre D"  I typed a note that my friend wanted to bring her puppies so we would prefer to be sat outside.  I was unable to reach them on the phone to confirm this so in my notes I also wrote that if this was going to be a problem for a party of 5 to call me and I would have my friend leave her dogs at home.  No one called me so we assumed it was OK.  We arrived promptly at 11 for our reservation and the restaurant was nearly empty all except two tables who had just been sat outside.  Not leaving a table for my friends and I.  The host first looked up my notes, clearly for the first time, and said that I had requested inside because it was cold out.  I then showed her that she was looking at the wrong name.  She then read my notes and realized they had goofed and suggested that perhaps we could leave the puppies in the car.  Um, no.  She also offered to seat our party 1/2 outside and 1/2 in.  I then asked if we could add a small table to the other small one outside as there appeared to be room.  I thought this must be against the rules as she hadn't suggested it herself but as it turned out she said of course that should work and got a busser to help move the tables.  The fact that she hadn't offered that already was sort of lame to me.  I mean, if they had been busy or something, I'd get it - but it was empty!  So once we were sat we waited a few minutes and when our server came to take our drink order she realized we didn't have menus.  The host came over and apologized for not giving us menus the first time.  The host was nice but seriously needs more training or something as I didn't find her very helpful at all.
Our server was good but she got slammed as suddenly the whole restaurant filled up at once.  My friends got their coffees that they ordered at 11:15 but I didn't get my mimosa until 11:50!!  Our server had apologized for the extreme wait and I have no doubt it was some sort of slammed bar error but still - that's crazy.  Overall I think I was just un-impressed with the way the service is run.  (Not with our server, with the system they seem to have or rather not have in place) 

The breakdown: 

The food was great.   Loved the Brixton Benedict and the Apple Buckwheat Pancakes

The experience was where they lost 2 stars:
We had reservations at 11, they didn't bother to read our open table notes, the host didn't offer a good solution and didn't give us menus, we ordered around 11:20 and didn't get our food until 12.. My drink alone took over 30 minutes, and my friends coffee cups were empty for way too long.. 

I'll try it again because like I said the food was great and I liked our server.  But overall this new spot has some work to do before it can offer a truly pleasurable dining experience.
author: Rebecca S.

description: I had lunch at Brixton and was very impressed.  I started with the warm pretzel which was excellent and then had the spinach salad with chicken which was also very good.  Next time I'll order the burger, it looked great.  Great looking new restaurant / bar in the neighborhood with a very fun atmosphere.
author: Joe C.

description: Love the food, the atmosphere, and the staff! This is a fabulous new hotspot that I feel will be around for a very longtime! Christina Deville was our waitress and made our experience a great one! A++
author: Caroline R.

description: It's my fault for going back when it wasn't great the first, or second time.  But round 3 did me in.  While the decor is classy and chic and the owners and service super friendly, the food...well, it just isn't good.  The blue cheese eggs benedict (I always order if an option on any menu) came out small, cold, and so hard on the bottom that I couldn't cut it.  The side of *fruit* was plopped in a cafeteria-looking cup and mediocre as well.  For $14 a benny, I expected more.  My friends' plates looked like something out of a 2am diner .  Don't get me wrong.  I love 2am breakfasts and I love diners.  But there's a time and a place and the impetus is usually a late-night out and a tight budget.  Our meal at The Brixton wasn't under those circumstances, but it sure seemed like it.  With a MAJOR upgrade in the food department (flavor, taste, quantity and presentation), this place should be on track.
author: J N.

description: Food is good and improving.  Menu is great!   Service is GREAT.  The people there could not be any nicer!  Very friendly.  Great atmosphere.   This place has huge potential!!  I wish them much success.  I've only been for lunch so far, can't wait to go for drinks.
author: Nat S.

description: For the people that have given this place a low rating this comment is aimed towards you: First off it JUST OPENED people, stop being so critical. Its not like the place has been opened for months, give them a break. It takes time for a restaurant to come into its own and I have all the faith that The Brixton will in time. Also because last week was the first soft opening, people came into to drink and mingle not sit and eat a four course meal. This place is  such a turn around and improvement from the old restaurant it was before, what was it called again? It is a bar and restaurant.. take it for what it is, you can't go there expecting it to be fine dining because its clearly not and they don't make themselves to be that. I do have to admit the food needs a little work but all in good time this place will have smoothed its edges. I plan to come back in a couple weeks and I'm sure it will have made a huge turn around.
author: Stephanie G.
